Hadith.3952 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim who report from one of Imams (as):
I asked Imam (as) about pledging collateral (Rahn) and having a guarantor (Kafil) in a deferred payment sale.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 3952 - وَ- رَوَى الْعَلَاءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ‌ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّهْنِ وَ الْكَفِيلِ فِي بَيْعِ النَّسِيئَةِ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ‌.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3952 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim who report from one of Imams (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about pledging collateral (Rahn) and having a guarantor (Kafil) in a deferred payment sale.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."

chapter: Chapter on Advance Payment in Food, Animals, and Other Goods
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3953 - In a narration from Zurarah who reported from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
"There is no harm in Salam (advance payment) for goods if you describe their length and width, and for animals if you describe their age."
arabicText: 3953 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ بَأْسَ بِالسَّلَمِ فِي اَلْمَتَاعِ إِذَا وَصَفْتَ اَلطُّولَ وَ اَلْعَرْضَ وَ فِي اَلْحَيَوَانِ إِذَا وَصَفْتَ أَسْنَانَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3953 - In a narration from Zurarah who reported from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in Salam (advance payment) for goods if you describe their length and width, and for animals if you describe their age."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3954 - It is narrated from Ghiyath bin Ibrahim, who reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
"Hoarding (Ihtikar) applies only to wheat, barley, dates, raisins, ghee, and oil."
arabicText: 3954 - رُوِيَ عَنْ غِيَاثِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لَيْسَ اَلْحُكْرَةُ إِلاَّ فِي اَلْحِنْطَةِ وَ اَلشَّعِيرِ وَ اَلتَّمْرِ وَ اَلزَّبِيبِ وَ اَلسَّمْنِ وَ اَلزَّيْتِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3954 - It is narrated from Ghiyath bin Ibrahim, who reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "Hoarding (Ihtikar) applies only to wheat, barley, dates, raisins, ghee, and oil."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3955 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, once passed by some hoarders and commanded that their hoarded goods be brought out into the marketplaces where people could see them.
Someone then suggested to the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family:
"Would you set a price for them?"
At this, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, became angry, and his anger was apparent on his face.
Prophet (sw) said: "Am I to set prices for them? Indeed, pricing is in the hands of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic. He raises it when He wills and lowers it when He wills."
arabicText: 3955 - وَ مَرَّ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِالْمُحْتَكِرِينَ فَأَمَرَ بِحُكْرَتِهِمْ أَنْ تُخْرَجَ إِلَى بُطُونِ اَلْأَسْوَاقِ وَ حَيْثُ يَنْظُرُ اَلنَّاسُ إِلَيْهَا فَقِيلَ لِرَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَوْ قَوَّمْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ فَغَضِبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ حَتَّى عُرِفَ اَلْغَضَبُ فِي وَجْهِهِ وَ قَالَ "أَنَا أُقَوِّمُ عَلَيْهِمْ إِنَّمَا اَلسِّعْرُ إِلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَرْفَعُهُ إِذَا شَاءَ وَ يَخْفِضُهُ إِذَا شَاءَ".

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3956 - Hammad narrated from Al-Halabi, who reported from Abu Abdullah (as), that Imam (as) was asked about hoarding (ḥukrah).
Imam (as) said: "Hoarding is when you purchase food, and there is no other food available in the town, and then you hoard it. However, if there is other food or goods available in the town, then there is no harm in seeking profit through your merchandise."
arabicText: 3956 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلْحُكْرَةِ فَقَالَ "إِنَّمَا اَلْحُكْرَةُ أَنْ تَشْتَرِيَ طَعَاماً وَ لَيْسَ فِي اَلْمِصْرِ غَيْرُهُ فَتَحْتَكِرَهُ فَإِنْ كَانَ فِي اَلْمِصْرِ طَعَامٌ أَوْ مَتَاعٌ غَيْرُهُ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ تَلْتَمِسَ بِسِلْعَتِكَ اَلْفَضْلَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3956 - Hammad narrated from Al-Halabi, who reported from Abu Abdullah (as), that Imam (as) was asked about hoarding (ḥukrah).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Hoarding is when you purchase food, and there is no other food available in the town, and then you hoard it. However, if there is other food or goods available in the town, then there is no harm in seeking profit through your merchandise."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3957 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Salamah al-Hannat, who said that Abu Abdullah (as), asked: "What is your occupation?"
I replied: "I am a wheat seller, and sometimes I arrive during a time of demand, and sometimes I arrive during a time of stagnation, so I hold onto it."
Imam (as) asked: "What do the people around you say about this?"
I said: "They say I am a hoarder."
Imam (as) then asked: "Do others besides you sell it?"
I said: "I sell only a small portion compared to the whole market."
Imam (as) replied: "There is no harm in that. This issue arose with a man from Quraysh named Hakim ibn Hizam. Whenever food entered Medina, he would buy all of it.
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, passed by him and said: 'O Hakim ibn Hizam, beware of hoarding.'"
arabicText:
3957 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ سَلَمَةَ اَلْحَنَّاطِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَا عَمَلُكَ" فَقُلْتُ حَنَّاطٌ وَ رُبَّمَا قَدِمْتُ عَلَى نَفَاقٍ وَ رُبَّمَا قَدِمْتُ عَلَى كَسَادٍ فَحَبَسْتُهُ قَالَ "فَمَا يَقُولُ مَنْ قِبَلَكُمْ فِيهِ" قُلْتُ يَقُولُونَ مُحْتَكِرٌ قَالَ "يَبِيعُهُ أَحَدٌ غَيْرُكَ"
قُلْتُ مَا أَبِيعُ أَنَا مِنْ أَلْفِ جُزْءٍ جُزْءاً فَقَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ إِنَّمَا كَانَ ذَلِكَ رَجُلٌ مِنْ قُرَيْشٍ يُقَالُ لَهُ حَكِيمُ بْنُ حِزَامٍ وَ كَانَ إِذَا دَخَلَ اَلطَّعَامُ اَلْمَدِينَةَ اِشْتَرَاهُ كُلَّهُ فَمَرَّ عَلَيْهِ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَقَالَ لَهُ "يَا حَكِيمَ بْنَ حِزَامٍ إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَحْتَكِرَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3957 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Salamah al-Hannat, who said that Abu Abdullah (as), asked:
thaqalaynMatn:
"What is your occupation?"
I replied: "I am a wheat seller, and sometimes I arrive during a time of demand, and sometimes I arrive during a time of stagnation, so I hold onto it."
Imam (as) asked: "What do the people around you say about this?"
I said: "They say I am a hoarder."
Imam (as) then asked: "Do others besides you sell it?"
I said: "I sell only a small portion compared to the whole market."
Imam (as) replied: "There is no harm in that. This issue arose with a man from Quraysh named Hakim ibn Hizam. Whenever food entered Medina, he would buy all of it.
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, passed by him and said: 'O Hakim ibn Hizam, beware of hoarding.'"

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3958 - Al-Nadr narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan that Abu Abdullah (as), said regarding merchants who arrived at a land and agreed among themselves not to sell their goods except at a price they desired: "There is no harm in that."
arabicText: 3958 - وَ رَوَى اَلنَّضْرُ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : فِي تُجَّارٍ قَدِمُوا أَرْضاً وَ اِشْتَرَكُوا عَلَى أَنْ لاَ يَبِيعُوا بَيْعَهُمْ إِلاَّ بِمَا أَحَبُّوا قَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3958 - Al-Nadr narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan that Abu Abdullah (as), said regarding merchants who arrived at a land and agreed among themselves not to sell their goods except at a price they desired:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in that."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3959 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"No one hoards food except a sinner."
arabicText: 3959 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "لاَ يَحْتَكِرُ اَلطَّعَامَ إِلاَّ خَاطِئٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3959 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "No one hoards food except a sinner."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3960 - It is narrated from Mu'ammar ibn Khallad that a man asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), about storing food for a year.
Imam (as) replied: "I do it."
arabicText: 3960 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَمَّرِ بْنِ خَلاَّدٍ قَالَ : سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ حَبْسِ اَلطَّعَامِ سَنَةً قَالَ "أَنَا أَفْعَلُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3960 - It is narrated from Mu'ammar ibn Khallad that a man asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), about storing food for a year.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "I do it."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3961 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"The one who brings goods to the market is blessed with sustenance, and the hoarder is cursed."
arabicText: 3961 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "اَلْجَالِبُ مَرْزُوقٌ وَ اَلْمُحْتَكِرُ مَلْعُونٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3961 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one who brings goods to the market is blessed with sustenance, and the hoarder is cursed."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3962 - Commander of the Faithful (as), peace be upon him, forbade hoarding in the cities.
arabicText: 3692 - وَ نَهَى أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْحُكْرَةِ فِي اَلْأَمْصَارِ".

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3963 - Al-Sakooni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), peace be upon him, who said that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib, stated:
"Hoarding during times of abundance is permitted for forty days, and during hardship and distress, for three days. Anything beyond forty days in times of abundance makes its owner accursed, and anything beyond three days in times of difficulty makes its owner accursed."
arabicText: 3963 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْحُكْرَةُ فِي اَلْخِصْبِ أَرْبَعُونَ يَوْماً وَ فِي اَلشِّدَّةِ وَ اَلْبَلاَءِ ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ فَمَا زَادَ عَلَى أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً فِي اَلْخِصْبِ فَصَاحِبُهُ مَلْعُونٌ وَ مَا زَادَ فِي اَلْعُسْرَةِ فَوْقَ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فَصَاحِبُهُ مَلْعُونٌ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3963 - Al-Sakooni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), peace be upon him, who said that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib, stated:
thaqalaynMatn: "Hoarding during times of abundance is permitted for forty days, and during hardship and distress, for three days. Anything beyond forty days in times of abundance makes its owner accursed, and anything beyond three days in times of difficulty makes its owner accursed."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3964 - Abu Ishaq narrated from Al-Harith, from Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib, who said:
"Whoever hoards food, mercy is removed from him."
arabicText: 3964 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو إِسْحَاقَ عَنِ اَلْحَارِثِ عَنْ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَنْ بَاعَ اَلطَّعَامَ نُزِعَتْ مِنْهُ اَلرَّحْمَةُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3964 - Abu Ishaq narrated from Al-Harith, from Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib, who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever hoards food, mercy is removed from him."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3965 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"Measure your food, for indeed, the blessing is in the measured food."
arabicText: 3965 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "كِيلُوا طَعَامَكُمْ فَإِنَّ اَلْبَرَكَةَ فِي اَلطَّعَامِ اَلْمَكِيلِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3965 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Measure your food, for indeed, the blessing is in the measured food."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3966 - It is narrated from Abu Hamzah al-Thumali that he said:
Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) was informed about the rise in prices.
Imam (as) said: "What concern is it to me if prices rise? It is upon Him (swt), and if they fall, it is upon Him (swt)."
arabicText: 3966 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ اَلثُّمَالِيِّ قَالَ : ذُكِرَ عِنْدَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ غَلاَءُ اَلسِّعْرِ فَقَالَ "وَ مَا عَلَيَّ مِنْ غَلاَئِهِ إِنْ غَلاَ فَهُوَ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنْ رَخُصَ فَهُوَ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3966 - It is narrated from Abu Hamzah al-Thumali that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) was informed about the rise in prices.
Imam (as) said: "What concern is it to me if prices rise? It is upon Him (swt), and if they fall, it is upon Him (swt)."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3967 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Buy, even if it is expensive, for indeed sustenance descends with purchasing."
arabicText: 3967 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اِشْتَرُوا وَ إِنْ كَانَ غَالِياً فَإِنَّ اَلرِّزْقَ يَنْزِلُ مَعَ اَلشِّرَاءِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3967 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Buy, even if it is expensive, for indeed sustenance descends with purchasing."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3968 - It is narrated that Imam (as), peace be upon him, said regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic: "Indeed, I see you in prosperity" (Surah Hud 11:84)
Imam (as) said: "Their prices were low."
arabicText:
3968 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: ۝ إِنِّي أَرٰاكُمْ بِخَيْرٍ ۝
فَقَالَ "كَانَ سِعْرُهُمْ رَخِيصاً".

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3969 - It was said to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family:
"Would you set a fixed price for us, for prices rise and fall?"
The Prophet (sw) replied:
"I would not meet Allah (swt), the Exalted, with an innovation about which He (swt) has revealed nothing to me. So leave the servants of Allah (swt) to benefit from one another. And if you are consulted for advice, then give sincere advice."
arabicText: 3969 - وَ قِيلَ لِلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَوْ سَعَّرْتَ لَنَا سِعْراً فَإِنَّ اَلْأَسْعَارَ تَزِيدُ وَ تَنْقُصُ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "مَا كُنْتُ لِأَلْقَى اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى بِبِدْعَةٍ لَمْ يُحَدِّثْ إِلَيَّ فِيهَا شَيْئاً فَدَعُوا عِبَادَ اَللَّهِ يَأْكُلُ بَعْضُهُمْ مِنْ بَعْضٍ وَ إِذَا اُسْتُنْصِحْتُمْ فَانْصَحُوا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3969 - It was said to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Would you set a fixed price for us, for prices rise and fall?"
The Prophet (sw) replied:
"I would not meet Allah (swt), the Exalted, with an innovation about which He (swt) has revealed nothing to me. So leave the servants of Allah (swt) to benefit from one another. And if you are consulted for advice, then give sincere advice."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3970 - It is narrated by Abu Hamzah Al-Thumali, that Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as), who said:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has appointed an angel to regulate prices by His command."
arabicText: 3970 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ اَلثُّمَالِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى وَكَّلَ بِالسِّعْرِ مَلَكاً يُدَبِّرُهُ بِأَمْرِهِ".

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3971 - It is narrated from Abu Al-Sabbah Al-Kinani that Abu Abdullah (as), said:
"O Abu Al-Sabbah! Buying flour is humiliation, buying wheat is honor, and buying bread is poverty. So seek refuge with Allah (swt) from poverty."
arabicText: 3971 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلصَّبَّاحِ اَلْكِنَانِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "يَا أَبَا اَلصَّبَّاحِ شِرَاءُ اَلدَّقِيقِ ذُلٌّ وَ شِرَاءُ اَلْحِنْطَةِ عِزٌّ وَ شِرَاءُ اَلْخُبْزِ فَقْرٌ فَتَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنَ اَلْفَقْرِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3971 - It is narrated from Abu Al-Sabbah Al-Kinani that Abu Abdullah (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O Abu Al-Sabbah! Buying flour is humiliation, buying wheat is honor, and buying bread is poverty. So seek refuge with Allah (swt) from poverty."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3972 - It is reported that the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, entered upon Aisha while she was counting pieces of bread.
Prophet (sw) said: "O Humaira, do not count, lest it be counted against you."
arabicText: 3972 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : دَخَلَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَلَى عَائِشَةَ وَ هِيَ تُحْصِي اَلْخُبْزَ فَقَالَ "يَا حُمَيْرَاءُ لاَ تُحْصِينَ فَيُحْصَى عَلَيْكِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3972 - It is reported that the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, entered upon Aisha while she was counting pieces of bread.
Prophet (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O Humaira, do not count, lest it be counted against you."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3973 - Al-Sakooni reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), peace be upon him, who said:
"Do not withhold lending leavened dough and bread, for withholding them causes poverty."
arabicText: 3973 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ تُمَانِعُوا قَرْضَ اَلْخَمِيرِ وَ اَلْخُبْزِ فَإِنَّ مَنْعَهُمَا يُورِثُ اَلْفَقْرَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3973 - Al-Sakooni reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), peace be upon him, who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not withhold lending leavened dough and bread, for withholding them causes poverty."

chapter: Chapter on Hoarding and Pricing
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3974 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"The sign of Allah's (swt) pleasure with His (swt) creation is the justice of their ruler and the affordability of their prices, and the sign of Allah's (swt) anger upon His (swt) creation is the oppression of their ruler and the high cost of their prices."
arabicText: 3974 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "عَلاَمَةُ رِضَا اَللَّهِ فِي خَلْقِهِ عَدْلُ سُلْطَانِهِمْ وَ رُخْصُ أَسْعَارِهِمْ وَ عَلاَمَةُ غَضَبِ اَللَّهِ عَلَى خَلْقِهِ جَوْرُ سُلْطَانِهِمْ وَ غَلاَءُ أَسْعَارِهِمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3974 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The sign of Allah's (swt) pleasure with His (swt) creation is the justice of their ruler and the affordability of their prices, and the sign of Allah's (swt) anger upon His (swt) creation is the oppression of their ruler and the high cost of their prices."

chapter: Chapter on Judgment in the Dispute Between Buyer and Seller
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3975 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said regarding a man who sells something and the buyer claims that it was sold for a lower price than what the seller stated:
"The statement of the seller is to be accepted if the item is still present in its original form, along with his oath."
arabicText: 3975 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَبِيعُ اَلشَّيْءَ فَيَقُولُ اَلْمُشْتَرِي هُوَ بِكَذَا وَ كَذَا بِأَقَلَّ مِمَّا قَالَ اَلْبَائِعُ قَالَ "اَلْقَوْلُ قَوْلُ اَلْبَائِعِ إِذَا كَانَ اَلشَّيْءُ قَائِماً بِعَيْنِهِ مَعَ يَمِينِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3975 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said regarding a man who sells something and the buyer claims that it was sold for a lower price than what the seller stated:
thaqalaynMatn: "The statement of the seller is to be accepted if the item is still present in its original form, along with his oath."

chapter: Chapter on the Obligation to Return the Sold Item Due to the Option of Inspection
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3976 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrates from Jamil ibn Darraj, who said:
I asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who purchased a property. He used to enter and leave it, but after paying the price and inspecting the property, he returned and requested the seller to annul the sale, but the seller refused.
Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said: "Even if he had examined and inspected ninety-nine parts of it, and one part remained unseen, he would still have the right of option (Khiyar al-Ru'yah) based on inspection."
arabicText:
3976 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ قَالَ :
سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ اِشْتَرَى ضَيْعَةً وَ قَدْ كَانَ يَدْخُلُهَا وَ يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا فَلَمَّا أَنْ نَقَدَ اَلْمَالَ صَارَ إِلَى اَلضَّيْعَةِ فَفَتَّشَهَا ثُمَّ رَجَعَ فَاسْتَقَالَ صَاحِبَهُ فَلَمْ يُقِلْهُ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "لَوْ قَلَّبَهَا وَ نَظَرَ مِنْهَا إِلَى تِسْعٍ وَ تِسْعِينَ قِطْعَةً ثُمَّ بَقِيَ مِنْهَا قِطْعَةٌ لَمْ يَرَهَا لَكَانَ لَهُ فِي ذَلِكَ خِيَارُ اَلرُّؤْيَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3976 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrates from Jamil ibn Darraj, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who purchased a property. He used to enter and leave it, but after paying the price and inspecting the property, he returned and requested the seller to annul the sale, but the seller refused.
Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said: "Even if he had examined and inspected ninety-nine parts of it, and one part remained unseen, he would still have the right of option (Khiyar al-Ru'yah) based on inspection."

chapter: Chapter on the Obligation to Return the Sold Item Due to the Option of Inspection
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3977 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrates from Muyassir ibn Abdul Aziz, who said:
I asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), about a man who bought a container of oil and found sediment (dregs) in it.
Imam (as) said: "If the buyer was aware that such sediment is commonly found in oil, he cannot return it. However, if he was unaware that such sediment is usually present, he has the right to return it."
arabicText:
3977 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُيَسِّرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلْعَزِيزِ قَالَ :
قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ اِشْتَرَى زِقَّ زَيْتٍ فَوَجَدَ فِيهِ دُرْدِيّاً فَقَالَ
"إِنْ كَانَ مِمَّنْ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ ذَلِكَ يَكُونُ فِي اَلزَّيْتِ لَمْ يَرُدَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ ذَلِكَ يَكُونُ فِي اَلزَّيْتِ رَدَّهُ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3977 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrates from Muyassir ibn Abdul Aziz, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), about a man who bought a container of oil and found sediment (dregs) in it.
Imam (as) said: "If the buyer was aware that such sediment is commonly found in oil, he cannot return it. However, if he was unaware that such sediment is usually present, he has the right to return it."

chapter: Chapter on the Obligation to Return the Sold Item Due to the Option of Inspection
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3978 - Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, entered the market of the date sellers. There, He (as) saw a woman crying while disputing with a date seller.
Imam (as) said to her: "What is the matter?"
She replied: "O Commander of the Faithful, I bought dates from this man for one dirham, but the bottom of the container was filled with poor-quality dates, unlike what I had seen at the top."
Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, said to the seller: "Return her money."
The seller refused, and Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) repeated the instruction three times, but the seller continued to refuse.
So, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) struck him with his staff until he returned the money to the woman.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to dislike covering the dates to conceal their defects.
arabicText: 3978 - وَ دَخَلَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ سُوقَ اَلتَّمَّارِينَ فَإِذَا اِمْرَأَةٌ تَبْكِي وَ هِيَ تُخَاصِمُ رَجُلاً تَمَّاراً فَقَالَ لَهَا "مَا لَكِ" فَقَالَتْ يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ اِشْتَرَيْتُ مِنْ هَذَا تَمْراً بِدِرْهَمٍ فَخَرَجَ أَسْفَلُهُ رَدِيّاً وَ لَيْسَ مِثْلَ هَذَا اَلَّذِي رَأَيْتُ فَقَالَ لَهُ "رُدَّ عَلَيْهَا" فَأَبَى حَتَّى قَالَ لَهُ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ فَأَبَى فَعَلاَهُ بِالدِّرَّةِ حَتَّى رَدَّ عَلَيْهَا وَ كَانَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَكْرَهُ أَنْ يُجَلَّلَ اَلتَّمْرُ.

chapter: Chapter on Announcing the Sale of Goods
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3979 - Umayyah ibn Amr narrated from Al-Sha'eeri, who narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), that Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, said:
"When the caller (auctioneer) announces the price, it is not permissible for you to increase the bid. However, when the caller becomes silent, then you are allowed to increase the bid. Indeed, raising the bid is prohibited while the announcement is still being heard, but it becomes permissible when silence follows."
arabicText: 3979 - رَوَى أُمَيَّةُ بْنُ عَمْرٍو عَنِ اَلشَّعِيرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : "إِذَا نَادَى اَلْمُنَادِي فَلَيْسَ لَكَ أَنْ تَزِيدَ فَإِذَا سَكَتَ فَلَكَ أَنْ تَزِيدَ وَ إِنَّمَا تَحْرُمُ اَلزِّيَادَةُ وَ اَلنِّدَاءُ يُسْمَعُ وَ يُحِلُّهَا اَلسُّكُوتُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3979 - Umayyah ibn Amr narrated from Al-Sha'eeri, who narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), that Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When the caller (auctioneer) announces the price, it is not permissible for you to increase the bid. However, when the caller becomes silent, then you are allowed to increase the bid. Indeed, raising the bid is prohibited while the announcement is still being heard, but it becomes permissible when silence follows."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3566 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Jamil ibn Salih, from Abu Abdullah (as):
Regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Almighty:
"Our Lord (azj), grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:201)
Imam (as) said:
"Good in the Hereafter" refers to Allah's (swt) pleasure and Paradise,
and "good in this world" refers to abundance in sustenance, favorable living conditions, and good character.
arabicText:
3566 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: ۝ رَبَّنٰا آتِنٰا فِي اَلدُّنْيٰا حَسَنَةً وَ فِي اَلْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً ۝
قَالَ "رِضْوَانُ اَللَّهِ وَ اَلْجَنَّةُ فِي اَلْآخِرَةِ وَ اَلسَّعَةُ فِي اَلرِّزْقِ وَ اَلْمَعَايِشِ وَ حُسْنُ اَلْخُلُقِ فِي اَلدُّنْيَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3566 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Jamil ibn Salih, from Abu Abdullah (as):
Regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Almighty:
"Our Lord (azj), grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:201)
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Good in the Hereafter" refers to Allah's (swt) pleasure and Paradise,
and "good in this world" refers to abundance in sustenance, favorable living conditions, and good character.

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3567 - Dharih ibn Yazid al-Muharibi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
"The world is an excellent aid for the Hereafter."
arabicText: 3567 - وَ رَوَى ذَرِيحُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ اَلْمُحَارِبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "نِعْمَ اَلْعَوْنُ اَلدُّنْيَا عَلَى اَلْآخِرَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3567 - Dharih ibn Yazid al-Muharibi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "The world is an excellent aid for the Hereafter."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3568 - Imam (as) said: "He is not from us who abandons his worldly life for his Hereafter, nor his Hereafter for his worldly life."
arabicText: 3568 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لَيْسَ مِنَّا مَنْ تَرَكَ دُنْيَاهُ لآِخِرَتِهِ وَ لاَ آخِرَتَهُ لِدُنْيَاهُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3568 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "He is not from us who abandons his worldly life for his Hereafter, nor his Hereafter for his worldly life."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3569 - It is narrated from the Imam (as) that he said:
"Work for your worldly life as if you will live forever, and work for your Hereafter as if you will die tomorrow."
arabicText: 3569 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْعَالِمِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "اِعْمَلْ لِدُنْيَاكَ كَأَنَّكَ تَعِيشُ أَبَداً وَ اِعْمَلْ لآِخِرَتِكَ كَأَنَّكَ تَمُوتُ غَداً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3569 - It is narrated from the Imam (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Work for your worldly life as if you will live forever, and work for your Hereafter as if you will die tomorrow."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3570 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"Wealth is an excellent aid in attaining piety towards Allah (swt)."
arabicText: 3570 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "نِعْمَ اَلْعَوْنُ عَلَى تَقْوَى اَللَّهِ اَلْغِنَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3570 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Wealth is an excellent aid in attaining piety towards Allah (swt)."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3571 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, loves traveling in pursuit of sustenance."
arabicText: 3571 - وَ رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى لَيُحِبُّ اَلاِغْتِرَابَ فِي طَلَبِ اَلرِّزْقِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3571 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, loves traveling in pursuit of sustenance."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3572 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Set out (on a journey), and sustenance will set out for you."
arabicText: 3572 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اِشْخَصْ يَشْخَصْ لَكَ اَلرِّزْقُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3572 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Set out (on a journey), and sustenance will set out for you."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3573 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"I love to see a man striving in pursuit of sustenance. Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: 'O Allah (swt), bless my nation in their early mornings.'"
arabicText: 3573 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلْعَزِيزِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "إِنِّي لَأُحِبُّ أَنْ أَرَى اَلرَّجُلَ مُتَحَرِّفاً فِي طَلَبِ اَلرِّزْقِ إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ -: " اَللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لِأُمَّتِي فِي بُكُورِهَا " ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3573 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I love to see a man striving in pursuit of sustenance. Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: 'O Allah (swt), bless my nation in their early mornings.'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3574 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"If any of you has a need, let him seek it early in the morning, for I asked my Lord (azj), the Almighty and Glorious, to bless my nation in their early mornings."
arabicText: 3574 - وَ قَالَ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "إِذَا أَرَادَ أَحَدُكُمُ اَلْحَاجَةَ فَلْيُبَكِّرْ إِلَيْهَا فَإِنِّي سَأَلْتُ رَبِّي عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنْ يُبَارِكَ لِأُمَّتِي فِي بُكُورِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3574 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If any of you has a need, let him seek it early in the morning, for I asked my Lord (azj), the Almighty and Glorious, to bless my nation in their early mornings."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3575 - Imam (as) said:
"If any of you intends to fulfill a need, let him seek it early in the morning and hasten in walking towards it."
arabicText: 3575 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا أَرَادَ أَحَدُكُمُ اَلْحَاجَةَ فَلْيُبَكِّرْ إِلَيْهَا وَ لْيُسْرِعِ اَلْمَشْيَ إِلَيْهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3575 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If any of you intends to fulfill a need, let him seek it early in the morning and hasten in walking towards it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3576 - Hammad al-Lahham narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Do not be lazy in seeking your livelihood, for our fathers used to strive for it and pursue it."
arabicText: 3576 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ اَللَّحَّامُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ تَكْسَلُوا فِي طَلَبِ مَعَايِشِكُمْ فَإِنَّ آبَاءَنَا كَانُوا يَرْكُضُونَ فِيهَا وَ يَطْلُبُونَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3576 - Hammad al-Lahham narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not be lazy in seeking your livelihood, for our fathers used to strive for it and pursue it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3577 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, sent a man to fulfill a need, and the man was walking in the sun.
So the Prophet (sw) said to him: "Walk in the shade, for the shade is blessed."
arabicText: 3577 - وَ أَرْسَلَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ رَجُلاً فِي حَاجَةٍ فَكَانَ يَمْشِي فِي اَلشَّمْسِ فَقَالَ لَهُ "اِمْشِ فِي اَلظِّلِّ فَإِنَّ اَلظِّلَّ مُبَارَكٌ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3577 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, sent a man to fulfill a need, and the man was walking in the sun.
So the Prophet (sw) said to him:
thaqalaynMatn: "Walk in the shade, for the shade is blessed."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3578 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever goes to fulfill a need without being in a state of ablution, and his need is not fulfilled, let him blame none but himself."
arabicText: 3578 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ ذَهَبَ فِي حَاجَةٍ عَلَى غَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ فَلَمْ تُقْضَ حَاجَتُهُ فَلاَ يَلُومَنَّ إِلاَّ نَفْسَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3578 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever goes to fulfill a need without being in a state of ablution, and his need is not fulfilled, let him blame none but himself."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3579 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), said:
"I find myself despising a man who faces difficulties in earning a livelihood, yet he lies on his back and says, 'O Allah (swt), provide for me,' while neglecting to go out into the land and seek Allah's (swt) bounty. Even the smallest ant comes out of its hole to seek its sustenance."
arabicText: 3579 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنِّي أَجِدُنِي أَمْقُتُ اَلرَّجُلَ يَتَعَذَّرُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْمَكَاسِبُ فَيَسْتَلْقِي عَلَى قَفَاهُ وَ يَقُولُ اَللَّهُمَّ اُرْزُقْنِي وَ يَدَعُ أَنْ يَنْتَشِرَ فِي اَلْأَرْضِ وَ يَلْتَمِسَ مِنْ فَضْلِ اَللَّهِ وَ اَلذَّرَّةُ تَخْرُجُ مِنْ جُحْرِهَا تَلْتَمِسُ رِزْقَهَا ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3579 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I find myself despising a man who faces difficulties in earning a livelihood, yet he lies on his back and says, 'O Allah (swt), provide for me,' while neglecting to go out into the land and seek Allah's (swt) bounty. Even the smallest ant comes out of its hole to seek its sustenance."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3580 - Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, said:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, loves the trustworthy worker."
arabicText: 3580 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى يُحِبُّ اَلْمُحْتَرِفَ اَلْأَمِينَ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3581 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn Udhafir, from his father, who said:
Abu Abdullah (as), handed me seven hundred dinars and said:
"O 'Udhafir, invest it in something."
Imam (as) then added: "I am not doing this out of greed, but I wish for Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, to see me seeking His bounties."
Udhafir said: I earned a profit of one hundred dinars from it. So, while performing Tawaf, I said to him: "May I be your ransom! Allah (swt), the Exalted, has grant a profit of one hundred dinars in it."
Imam (as) replied: "Add it to my capital."
arabicText: 3581 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُذَافِرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ : دَفَعَ إِلَيَّ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ سَبْعَمِائَةِ دِينَارٍ وَ قَالَ "يَا عُذَافِرُ اِصْرِفْهَا فِي شَيْءٍ مَا" وَ قَالَ "مَا أَفْعَلُ هَذَا عَلَى شَرَهٍ مِنِّي وَ لَكِنِّي أَحْبَبْتُ أَنْ يَرَانِيَ اَللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى مُتَعَرِّضاً لِفَوَائِدِهِ" قَالَ عُذَافِرٌ فَرَبِحْتُ فِيهَا مِائَةَ دِينَارٍ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ فِي اَلطَّوَافِ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ قَدْ رَزَقَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِيهَا مِائَةَ دِينَارٍ قَالَ "أَثْبِتْهَا فِي رَأْسِ مَالِي".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3582 - Ibrahim ibn Abdul-Hamid narrated from Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), who said:
A man came to the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, and said:
"O Messenger of Allah (swt), I have taught my son to read and write. In what profession should I place him?"
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, replied:"Entrust him to Allah (swt) and do not place him in five professions:
Do not make him a seller of shrouds, nor a jeweler, nor a butcher, nor a grain merchant, nor a slave trader."
The man asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is the harm in selling shrouds?"
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, explained: "The one who sells shrouds wishes for the death of my nation, while the birth of a new soul in my nation is more beloved to me than all that the sun has risen upon.
As for the jeweler, he engages in defrauding my nation.
As for the butcher, he slaughters so frequently that mercy departs from his heart.
As for the grain merchant, he hoards food against my nation, and it is more beloved to me that a servant meets Allah (swt) as a thief than that he meets Him having hoarded food for forty days.
As for the slave trader, Archangel Jibril (as) came to me and said: 'O Muhammad, the worst of your nation are those who sell human beings.'"
arabicText: 3582 - وَ رَوَى إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلْحَمِيدِ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ قَدْ عَلَّمْتُ اِبْنِي هَذَا اَلْكِتَابَ فَفِي أَيِّ شَيْءٍ أُسْلِمُهُ فَقَالَ "أَسْلِمْهُ لِلَّهِ أَبُوكَ وَ لاَ تُسْلِمْهُ فِي خَمْسٍ لاَ تُسْلِمْهُ سَيَّاءً وَ لاَ صَائِغاً وَ لاَ قَصَّاباً وَ لاَ حَنَّاطاً وَ لاَ نَخَّاساً" فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ وَ مَا اَلسَّيَّاءُ قَالَ "اَلَّذِي يَبِيعُ اَلْأَكْفَانَ وَ يَتَمَنَّى مَوْتَ أُمَّتِي وَ لَلْمَوْلُودُ مِنْ أُمَّتِي أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ اَلشَّمْسُ وَ أَمَّا اَلصَّائِغُ فَإِنَّهُ يُعَالِجُ غَبْنَ أُمَّتِي وَ أَمَّا اَلْقَصَّابُ فَإِنَّهُ يَذْبَحُ حَتَّى تَذْهَبَ اَلرَّحْمَةُ مِنْ قَلْبِهِ وَ أَمَّا اَلْحَنَّاطُ فَإِنَّهُ يَحْتَكِرُ اَلطَّعَامَ عَلَى أُمَّتِي وَ لَأَنْ يَلْقَى اَللَّهَ اَلْعَبْدُ سَارِقاً أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنْ أَنْ يَلْقَاهُ قَدِ اِحْتَكَرَ طَعَاماً أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً وَ أَمَّا اَلنَّخَّاسُ فَإِنَّهُ أَتَانِي جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ يَا مُحَمَّدُ إِنَّ شَرَّ أُمَّتِكَ اَلَّذِينَ يَبِيعُونَ اَلنَّاسَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3582 - Ibrahim ibn Abdul-Hamid narrated from Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man came to the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, and said:
"O Messenger of Allah (swt), I have taught my son to read and write. In what profession should I place him?"
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, replied:"Entrust him to Allah (swt) and do not place him in five professions:
Do not make him a seller of shrouds, nor a jeweler, nor a butcher, nor a grain merchant, nor a slave trader."
The man asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is the harm in selling shrouds?"
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, explained: "The one who sells shrouds wishes for the death of my nation, while the birth of a new soul in my nation is more beloved to me than all that the sun has risen upon.
As for the jeweler, he engages in defrauding my nation.
As for the butcher, he slaughters so frequently that mercy departs from his heart.
As for the grain merchant, he hoards food against my nation, and it is more beloved to me that a servant meets Allah (swt) as a thief than that he meets Him having hoarded food for forty days.
As for the slave trader, Archangel Jibril (as) came to me and said: 'O Muhammad, the worst of your nation are those who sell human beings.'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3583 - Sadir al-Sayrafi narrated:
I said to Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
"A report has reached me about Hasan al-Basri, and if it is true, then 'Indeed, we belong to Allah (swt) and to Him we shall return.'"
Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) asked: "What is it?"
I said: "I have heard that Hasan used to say, 'If my head boiled from the heat of the sun, I would not seek shade under the wall of a moneychanger, and if my liver dried up from thirst, I would not drink water earned through trade. Yet, this (trade) is my occupation, my business, and by it my flesh and blood have grown, and from it, I performed my Hajj and Umrah.'"
Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) then sat up and said: "Hasan has lied! Take what is fair and give what is fair, and when the time for prayer arrives, leave what is in your hands and rise for prayer. Do you not know that the companions of the cave (Ashab al-Kahf) were moneychangers?"
arabicText: 3583 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ سَدِيرٍ اَلصَّيْرَفِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ حَدِيثٌ بَلَغَنِي عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْبَصْرِيِّ فَإِنْ كَانَ حَقّاً فَ‍ "إِنّٰا لِلّٰهِ وَ إِنّٰا إِلَيْهِ رٰاجِعُونَ" قَالَ "وَ مَا هُوَ" قُلْتُ بَلَغَنِي أَنَّ اَلْحَسَنَ كَانَ يَقُولُ لَوْ غَلَى دِمَاغُهُ مِنْ حَرِّ اَلشَّمْسِ مَا اِسْتَظَلَّ بِحَائِطِ صَيْرَفِيٍّ وَ لَوْ تَفَرَّثَتْ كَبِدُهُ مَاءً وَ هُوَ عَمَلِي وَ تِجَارَتِي وَ عَلَيْهِ نَبَتَ لَحْمِي وَ دَمِي وَ مِنْهُ حَجَّتِي وَ عُمْرَتِي قَالَ فَجَلَسَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ ثُمَّ قَالَ "كَذَبَ اَلْحَسَنُ خُذْ سَوَاءً وَ أَعْطِ سَوَاءً فَإِذَا حَضَرَتِ اَلصَّلاَةُ فَدَعْ مَا بِيَدِكَ وَ اِنْهَضْ إِلَى اَلصَّلاَةِ أَ مَا عَلِمْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَابَ اَلْكَهْفِ كَانُوا صَيَارِفَةً ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3583 - Sadir al-Sayrafi narrated:
I said to Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"A report has reached me about Hasan al-Basri, and if it is true, then 'Indeed, we belong to Allah (swt) and to Him we shall return.'"
Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) asked: "What is it?"
I said: "I have heard that Hasan used to say, 'If my head boiled from the heat of the sun, I would not seek shade under the wall of a moneychanger, and if my liver dried up from thirst, I would not drink water earned through trade. Yet, this (trade) is my occupation, my business, and by it my flesh and blood have grown, and from it, I performed my Hajj and Umrah.'"
Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) then sat up and said: "Hasan has lied! Take what is fair and give what is fair, and when the time for prayer arrives, leave what is in your hands and rise for prayer. Do you not know that the companions of the cave (Ashab al-Kahf) were moneychangers?"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3584 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"Woe to the merchants of my nation because of (their frequent oaths) 'No, by Allah (swt)' and 'Yes, by Allah (swt).' And woe to the craftsmen of my nation because of (their worries about) today and tomorrow."
arabicText: 3584 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "وَيْلٌ لِتُجَّارِ أُمَّتِي مِنْ لاَ وَ اَللَّهِ وَ بَلَى وَ اَللَّهِ وَ وَيْلٌ لِصُنَّاعِ أُمَّتِي مِنَ اَلْيَوْمِ وَ غَدٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3584 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Woe to the merchants of my nation because of (their frequent oaths) 'No, by Allah (swt)' and 'Yes, by Allah (swt).' And woe to the craftsmen of my nation because of (their worries about) today and tomorrow."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3585 - Imam Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), narrated through Jabir from Amr ibn Shimr:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, underwent cupping. A servant from the tribe of Banu Bayadah performed the cupping, and the Prophet (sw) gave him payment. If it were prohibited, he would not have given him payment.
When the procedure was completed, the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, asked him: 'Where is the blood?'
The servant replied: 'I drank it, O Messenger of Allah (swt).'
The Prophet said: 'You should not have done that, but Allah (swt) has made it a barrier for you against the Fire.'"
arabicText: 3585 - وَ رَوَى عَمْرُو بْنُ شِمْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : قَالَ "اِحْتَجَمَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ حَجَمَهُ مَوْلًى لِبَنِي بَيَاضَةَ وَ أَعْطَاهُ وَ لَوْ كَانَ حَرَاماً مَا أَعْطَاهُ فَلَمَّا فَرَغَ قَالَ لَهُ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "أَيْنَ اَلدَّمُ" قَالَ شَرِبْتُهُ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ فَقَالَ "مَا كَانَ يَنْبَغِي لَكَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَهُ وَ قَدْ جَعَلَهُ اَللَّهُ لَكَ حِجَاباً مِنَ اَلنَّارِ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3585 - Imam Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), narrated through Jabir from Amr ibn Shimr:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, underwent cupping. A servant from the tribe of Banu Bayadah performed the cupping, and the Prophet (sw) gave him payment. If it were prohibited, he would not have given him payment.
When the procedure was completed, the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, asked him: 'Where is the blood?'
The servant replied: 'I drank it, O Messenger of Allah (swt).'
The Prophet said: 'You should not have done that, but Allah (swt) has made it a barrier for you against the Fire.'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3586 - It is narrated from Ali ibn Ja'far, from his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), who said:
"I asked him about scattered treats such as sugar, almonds, and similar items-whether it is permissible to eat them.
Imam (as) replied: 'It is disliked to consume anything that is seized unlawfully.'"
arabicText: 3586 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلنُّثَارِ مِنَ اَلسُّكَّرِ وَ اَللَّوْزِ وَ أَشْبَاهِهِ أَ يَحِلُّ أَكْلُهُ فَقَالَ "يُكْرَهُ كُلُّ مَالٍ يُنْتَهَبُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3586 - It is narrated from Ali ibn Ja'far, from his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked him about scattered treats such as sugar, almonds, and similar items-whether it is permissible to eat them.
Imam (as) replied: 'It is disliked to consume anything that is seized unlawfully.'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3587 - It is narrated from Amr ibn Shimr, from Jabir, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
"When Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, revealed the verse: 'Indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than Allah (swt)], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid them' (Surah Al-Ma'idah 5:90).
The people asked: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is gambling (maysir)?'
He (sw) replied: 'Everything that involves betting, even dice and walnuts.'
They asked: 'What are the stone alters (ansab)?'
He (sw) said: 'They are the sacrifices offered to their idols.'
They asked: 'What are the divining arrows (azlam)?'
He (sw) said: 'They are their arrows used for seeking decisions or division.'"
arabicText:
3587 - وَ رَوَى عَمْرُو بْنُ شِمْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لَمَّا أَنْزَلَ اَللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى:
۝ إِنَّمَا اَلْخَمْرُ وَ اَلْمَيْسِرُ وَ اَلْأَنْصٰابُ وَ اَلْأَزْلاٰمُ رِجْسٌ مِنْ عَمَلِ اَلشَّيْطٰانِ فَاجْتَنِبُوهُ ۝
قِيلَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ مَا اَلْمَيْسِرُ قَالَ "كُلُّ مَا تُقُومِرَ بِهِ حَتَّى اَلْكِعَابُ وَ اَلْجَوْزُ، " قِيلَ فَمَا اَلْأَنْصَابُ قَالَ "مَا ذَبَحُوا لآِلِهَتِهِمْ " قِيلَ فَمَا اَلْأَزْلاَمُ قَالَ "قِدَاحُهُمُ اَلَّتِي يَسْتَقْسِمُونَ بِهَا " ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3587 - It is narrated from Amr ibn Shimr, from Jabir, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, revealed the verse: 'Indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than Allah (swt)], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid them' (Surah Al-Ma'idah 5:90).
The people asked: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is gambling (maysir)?'
He (sw) replied: 'Everything that involves betting, even dice and walnuts.'
They asked: 'What are the stone alters (ansab)?'
He (sw) said: 'They are the sacrifices offered to their idols.'
They asked: 'What are the divining arrows (azlam)?'
He (sw) said: 'They are their arrows used for seeking decisions or division.'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3588 - It is narrated from Al-Sakuni, from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that:
"He (as) used to forbid eating the walnuts that children bring from gambling, and He (as) said it is unlawful (suht)."
arabicText: 3588 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَنْهَى عَنِ اَلْجَوْزِ اَلَّذِي يَجِيءُ بِهِ اَلصِّبْيَانُ مِنَ اَلْقِمَارِ أَنْ يُؤْكَلَ وَ قَالَ هُوَ سُحْتٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3588 - It is narrated from Al-Sakuni, from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that:
thaqalaynMatn: "He (as) used to forbid eating the walnuts that children bring from gambling, and He (as) said it is unlawful (suht)."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3589 - It is narrated from Ayyub ibn Al-Hurr, from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
"There is no harm in the payment for a wailing woman who mourns the deceased, and the payment for a singer who escorts brides; there is no harm in it, as long as she is not someone whom men enter upon."
arabicText: 3589 - وَ رَوَى أَيُّوبُ بْنُ اَلْحُرِّ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَجْرِ اَلنَّائِحَةِ اَلَّتِي تَنُوحُ عَلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ وَ أَجْرِ اَلْمُغَنِّيَةِ اَلَّتِي تَزُفُّ اَلْعَرَائِسَ لَيْسَ بِهِ بَأْسٌ وَ لَيْسَتْ بِالَّتِي يَدْخُلُ عَلَيْهَا اَلرِّجَالُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3589 - It is narrated from Ayyub ibn Al-Hurr, from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in the payment for a wailing woman who mourns the deceased, and the payment for a singer who escorts brides; there is no harm in it, as long as she is not someone whom men enter upon."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3590 - It is narrated from Aban ibn Uthman, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Four things are not permissible in four situations: treachery, embezzlement, theft, and usury. They are not permissible in Hajj, Umrah, Jihad, or charity."
arabicText:
3590 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ :
"أَرْبَعٌ لاَ تَجُوزُ فِي أَرْبَعَةٍ اَلْخِيَانَةُ وَ اَلْغُلُولُ وَ اَلسَّرِقَةُ وَ اَلرِّبَا لاَ يَجُزْنَ فِي حَجٍّ وَ لاَ عُمْرَةٍ وَ لاَ جِهَادٍ وَ لاَ صَدَقَةٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3590 - It is narrated from Aban ibn Uthman, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Four things are not permissible in four situations: treachery, embezzlement, theft, and usury. They are not permissible in Hajj, Umrah, Jihad, or charity."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3591 - Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in the earnings of a hairdresser if she does not stipulate a specific payment and accepts what is given to her. However, she should not attach the hair of one woman to the hair of another woman. As for the hair of goats, there is no harm in attaching it to a woman's hair. Also, there is no harm in the earnings of a mourner if she speaks the truth."
arabicText: 3591 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ بَأْسَ بِكَسْبِ اَلْمَاشِطَةِ إِذَا لَمْ تُشَارِطْ وَ قَبِلَتْ مَا تُعْطَى وَ لاَ تَصِلُ شَعْرَ اَلْمَرْأَةِ بِشَعْرِ اِمْرَأَةٍ غَيْرِهَا فَأَمَّا شَعْرُ اَلْمَعْزِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يُوصَلَ بِشَعْرِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ وَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِكَسْبِ اَلنَّائِحَةِ إِذَا قَالَتْ صِدْقاً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3591 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in the earnings of a hairdresser if she does not stipulate a specific payment and accepts what is given to her. However, she should not attach the hair of one woman to the hair of another woman. As for the hair of goats, there is no harm in attaching it to a woman's hair. Also, there is no harm in the earnings of a mourner if she speaks the truth."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3592 - It is narrated: "She makes it permissible by striking one of her hands against the other."
arabicText: 3592 - وَ رُوِيَ "أَنَّهَا تَسْتَحِلُّهُ بِضَرْبِ إِحْدَى يَدَيْهَا عَلَى اَلْأُخْرَى ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3593 - It is narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from his father, who said:
"I saw Abu Al-Hasan (as) working in his land, and his feet were soaked in sweat. I said to him, 'May I be your ransom! Where are the men (to assist you)?'
Imam (as) replied: 'O Ali, one who is better than me and my father worked with his hands in his land.'
I asked him, 'Who is that?'
He said: 'The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family), Commander of the Faithful, and my forefathers (peace be upon them)-all of them worked with their hands, and it is the work of the prophets, the messengers, and the righteous."
arabicText: 3593 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ : رَأَيْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَعْمَلُ فِي أَرْضٍ لَهُ وَ قَدِ اِسْتَنْقَعَتْ قَدَمَاهُ فِي اَلْعَرَقِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ أَيْنَ اَلرِّجَالُ فَقَالَ "يَا عَلِيُّ عَمِلَ بِالْيَدِ مَنْ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنِّي وَ مِنْ أَبِي فِي أَرْضِهِ" فَقُلْتُ لَهُ مَنْ هُوَ فَقَالَ " رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَ آبَائِي عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ كُلُّهُمْ قَدْ عَمِلُوا بِأَيْدِيهِمْ وَ هُوَ مِنْ عَمَلِ اَلنَّبِيِّينَ وَ اَلْمُرْسَلِينَ وَ اَلصَّالِحِينَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3593 - It is narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from his father, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I saw Abu Al-Hasan (as) working in his land, and his feet were soaked in sweat. I said to him, 'May I be your ransom! Where are the men (to assist you)?'
Imam (as) replied: 'O Ali, one who is better than me and my father worked with his hands in his land.'
I asked him, 'Who is that?'
He said: 'The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family), Commander of the Faithful, and my forefathers (peace be upon them)-all of them worked with their hands, and it is the work of the prophets, the messengers, and the righteous."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3594 - It is narrated from Sharif ibn Sabiq Al-Taflisi, from Al-Fadl ibn Abi Qurrah Al-Samandi Al-Kufi, from Abu Abdullah (as), that Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
"Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, revealed to Dawud (as): 'You are an excellent servant, except that you eat from the public treasury and do not work with your hands.'
Dawud (as) then wept.
So Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, revealed to the iron:
'Soften for My servant Dawud.' (Surah Saba 34:10)
And the iron softened.
Allah (swt) made the iron pliable for him, and he began to make a coat of armor each day, selling it for a thousand dirhams.
Dawud (as) made three hundred and sixty coats of armor, selling them for three hundred and sixty thousand dirhams, and he became independent of the public treasury."
arabicText:
3594 - وَ رَوَى شَرِيفُ بْنُ سَابِقٍ اَلتَّفْلِيسِيُّ عَنِ اَلْفَضْلِ بْنِ أَبِي قُرَّةَ اَلسَّمَنْدِيِّ اَلْكُوفِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّ أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ :
"أَوْحَى اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَى دَاوُدَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ " "أَنَّكَ نِعْمَ اَلْعَبْدُ لَوْ لاَ أَنَّكَ تَأْكُلُ مِنْ بَيْتِ اَلْمَالِ وَ لاَ تَعْمَلُ بِيَدِكَ شَيْئاً" قَالَ "فَبَكَى دَاوُدُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَأَوْحَى اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَى اَلْحَدِيدِ ۝ أَنْ لِنْ لِعَبْدِي دَاوُدَ ۝
فَلاَنَ فَأَلاَنَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى لَهُ اَلْحَدِيدَ فَكَانَ يَعْمَلُ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ دِرْعاً فَيَبِيعُهَا بِأَلْفِ دِرْهَمٍ فَعَمِلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ ثَلاَثَمِائَةٍ وَ سِتِّينَ دِرْعاً فَبَاعَهَا بِثَلاَثِمِائَةٍ وَ سِتِّينَ أَلْفاً وَ اِسْتَغْنَى عَنْ بَيْتِ اَلْمَالِ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3595 - It is narrated from Al-Fadl ibn Abi Qurrah:
"We entered upon Abu Abdullah (as) while he was working in his garden.
We said: 'May Allah (swt) make us your ransom! Let us work for you, or let the servants handle it.'
Imam (as) replied: 'No, leave me to it, for I desire that Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, sees me working with my own hands and seeking lawful sustenance, even if it causes hardship to myself.'"
arabicText: 3595 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْفَضْلِ بْنِ أَبِي قُرَّةَ قَالَ : دَخَلْنَا عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ هُوَ يَعْمَلُ فِي حَائِطٍ لَهُ فَقُلْنَا جَعَلَنَا اَللَّهُ فِدَاكَ دَعْنَا نَعْمَلْ لَكَ أَوْ تَعْمَلْهُ اَلْغِلْمَانُ قَالَ "لاَ دَعُونِي فَإِنِّي أَشْتَهِي أَنْ يَرَانِيَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَعْمَلُ بِيَدِي وَ أَطْلُبُ اَلْحَلاَلَ فِي أَذَى نَفْسِي".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3595 - It is narrated from Al-Fadl ibn Abi Qurrah:
thaqalaynMatn:
"We entered upon Abu Abdullah (as) while he was working in his garden.
We said: 'May Allah (swt) make us your ransom! Let us work for you, or let the servants handle it.'
Imam (as) replied: 'No, leave me to it, for I desire that Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, sees me working with my own hands and seeking lawful sustenance, even if it causes hardship to myself.'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3596 - It is reported that Commander of the Faithful (as) used to go out during the midday heat for tasks that had already been taken care of, desiring that Allah (swt), the Exalted, would see him exerting himself in the pursuit of lawful sustenance.
arabicText: 3596 - وَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَخْرُجُ فِي اَلْهَاجِرَةِ فِي اَلْحَاجَةِ قَدْ كُفِيَهَا يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَرَاهُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى يُتْعِبُ نَفْسَهُ فِي طَلَبِ اَلْحَلاَلِ.

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3597 - It is reported from al-Fadl ibn Abi Qurrah that he said:
I asked Abu Abdillah (as), "These people claim that the earnings of a teacher are unlawful."
Imam (as) replied: "The enemies of Allah (swt) have lied! They only intend to prevent their children from learning the Quran. If a man were to give the teacher the blood money of his child, it would be lawful for the teacher."
arabicText:
3597 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْفَضْلِ بْنِ أَبِي قُرَّةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ إِنَّ هَؤُلاَءِ يَقُولُونَ إِنَّ كَسْبَ اَلْمُعَلِّمِ سُحْتٌ فَقَالَ
"كَذَبَ أَعْدَاءُ اَللَّهِ إِنَّمَا أَرَادُوا أَنْ لاَ يُعَلِّمُوا أَوْلاَدَهُمُ اَلْقُرْآنَ لَوْ أَنَّ رَجُلاً أَعْطَى اَلْمُعَلِّمَ دِيَةَ وَلَدِهِ كَانَ لِلْمُعَلِّمِ مُبَاحاً".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3597 - It is reported from al-Fadl ibn Abi Qurrah that he said:
I asked Abu Abdillah (as), "These people claim that the earnings of a teacher are unlawful."
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The enemies of Allah (swt) have lied! They only intend to prevent their children from learning the Quran. If a man were to give the teacher the blood money of his child, it would be lawful for the teacher."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3598 - Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) said:
"Part of a man's happiness is that his business is in his own land, that his associates are righteous, and that he has children who assist him."
arabicText: 3598 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ مِنْ سَعَادَةِ اَلْمَرْءِ أَنْ يَكُونَ مَتْجَرُهُ فِي بِلاَدِهِ وَ يَكُونَ خُلَطَاؤُهُ صَالِحِينَ وَ يَكُونَ لَهُ أَوْلاَدٌ يَسْتَعِينُ بِهِمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3598 - Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Part of a man's happiness is that his business is in his own land, that his associates are righteous, and that he has children who assist him."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3599 - It is narrated from Abdul-Hamid ibn 'Awad al-Ta'i who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "I have set up a millstone, and it is my sitting place where my companions also sit with me."
Imam (as) said: "That is Allah's (swt) mercy."
arabicText:
3599 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْحَمِيدِ بْنِ عَوَّاضٍ اَلطَّائِيِّ قَالَ :
قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي اِتَّخَذْتُ رَحًى فِيهَا مَجْلِسِي وَ يَجْلِسُ إِلَيَّ فِيهَا أَصْحَابِي قَالَ "ذَاكَ رِفْقُ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3599 - It is narrated from Abdul-Hamid ibn 'Awad al-Ta'i who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "I have set up a millstone, and it is my sitting place where my companions also sit with me."
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "That is Allah's (swt) mercy."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3600 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said to Al-Walid ibn Subayh:
"O Walid, do not buy anything for me from one who is engaged in unlawful earnings (Muharif), for there is no blessing in associating with him."
arabicText: 3600 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِلْوَلِيدِ بْنِ صَبِيحٍ : "يَا وَلِيدُ لاَ تَشْتَرِ لِي مِنْ مُحَارَفٍ شَيْئاً فَإِنَّ خُلْطَتَهُ لاَ بَرَكَةَ فِيهَا ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3600 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said to Al-Walid ibn Subayh:
thaqalaynMatn: "O Walid, do not buy anything for me from one who is engaged in unlawful earnings (Muharif), for there is no blessing in associating with him."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3601 - Imam (as) said: "Do not associate with or conduct business except with those who have been raised in goodness."
arabicText: 3601 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تُخَالِطُوا وَ لاَ تُعَامِلُوا إِلاَّ مَنْ نَشَأَ فِي اَلْخَيْرِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3601 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not associate with or conduct business except with those who have been raised in goodness."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3602 - Imam (as) said: "Beware of dealing with those who have defects, for they are the most unjust of people."
arabicText: 3602 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اِحْذَرُوا مُعَامَلَةَ أَصْحَابِ اَلْعَاهَاتِ فَإِنَّهُمْ أَظْلَمُ شَيْءٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3602 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Beware of dealing with those who have defects, for they are the most unjust of people."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3603 - Imam (as) said to Abu Al-Rabi' Al-Shami:
"Do not associate with the Kurds, for the Kurds are a group from the Jinn whom Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, has removed the veil from."
arabicText: 3603 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِأَبِي اَلرَّبِيعِ اَلشَّامِيِّ : "لاَ تُخَالِطِ اَلْأَكْرَادَ فَإِنَّ اَلْأَكْرَادَ حَيٌّ مِنَ اَلْجِنِّ كَشَفَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَنْهُمُ اَلْغِطَاءَ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3603 - Imam (as) said to Abu Al-Rabi' Al-Shami:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not associate with the Kurds, for the Kurds are a group from the Jinn whom Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, has removed the veil from."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3604 - Imam (as) said:
"Do not seek the assistance of a Magian, even for holding the legs of your sheep while you intend to slaughter it."
arabicText: 3604 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تَسْتَعِنْ بِمَجُوسِيٍّ ، وَ لَوْ عَلَى أَخْذِ قَوَائِمِ شَاتِكَ وَ أَنْتَ تُرِيدُ أَنْ تَذْبَحَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3604 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not seek the assistance of a Magian, even for holding the legs of your sheep while you intend to slaughter it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3605 - Imam (as) said: "Beware of associating with the lowly, for it does not lead to any good."
arabicText: 3605 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِيَّاكُمْ وَ مُخَالَطَةَ اَلسَّفِلَةِ، فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَئُولُ إِلَى خَيْرٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3605 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Beware of associating with the lowly, for it does not lead to any good."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3606 - Al-Fudhayl ibn Yasaar asked Abu Abdullah (as): "I have abandoned trade."
Imam (as) replied: "Do not do that. Open your door, spread your mat, and seek sustenance from your Lord (azj), Allah (swt)."
arabicText: 3606 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي قَدْ تَرَكْتُ اَلتِّجَارَةَ فَقَالَ "لاَ تَفْعَلْ اِفْتَحْ بَابَكَ وَ اُبْسُطْ بِسَاطَكَ وَ اِسْتَرْزِقِ اَللَّهَ رَبَّكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3606 - Al-Fudhayl ibn Yasaar asked Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I have abandoned trade."
Imam (as) replied: "Do not do that. Open your door, spread your mat, and seek sustenance from your Lord (azj), Allah (swt)."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3607 - Sadir Al-Sayrafi said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "What is required of a man in seeking sustenance?"
Imam (as) replied: "O Sadir, if you open your door and spread your mat, then you have fulfilled what is required of you."
arabicText: 3607 - وَ قَالَ سَدِيرٌ اَلصَّيْرَفِيُّ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَيُّ شَيْءٍ عَلَى اَلرَّجُلِ فِي طَلَبِ اَلرِّزْقِ فَقَالَ "يَا سَدِيرُ إِذَا فَتَحْتَ بَابَكَ وَ بَسَطْتَ بِسَاطَكَ فَقَدْ قَضَيْتَ مَا عَلَيْكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3607 - Sadir Al-Sayrafi said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "What is required of a man in seeking sustenance?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "O Sadir, if you open your door and spread your mat, then you have fulfilled what is required of you."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3608 - Imam (as) said: "Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, has made the sustenance of the believers come from where they do not expect. This is because when a servant does not know the source of his sustenance, his supplications increase."
arabicText: 3608 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى جَعَلَ أَرْزَاقَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ مِنْ حَيْثُ لاَ يَحْتَسِبُونَ وَ ذَلِكَ أَنَّ اَلْعَبْدَ إِذَا لَمْ يَعْرِفْ وَجْهَ رِزْقِهِ كَثُرَ دُعَاؤُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3608 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, has made the sustenance of the believers come from where they do not expect. This is because when a servant does not know the source of his sustenance, his supplications increase."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3609 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Be more hopeful for what you do not expect than for what you expect. Indeed, Moses, son of Imran (as), went out to fetch fire for his family, but Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, spoke to him, and he returned as a prophet. And the Queen of Sheba went out and embraced Islam with Solomon (as). And the magicians of Pharaoh went out seeking honor for Pharaoh but returned as believers."
arabicText: 3609 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "كُنْ لِمَا لاَ تَرْجُو أَرْجَى مِنْكَ لِمَا تَرْجُو فَإِنَّ مُوسَى بْنَ عِمْرَانَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ خَرَجَ يَقْتَبِسُ لِأَهْلِهِ نَاراً فَكَلَّمَهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ رَجَعَ نَبِيّاً وَ خَرَجَتْ مَلِكَةُ، سَبَإٍ فَأَسْلَمَتْ مَعَ سُلَيْمَانَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ خَرَجَتْ سَحَرَةُ فِرْعَوْنَ يَطْلُبُونَ اَلْعِزَّةَ لِفِرْعَوْنَ فَرَجَعُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3609 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Be more hopeful for what you do not expect than for what you expect. Indeed, Moses, son of Imran (as), went out to fetch fire for his family, but Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, spoke to him, and he returned as a prophet. And the Queen of Sheba went out and embraced Islam with Solomon (as). And the magicians of Pharaoh went out seeking honor for Pharaoh but returned as believers."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3610 - A man said to Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as):
"Promise me something."
Imam (as) replied: "How can I promise you, when I have more hope in what I do not expect than in what I do expect?"
arabicText: 3610 - وَ قَالَ رَجُلٌ لِأَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عِدْنِي قَالَ "كَيْفَ أَعِدُكَ وَ أَنَا لِمَا لاَ أَرْجُو أَرْجَى مِنِّي لِمَا أَرْجُو".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3610 - A man said to Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"Promise me something."
Imam (as) replied: "How can I promise you, when I have more hope in what I do not expect than in what I do expect?"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3611 - It is narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj, from Abu Abdullah (as):
"Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, does not close a door of sustenance for a believer except that He opens for him what is better than it."
arabicText: 3611 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَا سَدَّ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَلَى مُؤْمِنٍ بَابَ رِزْقٍ إِلاَّ فَتَحَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ مَا هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3611 - It is narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj, from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, does not close a door of sustenance for a believer except that He opens for him what is better than it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3612 - It is narrated by Al-Sakooni, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers (peace be upon them) that
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Whoever receives sustenance from Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, without having walked towards it with his feet, nor extended his hand for it, nor spoken about it with his tongue, nor prepared himself for it by tightening his garments, nor exposed himself to acquire it-he is among those whom Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, mentioned in His Book:
'And whoever fears Allah (swt), He will make a way out for him, and will provide for him from where he does not expect.'" (Surah At-Talaq 65:2-3)
arabicText: 3612 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ أَتَاهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِرِزْقٍ لَمْ يَخْطُ إِلَيْهِ بِرِجْلِهِ وَ لَمْ يَمُدَّ إِلَيْهِ يَدَهُ وَ لَمْ يَتَكَلَّمْ فِيهِ بِلِسَانِهِ وَ لَمْ يَشُدَّ إِلَيْهِ ثِيَابَهُ وَ لَمْ يَتَعَرَّضْ لَهُ كَانَ مِمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي كِتَابِهِ: ۝ وَ مَنْ يَتَّقِ اَللّٰهَ يَجْعَلْ لَهُ مَخْرَجاً وَ يَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لاٰ يَحْتَسِبُ ۝ "
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3612 - It is narrated by Al-Sakooni, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers (peace be upon them) that
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Whoever receives sustenance from Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, without having walked towards it with his feet, nor extended his hand for it, nor spoken about it with his tongue, nor prepared himself for it by tightening his garments, nor exposed himself to acquire it-he is among those whom Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, mentioned in His Book:
'And whoever fears Allah (swt), He will make a way out for him, and will provide for him from where he does not expect.'" (Surah At-Talaq 65:2-3)

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3613 - Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said: "Assistance descends from the heavens in proportion to one's needs."
arabicText: 3613 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْمَعُونَةُ تَنْزِلُ مِنَ اَلسَّمَاءِ عَلَى قَدْرِ اَلْمَئُونَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3613 - Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Assistance descends from the heavens in proportion to one's needs."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3614 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Wealth that prevents you from committing oppression is better than poverty that leads you to sin."
arabicText: 3614 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "غِنًى يَحْجُزُكَ عَنِ اَلظُّلْمِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ فَقْرٍ يَحْمِلُكَ عَلَى اَلْإِثْمِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3614 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Wealth that prevents you from committing oppression is better than poverty that leads you to sin."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3615 - Imam (as) said: "There is no good in one who does not desire to earn wealth through lawful means, so that he may protect his dignity, pay off his debts, and maintain ties of kinship."
arabicText: 3615 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ خَيْرَ فِيمَنْ لاَ يُحِبُّ جَمْعَ اَلْمَالِ مِنْ حَلاَلٍ فَيَكُفَّ بِهِ وَجْهَهُ وَ يَقْضِيَ بِهِ دَيْنَهُ وَ يَصِلَ بِهِ رَحِمَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3615 - Imam (as) said:
