thaqalaynMatn: "There is no good in one who does not desire to earn wealth through lawful means, so that he may protect his dignity, pay off his debts, and maintain ties of kinship."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3616 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"Part of honor and dignity is managing wealth properly."
arabicText: 3616 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مِنَ اَلْمُرُوءَةِ اِسْتِصْلاَحُ اَلْمَالِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3616 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Part of honor and dignity is managing wealth properly."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3617 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Managing wealth properly is a part of faith."
arabicText: 3617 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِصْلاَحُ اَلْمَالِ مِنَ اَلْإِيمَانِ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3618 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"A Muslim cannot be righteous except through three qualities: understanding the religion, managing livelihood wisely, and exercising patience in adversity."
arabicText: 3618 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ يَصْلُحُ اَلْمَرْءُ اَلْمُسْلِمُ إِلاَّ بِثَلاَثٍ اَلتَّفَقُّهِ فِي اَلدِّينِ وَ اَلتَّقْدِيرِ فِي اَلْمَعِيشَةِ وَ اَلصَّبْرِ عَلَى اَلنَّائِبَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3618 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A Muslim cannot be righteous except through three qualities: understanding the religion, managing livelihood wisely, and exercising patience in adversity."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3619 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Indeed, when the soul secures its provision, it becomes content."
arabicText: 3619 - قَالَ وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "إِنَّ اَلنَّفْسَ إِذَا أَحْرَزَتْ قُوتَهَا اِسْتَقَرَّتْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3619 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, when the soul secures its provision, it becomes content."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3620 - Mu'ammar ibn Khallad asked Abu al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about storing food for a year.
Imam (as) replied: "I do it myself."
arabicText: 3620 - وَ سَأَلَ مُعَمَّرُ بْنُ خَلاَّدٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ حَبْسِ اَلطَّعَامِ سَنَةً فَقَالَ "أَنَا أَفْعَلُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3620 - Mu'ammar ibn Khallad asked Abu al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about storing food for a year.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "I do it myself."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3621 - Ibn Abi Ya'fur narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
'There is no spending more beloved to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, than moderate spending. He (swt) dislikes extravagance, except in Hajj and Umrah.
May Allah (swt) have mercy on a believer who earns lawfully, spends moderately, or gives something in charity from his surplus.' "
arabicText: 3621 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ : "مَا مِنْ نَفَقَةٍ أَحَبَّ إِلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ نَفَقَةِ قَصْدٍ وَ يُبْغِضُ اَلْإِسْرَافَ إِلاَّ فِي اَلْحَجِّ وَ اَلْعُمْرَةِ فَرَحِمَ اَللَّهُ مُؤْمِناً كَسَبَ طَيِّباً وَ أَنْفَقَ مِنْ قَصْدٍ أَوْ قَدَّمَ فَضْلاً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3621 - Ibn Abi Ya'fur narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
'There is no spending more beloved to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, than moderate spending. He (swt) dislikes extravagance, except in Hajj and Umrah.
May Allah (swt) have mercy on a believer who earns lawfully, spends moderately, or gives something in charity from his surplus.' "

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3622 - The Scholar, Imam (as) said: "I guarantee that whoever practices moderation will never become poor."
arabicText: 3622 - وَ قَالَ اَلْعَالِمُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "ضَمِنْتُ لِمَنِ اِقْتَصَدَ أَنْ لاَ يَفْتَقِرَ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3623 - Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) said:
"A man may spend his wealth on what is right, yet still be considered extravagant."
arabicText: 3623 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَلرَّجُلَ لَيُنْفِقُ مَالَهُ فِي حَقٍّ وَ إِنَّهُ لَمُسْرِفٌ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3623 - Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A man may spend his wealth on what is right, yet still be considered extravagant."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3624 - Al-Asbagh ibn Nubata narrated from Commander of the Faithful (as) that he said:
"The extravagant person has three signs: he eats what does not belong to him, buys what does not belong to him, and wears what does not belong to him."
arabicText: 3624 - وَ رَوَى اَلْأَصْبَغُ بْنُ نُبَاتَةَ عَنْ أَمِيرِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "لِلْمُسْرِفِ ثَلاَثُ عَلاَمَاتٍ يَأْكُلُ مَا لَيْسَ لَهُ وَ يَشْتَرِي مَا لَيْسَ لَهُ وَ يَلْبَسُ مَا لَيْسَ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3624 - Al-Asbagh ibn Nubata narrated from Commander of the Faithful (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The extravagant person has three signs: he eats what does not belong to him, buys what does not belong to him, and wears what does not belong to him."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3625 - Abu Hisham al-Basri narrated from Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) that he said:
"Among the causes of corruption are the discontinuation of currency (dirham and dinar) and the discarding of date pits."
arabicText: 3625 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو هِشَامٍ اَلْبَصْرِيُّ عَنْ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "مِنَ اَلْفَسَادِ قَطْعُ اَلدِّرْهَمِ وَ اَلدِّينَارِ وَ طَرْحُ اَلنَّوَى ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3625 - Abu Hisham al-Basri narrated from Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Among the causes of corruption are the discontinuation of currency (dirham and dinar) and the discarding of date pits."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3626 - Ishaq ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the least form of extravagance. Imam (as) replied: "Wearing your garment of dignity for ordinary tasks, spilling the excess of what is in your vessel, and carelessly throwing away date pits like this and that."
arabicText: 3626 - وَ سَأَلَ إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ أَدْنَى اَلْإِسْرَافِ فَقَالَ "ثَوْبُ صَوْنِكَ تَبْتَذِلُهُ وَ فَضْلُ اَلْإِنَاءِ تُهَرِيقُهُ وَ قَذْفُكَ اَلنَّوَى هَكَذَا وَ هَكَذَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3626 - Ishaq ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the least form of extravagance. Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Wearing your garment of dignity for ordinary tasks, spilling the excess of what is in your vessel, and carelessly throwing away date pits like this and that."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3627 - Al-Walid ibn Sabih narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that he said:
"Three people make supplications, but their prayers are not answered"-or he said: "their prayers are returned to them":
A man who had a large amount of wealth, reaching thirty thousand or forty thousand, and spent it without careful consideration. Then he says, 'O Allah (swt), provide for me.' Allah (swt), the Exalted, says, 'Did I not provide for you?'
A man who refrains from seeking sustenance and says, 'O Allah (swt), provide for me.' Allah (swt), the Exalted, says, 'Did I not make a way for you to seek provision?'
A man who had a wife and prays, 'O Allah (swt), separate me from her.' Allah (swt), the Almighty, says, 'Did I not give you the authority to handle this matter yourself?'"
arabicText: 3627 - وَ رَوَى اَلْوَلِيدُ بْنُ صَبِيحٍ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "ثَلاَثَةٌ يَدْعُونَ فَلاَ يُسْتَجَابُ لَهُمْ" أَوْ قَالَ "يُرَدُّ عَلَيْهِمْ دُعَاؤُهُمْ رَجُلٌ كَانَ لَهُ مَالٌ كَثِيرٌ يَبْلُغُ ثَلاَثِينَ أَلْفاً أَوْ أَرْبَعِينَ أَلْفاً فَأَنْفَقَهُ فِي وُجُوهِهِ فَيَقُولُ اَللَّهُمَّ اُرْزُقْنِي فَيَقُولُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى أَ لَمْ أَرْزُقْكَ وَ رَجُلٌ أَمْسَكَ عَنِ اَلطَّلَبِ فَيَقُولُ اَللَّهُمَّ اُرْزُقْنِي فَيَقُولُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى أَ لَمْ أَجْعَلْ لَكَ اَلسَّبِيلَ إِلَى اَلطَّلَبِ وَ رَجُلٌ كَانَتْ عِنْدَهُ اِمْرَأَةٌ فَقَالَ اَللَّهُمَّ فَرِّقْ بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَهَا فَيَقُولُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَ لَمْ أَجْعَلْ ذَلِكَ إِلَيْكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3627 - Al-Walid ibn Sabih narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Three people make supplications, but their prayers are not answered"-or he said: "their prayers are returned to them":
A man who had a large amount of wealth, reaching thirty thousand or forty thousand, and spent it without careful consideration. Then he says, 'O Allah (swt), provide for me.' Allah (swt), the Exalted, says, 'Did I not provide for you?'
A man who refrains from seeking sustenance and says, 'O Allah (swt), provide for me.' Allah (swt), the Exalted, says, 'Did I not make a way for you to seek provision?'
A man who had a wife and prays, 'O Allah (swt), separate me from her.' Allah (swt), the Almighty, says, 'Did I not give you the authority to handle this matter yourself?'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3628 - Imam (as) said: "Part of a man's happiness is that he is the caretaker of his family."
arabicText: 3628 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مِنْ سَعَادَةِ اَلْمَرْءِ أَنْ يَكُونَ اَلْقَيِّمَ عَلَى عِيَالِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3628 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Part of a man's happiness is that he is the caretaker of his family."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3629 - Imam (as) said: "It is sufficient for a man to be sinful if he neglects those he is responsible for."
arabicText: 3629 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ إِثْماً أَنْ يُضَيِّعَ مَنْ يَعُولُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3629 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is sufficient for a man to be sinful if he neglects those he is responsible for."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3630 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"Cursed, cursed is the one who neglects those he is responsible for."
arabicText: 3630 - وَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَلْعُونٌ مَلْعُونٌ مَنْ يُضَيِّعُ مَنْ يَعُولُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3630 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Cursed, cursed is the one who neglects those he is responsible for."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3631 - Imam (as) said: "The one who strives to provide for his family through lawful means is like a warrior in the path of Allah (swt)."
arabicText: 3631 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْكَادُّ عَلَى عِيَالِهِ مِنْ حَلاَلٍ كَالْمُجَاهِدِ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3632 - Isma'il bin Jabir narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) that he said:
"Do not expose yourselves to obligations, but if they become binding upon you, then be patient with them."
arabicText: 3632 - وَ رَوَى إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "لاَ تَتَعَرَّضُوا لِلْحُقُوقِ، فَإِذَا لَزِمَتْكُمْ فَاصْبِرُوا لَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3632 - Isma'il bin Jabir narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not expose yourselves to obligations, but if they become binding upon you, then be patient with them."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3633 - Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) said:
"Do not give to your brothers from yourself what causes you more harm than it benefits them."
arabicText: 3633 - وَ قَالَ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تَبْذُلْ لِإِخْوَانِكَ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ مَا ضَرَرُهُ عَلَيْكَ أَكْثَرُ مِنْ نَفْعِهِ لَهُمْ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3633 - Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not give to your brothers from yourself what causes you more harm than it benefits them."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3634 - Abu Abdillah (as) said:
"Beware of laziness and restlessness, for they are the keys to every evil. Indeed, whoever is lazy will not fulfill a right, and whoever is restless will not endure upon the truth."
arabicText: 3634 - وَ رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "إِيَّاكَ وَ اَلْكَسَلَ وَ اَلضَّجَرَ فَإِنَّهُمَا مِفْتَاحُ كُلِّ سُوءٍ إِنَّهُ مَنْ كَسِلَ لَمْ يُؤَدِّ حَقّاً وَ مَنْ ضَجِرَ لَمْ يَصْبِرْ عَلَى حَقٍّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3634 - Abu Abdillah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Beware of laziness and restlessness, for they are the keys to every evil. Indeed, whoever is lazy will not fulfill a right, and whoever is restless will not endure upon the truth."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3635 - Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said: "Indeed, Allah (swt) the Exalted hates a servant who sleeps excessively. Indeed, Allah (swt) the Exalted hates a servant who is idle."
arabicText: 3635 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى لَيُبْغِضُ اَلْعَبْدَ اَلنَّوَّامَ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى لَيُبْغِضُ اَلْعَبْدَ اَلْفَارِغَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3635 - Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Allah (swt) the Exalted hates a servant who sleeps excessively. Indeed, Allah (swt) the Exalted hates a servant who is idle."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3636 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said to Bishir al-Nabbal:
"When you are granted provision from something, remain committed to it."
arabicText: 3636 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِبَشِيرٍ اَلنَّبَّالِ : "إِذَا رُزِقْتَ مِنْ شَيْءٍ فَالْزَمْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3636 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said to Bishir al-Nabbal:
thaqalaynMatn: "When you are granted provision from something, remain committed to it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3637 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
A man complained to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) about trade.
The Prophet said: "Look for merchandise, purchase it, and then sell it. Whatever you profit from it, remain committed to it."
arabicText: 3637 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "شَكَا رَجُلٌ إِلَى رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَلْحُرْفَةَ فَقَالَ "اُنْظُرْ بُيُوعاً فَاشْتَرِهَا ثُمَّ بِعْهَا فَمَا رَبِحْتَ فِيهِ فَالْزَمْهُ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3637 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
A man complained to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) about trade.
The Prophet said: "Look for merchandise, purchase it, and then sell it. Whatever you profit from it, remain committed to it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3638 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Handle your major affairs personally, and delegate the smaller ones to others."
It was asked: "What kind of tasks are you referring to?"
Imam (as) replied: "Matters like buying and selling properties and similar transactions."
arabicText: 3638 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "بَاشِرْ كِبَارَ أُمُورِكَ بِنَفْسِكَ وَ كِلْ مَا صَغُرَ مِنْهَا إِلَى غَيْرِكَ " فَقِيلَ ضَرْبُ أَيِّ شَيْءٍ فَقَالَ "ضَرْبُ أَشْرِيَةِ اَلْعَقَارِ وَ مَا أَشْبَهَهَا".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3639 - It is narrated from Al-Arqat that Abu Abdillah (as) said:
"Do not spend your time wandering through markets, nor personally handle the purchase of minor goods. It does not befit a Muslim who possesses faith and honor to involve himself directly in purchasing small items-except in three matters.
It is proper for a man of faith and dignity to personally handle these three matters: buying real estate, camels, and slaves."
arabicText:
3639 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْأَرْقَطِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
"لاَ تَكُونَنَّ دَوَّاراً فِي اَلْأَسْوَاقِ وَ لاَ تَلِي شِرَاءَ دَقَائِقِ اَلْأَشْيَاءِ بِنَفْسِكَ فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَنْبَغِي لِلْمَرْءِ اَلْمُسْلِمِ ذِي اَلدِّينِ وَ اَلْحَسَبِ أَنْ يَلِيَ شِرَاءَ دَقَائِقِ اَلْأَشْيَاءِ بِنَفْسِهِ مَا خَلاَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَشْيَاءَ فَإِنَّهُ يَنْبَغِي لِذِي اَلدِّينِ وَ اَلْحَسَبِ أَنْ يَلِيَهَا بِنَفْسِهِ اَلْعَقَارَ وَ اَلْإِبِلَ وَ اَلرَّقِيقَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3639 - It is narrated from Al-Arqat that Abu Abdillah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Do not spend your time wandering through markets, nor personally handle the purchase of minor goods. It does not befit a Muslim who possesses faith and honor to involve himself directly in purchasing small items-except in three matters.
It is proper for a man of faith and dignity to personally handle these three matters: buying real estate, camels, and slaves."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3640 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
"Commander of the Faithful (as) used to gather firewood, draw water, and sweep, while Sayiida Fatimah {s.a} used to grind, knead, and bake."
arabicText:
3640 - وَ رَوَى هِشَامُ بْنُ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ :
"كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَحْتَطِبُ وَ يَسْتَقِي وَ يَكْنُسُ وَ كَانَتْ فَاطِمَةُ عَلَيْهَا اَلسَّلاَمُ تَطْحَنُ وَ تَعْجِنُ وَ تَخْبِزُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3640 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Commander of the Faithful (as) used to gather firewood, draw water, and sweep, while Sayiida Fatimah {s.a} used to grind, knead, and bake."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3641 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"The buyer of real estate is blessed, while the seller of real estate is deprived."
arabicText: 3641 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مُشْتَرِي اَلْعَقَارِ مَرْزُوقٌ وَ بَائِعُ اَلْعَقَارِ مَمْحُوقٌ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3641 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The buyer of real estate is blessed, while the seller of real estate is deprived."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3642 - Zurara narrated from Abu Abdillah (as): "A man does not leave behind anything more burdensome upon him than silent wealth (hoarded wealth)."
I asked him, "What should he do with it?"
Imam (as) replied: "Invest it in walls, orchards, and houses."
arabicText: 3642 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَا يُخَلِّفُ اَلرَّجُلُ بَعْدَهُ شَيْئاً أَشَدَّ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ اَلْمَالِ اَلصَّامِتِ " قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ قَالَ "يَضَعُهُ فِي اَلْحَائِطِ وَ اَلْبُسْتَانِ وَ اَلدَّارِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3642 - Zurara narrated from Abu Abdillah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"A man does not leave behind anything more burdensome upon him than silent wealth (hoarded wealth)."
I asked him, "What should he do with it?"
Imam (as) replied: "Invest it in walls, orchards, and houses."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3643 - Abdul-Samad ibn Bashir narrate from Muawiyah ibn Ammar from Abu Abdullah (as):
"When the Messenger of Allah (swt) entered Medina, he marked its houses with his foot and then said: 'O Allah (swt), do not bless anyone who sells a piece of land from it.' "
arabicText: 3643 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَلصَّمَدِ بْنُ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لَمَّا دَخَلَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَلْمَدِينَةَ خَطَّ دُورَهَا بِرِجْلِهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ " اَللَّهُمَّ مَنْ بَاعَ رُقْعَةً مِنْ أَرْضٍ فَلاَ تُبَارِكْ فِيهِ " ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3643 - Abdul-Samad ibn Bashir narrate from Muawiyah ibn Ammar from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "When the Messenger of Allah (swt) entered Medina, he marked its houses with his foot and then said: 'O Allah (swt), do not bless anyone who sells a piece of land from it.' "

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3644 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"It is written in the Torah that whoever sells land and water, and does not invest its price in land and water, its price will be lost in ruin."
arabicText: 3644 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَكْتُوبٌ فِي اَلتَّوْرَاةِ أَنَّهُ مَنْ بَاعَ أَرْضاً وَ مَاءً فَلَمْ يَضَعْ ثَمَنَهُ فِي أَرْضٍ وَ مَاءٍ ذَهَبَ ثَمَنُهُ مَحْقاً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3644 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is written in the Torah that whoever sells land and water, and does not invest its price in land and water, its price will be lost in ruin."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3645 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
I asked him about the earnings of a cupper (bloodletter).
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 3645 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ كَسْبِ اَلْحَجَّامِ فَقَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3645 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about the earnings of a cupper (bloodletter).
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3646 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade 'Aseeb Al-Fahl', which is the fee for the mating of a stallion.
arabicText: 3646 - وَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَنْ عَسِيبِ اَلْفَحْلِ وَ هُوَ أَجْرُ اَلضِّرَابِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3646 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade 'Aseeb Al-Fahl', which is the fee for the mating of a stallion.

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3647 - Abu Basir asked him about the price of a hunting dog.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in its price, but as for the other type, its price is not permissible."
arabicText: 3647 - وَ سَأَلَهُ أَبُو بَصِيرٍ : عَنْ ثَمَنِ كَلْبِ اَلصَّيْدِ فَقَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ بِثَمَنِهِ وَ اَلْآخَرُ لاَ يَحِلُّ ثَمَنُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3647 - Abu Basir asked him about the price of a hunting dog.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in its price, but as for the other type, its price is not permissible."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3648 - Imam (as) said:
"The wage of a prostitute is unlawful (suht), the price of a dog that is not a hunting dog is unlawful (suht), the price of wine is unlawful (suht), the earnings of a soothsayer are unlawful (suht), and the price of a dead animal is unlawful (suht). As for bribes in judgment, they amount to disbelief in Allah (swt), the Almighty."
arabicText: 3648 - وَ قَالَ : "أَجْرُ اَلزَّانِيَةِ سُحْتٌ وَ ثَمَنُ اَلْكَلْبِ اَلَّذِي لَيْسَ بِكَلْبِ اَلصَّيْدِ سُحْتٌ وَ ثَمَنُ اَلْخَمْرِ سُحْتٌ وَ أَجْرُ اَلْكَاهِنِ سُحْتٌ وَ ثَمَنُ اَلْمَيْتَةِ سُحْتٌ فَأَمَّا اَلرِّشَا فِي اَلْحُكْمِ فَهُوَ اَلْكُفْرُ بِاللَّهِ اَلْعَظِيمِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3648 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The wage of a prostitute is unlawful (suht), the price of a dog that is not a hunting dog is unlawful (suht), the price of wine is unlawful (suht), the earnings of a soothsayer are unlawful (suht), and the price of a dead animal is unlawful (suht). As for bribes in judgment, they amount to disbelief in Allah (swt), the Almighty."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3649 - It is narrated: "The earnings of a male singer and a female singer are unlawful (suht)."
arabicText: 3649 - وَ رُوِيَ : "أَنَّ أَجْرَ اَلْمُغَنِّي وَ اَلْمُغَنِّيَةِ سُحْتٌ ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3650 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, forbade taking payment for recitation by one who does not recite except on a stipulated fee.
arabicText: 3650 - : وَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَنْ أُجْرَةِ اَلْقَارِئِ اَلَّذِي لاَ يَقْرَأُ إِلاَّ عَلَى أَجْرٍ مَشْرُوطٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3650 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, forbade taking payment for recitation by one who does not recite except on a stipulated fee.

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3651 - Al-Husayn ibn al-Mukhtar al-Qalanisi narrated:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as), 'We make caps and place old cotton inside them, then sell them without informing the buyers of what is inside.'
Imam (as) replied: 'I would prefer that you inform them about what is inside.'
arabicText:
3651 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ اَلْمُخْتَارِ اَلْقَلاَنِسِيِّ قَالَ :
قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّا نَعْمَلُ اَلْقَلاَنِسَ فَنَجْعَلُ فِيهَا اَلْقُطْنَ اَلْعَتِيقَ فَنَبِيعُهَا وَ لاَ نُبَيِّنُ لَهُمْ مَا فِيهَا فَقَالَ "إِنِّي لَأُحِبُّ لَكَ أَنْ تُبَيِّنَ لَهُمْ مَا فِيهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3651 - Al-Husayn ibn al-Mukhtar al-Qalanisi narrated:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as), 'We make caps and place old cotton inside them, then sell them without informing the buyers of what is inside.'
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: 'I would prefer that you inform them about what is inside.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3652 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Indeed, the one who consumes the wealth of an orphan will face its consequences both in this world and in the Hereafter.
As for this world, Allah (swt), the Almighty, says: 'And let those fear who, if they left behind weak offspring, would be afraid for them. So let them fear Allah (swt)...' (Surah An-Nisa 4:9).
And as for the Hereafter, Allah (swt), the Almighty, says: 'Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.' (Surah An-Nisa 4:10)."
arabicText:
3652 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ آكِلَ مَالِ اَلْيَتِيمِ سَيَلْحَقُهُ وَبَالُ ذَلِكَ فِي اَلدُّنْيَا وَ اَلْآخِرَةِ أَمَّا فِي اَلدُّنْيَا فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ:
۝ وَ لْيَخْشَ اَلَّذِينَ لَوْ تَرَكُوا مِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّةً ضِعٰافاً خٰافُوا عَلَيْهِمْ فَلْيَتَّقُوا اَللّٰهَ ۝
وَ أَمَّا فِي اَلْآخِرَةِ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ:
۝ إِنَّ اَلَّذِينَ يَأْكُلُونَ أَمْوٰالَ اَلْيَتٰامىٰ ظُلْماً إِنَّمٰا يَأْكُلُونَ فِي بُطُونِهِمْ نٰاراً وَ سَيَصْلَوْنَ سَعِيراً ۝ "
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3652 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Indeed, the one who consumes the wealth of an orphan will face its consequences both in this world and in the Hereafter.
As for this world, Allah (swt), the Almighty, says: 'And let those fear who, if they left behind weak offspring, would be afraid for them. So let them fear Allah (swt)...' (Surah An-Nisa 4:9).
And as for the Hereafter, Allah (swt), the Almighty, says: 'Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.' (Surah An-Nisa 4:10)."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3653 - Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Imam Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan bin Ali (as) asking:
"A man escorts caravans without the order of the ruler in a fearful place, and they agree with him on a specific payment. Is it permissible for him to take it from them or not?"
Imam (as) said: "If he hires himself out for a well-known payment, he may take his due, Allah (swt) willing."
arabicText: 3653 - وَ كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلصَّفَّارُ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : رَجُلٌ يُبَذْرِقُ اَلْقَوَافِلَ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَمْرِ اَلسُّلْطَانِ فِي مَوْضِعٍ مُخِيفٍ وَ يُشَارِطُونَهُ عَلَى شَيْءٍ مُسَمًّى أَ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَهُ مِنْهُمْ أَمْ لاَ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "إِذَا آجَرَ نَفْسَهُ بِشَيْءٍ مَعْرُوفٍ أَخَذَ حَقَّهُ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3653 - Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Imam Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan bin Ali (as) asking:
"A man escorts caravans without the order of the ruler in a fearful place, and they agree with him on a specific payment. Is it permissible for him to take it from them or not?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he hires himself out for a well-known payment, he may take his due, Allah (swt) willing."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3654 - Muhammad bin Isa bin Ubaid Al-Yaqtini wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali bin Muhammad Al-Askari (as), asking: "A man entrusted his son to another man and handed him over for a year with a known wage to sew for him. Then another man came and said to him, 'Hand over your son to me for a year with an increased wage.'
Does he have the choice in this matter, and is it permissible for him to revoke the agreement made with the first man or not?"
Imam (as) replied in his handwriting: 'He must fulfill the agreement with the first man unless his son faces illness or weakness.'
arabicText: 3654 - وَ كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عِيسَى بْنِ عُبَيْدٍ اَلْيَقْطِينِيُّ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْعَسْكَرِيِّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ دَفَعَ اِبْنَهُ إِلَى رَجُلٍ وَ سَلَّمَهُ مِنْهُ سَنَةً بِأُجْرَةٍ مَعْلُومَةٍ لِيَخِيطَ لَهُ ثُمَّ جَاءَ رَجُلٌ آخَرُ فَقَالَ لَهُ سَلِّمْ اِبْنَكَ مِنِّي سَنَةً بِزِيَادَةٍ هَلْ لَهُ اَلْخِيَارُ فِي ذَلِكَ وَ هَلْ يَجُوزُ لَهُ أَنْ يَفْسَخَ مَا وَافَقَ عَلَيْهِ اَلْأَوَّلُ أَمْ لاَ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِخَطِّهِ "يَجِبُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْوَفَاءُ لِلْأَوَّلِ مَا لَمْ يَعْرِضْ لاِبْنِهِ مَرَضٌ أَوْ ضَعْفٌ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3654 - Muhammad bin Isa bin Ubaid Al-Yaqtini wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali bin Muhammad Al-Askari (as), asking: "A man entrusted his son to another man and handed him over for a year with a known wage to sew for him. Then another man came and said to him, 'Hand over your son to me for a year with an increased wage.'
Does he have the choice in this matter, and is it permissible for him to revoke the agreement made with the first man or not?"
Imam (as) replied in his handwriting:
thaqalaynMatn: 'He must fulfill the agreement with the first man unless his son faces illness or weakness.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3655 - Muhammad bin Khalid Al-Barqi narrated from Muhammad bin Sinan, who narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as) that he said: I asked him about hiring (employment).
Imam (as) said: 'It is permissible and there is no harm in it as long as one does it sincerely and to the best of his ability. Indeed, Musa bin Imran (as) hired himself out and stipulated: "If you wish, for eight years, and if you wish, for ten years."
Then Allah (swt), the Exalted, revealed regarding him:
That you serve me for eight years, but if you complete ten, it will be of your own accord.'' (Surah Al-Qasas 28:27)
arabicText:
3655 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ خَالِدٍ اَلْبَرْقِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْإِجَارَةِ فَقَالَ "صَالِحٌ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهَا إِذَا نَصَحَ قَدْرَ طَاقَتِهِ قَدْ آجَرَ نَفْسَهُ مُوسَى بْنُ عِمْرَانَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ اِشْتَرَطَ قَالَ إِنْ شِئْتُ ثَمَانِياً وَ إِنْ شِئْتُ عَشْراً فَأَنْزَلَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى فِيهِ
۝ عَلىٰ أَنْ تَأْجُرَنِي ثَمٰانِيَ حِجَجٍ فَإِنْ أَتْمَمْتَ عَشْراً فَمِنْ عِنْدِكَ ۝ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3655 - Muhammad bin Khalid Al-Barqi narrated from Muhammad bin Sinan, who narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as) that he said: I asked him about hiring (employment).
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: 'It is permissible and there is no harm in it as long as one does it sincerely and to the best of his ability. Indeed, Musa bin Imran (as) hired himself out and stipulated: "If you wish, for eight years, and if you wish, for ten years."
Then Allah (swt), the Exalted, revealed regarding him:
That you serve me for eight years, but if you complete ten, it will be of your own accord.'' (Surah Al-Qasas 28:27)

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3656 - Muhammad bin Amr bin Abi Al-Miqdam narrated from Ammar Al-Sabati, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who trades but, if he hires himself out, earns more than he does in his trade.
Imam (as) said: 'He should not hire himself out but rather seek sustenance from Allah (swt), the Exalted, and continue trading. For if he hires himself out, he will restrict his sustenance.'
arabicText: 3656 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَمْرِو بْنِ أَبِي اَلْمِقْدَامِ عَنْ عَمَّارٍ اَلسَّابَاطِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَتَّجِرُ وَ إِنْ هُوَ آجَرَ نَفْسَهُ أُعْطِيَ أَكْثَرَ مِمَّا يُصِيبُ فِي تِجَارَتِهِ قَالَ "لاَ يُؤَاجِرْ نَفْسَهُ وَ لَكِنْ يَسْتَرْزِقُ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى وَ يَتَّجِرُ فَإِنَّهُ إِذَا آجَرَ نَفْسَهُ حَظَرَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ اَلرِّزْقَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3656 - Muhammad bin Amr bin Abi Al-Miqdam narrated from Ammar Al-Sabati, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as),
thaqalaynMatn:
about a man who trades but, if he hires himself out, earns more than he does in his trade.
Imam (as) said: 'He should not hire himself out but rather seek sustenance from Allah (swt), the Exalted, and continue trading. For if he hires himself out, he will restrict his sustenance.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3657 - Abdullah bin Muhammad Al-Ju'fi narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
'Whoever hires himself out has restricted his sustenance. And how could he not restrict his sustenance when whatever he earns belongs to the master who hired him?'
arabicText: 3657 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْجُعْفِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَنْ آجَرَ نَفْسَهُ فَقَدْ حَظَرَ عَلَيْهَا اَلرِّزْقَ وَ كَيْفَ لاَ يَحْظُرُ عَلَيْهَا اَلرِّزْقَ وَ مَا أَصَابَ فَهُوَ لِرَبٍّ آجَرَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3657 - Abdullah bin Muhammad Al-Ju'fi narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: 'Whoever hires himself out has restricted his sustenance. And how could he not restrict his sustenance when whatever he earns belongs to the master who hired him?'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3658 - Harun bin Hamzah Al-Ghanawi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a man who hired a laborer, but neither of them trusted the other, so they deposited the wages with a third person. Then that third person died without leaving anything to cover the wages, and the wages were lost.
Imam (as) said: 'The employer is responsible for the wages of the laborer until they are settled, unless the laborer had invited the employer to do so and agreed to it. If he did, then his right is where he placed it and what he agreed upon.'
arabicText: 3658 - وَ رَوَى هَارُونُ بْنُ حَمْزَةَ اَلْغَنَوِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ اِسْتَأْجَرَ أَجِيراً فَلَمْ يَأْمَنْ أَحَدُهُمَا صَاحِبَهُ فَوَضَعَ اَلْأَجْرَ عَلَى يَدَيْ رَجُلٍ فَهَلَكَ ذَلِكَ اَلرَّجُلُ وَ لَمْ يَدَعْ وَفَاءً وَ اُسْتُهْلِكَ اَلْأَجْرُ فَقَالَ "اَلْمُسْتَأْجِرُ ضَامِنٌ لِأَجْرِ اَلْأَجِيرِ حَتَّى يَقْضِيَ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ اَلْأَجِيرُ دَعَاهُ إِلَى ذَلِكَ فَرَضِيَ بِهِ فَإِنْ فَعَلَ فَحَقُّهُ حَيْثُ وَضَعَهُ وَ رَضِيَ بِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3658 - Harun bin Hamzah Al-Ghanawi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a man who hired a laborer, but neither of them trusted the other, so they deposited the wages with a third person. Then that third person died without leaving anything to cover the wages, and the wages were lost.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: 'The employer is responsible for the wages of the laborer until they are settled, unless the laborer had invited the employer to do so and agreed to it. If he did, then his right is where he placed it and what he agreed upon.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3659 - Ubayd bin Zurarah narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said to him:
'O Ubayd, extravagance leads to poverty, and moderation leads to wealth.'
arabicText: 3659 - وَ رَوَى عُبَيْدُ بْنُ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : لَهُ "يَا عُبَيْدُ إِنَّ اَلسَّرَفَ يُورِثُ اَلْفَقْرَ وَ إِنَّ اَلْقَصْدَ يُورِثُ اَلْغِنَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3659 - Ubayd bin Zurarah narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said to him:
thaqalaynMatn: 'O Ubayd, extravagance leads to poverty, and moderation leads to wealth.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3660 - Muhammad bin Muslim asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), about a man who prepares medicine for people and takes a fee for it.
Imam (as) said: 'There is no harm in it.'
arabicText: 3660 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُعَالِجُ اَلدَّوَاءَ لِلنَّاسِ فَيَأْخُذُ عَلَيْهِ جُعْلاً قَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3660 - Muhammad bin Muslim asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as),
thaqalaynMatn:
about a man who prepares medicine for people and takes a fee for it.
Imam (as) said: 'There is no harm in it.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3661 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Ali bin al-Hasan bin Ribaat, from Abu Sarah, from Hind al-Sarraj, who said:
I said to Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as): 'May Allah (swt) set you aright. I used to carry weapons to the people of Sham and sell them.
But when Allah (swt) made me aware of this matter, I became distressed about that weaponry. I said, I will not carry it to the enemies of Allah (swt).'
Imam (as) said: 'Carry it to them and sell it, for Allah (swt), the Exalted, uses them to repel our enemies and your enemies, meaning the Romans.'
Imam (as) continued, 'But if there is a war between us and them, whoever carries weapons to our enemy that they use against us is a polytheist.'
arabicText: 3661 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ رِبَاطٍ عَنْ أَبِي سَارَةَ عَنْ هِنْدٍ اَلسَّرَّاجِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَصْلَحَكَ اَللَّهُ إِنِّي كُنْتُ أَحْمِلُ اَلسِّلاَحَ إِلَى أَهْلِ اَلشَّامِ فَأَبِيعُهُ مِنْهُمْ فَلَمَّا عَرَّفَنِيَ اَللَّهُ هَذَا اَلْأَمْرَ ضِقْتُ بِذَلِكَ اَلسِّلاَحِ قُلْتُ لاَ أَحْمِلُ إِلَى أَعْدَاءِ اَللَّهِ قَالَ "اِحْمِلْ إِلَيْهِمْ وَ بِعْهُمْ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى يَدْفَعُ بِهِمْ عَدُوَّنَا وَ عَدُوَّكُمْ يَعْنِي اَلرُّومَ " قَالَ "فَإِذَا كَانَتِ اَلْحَرْبُ بَيْنَنَا وَ بَيْنَهُمْ فَمَنْ حَمَلَ إِلَى عَدُوِّنَا سِلاَحاً يَسْتَعِينُونَ بِهِ عَلَيْنَا فَهُوَ مُشْرِكٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3661 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Ali bin al-Hasan bin Ribaat, from Abu Sarah, from Hind al-Sarraj, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as): 'May Allah (swt) set you aright. I used to carry weapons to the people of Sham and sell them.
But when Allah (swt) made me aware of this matter, I became distressed about that weaponry. I said, I will not carry it to the enemies of Allah (swt).'
Imam (as) said: 'Carry it to them and sell it, for Allah (swt), the Exalted, uses them to repel our enemies and your enemies, meaning the Romans.'
Imam (as) continued, 'But if there is a war between us and them, whoever carries weapons to our enemy that they use against us is a polytheist.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3662 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrate from Abu Walad who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), 'What do you think about a man who holds positions in the service of the Sultan and has no means of livelihood except through his work for them?
I pass by him, and he hosts me, treats me kindly, and sometimes gives me dirhams and clothing. I feel uneasy about this.'
Imam (as) said to me: 'Take it and eat from it, for the benefit is yours, and the sin is upon him.'
arabicText: 3662 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي وَلاَّدٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَا تَرَى فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَلِي أَعْمَالَ اَلسُّلْطَانِ لَيْسَ لَهُ مَكْسَبٌ إِلاَّ مِنْ أَعْمَالِهِمْ وَ أَنَا أَمُرُّ بِهِ وَ أَنْزِلُ عَلَيْهِ فَيُضِيفُنِي وَ يُحْسِنُ إِلَيَّ وَ رُبَّمَا أَمَرَ لِي بِالدَّرَاهِمِ وَ اَلْكِسْوَةِ وَ قَدْ ضَاقَ صَدْرِي مِنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ لِي "خُذْ وَ كُلْ مِنْهُ فَلَكَ اَلْمَهْنَأُ وَ عَلَيْهِ اَلْوِزْرُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3662 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrate from Abu Walad who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as), 'What do you think about a man who holds positions in the service of the Sultan and has no means of livelihood except through his work for them?
I pass by him, and he hosts me, treats me kindly, and sometimes gives me dirhams and clothing. I feel uneasy about this.'
Imam (as) said to me: 'Take it and eat from it, for the benefit is yours, and the sin is upon him.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3663 - It is narrated from Abu al-Maghra, who said: A man asked Abu Abdullah (as), while I was present, 'May Allah (swt) rectify your affairs. I pass by the official or go to the official, and he grants me dirhams. Should I take them?'
Imam (as) said: 'Yes.'
I asked: 'Can I perform Hajj with them?'
Imam (as) said: 'Yes, and perform Hajj with them.'
arabicText: 3663 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْمَغْرَاءِ قَالَ : سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ أَنَا عِنْدَهُ فَقَالَ أَصْلَحَكَ اَللَّهُ أَمُرُّ بِالْعَامِلِ أَوْ آتِي اَلْعَامِلَ فَيُجِيزُنِي بِالدَّرَاهِمِ آخُذُهَا قَالَ "نَعَمْ" قُلْتُ وَ أَحُجُّ بِهَا قَالَ "نَعَمْ وَ حُجَّ بِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3663 - It is narrated from Abu al-Maghra, who said: A man asked Abu Abdullah (as), while I was present, 'May Allah (swt) rectify your affairs.
thaqalaynMatn:
I pass by the official or go to the official, and he grants me dirhams. Should I take them?'
Imam (as) said: 'Yes.'
I asked: 'Can I perform Hajj with them?'
Imam (as) said: 'Yes, and perform Hajj with them.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3664 - It is narrated from Ali ibn Yaqtin who said:
Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said to me: 'Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, has allies among the rulers through whom He (swt) repels harm from His (swt) friends.'
arabicText: 3664 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ يَقْطِينٍ قَالَ قَالَ لِي أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ لِلَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى مَعَ اَلسُّلْطَانِ أَوْلِيَاءَ يَدْفَعُ بِهِمْ عَنْ أَوْلِيَائِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3664 - It is narrated from Ali ibn Yaqtin who said:
Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said to me:
thaqalaynMatn: 'Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, has allies among the rulers through whom He (swt) repels harm from His (swt) friends.'

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3665 - And in another narration: "They are the freed ones of Allah (swt) from the Fire."
arabicText: 3665 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : "أُولَئِكَ عُتَقَاءُ اَللَّهِ مِنَ اَلنَّارِ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3666 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"The expiation for working for the ruler is fulfilling the needs of the brothers."
arabicText: 3666 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "كَفَّارَةُ عَمَلِ اَلسُّلْطَانِ قَضَاءُ حَوَائِجِ اَلْإِخْوَانِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3666 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The expiation for working for the ruler is fulfilling the needs of the brothers."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3667 - It is narrated from Ubayd ibn Zurarah that he said:
Abu Abdillah (as) sent a man to Ziyad ibn Ubaydillah and said: "Appoint this person to some of your work."
arabicText: 3667 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ زُرَارَةَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : بَعَثَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلاً إِلَى زِيَادِ بْنِ عُبَيْدِ اَللَّهِ فَقَالَ "وَلِّ ذَا بَعْضَ عَمَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3667 - It is narrated from Ubayd ibn Zurarah that he said:
Abu Abdillah (as) sent a man to Ziyad ibn Ubaydillah and said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Appoint this person to some of your work."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3668 - Hariz narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim who said:
I asked him about a man whose son has wealth, and the father is in need of it.
Imam (as) said: "He may take from it, but as for the mother, she should not take from it except as a loan upon herself."
arabicText: 3668 - رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ لاِبْنِهِ مَالٌ فَاحْتَاجَ إِلَيْهِ اَلْأَبُ قَالَ "يَأْكُلُ مِنْهُ وَ أَمَّا اَلْأُمُّ فَلاَ تَأْخُذْ مِنْهُ إِلاَّ قَرْضاً عَلَى نَفْسِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3668 - Hariz narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about a man whose son has wealth, and the father is in need of it.
Imam (as) said: "He may take from it, but as for the mother, she should not take from it except as a loan upon herself."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3669 - Al-Husayn ibn Abi Al-Ala narrated that he said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "What is permissible for a man to take from the wealth of his child?" Imam (as) said: "His sustenance without extravagance if he is in need."
He said: "I then asked him about the saying of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family), 'You and your wealth belong to your father.'"
Imam (as) replied: "Indeed, the father brought his case to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) and said: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), this is my son, and he has wronged me concerning my inheritance from his mother.'
The father then informed him that he had spent it on him and on himself. So, the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said: 'You and your wealth belong to your father.'
The man had nothing left with him, so would the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) imprison a father for the sake of his son?'"
arabicText: 3669 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ أَبِي اَلْعَلاَءِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَا يَحِلُّ لِلرَّجُلِ مِنْ مَالِ وُلْدِهِ قَالَ "قُوتُهُ بِغَيْرِ سَرَفٍ إِذَا اُضْطُرَّ إِلَيْهِ " قَالَ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ فَقَوْلُ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "أَنْتَ وَ مَالُكَ لِأَبِيكَ" فَقَالَ "إِنَّمَا جَاءَ بِأَبِيهِ إِلَى رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ هَذَا أَبِي وَ قَدْ ظَلَمَنِي مِيرَاثِي مِنْ أُمِّي فَأَخْبَرَهُ اَلْأَبُ أَنَّهُ قَدْ أَنْفَقَهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ فَقَالَ "أَنْتَ وَ مَالُكَ لِأَبِيكَ" وَ لَمْ يَكُنْ عِنْدَ اَلرَّجُلِ شَيْءٌ أَ فَكَانَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ يَحْبِسُ أَباً لاِبْنٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3669 - Al-Husayn ibn Abi Al-Ala narrated that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "What is permissible for a man to take from the wealth of his child?" Imam (as) said: "His sustenance without extravagance if he is in need."
He said: "I then asked him about the saying of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family), 'You and your wealth belong to your father.'"
Imam (as) replied: "Indeed, the father brought his case to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) and said: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), this is my son, and he has wronged me concerning my inheritance from his mother.'
The father then informed him that he had spent it on him and on himself. So, the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said: 'You and your wealth belong to your father.'
The man had nothing left with him, so would the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) imprison a father for the sake of his son?'"

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3670 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said: "A woman has no authority with her husband regarding emancipation, charity, endowment, gift, or vow concerning her wealth, except with her husband's permission-except in the case of Zakat, kindness to her parents, or maintaining ties with her relatives."
arabicText: 3670 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لَيْسَ لِلْمَرْأَةِ مَعَ زَوْجِهَا أَمْرٌ فِي عِتْقٍ وَ لاَ صَدَقَةٍ وَ لاَ تَدْبِيرٍ وَ لاَ هِبَةٍ وَ لاَ نَذْرٍ فِي مَالِهَا إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِ زَوْجِهَا إِلاَّ فِي زَكَاةٍ أَوْ بِرِّ وَالِدَيْهَا أَوْ صِلَةِ قَرَابَتِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3670 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman has no authority with her husband regarding emancipation, charity, endowment, gift, or vow concerning her wealth, except with her husband's permission-except in the case of Zakat, kindness to her parents, or maintaining ties with her relatives."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3671 - It was said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"People narrate from the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) that he said: 'Charity is not permissible for a wealthy person nor for one who is strong and able-bodied.'"
Imam (as) replied: "He (sw) indeed said it is not permissible for a wealthy person, but he (sw) did not say for one who is strong and able-bodied."
arabicText: 3671 - وَ - قِيلَ لِلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ اَلنَّاسَ يَرْوُونَ عَنْ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ "إِنَّ اَلصَّدَقَةَ لاَ تَحِلُّ لِغَنِيٍّ وَ لاَ لِذِي مِرَّةٍ سَوِيٍّ" فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "قَدْ قَالَ لِغَنِيٍّ وَ لَمْ يَقُلْ لِذِي مِرَّةٍ سَوِيٍّ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3672 - Abu Al-Bakhtari narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
"Helping a deaf person to hear without annoyance is a pleasant charity."
arabicText: 3672 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لَإِسْمَاعُ اَلْأَصَمِّ مِنْ غَيْرِ ضَجَرٍ صَدَقَةٌ هَنِيئَةٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3672 - Abu Al-Bakhtari narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Helping a deaf person to hear without annoyance is a pleasant charity."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3673 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said to a man:
"Did you wake up fasting?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then did you visit a sick person?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then did you follow a funeral procession?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then did you feed a poor person?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then return to your family and be with them, for that is a charity from you to them."
arabicText: 3673 - وَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لِرَجُلٍ "أَصْبَحْتَ صَائِماً" قَالَ لاَ قَالَ "فَعُدْتَ مَرِيضاً" قَالَ لاَ قَالَ "فَاتَّبَعْتَ جَنَازَةً" قَالَ لاَ قَالَ "فَأَطْعَمْتَ مِسْكِيناً" قَالَ لاَ قَالَ "فَارْجِعْ إِلَى أَهْلِكَ فَأَصِبْهُمْ فَإِنَّهُ مِنْكَ عَلَيْهِمْ صَدَقَةٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3673 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said to a man:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Did you wake up fasting?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then did you visit a sick person?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then did you follow a funeral procession?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then did you feed a poor person?"
He replied: "No."
He (sw) said: "Then return to your family and be with them, for that is a charity from you to them."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3674 - A man came to the Commander of the Faithful (as) and said:
"O Commander of the Faithful, by Allah (swt), I love you."
Imam (as) said to him: "But I dislike you."
The man asked: "Why?"
Imam (as) replied: "Because you seek profit through the call to prayer (Adhan) and take payment for teaching the Quran."
arabicText: 3674 - وَ أَتَى رَجُلٌ أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَ اَللَّهِ إِنِّي لَأُحِبُّكَ فَقَالَ لَهُ "وَ لَكِنِّي أُبْغِضُكَ" قَالَ وَ لِمَ قَالَ "لِأَنَّكَ تَبْغِي فِي اَلْأَذَانِ كَسْباً وَ تَأْخُذُ عَلَى تَعْلِيمِ اَلْقُرْآنِ أَجْراً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3674 - A man came to the Commander of the Faithful (as) and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O Commander of the Faithful, by Allah (swt), I love you."
Imam (as) said to him: "But I dislike you."
The man asked: "Why?"
Imam (as) replied: "Because you seek profit through the call to prayer (Adhan) and take payment for teaching the Quran."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3675 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Whoever takes payment for teaching the Quran, his share will be [taken] on the Day of Judgment."
arabicText: 3675 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ أَخَذَ عَلَى تَعْلِيمِ اَلْقُرْآنِ أَجْراً كَانَ حَظَّهُ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ ".

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3676 - Al-Hakam ibn Miskin narrated from Qutaybah ibn Al-A'sha who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I recite the Quran, and gifts are given to me-should I accept them?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I said: "What if I did not stipulate it (as a condition)?"
Imam (as) said: "Tell me, if you had not recited it, would they have given you a gift?"
I said: "No."
Imam (as) said: "Then do not accept it."
arabicText: 3676 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَكَمُ بْنُ مِسْكِينٍ عَنْ قُتَيْبَةَ بْنِ اَلْأَعْشَى قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي أَقْرَأُ اَلْقُرْآنَ فَتُهْدَى إِلَيَّ اَلْهَدِيَّةُ فَأَقْبَلُهَا قَالَ "لاَ" قُلْتُ إِنْ لَمْ أُشَارِطْهُ قَالَ "أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ لَمْ تَقْرَأْهُ أَ كَانَ يُهْدِي لَكَ" قَالَ قُلْتُ لاَ قَالَ "فَلاَ تَقْبَلْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3676 - Al-Hakam ibn Miskin narrated from Qutaybah ibn Al-A'sha who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I recite the Quran, and gifts are given to me-should I accept them?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I said: "What if I did not stipulate it (as a condition)?"
Imam (as) said: "Tell me, if you had not recited it, would they have given you a gift?"
I said: "No."
Imam (as) said: "Then do not accept it."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3677 - It is narrated from Isa ibn Shaqafi, who was a sorcerer to whom people would come, and he used to take payment for it.
He said: I performed Hajj and met Abu Abdillah (as) in Mina.
I said to Him (as): "May I be your ransom! I am a man whose profession was sorcery, and I used to take payment for it. I have performed Hajj, and Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, has blessed me with meeting you, and I have repented to Allah (swt). Is there any way out for me regarding it?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, undo (the spells) and do not tie (them)."
arabicText: 3677 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ شَقَفِيٍّ : وَ كَانَ سَاحِراً يَأْتِيهِ اَلنَّاسُ وَ يَأْخُذُ عَلَى ذَلِكَ اَلْأَجْرَ قَالَ فَحَجَجْتُ فَلَقِيتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِمِنًى فَقُلْتُ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ أَنَا رَجُلٌ كَانَتْ صِنَاعَتِيَ اَلسِّحْرَ وَ كُنْتُ آخُذُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْأَجْرَ وَ قَدْ حَجَجْتُ وَ مَنَّ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَلَيَّ بِلِقَائِكَ وَ قَدْ تُبْتُ إِلَى اَللَّهِ فَهَلْ لِي فِي شَيْءٍ مِنْهُ مَخْرَجٌ فَقَالَ "نَعَمْ حُلَّ وَ لاَ تَعْقِدْ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3677 - It is narrated from Isa ibn Shaqafi, who was a sorcerer to whom people would come, and he used to take payment for it.
He said: I performed Hajj and met Abu Abdillah (as) in Mina.
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Him (as): "May I be your ransom! I am a man whose profession was sorcery, and I used to take payment for it. I have performed Hajj, and Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, has blessed me with meeting you, and I have repented to Allah (swt). Is there any way out for me regarding it?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, undo (the spells) and do not tie (them)."

chapter: Chapter on Livelihoods, Earnings, Profits, and Professions
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3678 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever passes by orchards, there is no harm in eating from their fruits, but he should not carry anything from them with him."
arabicText: 3678 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ مَرَّ بِبَسَاتِينَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَأْكُلَ مِنْ ثِمَارِهَا وَ لاَ يَحْمِلْ مَعَهُ مِنْهَا شَيْئاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3678 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever passes by orchards, there is no harm in eating from their fruits, but he should not carry anything from them with him."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3679 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said: "Seek refuge with Allah (swt) from the burden of debt, the dominance of men, and the ruin of the unmarried."
arabicText: 3679 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ اَلْحَجَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "تَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنْ غَلَبَةِ اَلدَّيْنِ وَ غَلَبَةِ اَلرِّجَالِ وَ بَوَارِ اَلْأَيِّمِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3679 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Seek refuge with Allah (swt) from the burden of debt, the dominance of men, and the ruin of the unmarried."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3680 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Beware of debt, for it is a disgrace to religion."
arabicText: 3680 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "إِيَّاكُمْ وَ اَلدَّيْنَ فَإِنَّهُ شَيْنٌ لِلدِّينِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3680 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Beware of debt, for it is a disgrace to religion."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3681 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Beware of debt, for it is worry at night and humiliation during the day."
arabicText: 3681 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِيَّاكُمْ وَ اَلدَّيْنَ فَإِنَّهُ هَمٌّ بِاللَّيْلِ وَ ذُلٌّ بِالنَّهَارِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3681 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Beware of debt, for it is worry at night and humiliation during the day."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3682 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Beware of debt, for it is humiliation during the day, worry at night, accountability in this world, and accountability in the Hereafter."
arabicText: 3682 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِيَّاكُمْ وَ اَلدَّيْنَ فَإِنَّهُ مَذَلَّةٌ بِالنَّهَارِ وَ مَهَمَّةٌ بِاللَّيْلِ وَ قَضَاءٌ فِي اَلدُّنْيَا وَ قَضَاءٌ فِي اَلْآخِرَةِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3682 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Beware of debt, for it is humiliation during the day, worry at night, accountability in this world, and accountability in the Hereafter."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3683 - It is narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Wahb who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "It has been mentioned to us that a man from the Ansar died while owing two dinars as debt, so the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) did not pray over him and said: 'Pray over your brother,' until one of his relatives guaranteed them on his behalf."
Abu Abdillah (as) said: "That is true."
Then Imam (as) said: "Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) did that so they would take heed, and so that they would support one another, and so that they would not take debt lightly.
And yet the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) died while he was in debt, the Commander of the Faithful (as) was killed while he was in debt, Al-Hasan (as) died while he was in debt, and Al-Husayn (as) was killed while he was in debt."
arabicText:
3683 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّهُ ذُكِرَ لَنَا أَنَّ رَجُلاً مِنَ اَلْأَنْصَارِ مَاتَ وَ عَلَيْهِ دِينَارَانِ دَيْناً فَلَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَيْهِ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ قَالَ "صَلُّوا عَلَى أَخِيكُمْ حَتَّى ضَمِنَهُمَا عَنْهُ بَعْضُ قَرَابَاتِهِ" فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "ذَاكَ اَلْحَقُّ"
ثُمَّ قَالَ "إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِنَّمَا فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ لِيَتَّعِظُوا وَ لِيَرُدَّ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَى بَعْضٍ وَ لِئَلاَّ يَسْتَخِفُّوا بِالدَّيْنِ وَ قَدْ مَاتَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ وَ قُتِلَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ وَ مَاتَ اَلْحَسَنُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ وَ قُتِلَ اَلْحُسَيْنُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3683 - It is narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Wahb who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as),
thaqalaynMatn:
"It has been mentioned to us that a man from the Ansar died while owing two dinars as debt, so the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) did not pray over him and said: 'Pray over your brother,' until one of his relatives guaranteed them on his behalf."
Abu Abdillah (as) said: "That is true."
Then Imam (as) said: "Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) did that so they would take heed, and so that they would support one another, and so that they would not take debt lightly.
And yet the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) died while he was in debt, the Commander of the Faithful (as) was killed while he was in debt, Al-Hasan (as) died while he was in debt, and Al-Husayn (as) was killed while he was in debt."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3684 - It is narrated from Musa ibn Bakr, from Abu Al-Hasan Al-Awwal (as), who said: "Whoever seeks sustenance through lawful means and is overcome, let him borrow in the name of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, and His Messenger (peace be upon him and his family)."
arabicText: 3684 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْأَوَّلِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَنْ طَلَبَ اَلرِّزْقَ مِنْ حِلِّهِ فَغُلِبَ فَلْيَسْتَقْرِضْ عَلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ عَلَى رَسُولِهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3684 - It is narrated from Musa ibn Bakr, from Abu Al-Hasan Al-Awwal (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever seeks sustenance through lawful means and is overcome, let him borrow in the name of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, and His Messenger (peace be upon him and his family)."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3685 - Al-Mithami narrated from Abu Musa who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as)-"May I be your ransom! Can a man borrow and perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I said: "Can he borrow and get married?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, for he awaits the provision of Allah (swt) morning and evening."
arabicText:
3685 - وَ رَوَى اَلْمِيثَمِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي مُوسَى قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ - جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ يَسْتَقْرِضُ اَلرَّجُلُ وَ يَحُجُّ قَالَ "نَعَمْ"
قُلْتُ يَسْتَقْرِضُ وَ يَتَزَوَّجُ قَالَ "نَعَمْ إِنَّهُ يَنْتَظِرُ رِزْقَ اَللَّهِ غُدْوَةً وَ عَشِيَّةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3685 - Al-Mithami narrated from Abu Musa who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as)-"May I be your ransom! Can a man borrow and perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I said: "Can he borrow and get married?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, for he awaits the provision of Allah (swt) morning and evening."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3686 - It is narrated from Abu Thumamah who said:
I said to Abu Ja'far Al-Thani (as), "I wish to remain in Makkah and Madinah, but I have a debt upon me. What do you advise?"
Imam (as) said: "Return and pay off your debt, and make sure you meet Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, without any debt upon you, for the believer does not betray."
arabicText: 3686 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي ثُمَامَةَ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلثَّانِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُلاَزِمَ مَكَّةَ وَ اَلْمَدِينَةَ وَ عَلَيَّ دَيْنٌ فَمَا تَقُولُ قَالَ "اِرْجِعْ إِلَى مُؤَدَّى دَيْنِكَ وَ اُنْظُرْ أَنْ تَلْقَى اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكَ دَيْنٌ فَإِنَّ اَلْمُؤْمِنَ لاَ يَخُونُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3686 - It is narrated from Abu Thumamah who said:
I said to Abu Ja'far Al-Thani (as), "I wish to remain in Makkah and Madinah, but I have a debt upon me. What do you advise?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Return and pay off your debt, and make sure you meet Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, without any debt upon you, for the believer does not betray."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3687 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever has a debt and intends to repay it, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, appoints two angels to assist him in fulfilling his trust. But if his intention to repay falls short, their assistance will also decrease in proportion to his intention."
arabicText: 3687 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ كَانَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ يَنْوِي قَضَاءَهُ كَانَ مَعَهُ مِنَ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ حَافِظَانِ يُعِينَانِهِ عَلَى اَلْأَدَاءِ عَنْ أَمَانَتِهِ فَإِنْ قَصَرَتْ نِيَّتُهُ عَنِ اَلْأَدَاءِ قَصَرَا عَنْهُ مِنَ اَلْمَعُونَةِ بِقَدْرِ مَا قَصَرَ مِنْ نِيَّتِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3687 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever has a debt and intends to repay it, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, appoints two angels to assist him in fulfilling his trust. But if his intention to repay falls short, their assistance will also decrease in proportion to his intention."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3688 - It is narrated from Aban, from Bashshar, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "The first drop of the martyr's blood is an expiation for his sins-except for debt, for its expiation is its repayment."
arabicText: 3688 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ بَشَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "أَوَّلُ قَطْرَةٍ مِنْ دَمِ اَلشَّهِيدِ كَفَّارَةٌ لِذُنُوبِهِ إِلاَّ اَلدَّيْنَ فَإِنَّ كَفَّارَتَهُ قَضَاؤُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3688 - It is narrated from Aban, from Bashshar, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The first drop of the martyr's blood is an expiation for his sins-except for debt, for its expiation is its repayment."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3689 - Abu Khadijah narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said: "Any man who goes to another man and borrows money from him while intending not to repay it, then he is a thief and a transgressor."
arabicText: 3689 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو خَدِيجَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "أَيُّمَا رَجُلٍ أَتَى رَجُلاً فَاسْتَقْرَضَ مِنْهُ مَالاً وَ فِي نِيَّتِهِ أَلاَّ يُؤَدِّيَهُ فَذَلِكَ اَللِّصُّ اَلْعَادِي".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3689 - Abu Khadijah narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Any man who goes to another man and borrows money from him while intending not to repay it, then he is a thief and a transgressor."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3690 - Sama'ah ibn Mihran narrated that he said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "A man among us has something with which he can sustain himself, but he is in debt. Should he feed his family with it until Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, provides him with ease so he can repay his debt, or should he borrow despite the difficulty of the times and the hardship of earning, or should he accept charity?"
Imam (as) said: "He should use what he has to repay his debt and should not consume people's wealth unless he has the means to repay them. Indeed, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, says: 'And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly.'" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:188)
arabicText: 3690 - وَ رَوَى سَمَاعَةُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلرَّجُلُ مِنَّا يَكُونُ عِنْدَهُ اَلشَّيْءُ يَتَبَلَّغُ بِهِ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ أَ يُطْعِمُهُ عِيَالَهُ حَتَّى يَأْتِيَهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِمَيْسَرَةٍ فَيَقْضِيَ دَيْنَهُ أَوْ يَسْتَقْرِضُ عَلَى ظَهْرِهِ فِي خُبْثِ اَلزَّمَانِ وَ شِدَّةِ اَلْمَكَاسِبِ أَوْ يَقْبَلُ اَلصَّدَقَةَ فَقَالَ "يَقْضِي بِمَا عِنْدَهُ دَيْنَهُ وَ لاَ يَأْكُلُ أَمْوَالَ اَلنَّاسِ إِلاَّ وَ عِنْدَهُ مَا يُؤَدِّي إِلَيْهِمْ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ: ۝ وَ لاٰ تَأْكُلُوا أَمْوٰالَكُمْ بَيْنَكُمْ بِالْبٰاطِلِ ۝ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3690 - Sama'ah ibn Mihran narrated that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "A man among us has something with which he can sustain himself, but he is in debt. Should he feed his family with it until Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, provides him with ease so he can repay his debt, or should he borrow despite the difficulty of the times and the hardship of earning, or should he accept charity?"
Imam (as) said: "He should use what he has to repay his debt and should not consume people's wealth unless he has the means to repay them. Indeed, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, says: 'And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly.'" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:188)

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3691 - Abu Hamzah Al-Thumali narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that he said:
"Whoever withholds the right of a Muslim while he is able to give it to him, out of fear that if he lets go of that right he might become poor, then Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, is more capable of making him poor than he is of enriching himself by withholding that right."
arabicText: 3691 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو حَمْزَةَ اَلثُّمَالِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "مَنْ حَبَسَ حَقَّ اِمْرِئٍ مُسْلِمٍ وَ هُوَ يَقْدِرُ عَلَى أَنْ يُعْطِيَهُ إِيَّاهُ مَخَافَةَ مِنْ أَنَّهُ إِنْ خَرَجَ ذَلِكَ اَلْحَقُّ مِنْ يَدِهِ أَنْ يَفْتَقِرَ كَانَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَقْدَرَ عَلَى أَنْ يُفْقِرَهُ مِنْهُ عَلَى أَنْ يُغْنِيَ نَفْسَهُ بِحَبْسِهِ ذَلِكَ اَلْحَقَّ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3691 - Abu Hamzah Al-Thumali narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever withholds the right of a Muslim while he is able to give it to him, out of fear that if he lets go of that right he might become poor, then Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, is more capable of making him poor than he is of enriching himself by withholding that right."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3692 - Isma'il ibn Abi Fudayk narrated from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, is with the debtor until he repays his debt, as long as he did not acquire it through what is forbidden to him."
arabicText: 3692 - وَ رَوَى إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي فُدَيْكٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مَعَ صَاحِبِ اَلدَّيْنِ حَتَّى يُؤَدِّيَهُ مَا لَمْ يَأْخُذْهُ مِمَّا يَحْرُمُ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3692 - Isma'il ibn Abi Fudayk narrated from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, is with the debtor until he repays his debt, as long as he did not acquire it through what is forbidden to him."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3693 - It is narrated from Burayd Al-Ijli who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I owe a debt to orphans, and I fear that if I sell my estate, I will be left with nothing."
Imam (as) said: "Do not sell your estate; rather, give some and keep some."
arabicText: 3693 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ اَلْعِجْلِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ عَلَيَّ دَيْناً لِأَيْتَامٍ وَ أَخَافُ إِنْ بِعْتُ ضَيْعَتِي بَقِيتُ وَ مَا لِيَ شَيْءٌ قَالَ "لاَ تَبِعْ ضَيْعَتَكَ وَ لَكِنْ أَعْطِ بَعْضاً وَ أَمْسِكْ بَعْضاً".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3693 - It is narrated from Burayd Al-Ijli who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I owe a debt to orphans, and I fear that if I sell my estate, I will be left with nothing."
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not sell your estate; rather, give some and keep some."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3694 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said: "There is no debtor whose creditor leaves him satisfied except that the creatures of the earth and the fish in the seas pray for him. And there is no debtor whose creditor leaves him angry while he is capable of paying, except that Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, records for him-each day or night that he withholds payment unjustly-a sin."
arabicText: 3694 - وَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "لَيْسَ مِنْ غَرِيمٍ يَنْطَلِقُ مِنْ عِنْدِهِ غَرِيمُهُ رَاضِياً إِلاَّ صَلَّتْ عَلَيْهِ دَوَابُّ اَلْأَرْضِ وَ نُونُ اَلْبُحُورِ وَ لَيْسَ مِنْ غَرِيمٍ يَنْطَلِقُ صَاحِبُهُ غَضْبَانَ وَ هُوَ مَلِيٌّ إِلاَّ كَتَبَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِكُلِّ يَوْمِ يَحْبِسُهُ أَوْ لَيْلَةٍ ظُلْماً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3694 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no debtor whose creditor leaves him satisfied except that the creatures of the earth and the fish in the seas pray for him. And there is no debtor whose creditor leaves him angry while he is capable of paying, except that Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, records for him-each day or night that he withholds payment unjustly-a sin."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
