Hadith.3695 - Ibrahim ibn Abdul Hamid narrated from Khidr ibn Amr Al-Nakha'i, from Abu Abdillah (as) regarding a man who has money owed to him by another man, but the debtor denies it.
Imam (as) said: "If he makes him swear an oath, then he has no right to take anything from him after the oath. And if he imprisons him, he has no right to take anything from him. But if he leaves him and does not make him swear, then his right remains intact."
arabicText: 3695 - وَ رَوَى إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلْحَمِيدِ عَنْ خَضِرِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو اَلنَّخَعِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَكُونُ لَهُ عَلَى اَلرَّجُلِ مَالٌ فَيَجْحَدُهُ قَالَ "إِنِ اِسْتَحْلَفَهُ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ مِنْهُ بَعْدَ اَلْيَمِينِ شَيْئاً وَ إِنْ حَبَسَهُ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ مِنْهُ شَيْئاً وَ إِنْ تَرَكَهُ وَ لَمْ يَسْتَحْلِفْهُ فَهُوَ عَلَى حَقِّهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3695 - Ibrahim ibn Abdul Hamid narrated from Khidr ibn Amr Al-Nakha'i, from Abu Abdillah (as) regarding a man who has money owed to him by another man, but the debtor denies it.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he makes him swear an oath, then he has no right to take anything from him after the oath. And if he imprisons him, he has no right to take anything from him. But if he leaves him and does not make him swear, then his right remains intact."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3696 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Sulayman ibn Khalid who said:
I asked Abu Abdillah (as) about a man who owed me money but denied it and swore an oath. Then, some of his money came into my possession. Should I take it in place of what he took from me and swear an oath as he did?
Imam (as) said: "If he has betrayed you, do not betray him, and do not commit what you criticized him for."
arabicText: 3696 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ وَقَعَ لِي عِنْدَهُ مَالٌ فَكَابَرَنِي عَلَيْهِ وَ حَلَفَ ثُمَّ وَقَعَ لَهُ عِنْدِي مَالٌ أَ فَآخُذُهُ مَكَانَ مَالِيَ اَلَّذِي أَخَذَهُ وَ أَحْلِفُ عَلَيْهِ كَمَا صَنَعَ هُوَ فَقَالَ "إِنْ خَانَكَ فَلاَ تَخُنْهُ وَ لاَ تَدْخُلْ فِيمَا عِبْتَهُ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3696 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Sulayman ibn Khalid who said:
I asked Abu Abdillah (as) about a man who owed me money but denied it and swore an oath. Then, some of his money came into my possession. Should I take it in place of what he took from me and swear an oath as he did?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he has betrayed you, do not betray him, and do not commit what you criticized him for."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3697 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
I said to him, "A man owes me a right but denies it, and then he entrusts me with some money. Is it permissible for me to take my due from it?"
Imam (as) said: "No, that would be betrayal."
arabicText: 3697 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَكُونُ لِي عَلَيْهِ حَقٌّ فَيَجْحَدُنِيهِ ثُمَّ يَسْتَوْدِعُنِي مَالاً أَ لِي أَنْ آخُذَ مَالِي عِنْدَهُ قَالَ "لاَ هَذِهِ اَلْخِيَانَةُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3697 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to him, "A man owes me a right but denies it, and then he entrusts me with some money. Is it permissible for me to take my due from it?"
Imam (as) said: "No, that would be betrayal."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3698 - Zayd Al-Shahham narrated that Abu Abdillah (as) said to me:
"Whoever entrusts you with a trust, then return it to him. And whoever betrays you, do not betray him."
arabicText: 3698 - وَ رَوَى زَيْدٌ اَلشَّحَّامُ قَالَ قَالَ لِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنِ اِئْتَمَنَكَ بِأَمَانَةٍ فَأَدِّهَا إِلَيْهِ وَ مَنْ خَانَكَ فَلاَ تَخُنْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3698 - Zayd Al-Shahham narrated that Abu Abdillah (as) said to me:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever entrusts you with a trust, then return it to him. And whoever betrays you, do not betray him."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3699 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Saif ibn Amirah, from Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami, who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "A man had money owed to him by another man, but the debtor denied it and took it away from him. Later, the creditor gained possession of an equivalent amount belonging to the debtor. Can he take it in place of the money that was taken from him?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, and he should say, 'O Allah (swt), I am only taking this in place of my money that he took from me.'"
arabicText: 3699 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ اَلْحَضْرَمِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ كَانَ لَهُ عَلَى رَجُلٍ مَالٌ فَجَحَدَهُ إِيَّاهُ وَ ذَهَبَ بِهِ مِنْهُ ثُمَّ صَارَ إِلَيْهِ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ مِنْهُ لِلرَّجُلِ اَلَّذِي ذَهَبَ بِمَالِهِ مَالٌ مِثْلُهُ أَ يَأْخُذُهُ مَكَانَ مَالِهِ اَلَّذِي ذَهَبَ بِهِ مِنْهُ قَالَ "نَعَمْ يَقُولُ اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي إِنَّمَا آخُذُ هَذَا مَكَانَ مَالِيَ اَلَّذِي أَخَذَهُ مِنِّي ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3699 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Saif ibn Amirah, from Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "A man had money owed to him by another man, but the debtor denied it and took it away from him. Later, the creditor gained possession of an equivalent amount belonging to the debtor. Can he take it in place of the money that was taken from him?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, and he should say, 'O Allah (swt), I am only taking this in place of my money that he took from me.'"

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3700 - And in another narration from Yunus ibn Abdul Rahman, from Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami, similar to the previous one, except that he said:
He should say, "O Allah (swt), I did not take what I took from him as an act of betrayal or injustice, but I took it in place of my rightful due."
arabicText: 3700 - وَ - فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ لِيُونُسَ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ اَلْحَضْرَمِيِّ مِثْلَهُ إِلاَّ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : يَقُولُ: " اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي لَمْ آخُذْ مَا أَخَذْتُ مِنْهُ خِيَانَةً وَ لاَ ظُلْماً وَ لَكِنِّي أَخَذْتُهُ مَكَانَ حَقِّي ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3700 - And in another narration from Yunus ibn Abdul Rahman, from Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami, similar to the previous one, except that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: He should say, "O Allah (swt), I did not take what I took from him as an act of betrayal or injustice, but I took it in place of my rightful due."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3701 - And in another narration: "If he makes him swear regarding what he took from him, then it is permissible for him to swear if he says this statement."
arabicText: 3701 - وَ - فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : "إِنِ اِسْتَحْلَفَهُ عَلَى مَا أَخَذَ مِنْهُ فَجَائِزٌ لَهُ أَنْ يَحْلِفَ إِذَا قَالَ هَذِهِ اَلْكَلِمَةَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3701 - And in another narration:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he makes him swear regarding what he took from him, then it is permissible for him to swear if he says this statement."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3702 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Whoever swears by Allah (swt) should speak the truth, and whoever is sworn to by Allah (swt) should be satisfied. And whoever is not satisfied is not from Allah (swt) in any way."
arabicText: 3702 - لِقَوْلِ اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَنْ حَلَفَ بِاللَّهِ فَلْيَصْدُقْ وَ مَنْ حُلِفَ لَهُ بِاللَّهِ فَلْيَرْضَ وَ مَنْ لَمْ يَرْضَ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ اَللَّهِ فِي شَيْءٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3702 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever swears by Allah (swt) should speak the truth, and whoever is sworn to by Allah (swt) should be satisfied. And whoever is not satisfied is not from Allah (swt) in any way."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3703 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Dawud ibn Zurbi who said:
I said to Abu Al-Hasan (as), "I deal with some people, and sometimes they send to me and take a bondwoman or an animal from me, and they take it away. Then their wealth later comes into my possession. Can I take from it an amount equivalent to what they took from me?"
Imam (as) said: "Take from them an amount equal to what they took from you and do not take more than that."
arabicText: 3703 - وَ قَدْ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ زُرْبِيٍّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي أُعَامِلُ قَوْماً فَرُبَّمَا أَرْسَلُوا إِلَيَّ فَأَخَذُوا مِنِّي اَلْجَارِيَةَ وَ اَلدَّابَّةَ فَذَهَبُوا بِهَا مِنِّي ثُمَّ يَدُورُ لَهُمُ اَلْمَالُ عِنْدِي فَآخُذُ مِنْهُ بِقَدْرِ مَا أَخَذُوا مِنِّي فَقَالَ "خُذْ مِنْهُمْ بِقَدْرِ مَا أَخَذُوا مِنْكَ وَ لاَ تَزِدْ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3703 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Dawud ibn Zurbi who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Al-Hasan (as), "I deal with some people, and sometimes they send to me and take a bondwoman or an animal from me, and they take it away. Then their wealth later comes into my possession. Can I take from it an amount equivalent to what they took from me?"
Imam (as) said: "Take from them an amount equal to what they took from you and do not take more than that."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3704 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hudhayl ibn Hanan, the brother of Ja'far ibn Hanan, the money changer, who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I gave my brother Ja'far some money, and he gives me from it what I spend, perform Hajj with, and give in charity. I asked the people around us, and they said that this is invalid and not permissible. I wish to follow your guidance in this matter."
Imam (as) said: "Did he use to give to you before you entrusted him with your money?"
I said: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "Then take what he gives you, eat, drink, perform Hajj, and give in charity. And when you return to Iraq, say, 'Ja'far ibn Muhammad (as) has given me this ruling.'"
arabicText: 3704 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هُذَيْلِ بْنِ حَنَانٍ أَخِي جَعْفَرِ بْنِ حَنَانٍ اَلصَّيْرَفِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي دَفَعْتُ إِلَى أَخِي جَعْفَرٍ مَالاً فَهُوَ يُعْطِينِي مَا أُنْفِقُهُ وَ أَحُجُّ مِنْهُ وَ أَتَصَدَّقُ وَ قَدْ سَأَلْتُ مَنْ عِنْدَنَا فَذَكَرُوا أَنَّ ذَلِكَ فَاسِدٌ لاَ يَحِلُّ وَ أَنَا أُحِبُّ أَنْ أَنْتَهِيَ فِي ذَلِكَ إِلَى قَوْلِكَ فَقَالَ "أَ كَانَ يَصِلُكَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَدْفَعَ إِلَيْهِ مَالَكَ" قُلْتُ نَعَمْ قَالَ "خُذْ مِنْهُ مَا يُعْطِيكَ وَ كُلْ وَ اِشْرَبْ وَ حُجَّ وَ تَصَدَّقْ فَإِذَا قَدِمْتَ اَلْعِرَاقَ فَقُلْ، جَعْفَرُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ أَفْتَانِي بِهَذَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3704 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hudhayl ibn Hanan, the brother of Ja'far ibn Hanan, the money changer, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I gave my brother Ja'far some money, and he gives me from it what I spend, perform Hajj with, and give in charity. I asked the people around us, and they said that this is invalid and not permissible. I wish to follow your guidance in this matter."
Imam (as) said: "Did he use to give to you before you entrusted him with your money?"
I said: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "Then take what he gives you, eat, drink, perform Hajj, and give in charity. And when you return to Iraq, say, 'Ja'far ibn Muhammad (as) has given me this ruling.'"

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3705 - Sama'ah asked Abu Abdillah (as) about a man who stays with another man to whom he owes a debt. Is it permissible for him to eat from his food?
Imam (as) said: "Yes, he may eat from his food for three days, but after that, he should not eat anything."
arabicText: 3705 - وَ سَأَلَ سَمَاعَةُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَنْزِلُ عَلَى اَلرَّجُلِ وَ لَهُ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ أَ يَأْكُلُ مِنْ طَعَامِهِ فَقَالَ "نَعَمْ يَأْكُلُ مِنْ طَعَامِهِ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ وَ لاَ يَأْكُلُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ شَيْئاً".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3705 - Sama'ah asked Abu Abdillah (as) about a man who stays with another man to whom he owes a debt. Is it permissible for him to eat from his food?
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, he may eat from his food for three days, but after that, he should not eat anything."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3706 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted: "There is no good in much of their secret talk except in one who enjoins charity, or kindness, or reconciliation between people" (Surah An-Nisa 4:114)
Imam (as) said: "Kindness refers to giving a loan."
arabicText: 3706 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: ۝ لاٰ خَيْرَ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِنْ نَجْوٰاهُمْ إِلاّٰ مَنْ أَمَرَ بِصَدَقَةٍ أَوْ مَعْرُوفٍ أَوْ إِصْلاٰحٍ بَيْنَ اَلنّٰاسِ ۝ فَقَالَ "يَعْنِي بِالْمَعْرُوفِ اَلْقَرْضَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3706 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted: "There is no good in much of their secret talk except in one who enjoins charity, or kindness, or reconciliation between people" (Surah An-Nisa 4:114)
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Kindness refers to giving a loan."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3707 - It is narrated from Al-Sabbah ibn Sayabah who said: I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "Abdullah ibn Abi Ya'fur instructed me to ask you-when we borrow bread from our neighbors, we sometimes return it smaller or larger in size. Is this permissible?"
Imam (as) said: "We borrow walnuts, sixty or seventy in number, and they may include small and large ones. There is no harm in this."
arabicText: 3707 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلصَّبَّاحِ بْنِ سَيَابَةَ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ عَبْدَ اَللَّهِ بْنَ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ أَمَرَنِي أَنْ أَسْأَلَكَ قَالَ إِنَّا نَسْتَقْرِضُ اَلْخُبْزَ مِنَ اَلْجِيرَانِ فَنَرُدُّ أَصْغَرَ مِنْهُ أَوْ أَكْبَرَ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "نَحْنُ نَسْتَقْرِضُ اَلْجَوْزَ اَلسِّتِّينَ وَ اَلسَّبْعِينَ عَدَداً فَيَكُونُ فِيهِ اَلصَّغِيرَةُ وَ اَلْكَبِيرَةُ فَلاَ بَأْسَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3707 - It is narrated from Al-Sabbah ibn Sayabah who said: I said to Abu Abdillah (as),
thaqalaynMatn:
"Abdullah ibn Abi Ya'fur instructed me to ask you-when we borrow bread from our neighbors, we sometimes return it smaller or larger in size. Is this permissible?"
Imam (as) said: "We borrow walnuts, sixty or seventy in number, and they may include small and large ones. There is no harm in this."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3708 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"Whoever gives a loan until ease of repayment, his wealth will be considered in Zakat, and the angels will continue praying for him until he receives it back."
arabicText: 3708 - قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ أَقْرَضَ قَرْضاً إِلَى مَيْسَرَةٍ كَانَ مَالُهُ فِي زَكَاةٍ وَ كَانَ هُوَ فِي صَلاَةٍ مِنَ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةِ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى يَقْبِضَهُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3708 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever gives a loan until ease of repayment, his wealth will be considered in Zakat, and the angels will continue praying for him until he receives it back."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3709 - Isma'il ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), that he used to say:
"If a man has a debt and then dies, the debt becomes due."
arabicText: 3709 - وَ رَوَى إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ : "إِذَا كَانَ عَلَى اَلرَّجُلِ دَيْنٌ ثُمَّ مَاتَ حَلَّ اَلدَّيْنُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3709 - Isma'il ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), that he used to say:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man has a debt and then dies, the debt becomes due."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3710 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"When a deceased person dies, what he owes and what is owed to him become due."
arabicText: 3710 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا مَاتَ اَلْمَيِّتُ حَلَّ مَا لَهُ وَ مَا عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3710 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a deceased person dies, what he owes and what is owed to him become due."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3711 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Salih Al-Thawri, from Abu Abdillah (as), regarding a man who dies while owing a debt, and a guarantor guarantees it for the creditors.
Imam (as) said: "If the creditors are satisfied with him, then the deceased is absolved of liability."
arabicText: 3711 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ اَلثَّوْرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ فَيَضْمَنُهُ ضَامِنٌ لِلْغُرَمَاءِ قَالَ "إِذَا رَضِيَ بِهِ اَلْغُرَمَاءُ فَقَدْ بَرِئَتْ ذِمَّةُ اَلْمَيِّتِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3711 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Salih Al-Thawri, from Abu Abdillah (as), regarding a man who dies while owing a debt, and a guarantor guarantees it for the creditors.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If the creditors are satisfied with him, then the deceased is absolved of liability."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3712 - Ibrahim ibn Abdul Hamid narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Khunays who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "Abdur-Rahman ibn Sayabah has a debt owed to him by a man who has died. We spoke to him about forgiving it, but he refused."
Imam (as) said: "Woe to him! Does he not know that for every dirham he forgives, he will receive ten in return? But if he does not forgive, then he will only receive a dirham in exchange for a dirham."
arabicText: 3712 - وَ رَوَى إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلْحَمِيدِ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ خُنَيْسٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ لِعَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ سَيَابَةَ دَيْناً عَلَى رَجُلٍ وَ قَدْ مَاتَ فَكَلَّمْنَاهُ أَنْ يُحَلِّلَهُ فَأَبَى قَالَ "وَيْحَهُ أَ مَا يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ لَهُ بِكُلِّ دِرْهَمٍ عَشَرَةً إِذَا حَلَّلَهُ وَ إِذَا لَمْ يُحَلِّلْهُ فَإِنَّمَا لَهُ دِرْهَمٌ بَدَلَ دِرْهَمٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3712 - Ibrahim ibn Abdul Hamid narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Khunays who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "Abdur-Rahman ibn Sayabah has a debt owed to him by a man who has died. We spoke to him about forgiving it, but he refused."
Imam (as) said: "Woe to him! Does he not know that for every dirham he forgives, he will receive ten in return? But if he does not forgive, then he will only receive a dirham in exchange for a dirham."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3713 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers (peace be upon them) who said:
A man came to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) and said: "I have earned wealth, but I was not careful in seeking it, whether it was lawful or unlawful. Now I wish to repent, but I do not know what portion of it is lawful and what is unlawful, as it has become mixed."
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Take out one-fifth of your wealth, for Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, has accepted one-fifth from a person, and the rest of the wealth is entirely lawful for you."
arabicText: 3713 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "أَتَى رَجُلٌ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ إِنِّي كَسَبْتُ مَالاً أَغْمَضْتُ فِي طَلَبِهِ حَلاَلاً وَ حَرَاماً فَقَدْ أَرَدْتُ اَلتَّوْبَةَ وَ لاَ أَدْرِي اَلْحَلاَلَ مِنْهُ وَ لاَ اَلْحَرَامَ فَقَدِ اِخْتَلَطَ عَلَيَّ فَقَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَخْرِجْ خُمُسَ مَالِكَ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ قَدْ رَضِيَ مِنَ اَلْإِنْسَانِ بِالْخُمُسِ وَ سَائِرُ اَلْمَالِ كُلُّهُ لَكَ حَلاَلٌ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3713 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers (peace be upon them) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man came to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) and said: "I have earned wealth, but I was not careful in seeking it, whether it was lawful or unlawful. Now I wish to repent, but I do not know what portion of it is lawful and what is unlawful, as it has become mixed."
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Take out one-fifth of your wealth, for Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, has accepted one-fifth from a person, and the rest of the wealth is entirely lawful for you."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3714 - Abu Al-Bakhtari Wahb ibn Wahb narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) (peace be upon them), who said:
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) ruled concerning a man who died and left heirs. One of the heirs acknowledged a debt against his father.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) ruled that it would be binding upon him in his share, according to what he inherited, and it would not apply to the entire estate.
If two of the heirs acknowledged the debt and they were just (trustworthy), then it would be enforced against all the heirs. However, if they were not just, they would only be liable in their shares, based on what they inherited.
Similarly, if some of the heirs acknowledged a brother or sister, the acknowledgment would only apply to their share.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Whoever acknowledges a brother, he is a partner in the wealth, but his lineage is not established.
If two heirs acknowledge him, the same applies-unless they are just (trustworthy), in which case his lineage is established, and he shares in the inheritance with them."
arabicText: 3714 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ وَهْبُ بْنُ وَهْبٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "قَضَى عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ وَرَثَةً فَأَقَرَّ أَحَدُ اَلْوَرَثَةِ بِدَيْنٍ عَلَى أَبِيهِ أَنَّهُ يَلْزَمُهُ ذَلِكَ فِي حِصَّتِهِ بِقَدْرِ مَا وَرِثَ وَ لاَ يَكُونُ ذَلِكَ فِي مَالِهِ كُلِّهِ فَإِنْ أَقَرَّ اِثْنَانِ مِنَ اَلْوَرَثَةِ وَ كَانَا عَدْلَيْنِ أُجِيزَ ذَلِكَ عَلَى اَلْوَرَثَةِ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُونَا عَدْلَيْنِ أُلْزِمَا فِي حِصَّتِهِمَا بِقَدْرِ مَا وَرِثَا وَ كَذَلِكَ إِنْ أَقَرَّ بَعْضُ اَلْوَرَثَةِ بِأَخٍ أَوْ أُخْتٍ إِنَّمَا يَلْزَمُهُ فِي حِصَّتِهِ وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "مَنْ أَقَرَّ لِأَخِيهِ فَهُوَ شَرِيكٌ فِي اَلْمَالِ وَ لاَ يَثْبُتُ نَسَبُهُ وَ إِذَا أَقَرَّ اِثْنَانِ فَكَذَلِكَ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَا عَدْلَيْنِ فَيُلْحَقُ نَسَبُهُ وَ يُضْرَبُ فِي اَلْمِيرَاثِ مَعَهُمْ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3714 - Abu Al-Bakhtari Wahb ibn Wahb narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) (peace be upon them), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) ruled concerning a man who died and left heirs. One of the heirs acknowledged a debt against his father.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) ruled that it would be binding upon him in his share, according to what he inherited, and it would not apply to the entire estate.
If two of the heirs acknowledged the debt and they were just (trustworthy), then it would be enforced against all the heirs. However, if they were not just, they would only be liable in their shares, based on what they inherited.
Similarly, if some of the heirs acknowledged a brother or sister, the acknowledgment would only apply to their share.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Whoever acknowledges a brother, he is a partner in the wealth, but his lineage is not established.
If two heirs acknowledge him, the same applies-unless they are just (trustworthy), in which case his lineage is established, and he shares in the inheritance with them."

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3715 - Ibrahim ibn Hashim narrated that Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr (may Allah (swt) be pleased with him) was a cloth merchant.
He lost his wealth and became poor. A man owed him ten thousand dirhams. Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr sold his house, which he lived in, for ten thousand dirhams and brought the money to the debtor's door.
Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr came out and asked: "What is this?"
The man replied: "This is your money that I owe you."
He asked: "Did you inherit it?"
The man said: "No."
He asked: "Was it gifted to you?"
The man said: "No."
He asked: "Is it the price of a property you sold?"
The man said: "No."
He asked: "Then what is it?"
The man replied: "I sold the house I live in to repay my debt."
Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr (may Allah (swt) be pleased with him) said: "Zarih Al-Muharibi narrated to me from Abu Abdillah (as) that he said:
'A man should not be forced out of his home because of a debt.' Take it back; I have no need for it. By Allah (swt), I am in need of a dirham at this moment, yet not a single dirham of it will enter my possession."
arabicText:
3715 - وَ رَوَى إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ كَانَ رَجُلاً بَزَّازاً فَذَهَبَ مَالُهُ وَ اِفْتَقَرَ وَ كَانَ لَهُ عَلَى رَجُلٍ عَشَرَةُ آلاَفِ دِرْهَمٍ فَبَاعَ دَاراً لَهُ كَانَ يَسْكُنُهَا بِعَشَرَةِ آلاَفِ دِرْهَمٍ وَ حَمَلَ اَلْمَالَ إِلَى بَابِهِ فَخَرَجَ إِلَيْهِ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ فَقَالَ مَا هَذَا قَالَ هَذَا مَالُكَ اَلَّذِي لَكَ عَلَيَّ قَالَ وَرِثْتَهُ قَالَ لاَ قَالَ وُهِبَ لَكَ قَالَ لاَ قَالَ فَقَالَ فَهُوَ ثَمَنُ ضَيْعَةٍ بِعْتَهَا قَالَ لاَ قَالَ فَمَا هُوَ قَالَ بِعْتُ دَارِيَ اَلَّتِي أَسْكُنُهَا لِأَقْضِيَ دَيْنِي
فَقَالَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ حَدَّثَنِي ذَرِيحٌ اَلْمُحَارِبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: "لاَ يُخْرَجُ اَلرَّجُلُ عَنْ مَسْقَطِ رَأْسِهِ بِالدَّيْنِ اِرْفَعْهَا فَلاَ حَاجَةَ لِي فِيهَا وَ اَللَّهِ إِنِّي مُحْتَاجٌ فِي وَقْتِي هَذَا إِلَى دِرْهَمٍ وَ مَا يَدْخُلُ مِلْكِي مِنْهَا دِرْهَمٌ".

chapter: Chapter on Debt and Loan
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3716 - Yunus ibn Abdul Rahman wrote to Al-Ridha (as), saying: "I had ten dirhams owed to me by a man, but the ruler invalidated those dirhams and introduced new dirhams that are higher in value than the previous ones. The earlier dirhams are now devalued. What is my right upon him-the original dirhams that the ruler invalidated or the new dirhams approved by the ruler?"
Imam (as) wrote in response: "You have the right to the original dirhams."
arabicText: 3716 - وَ كَتَبَ يُونُسُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ إِلَى اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ كَانَ لِي عَلَى رَجُلٍ عَشَرَةُ دَرَاهِمَ وَ إِنَّ اَلسُّلْطَانَ أَسْقَطَ تِلْكَ اَلدَّرَاهِمَ وَ جَاءَ بِدَرَاهِمَ أَعْلَى مِنْ تِلْكَ اَلدَّرَاهِمِ وَ فِي تِلْكَ اَلدَّرَاهِمِ اَلْأُولَى اَلْيَوْمَ وَضِيعَةٌ فَأَيُّ شَيْءٍ لِي عَلَيْهِ اَلدَّرَاهِمُ اَلْأُولَى اَلَّتِي أَسْقَطَهَا اَلسُّلْطَانُ أَوِ اَلدَّرَاهِمُ اَلَّتِي أَجَازَهَا اَلسُّلْطَانُ فَكَتَبَ "لَكَ اَلدَّرَاهِمُ اَلْأُولَى".

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3717 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Trade increases intellect."
arabicText: 3717 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلتِّجَارَةُ تَزِيدُ فِي اَلْعَقْلِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3717 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Trade increases intellect."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3718 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Abandoning trade diminishes intellect."
arabicText: 3718 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "تَرْكُ اَلتِّجَارَةِ مَذْهَبَةٌ لِلْعَقْلِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3718 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Abandoning trade diminishes intellect."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3719 - It is narrated from Al-Mu'alla ibn Khunays that he said:
Abu Abdillah (as) saw me when I had delayed going to the market, so Imam (as) said to me,
"Go early to your source of honor."
arabicText: 3719 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْمُعَلَّى بْنِ خُنَيْسٍ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : رَآنِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ قَدْ تَأَخَّرْتُ عَنِ اَلسُّوقِ فَقَالَ لِي "اُغْدُ إِلَى عِزِّكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3719 - It is narrated from Al-Mu'alla ibn Khunays that he said:
Abu Abdillah (as) saw me when I had delayed going to the market, so Imam (as) said to me,
thaqalaynMatn: "Go early to your source of honor."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3720 - It is narrated from Rawh ibn Abd Al-Rahim, from Abu Abdillah (as), regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted: "Men whom neither trade nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah (swt)." (Surah An-Nur 24:37)
Imam (as) said: "They were businessmen, but when the time for prayer arrived, they left their trade and went to perform the prayer. They are greater in reward than those who did not engage in trade."
arabicText:
3720 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ رَوْحِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحِيمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ:
۝ رِجٰالٌ لاٰ تُلْهِيهِمْ تِجٰارَةٌ وَ لاٰ بَيْعٌ عَنْ ذِكْرِ اَللّٰهِ ۝ قَالَ "كَانُوا أَصْحَابَ تِجَارَةٍ فَإِذَا حَضَرَتِ اَلصَّلاَةُ تَرَكُوا اَلتِّجَارَةَ وَ اِنْطَلَقُوا إِلَى اَلصَّلاَةِ وَ هُمْ أَعْظَمُ أَجْراً مِمَّنْ لَمْ يَتَّجِرْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3720 - It is narrated from Rawh ibn Abd Al-Rahim, from Abu Abdillah (as), regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted: "Men whom neither trade nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah (swt)." (Surah An-Nur 24:37)
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "They were businessmen, but when the time for prayer arrived, they left their trade and went to perform the prayer. They are greater in reward than those who did not engage in trade."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3721 - Harun ibn Hamzah narrated from Ali ibn Abdul Aziz who said:
Abu Abdillah (as) asked: "What has Umar ibn Muslim done?"
I said: "May I be your ransom! He has devoted himself to worship and abandoned trade."
Imam (as) said: "Woe to him! Does he not know that the one who abandons seeking sustenance will not have his supplication answered?
Indeed, some of the companions of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family), when the verse was revealed;
'And whoever fears Allah (swt), He will make a way out for him, and provide for him from where he does not expect' (Surah At-Talaq 65:2-3),
they locked their doors and devoted themselves to worship, saying, 'We have been guaranteed provision.'
When the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) heard about this, he sent for them and said: 'What led you to do what you have done?'
They said: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, has guaranteed our provision, so we have devoted ourselves to worship.'
He (sw) said: 'Whoever does this, Allah (swt) will not answer his supplication. You must continue seeking sustenance.'
Then Imam (as) said: 'I hate a man who sits idle, opening his mouth to his Lord (azj), saying, "Provide for me," while he abandons seeking sustenance.'"
arabicText:
3721 - وَ رَوَى هَارُونُ بْنُ حَمْزَةَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلْعَزِيزِ قَالَ : قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "مَا فَعَلَ عُمَرُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ " قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ أَقْبَلَ عَلَى اَلْعِبَادَةِ وَ تَرَكَ اَلتِّجَارَةَ فَقَالَ "وَيْحَهُ أَ مَا عَلِمَ أَنَّ تَارِكَ اَلطَّلَبِ لاَ يُسْتَجَابُ لَهُ دَعْوَةٌ، إِنَّ قَوْماً مِنْ أَصْحَابِ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَمَّا نَزَلَتْ:
۝ وَ مَنْ يَتَّقِ اَللّٰهَ يَجْعَلْ لَهُ مَخْرَجاً وَ يَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لاٰ يَحْتَسِبُ ۝
أَغْلَقُوا اَلْأَبْوَابَ وَ أَقْبَلُوا عَلَى اَلْعِبَادَةِ وَ قَالُوا قَدْ كُفِينَا فَبَلَغَ ذَلِكَ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَأَرْسَلَ إِلَيْهِمْ فَقَالَ "مَا حَمَلَكُمْ عَلَى مَا صَنَعْتُمْ" قَالُوا يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ تَكَفَّلَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِأَرْزَاقِنَا فَأَقْبَلْنَا عَلَى اَلْعِبَادَةِ فَقَالَ "إِنَّهُ مَنْ فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ لَمْ يَسْتَجِبِ اَللَّهُ لَهُ عَلَيْكُمْ بِالطَّلَبِ"
ثُمَّ قَالَ "إِنِّي لَأُبْغِضُ اَلرَّجُلَ فَاغِراً فَاهُ إِلَى رَبِّهِ يَقُولُ اُرْزُقْنِي وَ يَتْرُكُ اَلطَّلَبَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3721 - Harun ibn Hamzah narrated from Ali ibn Abdul Aziz who said:
Abu Abdillah (as) asked:
thaqalaynMatn:
"What has Umar ibn Muslim done?"
I said: "May I be your ransom! He has devoted himself to worship and abandoned trade."
Imam (as) said: "Woe to him! Does he not know that the one who abandons seeking sustenance will not have his supplication answered?
Indeed, some of the companions of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family), when the verse was revealed;
'And whoever fears Allah (swt), He will make a way out for him, and provide for him from where he does not expect' (Surah At-Talaq 65:2-3),
they locked their doors and devoted themselves to worship, saying, 'We have been guaranteed provision.'
When the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) heard about this, he sent for them and said: 'What led you to do what you have done?'
They said: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, has guaranteed our provision, so we have devoted ourselves to worship.'
He (sw) said: 'Whoever does this, Allah (swt) will not answer his supplication. You must continue seeking sustenance.'
Then Imam (as) said: 'I hate a man who sits idle, opening his mouth to his Lord (azj), saying, "Provide for me," while he abandons seeking sustenance.'"

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3722 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
"Engage in trade - may Allah (swt) bless you - for I heard the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) say, 'Provision is divided into ten parts, nine of which are in trade, and one in other means.'"
arabicText: 3722 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اِتَّجِرُوا بَارَكَ اَللَّهُ لَكُمْ فَإِنِّي سَمِعْتُ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ يَقُولُ "إِنَّ اَلرِّزْقَ عَشَرَةُ أَجْزَاءٍ تِسْعَةٌ فِي اَلتِّجَارَةِ وَ وَاحِدٌ فِي غَيْرِهَا" ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3722 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
"Engage in trade - may Allah (swt) bless you - for I heard the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) say,
thaqalaynMatn: 'Provision is divided into ten parts, nine of which are in trade, and one in other means.'"

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3723 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
"Engage in trade, for in it lies independence from what is in the hands of others."
arabicText: 3723 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "تَعَرَّضُوا لِلتِّجَارَةِ فَإِنَّ فِيهَا لَكُمْ غِنًى عَمَّا فِي أَيْدِي اَلنَّاسِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3723 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Engage in trade, for in it lies independence from what is in the hands of others."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3724 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Do not abandon trade, lest you become insignificant. Engage in trade-may Allah (swt) bless you."
arabicText: 3724 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تَدَعُوا اَلتِّجَارَةَ فَتَهُونُوا اِتَّجِرُوا بَارَكَ اَللَّهُ لَكُمْ"
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3724 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not abandon trade, lest you become insignificant. Engage in trade-may Allah (swt) bless you."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3725 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
"Whoever engages in trade without knowledge will fall into usury, and then fall into it again. Therefore, no one should sit in the marketplace except one who understands buying and selling."
arabicText: 3725 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنِ اِتَّجَرَ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ اِرْتَطَمَ فِي اَلرِّبَا ثُمَّ اِرْتَطَمَ فَلاَ يَقْعُدَنَّ فِي اَلسُّوقِ إِلاَّ مَنْ يَعْقِلُ اَلشِّرَاءَ وَ اَلْبَيْعَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3725 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever engages in trade without knowledge will fall into usury, and then fall into it again. Therefore, no one should sit in the marketplace except one who understands buying and selling."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3726 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to go out every morning in Kufa and walk through its markets, visiting them one by one.
Imam (as) carried a whip with two ends, which was called "Al-Sabeebah."
Imam (as) would stand in each market and call out to the merchants, saying:
"O group of traders! Begin with seeking goodness (from Allah (swt)), bless your trade with ease, draw near to the buyers, adorn yourselves with patience, avoid oppression, give justice to the oppressed, and do not approach usury.
'And give full measure and weight' and 'Do not diminish people's goods, nor act corruptly in the land, making mischief.'"
Then Imam (as) would continue walking through all the markets of Kufa before returning to sit and attend to the people's needs.
arabicText:
3726 - وَ كَانَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ ، بِالْكُوفَةِ يَغْتَدِي كُلَّ بُكْرَةٍ فَيَطُوفُ فِي أَسْوَاقِ اَلْكُوفَةِ سُوقاً سُوقاً وَ مَعَهُ اَلدِّرَّةُ عَلَى عَاتِقِهِ وَ كَانَ لَهَا طَرَفَانِ وَ كَانَتْ تُسَمَّى اَلسَّبِيبَةَ قَالَ فَيَقِفُ عَلَى أَهْلِ كُلِّ سُوقٍ فَيُنَادِيهِمْ "يَا مَعْشَرَ اَلتُّجَّارِ قَدِّمُوا اَلاِسْتِخَارَةَ وَ تَبَرَّكُوا بِالسُّهُولَةِ وَ اِقْتَرِبُوا مِنَ اَلْمُبْتَاعِينَ وَ تَزَيَّنُوا بِالْحِلْمِ وَ تَجَافَوْا عَنِ اَلظُّلْمِ وَ أَنْصِفُوا اَلْمَظْلُومِينَ وَ لاَ تَقْرَبُوا اَلرِّبَا "وَ أَوْفُوا اَلْكَيْلَ وَ اَلْمِيزٰانَ" "وَ لاٰ تَبْخَسُوا اَلنّٰاسَ أَشْيٰاءَهُمْ وَ لاٰ تَعْثَوْا فِي اَلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ" "
قَالَ فَيَطُوفُ فِي جَمِيعِ أَسْوَاقِ اَلْكُوفَةِ ثُمَّ يَرْجِعُ فَيَقْعُدُ لِلنَّاسِ.

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3727 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"Whoever buys and sells should observe five qualities; otherwise, let him not buy or sell: usury, swearing, concealing defects, praising when selling, and criticizing when buying."
arabicText: 3727 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَنْ بَاعَ وَ اِشْتَرَى فَلْيَحْفَظْ خَمْسَ خِصَالٍ وَ إِلاَّ فَلاَ يَشْتَرِيَنَّ وَ لاَ يَبِيعَنَّ اَلرِّبَا وَ اَلْحَلْفَ وَ كِتْمَانَ اَلْعُيُوبِ وَ اَلْمَدْحَ إِذَا بَاعَ وَ اَلذَّمَّ إِذَا اِشْتَرَى ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3727 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever buys and sells should observe five qualities; otherwise, let him not buy or sell: usury, swearing, concealing defects, praising when selling, and criticizing when buying."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3728 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"O group of traders, raise your heads, for the path has been made clear for you. You will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment as transgressors, except those who speak the truth."
arabicText: 3728 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "يَا مَعْشَرَ اَلتُّجَّارِ اِرْفَعُوا رُءُوسَكُمْ فَقَدْ وَضَحَ لَكُمُ اَلطَّرِيقُ تُبْعَثُونَ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ فُجَّاراً إِلاَّ مَنْ صَدَقَ حَدِيثُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3728 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O group of traders, raise your heads, for the path has been made clear for you. You will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment as transgressors, except those who speak the truth."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3729 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"The trader is sinful, and the sinful one is in the Fire-except for the one who takes what is right and gives what is right."
arabicText: 3729 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "اَلتَّاجِرُ فَاجِرٌ وَ اَلْفَاجِرُ فِي اَلنَّارِ إِلاَّ مَنْ أَخَذَ اَلْحَقَّ وَ أَعْطَى اَلْحَقَّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3729 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The trader is sinful, and the sinful one is in the Fire-except for the one who takes what is right and gives what is right."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3730 - Imam (as) said: "O group of traders, protect your wealth through charity, your sins will be forgiven, and the oaths you make will be purified for you-thus your trade will be blessed."
arabicText: 3730 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "يَا مَعْشَرَ اَلتُّجَّارِ صُونُوا أَمْوَالَكُمْ بِالصَّدَقَةِ تُكَفَّرْ عَنْكُمْ ذُنُوبُكُمْ وَ أَيْمَانَكُمُ اَلَّتِي تَحْلِفُونَ فِيهَا تُطَيَّبْ لَكُمْ تِجَارَتُكُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3730 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O group of traders, protect your wealth through charity, your sins will be forgiven, and the oaths you make will be purified for you-thus your trade will be blessed."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3731 - It is narrated from Al-Asbagh ibn Nubatah who said:
I heard Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) saying from the pulpit:
"O group of traders! Learn jurisprudence, then engage in trade. Learn jurisprudence, then engage in trade. By Allah (swt), usury in this nation is more hidden than the crawling of an ant on a smooth stone.
Protect your wealth through charity. The trader is sinful, and the sinful one is in the Fire-except the one who takes what is right and gives what is right."
arabicText: 3731 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْأَصْبَغِ بْنِ نُبَاتَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ عَلَى اَلْمِنْبَرِ : "يَا مَعْشَرَ اَلتُّجَّارِ اَلْفِقْهَ ثُمَّ اَلْمَتْجَرَ اَلْفِقْهَ ثُمَّ اَلْمَتْجَرَ وَ اَللَّهِ لَلرِّبَا فِي هَذِهِ اَلْأُمَّةِ دَبِيبٌ أَخْفَى مِنْ دَبِيبِ اَلنَّمْلِ عَلَى اَلصَّفَا صُونُوا أَمْوَالَكُمْ بِالصَّدَقَةِ اَلتَّاجِرُ فَاجِرٌ وَ اَلْفَاجِرُ فِي اَلنَّارِ إِلاَّ مَنْ أَخَذَ اَلْحَقَّ وَ أَعْطَى اَلْحَقَّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3731 - It is narrated from Al-Asbagh ibn Nubatah who said:
I heard Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) saying from the pulpit:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O group of traders! Learn jurisprudence, then engage in trade. Learn jurisprudence, then engage in trade. By Allah (swt), usury in this nation is more hidden than the crawling of an ant on a smooth stone.
Protect your wealth through charity. The trader is sinful, and the sinful one is in the Fire-except the one who takes what is right and gives what is right."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3732 - Hafs ibn Al-Bakhtari narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Al-Mundhir who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "My wife gave me money to use as I wish. Can I buy a bondwoman with her money and have relations with her?"
Imam (as) said: "No. She gave it to you to bring comfort to her eyes, and you intend to cause her distress."
arabicText: 3732 - وَ رَوَى حَفْصُ بْنُ اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ اَلْمُنْذِرِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ دَفَعَتْ إِلَيَّ اِمْرَأَتِي مَالاً أَعْمَلُ بِهِ مَا شِئْتُ فَأَشْتَرِي مِنْ مَالِهَا اَلْجَارِيَةَ أَطَأُهَا قَالَ "لاَ إِنَّمَا دَفَعَتْ إِلَيْكَ لِتَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَ أَنْتَ تُرِيدُ أَنْ تُسْخِنَ عَيْنَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3732 - Hafs ibn Al-Bakhtari narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Al-Mundhir who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "My wife gave me money to use as I wish. Can I buy a bondwoman with her money and have relations with her?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "No. She gave it to you to bring comfort to her eyes, and you intend to cause her distress."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3733 - Uthman ibn Isa narrated from Muyassir who said:
I said to Him (as): "A man comes to me and asks me to buy something for him, but what I have is better than what is available in the market. What should I do?"
Imam (as) said: "If you are confident that he will not suspect you, then give him from what you have. But if you fear that he might suspect you, then buy for him from the market."
arabicText: 3733 - وَ رَوَى عُثْمَانُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ مُيَسِّرٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ يَجِيئُنِي اَلرَّجُلُ فَيَقُولُ تَشْتَرِي لِي فَيَكُونُ مَا عِنْدِي خَيْراً مِنْ مَتَاعِ اَلسُّوقِ قَالَ "إِنْ أَمِنْتَ أَلاَّ يَتَّهِمَكَ فَأَعْطِهِ مِنْ عِنْدِكَ وَ إِنْ خِفْتَ أَنْ يَتَّهِمَكَ فَاشْتَرِ لَهُ مِنَ اَلسُّوقِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3733 - Uthman ibn Isa narrated from Muyassir who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Him (as): "A man comes to me and asks me to buy something for him, but what I have is better than what is available in the market. What should I do?"
Imam (as) said: "If you are confident that he will not suspect you, then give him from what you have. But if you fear that he might suspect you, then buy for him from the market."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3734 - Isma'il ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
Allah (swt), the Exalted, revealed to one of His prophets (peace be upon them): "Deal generously with the generous, be lenient with the lenient, be tight-fisted with the stingy, and be evasive with the harsh."
arabicText: 3734 - وَ رَوَى إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "أَنْزَلَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى عَلَى بَعْضِ أَنْبِيَائِهِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِلْكَرِيمِ فَكَارِمْ وَ لِلسَّمْحِ فَسَامِحْ وَ لِلشَّحِيحِ فَشَاحِحْ وَ عِنْدَ اَلشَّكِسِ فَالْتَوِ".

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3735 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) say, "Leniency is a means of profit."
Imam (as) then said: "This applies to a man who is advised while he has goods to sell."
arabicText: 3735 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ سَمِعْتُ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ يَقُولُ : "اَلسَّمَاحُ وَجْهٌ مِنَ اَلرَّبَاحِ" قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "ذَلِكَ لِرَجُلٍ يُوصِيهِ وَ مَعَهُ سِلْعَةٌ يَبِيعُهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3735 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
I heard the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) say,
thaqalaynMatn:
"Leniency is a means of profit."
Imam (as) then said: "This applies to a man who is advised while he has goods to sell."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3736 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) passed by a bondwoman who had bought meat from a butcher and was asking him to add more.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said to the butcher: "Give her more, for it brings greater blessings."
arabicText: 3736 - وَ مَرَّ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَى جَارِيَةٍ قَدِ اِشْتَرَتْ لَحْماً مِنْ قَصَّابٍ وَ هِيَ تَقُولُ زِدْنِي فَقَالَ لَهُ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "زِدْهَا فَإِنَّهُ أَعْظَمُ لِلْبَرَكَةِ".

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3737 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, loves a servant who is easygoing in selling, easygoing in buying, easygoing in settling debts, and easygoing in demanding repayment."
arabicText: 3737 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى يُحِبُّ اَلْعَبْدَ يَكُونُ سَهْلَ اَلْبَيْعِ سَهْلَ اَلشِّرَاءِ سَهْلَ اَلْقَضَاءِ سَهْلَ اَلاِقْتِضَاءِ".

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3738 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Any Muslim who cancels a sale for another Muslim who regrets it, Allah (swt) will cancel his slip on the Day of Judgment."
arabicText: 3738 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَيُّمَا مُسْلِمٍ أَقَالَ مُسْلِماً نَدَامَةً فِي اَلْبَيْعِ أَقَالَهُ اَللَّهُ عَثْرَتَهُ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3738 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Any Muslim who cancels a sale for another Muslim who regrets it, Allah (swt) will cancel his slip on the Day of Judgment."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3739 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) passed by a man who had goods he wanted to sell and said to him, "Go to the beginning of the market."
arabicText: 3739 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : مَرَّ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَلَى رَجُلٍ وَ مَعَهُ سِلْعَةٌ يُرِيدُ بَيْعَهَا فَقَالَ "عَلَيْكَ بِأَوَّلِ اَلسُّوقِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3739 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) passed by a man who had goods he wanted to sell and said to him,
thaqalaynMatn: "Go to the beginning of the market."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3740 - Imam (as) said: "The owner of the goods has more right to set the price."
arabicText: 3740 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "صَاحِبُ اَلسِّلْعَةِ أَحَقُّ بِالسَّوْمِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3740 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The owner of the goods has more right to set the price."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3741 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) forbade trading between the rise of dawn and the rise of the sun.
arabicText: 3741 - وَ نَهَى صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَنِ اَلسَّوْمِ مَا بَيْنَ طُلُوعِ اَلْفَجْرِ إِلَى طُلُوعِ اَلشَّمْسِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3741 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) forbade trading between the rise of dawn and the rise of the sun.

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3742 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"Bargain with the buyer, for it is more satisfying to the soul. Even if he gives generously, the one who is cheated in buying or selling is neither praiseworthy nor rewarded."
arabicText: 3742 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَاكِسِ اَلْمُشْتَرِيَ فَإِنَّهُ أَطْيَبُ لِلنَّفْسِ وَ إِنْ أَعْطَى اَلْجَزِيلَ فَإِنَّ اَلْمَغْبُونَ فِي بَيْعِهِ وَ شِرَائِهِ غَيْرُ مَحْمُودٍ وَ لاَ مَأْجُورٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3742 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Bargain with the buyer, for it is more satisfying to the soul. Even if he gives generously, the one who is cheated in buying or selling is neither praiseworthy nor rewarded."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3743 - Imam (as) said: "Do not bargain in four things; the sacrificial animal, the shroud, the price of freeing a slave, and the fare to Makkah."
arabicText: 3743 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تُمَاكِسْ فِي أَرْبَعَةِ أَشْيَاءَ فِي اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ وَ فِي اَلْكَفَنِ وَ فِي ثَمَنِ نَسَمَةٍ وَ فِي اَلْكِرَى إِلَى مَكَّةَ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3743 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not bargain in four things; the sacrificial animal, the shroud, the price of freeing a slave, and the fare to Makkah."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3744 - Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain Zayn Al-Abidin (as) used to say to his steward:
"If you intend to buy something for me from the needs of Hajj, then buy it and do not bargain."
arabicText: 3744 - وَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ زَيْنُ اَلْعَابِدِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ لِقَهْرَمَانِهِ إِذَا أَرَدْتَ أَنْ تَشْتَرِيَ لِي مِنْ حَوَائِجِ اَلْحَجِّ شَيْئاً فَاشْتَرِ وَ لاَ تُمَاكِسْ
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3744 - Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain Zayn Al-Abidin (as) used to say to his steward:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you intend to buy something for me from the needs of Hajj, then buy it and do not bargain."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3745 - Muyassir narrated from Hafs, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said: I said to him, "A man intends to be honest, but when he measures, he does not measure accurately."
He (as) asked: "What do those around him say?"
I said: "They say he does not give full measure."
He (as) said: "He is among those who should not be measuring."
arabicText: 3745 - وَ رَوَى مُيَسِّرٌ عَنْ حَفْصٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ مِنْ نِيَّتِهِ اَلْوَفَاءُ وَ هُوَ إِذَا كَالَ لَمْ يُحْسِنْ أَنْ يَكِيلَ فَقَالَ "مَا يَقُولُ اَلَّذِينَ حَوْلَهُ" قَالَ قُلْتُ يَقُولُونَ لاَ يُوفِي قَالَ "هُوَ مِمَّنْ لاَ يَنْبَغِي لَهُ أَنْ يَكِيلَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3745 - Muyassir narrated from Hafs, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to him, "A man intends to be honest, but when he measures, he does not measure accurately."
He (as) asked: "What do those around him say?"
I said: "They say he does not give full measure."
He (as) said: "He is among those who should not be measuring."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3746 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said: "Whoever takes the scales in his hand with the intention of taking a full measure for himself will only take more than his due. And whoever gives with the intention of giving an equal measure will only give less."
arabicText: 3746 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَنْ أَخَذَ اَلْمِيزَانَ بِيَدِهِ فَنَوَى أَنْ يَأْخُذَ لِنَفْسِهِ وَافِياً لَمْ يَأْخُذْهُ إِلاَّ رَاجِحاً وَ مَنْ أَعْطَى فَنَوَى أَنْ يُعْطِيَ سَوَاءً لَمْ يُعْطِ إِلاَّ نَاقِصاً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3746 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever takes the scales in his hand with the intention of taking a full measure for himself will only take more than his due. And whoever gives with the intention of giving an equal measure will only give less."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3747 - Hammad ibn Bashir narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
"Fulfillment (of measure) is not achieved until the scale tips."
arabicText: 3747 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ يَكُونُ اَلْوَفَاءُ حَتَّى يَمِيلَ اَللِّسَانُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3747 - Hammad ibn Bashir narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Fulfillment (of measure) is not achieved until the scale tips."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3748 - And in another narration: "Fulfillment (of measure) is not achieved until it exceeds (the exact amount)."
arabicText: 3748 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : "لاَ يَكُونُ اَلْوَفَاءُ حَتَّى يَرْجَحَ".

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3749 - It is narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I receive dirhams from a man, weigh them, then distribute them, and a surplus remains in my hand. What should I do?"
Imam (as) said: "Did you not strive to be accurate in your measure?"
I said: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "Then there is no harm."
arabicText: 3749 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ آخُذُ اَلدَّرَاهِمَ مِنَ اَلرَّجُلِ فَأَزِنُهَا ثُمَّ أُفَرِّقُهَا وَ يَفْضُلُ فِي يَدِي مِنْهَا فَضْلٌ قَالَ "أَ لَيْسَ تَحَرَّى اَلْوَفَاءَ" قُلْتُ بَلَى قَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3749 - It is narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar who said:
I said to Abu Abdillah (as), "I receive dirhams from a man, weigh them, then distribute them, and a surplus remains in my hand. What should I do?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Did you not strive to be accurate in your measure?"
I said: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "Then there is no harm."

chapter: Chapter on Trade, Its Etiquettes, Virtues, and Jurisprudence
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3750 - Wahb ibn Wahb narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) (peace be upon them), that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to say:
"Earnest money (down payment) is not permissible unless it is part of the price."
arabicText: 3750 - وَ رَوَى وَهْبُ بْنُ وَهْبٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ كَانَ يَقُولُ : "لاَ يَجُوزُ اَلْعَرَبُونُ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ نَقْداً مِنَ اَلثَّمَنِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3750 - Wahb ibn Wahb narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) (peace be upon them), that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to say:
thaqalaynMatn: "Earnest money (down payment) is not permissible unless it is part of the price."

chapter: Chapter on the Marketplace
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3751 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
A Bedouin from the tribe of Banu 'Amir came to the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) and asked him about the worst and the best places on earth.
The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "The worst places on earth are the markets-they are the playgrounds of Iblis. He sets out in the morning with his banner, places his throne there, and sends out his offspring among them. There, you find someone who cheats in measuring, another who falsifies the scale, someone who steals in length, or someone who lies about merchandise. Iblis then says to them: 'Stick to a man whose father has died while your father is still alive.' And he remains there, being the first to enter and the last to leave."
Then Imam (as) said: "And the best places are the mosques. The most beloved among them to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, are those who enter first and leave last."
arabicText: 3751 - قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "جَاءَ أَعْرَابِيٌّ مِنْ بَنِي عَامِرٍ إِلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَسَأَلَهُ عَنْ شَرِّ بِقَاعِ اَلْأَرْضِ وَ خَيْرِ بِقَاعِ اَلْأَرْضِ فَقَالَ لَهُ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "شَرُّ بِقَاعِ اَلْأَرْضِ اَلْأَسْوَاقُ وَ هِيَ مَيْدَانُ إِبْلِيسَ يَغْدُو بِرَايَتِهِ وَ يَضَعُ كُرْسِيَّهُ وَ يَبُثُّ ذُرِّيَّتَهُ فَبَيْنَ مُطَفِّفٍ فِي قَفِيزٍ أَوْ طَائِشٍ فِي مِيزَانٍ أَوْ سَارِقٍ فِي ذَرْعٍ أَوْ كَاذِبٍ فِي سِلْعَةٍ فَيَقُولُ عَلَيْكُمْ بِرَجُلٍ مَاتَ أَبُوهُ وَ أَبُوكُمْ حَيٌّ فَلاَ يَزَالُ مَعَ ذَلِكَ أَوَّلَ دَاخِلٍ وَ آخِرَ خَارِجٍ " ثُمَّ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "وَ خَيْرُ اَلْبِقَاعِ اَلْمَسَاجِدُ وَ أَحَبُّهُمْ إِلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَوَّلُهُمْ دُخُولاً وَ آخِرُهُمْ خُرُوجاً مِنْهَا" ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3751 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
A Bedouin from the tribe of Banu 'Amir came to the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) and asked him about the worst and the best places on earth.
The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The worst places on earth are the markets-they are the playgrounds of Iblis. He sets out in the morning with his banner, places his throne there, and sends out his offspring among them. There, you find someone who cheats in measuring, another who falsifies the scale, someone who steals in length, or someone who lies about merchandise. Iblis then says to them: 'Stick to a man whose father has died while your father is still alive.' And he remains there, being the first to enter and the last to leave."
Then Imam (as) said: "And the best places are the mosques. The most beloved among them to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, are those who enter first and leave last."

chapter: Chapter on the Marketplace
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3752 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said: "The marketplace of the Muslims is like their mosque. Whoever reaches a spot first has more right to it until the night."
arabicText: 3752 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "سُوقُ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ كَمَسْجِدِهِمْ فَمَنْ سَبَقَ إِلَى مَكَانٍ فَهُوَ أَحَقُّ بِهِ إِلَى اَللَّيْلِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3752 - The Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The marketplace of the Muslims is like their mosque. Whoever reaches a spot first has more right to it until the night."

chapter: Chapter on the Reward of Supplication in Marketplaces
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3753 - Asim ibn Humayd narrated from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
"Whoever enters a marketplace or a congregational mosque and says once:
I bear witness that there is no god but Allah (swt), alone, without any partner.
Allah (swt) is the Greatest, immensely great.
All praise is due to Allah (swt), abundantly.
Glory be to Allah (swt), morning and evening.
There is no power and no strength except with Allah (swt), the Most High, the Most Great.
May Allah (swt) send blessings upon Muhammad and his family.
This will be equal to a blessed and accepted Hajj for him."
arabicText:
3753 - رَوَى عَاصِمُ بْنُ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ :
"مَنْ دَخَلَ سُوقاً أَوْ مَسْجِدَ جَمَاعَةٍ فَقَالَ مَرَّةً وَاحِدَةً: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَ اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً وَ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً وَ سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ بُكْرَةً وَ أَصِيلاً وَ لاَ حَوْلَ وَ لاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ اَلْعَلِيِّ اَلْعَظِيمِ وَ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِهِ عَدَلَتْ لَهُ حَجَّةً مَبْرُورَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3753 - Asim ibn Humayd narrated from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever enters a marketplace or a congregational mosque and says once:
I bear witness that there is no god but Allah (swt), alone, without any partner.
Allah (swt) is the Greatest, immensely great.
All praise is due to Allah (swt), abundantly.
Glory be to Allah (swt), morning and evening.
There is no power and no strength except with Allah (swt), the Most High, the Most Great.
May Allah (swt) send blessings upon Muhammad and his family.
This will be equal to a blessed and accepted Hajj for him."

chapter: Chapter on the Reward of Supplication in Marketplaces
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3754 - Abdullah ibn Hammad Al-Ansari narrated from Sadeer, who said: Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"O Abu Al-Fadl, do you not have a place in the market where you sit and deal with people?"
I said: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "Know that any man who goes to his seat in the market, and when he places his foot in the market says:
'O Allah (swt), I ask You for its goodness and the goodness of its people, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil of its people',
Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, appoints an angel to protect him and preserve him until he returns to his home. The angel then says to him, 'I have safeguarded you from its evil and the evil of its people for this day.'
And when he sits in his place, he should say:
'I bear witness that there is no god but Allah (swt), alone, without any partner. And I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. O Allah (swt), I ask You for lawful, pure sustenance from Your bounty, and I seek refuge in You from wronging others or being wronged, and I seek refuge in You from a bad transaction and a false oath.'
When he says this, the appointed angel says, 'Rejoice! For there is no one in the market today with a greater share than you. And what Allah (swt) has decreed for you will come to you fully, lawfully, purely, and with blessings.'"
arabicText:
3754 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ حَمَّادٍ اَلْأَنْصَارِيُّ عَنْ سَدِيرٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "يَا أَبَا اَلْفَضْلِ أَ مَا لَكَ فِي اَلسُّوقِ مَكَانٌ تَقْعُدُ فِيهِ تُعَامِلُ اَلنَّاسَ" قَالَ قُلْتُ بَلَى قَالَ
"اِعْلَمْ أَنَّهُ مَا مِنْ رَجُلٍ يَغْدُو وَ يَرُوحُ إِلَى مَجْلِسِهِ وَ سُوقِهِ فَيَقُولُ حِينَ يَضَعُ رِجْلَهُ فِي اَلسُّوقِ: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا وَ خَيْرَ أَهْلِهَا وَ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَ شَرِّ أَهْلِهَا إِلاَّ وَكَّلَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِهِ، مَنْ يَحْفَظُهُ وَ يَحْفَظُ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ إِلَى مَنْزِلِهِ فَيَقُولُ لَهُ قَدْ أَجَرْتُكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَ شَرِّ أَهْلِهَا يَوْمَكَ هَذَا فَإِذَا جَلَسَ مَكَانَهُ حِينَ يَجْلِسُ فَيَقُولُ
أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَ رَسُولُهُ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ حَلاَلاً طَيِّباً وَ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ أَنْ أَظْلِمَ أَوْ أُظْلَمَ وَ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ صَفْقَةٍ خَاسِرَةٍ وَ يَمِينٍ كَاذِبَةٍ فَإِذَا قَالَ ذَلِكَ قَالَ اَلْمَلَكُ اَلْمُوَكَّلُ أَبْشِرْ فَمَا فِي سُوقِكَ اَلْيَوْمَ أَحَدٌ أَوْفَرُ نَصِيباً مِنْكَ وَ سَيَأْتِيكَ مَا قَسَمَ اَللَّهُ لَكَ مُوَفَّراً حَلاَلاً طَيِّباً مُبَارَكاً فِيهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3754 - Abdullah ibn Hammad Al-Ansari narrated from Sadeer, who said: Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O Abu Al-Fadl, do you not have a place in the market where you sit and deal with people?"
I said: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "Know that any man who goes to his seat in the market, and when he places his foot in the market says:
'O Allah (swt), I ask You for its goodness and the goodness of its people, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil of its people',
Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, appoints an angel to protect him and preserve him until he returns to his home. The angel then says to him, 'I have safeguarded you from its evil and the evil of its people for this day.'
And when he sits in his place, he should say:
'I bear witness that there is no god but Allah (swt), alone, without any partner. And I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. O Allah (swt), I ask You for lawful, pure sustenance from Your bounty, and I seek refuge in You from wronging others or being wronged, and I seek refuge in You from a bad transaction and a false oath.'
When he says this, the appointed angel says, 'Rejoice! For there is no one in the market today with a greater share than you. And what Allah (swt) has decreed for you will come to you fully, lawfully, purely, and with blessings.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Reward of Supplication in Marketplaces
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3755 - It is narrated: "Whoever remembers Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, in the marketplaces, Allah (swt) will forgive him in proportion to the number of those in it, both those who speak and those who do not."
arabicText: 3755 - وَ رُوِيَ : "أَنَّ مَنْ ذَكَرَ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي اَلْأَسْوَاقِ غَفَرَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ بِعَدَدِ مَا فِيهَا مِنْ فَصِيحٍ وَ أَعْجَمَ".

chapter: Chapter on the Reward of Supplication in Marketplaces
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3756 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever remembers Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, in the marketplaces, Allah (swt) will forgive him by the number of its people."
arabicText: 3756 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ ذَكَرَ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي اَلْأَسْوَاقِ غَفَرَ لَهُ بِعَدَدِ أَهْلِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3756 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever remembers Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, in the marketplaces, Allah (swt) will forgive him by the number of its people."

chapter: Chapter on Supplication When Purchasing Goods for Trade
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3757 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim who said:
One of the Imams (as) said:
"When you purchase merchandise, glorify Allah (swt) (say Allahu Akbar) three times, then say:
O Allah (swt), I have purchased it seeking Your goodness, so make goodness for me in it.
O Allah (swt), I have purchased it seeking Your bounty, so make bounty for me in it.
O Allah (swt), I have purchased it seeking Your provision, so make provision for me in it.
Then repeat each of these supplications three times."
arabicText: 3757 - رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَحَدُهُمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا اِشْتَرَيْتَ مَتَاعاً فَكَبِّرِ اَللَّهَ ثَلاَثاً ثُمَّ قُلِ اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي اِشْتَرَيْتُهُ أَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ مِنْ خَيْرِكَ فَاجْعَلْ لِي فِيهِ خَيْراً اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي اِشْتَرَيْتُهُ أَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ فَاجْعَلْ لِي فِيهِ فَضْلاً اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي اِشْتَرَيْتُهُ أَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ مِنْ رِزْقِكَ فَاجْعَلْ لِي فِيهِ رِزْقاً ثُمَّ أَعِدْ كُلَّ وَاحِدَةٍ مِنْهَا ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3757 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim who said:
One of the Imams (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When you purchase merchandise, glorify Allah (swt) (say Allahu Akbar) three times, then say:
O Allah (swt), I have purchased it seeking Your goodness, so make goodness for me in it.
O Allah (swt), I have purchased it seeking Your bounty, so make bounty for me in it.
O Allah (swt), I have purchased it seeking Your provision, so make provision for me in it.
Then repeat each of these supplications three times."

chapter: Chapter on Supplication When Purchasing Goods for Trade
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3758 - Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) used to write on merchandise: "Blessing for us."
arabicText: 3758 - وَ كَانَ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَكْتُبُ عَلَى اَلْمَتَاعِ "بَرَكَةٌ لَنَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3758 - Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) used to write on merchandise:
thaqalaynMatn: "Blessing for us."

chapter: Chapter on Supplication When Purchasing Animals
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3759 - Umar ibn Ibrahim narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as) who said:
"Whoever buys an animal should stand on its left side, hold its forelock with his right hand, and recite over its head:
Surah Al-Fatiha: the Opening of the Book,
Surah Al-Ikhlas (Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad),
Surah Al-Falaq and Surah Al-Nas (the two Mu'awwidhatayn) - two chapters of seeking refuge
The last verses of Surah Al-Hashr,
The last verse of Surah Bani Isra'il (Al-Isra'): 'Say, call upon Allah (swt) or call upon the Most Merciful',
Ayat Al-Kursi
Verily, this will serve as protection for the animal from afflictions."
arabicText: 3759 - رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَنِ اِشْتَرَى دَابَّةً فَلْيَقُمْ مِنْ جَانِبِهَا اَلْأَيْسَرِ وَ يَأْخُذُ نَاصِيَتَهَا بِيَدِهِ اَلْيُمْنَى وَ يَقْرَأُ عَلَى رَأْسِهَا فَاتِحَةَ اَلْكِتَابِ وَ "قُلْ هُوَ اَللّٰهُ أَحَدٌ" وَ اَلْمُعَوِّذَتَيْنِ وَ آخِرَ اَلْحَشْرِ وَ آخِرَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ "قُلِ اُدْعُوا اَللّٰهَ أَوِ اُدْعُوا اَلرَّحْمٰنَ" وَ آيَةَ اَلْكُرْسِيِّ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ أَمَانُ تِلْكَ اَلدَّابَّةِ مِنَ اَلْآفَاتِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3759 - Umar ibn Ibrahim narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever buys an animal should stand on its left side, hold its forelock with his right hand, and recite over its head:
Surah Al-Fatiha: the Opening of the Book,
Surah Al-Ikhlas (Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad),
Surah Al-Falaq and Surah Al-Nas (the two Mu'awwidhatayn) - two chapters of seeking refuge
The last verses of Surah Al-Hashr,
The last verse of Surah Bani Isra'il (Al-Isra'): 'Say, call upon Allah (swt) or call upon the Most Merciful',
Ayat Al-Kursi
Verily, this will serve as protection for the animal from afflictions."

chapter: Chapter on Supplication When Purchasing Animals
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3760 - Ibn Faddal narrated from Thalabah ibn Maymun, from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
"When you purchase a bondwoman, say:
O Allah (swt), I seek Your (swt) counsel and ask for Your (swt) guidance.
And when you purchase an animal or livestock, say:
O Allah (swt), decree for me the longest life, the greatest benefit, and the best outcome among them."
arabicText: 3760 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "إِذَا اِشْتَرَيْتَ جَارِيَةً فَقُلِ: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْتَشِيرُكَ وَ أَسْتَخِيرُكَ وَ إِذَا اِشْتَرَيْتَ دَابَّةً أَوْ رَأْساً فَقُلِ: اَللَّهُمَّ قَدِّرْ لِي أَطْوَلَهُنَّ حَيَاةً وَ أَكْثَرَهُنَّ مَنْفَعَةً وَ خَيْرَهُنَّ عَاقِبَةً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3760 - Ibn Faddal narrated from Thalabah ibn Maymun, from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When you purchase a bondwoman, say:
O Allah (swt), I seek Your (swt) counsel and ask for Your (swt) guidance.
And when you purchase an animal or livestock, say:
O Allah (swt), decree for me the longest life, the greatest benefit, and the best outcome among them."

chapter: Chapter on Conditions and Options in Sales
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3761 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
"For all animals, the buyer has a three-day condition (option) to return it, whether he stipulated it or not."
arabicText: 3761 - رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "فِي اَلْحَيَوَانِ كُلِّهِ شَرْطُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ لِلْمُشْتَرِي فَهُوَ بِالْخِيَارِ فِيهَا إِنِ اِشْتَرَطَ أَوْ لَمْ يَشْتَرِطْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3761 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "For all animals, the buyer has a three-day condition (option) to return it, whether he stipulated it or not."

chapter: Chapter on Conditions and Options in Sales
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3762 - Imam (as) said: "Whenever a man buys something from another man, they both have the option (to cancel the deal) until they part ways. Once they part, the sale becomes binding."
arabicText: 3762 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَيُّمَا رَجُلٍ اِشْتَرَى مِنْ رَجُلٍ بَيْعاً فَهُمَا بِالْخِيَارِ حَتَّى يَفْتَرِقَا فَإِذَا اِفْتَرَقَا فَقَدْ وَجَبَ اَلْبَيْعُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3762 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whenever a man buys something from another man, they both have the option (to cancel the deal) until they part ways. Once they part, the sale becomes binding."

chapter: Chapter on Conditions and Options in Sales
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3763 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who purchased a slave or an animal from another man and stipulated a condition for one or two days. If the slave dies, the animal perishes, or a defect occurs during that period, who is responsible for the loss?
Imam (as) said: "There is no liability on the buyer until the condition period ends and the sale becomes final."
arabicText: 3763 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ اِشْتَرَى مِنْ رَجُلٍ عَبْداً أَوْ دَابَّةً وَ شَرَطَ يَوْماً أَوْ يَوْمَيْنِ فَمَاتَ اَلْعَبْدُ أَوْ نَفَقَتِ اَلدَّابَّةُ أَوْ حَدَثَ فِيهِ حَدَثٌ عَلَى مَنِ اَلضَّمَانُ قَالَ "لاَ ضَمَانَ عَلَى اَلْمُبْتَاعِ حَتَّى يَنْقَضِيَ اَلشَّرْطُ وَ يَصِيرَ اَلْمَبِيعُ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3763 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who purchased a slave or an animal from another man and stipulated a condition for one or two days. If the slave dies, the animal perishes, or a defect occurs during that period, who is responsible for the loss?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no liability on the buyer until the condition period ends and the sale becomes final."

chapter: Chapter on Conditions and Options in Sales
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3764 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from the Righteous Servant of Allah (swt) (Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as)) who said:
"Whoever buys an item, and three days pass without him coming (to confirm or claim it), then the sale is void."
arabicText: 3764 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنِ اَلْعَبْدِ اَلصَّالِحِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "مَنِ اِشْتَرَى بَيْعاً وَ مَضَتْ ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَ لَمْ يَجِئْ فَلاَ بَيْعَ لَهُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3764 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from the Righteous Servant of Allah (swt) (Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as)) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever buys an item, and three days pass without him coming (to confirm or claim it), then the sale is void."

chapter: Chapter on Conditions and Options in Sales
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3765 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
"Muslims are bound by their conditions, except for any condition that contradicts the Book of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Exalted, which is not permissible."
arabicText: 3765 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : " اَلْمُسْلِمُونَ عِنْدَ شُرُوطِهِمْ إِلاَّ كُلَّ شَرْطٍ خَالَفَ، كِتَابَ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَلاَ يَجُوزُ ".
