author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4231 - It was said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"We have heard that the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: 'Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, despises the house filled with meat and the fattened meat.'"
So Imam (as) replied: "We eat meat and love it. What the Prophet, peace be upon him, meant was the house where the flesh of people is consumed through backbiting. And by 'fattened meat,' he meant the one who is arrogant and boastful in his walk."
arabicText: 4231 - وَ قِيلَ لِلصَّادِقِ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بَلَغَنَا أَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى لَيُبْغِضُ اَلْبَيْتَ اَللَّحِمَ وَ اَللَّحِمَ اَلسَّمِينَ" فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "إِنَّا لَنَأْكُلُ اَللَّحْمَ وَ نُحِبُّهُ وَ إِنَّمَا عَنَى عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلْبَيْتَ اَلَّذِي تُؤْكَلُ فِيهِ لُحُومُ اَلنَّاسِ بِالْغِيبَةِ وَ عَنَى بِاللَّحِمِ اَلسَّمِينِ اَلْمُتَبَخْتِرَ اَلْمُخْتَالَ فِي مِشْيَتِهِ".

chapter: Chapter on Hunting and Slaughtering
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4232 - Hariz narrated from Zurara, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that the Messenger of Allah (swt) prohibited eating meat raw, meaning uncooked.
The Prophet (sw) said: "It is only eaten by wild beasts."
Hariz said: "This means until it is altered by the sun or fire."
arabicText: 4232 - وَ رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ نَهَى أَنْ يُؤْكَلَ اَللَّحْمُ غَرِيضاً يَعْنِي نِيئاً وَ قَالَ "إِنَّمَا تَأْكُلُهُ اَلسِّبَاعُ" " قَالَ حَرِيزٌ يَعْنِي حَتَّى تُغَيِّرَهُ اَلشَّمْسُ أَوِ اَلنَّارُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4232 - Hariz narrated from Zurara, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that the Messenger of Allah (swt) prohibited eating meat raw, meaning uncooked.
The Prophet (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"It is only eaten by wild beasts."
Hariz said: "This means until it is altered by the sun or fire."

chapter: Chapter on Hunting and Slaughtering
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4233 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"No type of crow, whether a 'Zagh' or any other kind, is permissible to eat, and nothing from snakes is permissible to eat."
arabicText: 4233 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ يُؤْكَلُ مِنَ اَلْغِرْبَانِ زَاغٌ وَ لاَ غَيْرُهُ وَ لاَ يُؤْكَلُ مِنَ اَلْحَيَّاتِ شَيْءٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4233 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "No type of crow, whether a 'Zagh' or any other kind, is permissible to eat, and nothing from snakes is permissible to eat."

chapter: Chapter on Hunting and Slaughtering
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4234 - Al-Halabi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about killing snakes.
Imam (as) said: "Kill everything you find in the wilderness except the jinn."
And he forbade killing the household spirits (ʿAwamir) and said:
"Do not leave them out of fear of their consequences, for the Jews during the time of the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, used to say that whoever killed a household spirit would suffer such-and-such misfortune."
Then the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"Whoever refrains from killing them out of fear of their consequences is not from me. Rather, leave them alone because they do not intend to harm you."
Imam (as) also said: "I sometimes killed them in their houses."
arabicText: 4234 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ قَتْلِ اَلْحَيَّاتِ فَقَالَ "اُقْتُلْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ تَجِدُهُ فِي اَلْبَرِّيَّةِ إِلاَّ اَلْجَانَّ " وَ نَهَى عَنْ قَتْلِ عَوَامِرِ اَلْبُيُوتِ وَ قَالَ "لاَ تَدَعُوهُنَّ مَخَافَةَ تَبِعَاتِهِنَّ فَإِنَّ اَلْيَهُودَ عَلَى عَهْدِ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَتْ مَنْ قَتَلَ عَامِرَ بَيْتٍ أَصَابَهُ كَذَا وَ كَذَا فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "مَنْ تَرَكَهُنَّ مَخَافَةَ تَبِعَاتِهِنَّ فَلَيْسَ مِنِّي وَ إِنَّمَا تَتْرُكُهَا لِأَنَّهَا لاَ تُرِيدُكَ" " وَ قَالَ "رُبَّمَا قَتَلْتُهُنَّ فِي بُيُوتِهِنَّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4234 - Al-Halabi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about killing snakes.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Kill everything you find in the wilderness except the jinn."
And he forbade killing the household spirits (ʿAwamir) and said:
"Do not leave them out of fear of their consequences, for the Jews during the time of the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, used to say that whoever killed a household spirit would suffer such-and-such misfortune."
Then the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"Whoever refrains from killing them out of fear of their consequences is not from me. Rather, leave them alone because they do not intend to harm you."
Imam (as) also said: "I sometimes killed them in their houses."

chapter: Chapter on Hunting and Slaughtering
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4235 - Musa ibn Bakr al-Wasiti narrated from Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) that he said:
"Meat nourishes the flesh, and fish melts the body. Gourd increases intelligence, and eating eggs frequently increases offspring. No sick person has sought healing with anything better than honey. And whoever consumes a morsel of fat expels an equal amount of illness from his body."
arabicText: 4235 - وَ رَوَى مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ اَلْوَاسِطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ : "اَللَّحْمُ يُنْبِتُ اَللَّحْمَ وَ اَلسَّمَكُ يُذِيبُ اَلْجَسَدَ وَ اَلدُّبَّاءُ يَزِيدُ فِي اَلدِّمَاغِ وَ كَثْرَةُ أَكْلِ اَلْبَيْضِ يَزِيدُ فِي اَلْوَلَدِ وَ مَا اِسْتَشْفَى مَرِيضٌ بِمِثْلِ اَلْعَسَلِ وَ مَنْ أَدْخَلَ جَوْفَهُ لُقْمَةَ شَحْمٍ أَخْرَجَتْ مِثْلَهَا مِنَ اَلدَّاءِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4235 - Musa ibn Bakr al-Wasiti narrated from Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Meat nourishes the flesh, and fish melts the body. Gourd increases intelligence, and eating eggs frequently increases offspring. No sick person has sought healing with anything better than honey. And whoever consumes a morsel of fat expels an equal amount of illness from his body."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4236 - Sama'ah narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"It is not proper to drink from vessels made of silver and gold."
arabicText: 4236 - رَوَى سَمَاعَةُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ يَنْبَغِي اَلشُّرْبُ فِي آنِيَةِ اَلْفِضَّةِ وَ اَلذَّهَبِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4236 - Sama'ah narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not proper to drink from vessels made of silver and gold."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4237 - Aban narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said: "Do not eat from vessels made of gold or silver."
arabicText: 4237 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ تَأْكُلْ فِي آنِيَةِ ذَهَبٍ وَ لاَ فِضَّةٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4237 - Aban narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not eat from vessels made of gold or silver."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4238 - Thalabah narrated from Burayd al-Ijli, from Abu Abdullah (as):
"Imam (as) disliked drinking from silver vessels and from cups plated with silver.
Imam (as) also disliked applying oil from a silver-plated container and using a comb that is silver-plated.
However, if one has no choice but to drink from a silver-plated cup, he should turn his mouth away from the part that is plated with silver."
arabicText:
4238 - وَ رَوَى ثَعْلَبَةُ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ اَلْعِجْلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
"أَنَّهُ كَرِهَ اَلشُّرْبَ فِي اَلْفِضَّةِ وَ فِي اَلْقَدَحِ اَلْمُفَضَّضِ وَ كَرِهَ أَنْ يُدَّهَنَ مِنْ مُدْهُنٍ مُفَضَّضٍ وَ اَلْمُشْطُ كَذَلِكَ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ بُدّاً مِنَ اَلشُّرْبِ فِي اَلْقَدَحِ اَلْمُفَضَّضِ عَدَلَ بِفَمِهِ عَنْ مَوْضِعِ اَلْفِضَّةِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4238 - Thalabah narrated from Burayd al-Ijli, from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"Imam (as) disliked drinking from silver vessels and from cups plated with silver.
Imam (as) also disliked applying oil from a silver-plated container and using a comb that is silver-plated.
However, if one has no choice but to drink from a silver-plated cup, he should turn his mouth away from the part that is plated with silver."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4239 - The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"Vessels of gold and silver are the possessions of those who do not have certainty (in faith)."
arabicText: 4239 - وَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "آنِيَةُ اَلذَّهَبِ وَ اَلْفِضَّةِ مَتَاعُ "اَلَّذِينَ لاٰ يُوقِنُونَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4239 - The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Vessels of gold and silver are the possessions of those who do not have certainty (in faith)."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4240 - Yunus bin Yaqub narrated from his brother Yusuf:
Abu Abdullah (as), once asked for water, and a vessel made of brass containing water was brought to him.
One of those sitting with him said: "'Abbad al-Basri dislikes drinking from brass vessels."
Imam (as) said: "Then ask him, is it gold or silver?"
arabicText: 4240 - وَ رَوَى يُونُسُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ يُوسُفَ أَخِيهِ : أَنَّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اِسْتَسْقَى مَاءً فَأُتِيَ بِقَدَحٍ مِنْ صُفْرٍ فِيهِ مَاءٌ فَقَالَ لَهُ بَعْضُ جُلَسَائِهِ إِنَّ عَبَّادَ اَلْبَصْرِيَّ يَكْرَهُ اَلشُّرْبَ فِي اَلصُّفْرِ قَالَ "فَسَلْهُ أَ ذَهَبٌ هُوَ أَمْ فِضَّةٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4240 - Yunus bin Yaqub narrated from his brother Yusuf:
thaqalaynMatn:
Abu Abdullah (as), once asked for water, and a vessel made of brass containing water was brought to him.
One of those sitting with him said: "'Abbad al-Basri dislikes drinking from brass vessels."
Imam (as) said: "Then ask him, is it gold or silver?"

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4241 - It is narrated from Jarrah Al-Mada'ini:
Abu Abdullah (as), disliked that a man should eat with his left hand, drink with it, or take anything with it.
arabicText: 4241 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ جَرَّاحٍ اَلْمَدَائِنِيِّ قَالَ : كَرِهَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ اَلرَّجُلُ بِشِمَالِهِ أَوْ يَشْرَبَ بِهَا أَوْ يَتَنَاوَلَ بِهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4241 - It is narrated from Jarrah Al-Mada'ini:
thaqalaynMatn: Abu Abdullah (as), disliked that a man should eat with his left hand, drink with it, or take anything with it.

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4242 - It is narrated by Abdullah bin Maymoon, from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
The companions of the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, were drinking water in large gulps at Tabuk.
So the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"Drink with your hands, for they are among the best of your vessels."
arabicText: 4242 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "كَانَ أَصْحَابُ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِتَبُوكَ يَعُبُّونَ اَلْمَاءَ فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "اِشْرَبُوا فِي أَيْدِيكُمْ فَإِنَّهَا مِنْ خَيْرِ آنِيَتِكُمْ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4242 - It is narrated by Abdullah bin Maymoon, from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
The companions of the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, were drinking water in large gulps at Tabuk.
So the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"Drink with your hands, for they are among the best of your vessels."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4243 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"Drinking water while standing during the day increases perspiration and strengthens the body."
arabicText: 4243 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "شُرْبُ اَلْمَاءِ مِنْ قِيَامٍ بِالنَّهَارِ أَدَرُّ لِلْعِرْقِ وَ أَقْوَى لِلْبَدَنِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4243 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Drinking water while standing during the day increases perspiration and strengthens the body."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4244 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"Drinking water while standing at night causes yellow water (jaundice)."
arabicText: 4244 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "شُرْبُ اَلْمَاءِ بِاللَّيْلِ مِنْ قِيَامٍ يُورِثُ اَلْمَاءَ اَلْأَصْفَرَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4244 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Drinking water while standing at night causes yellow water (jaundice)."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4245 - One of his companions asked him about drinking water in a single breath.
Imam (as) said: "If the person handing you the water is your servant, then drink it in three breaths; but if he is free, then drink it in a single breath."
arabicText: 4245 - و سَأَلَهُ بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِهِ : عَنِ اَلشُّرْبِ بِنَفَسٍ وَاحِدٍ فَقَالَ "إِذَا كَانَ اَلَّذِي يُنَاوِلُكَ اَلْمَاءَ مَمْلُوكاً لَكَ فَاشْرَبْ فِي ثَلاَثَةِ أَنْفَاسٍ وَ إِنْ كَانَ حُرّاً فَاشْرَبْهُ بِنَفَسٍ وَاحِدٍ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4245 - One of his companions asked him about drinking water in a single breath.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the person handing you the water is your servant, then drink it in three breaths; but if he is free, then drink it in a single breath."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4246 - In a narration by Hammad from Al-Halabi, Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said: "Drinking in three breaths is better than drinking in one breath."
Imam (as) disliked that a person should resemble 'Al-Heem.'
I asked: "What is Al-Heem?"
Imam (as) replied: "It refers to camels."
In another narration, it states: "Al-Heem refers to thirsty camels."
And it is also narrated: "Al-Heem refers to those upon whom the name of Allah (swt) has not been mentioned."
arabicText:
4246 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "ثَلاَثَةُ أَنْفَاسٍ فِي اَلشُّرْبِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ شُرْبٍ بِنَفَسٍ وَاحِدٍ" وَ كَانَ يَكْرَهُ أَنْ يُشَبَّهَ بِالْهِيمِ قُلْتُ وَ مَا اَلْهِيمُ قَالَ "اَلزِّمْلُ". وَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ: اَلْإِبِلُ.
وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ اَلْهِيمَ اَلنِّيبُ". وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ اَلْهِيمَ مَا "لَمْ يُذْكَرِ اِسْمُ اَللّٰهِ عَلَيْهِ" "
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4246 - In a narration by Hammad from Al-Halabi, Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Drinking in three breaths is better than drinking in one breath."
Imam (as) disliked that a person should resemble 'Al-Heem.'
I asked: "What is Al-Heem?"
Imam (as) replied: "It refers to camels."
In another narration, it states: "Al-Heem refers to thirsty camels."
And it is also narrated: "Al-Heem refers to those upon whom the name of Allah (swt) has not been mentioned."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4247 - Abdullah ibn Al-Mughirah narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan, who reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), that he said:
"Do not eat while you are walking unless you are compelled to do so."
arabicText: 4247 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ اَلْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ تَأْكُلْ وَ أَنْتَ تَمْشِي إِلاَّ أَنْ تُضْطَرَّ إِلَى ذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4247 - Abdullah ibn Al-Mughirah narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan, who reported from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not eat while you are walking unless you are compelled to do so."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4248 - It is narrated from Umar ibn Abi Shu'bah who said:
"I saw Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) eating while reclining.
Then Imam (as) mentioned the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and said: 'He never ate while reclining until he passed away.' "
arabicText: 4248 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ أَبِي شُعْبَةَ قَالَ : رَأَيْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَأْكُلُ مُتَّكِئاً ثُمَّ ذَكَرَ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَقَالَ "مَا أَكَلَ مُتَّكِئاً حَتَّى مَاتَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4248 - It is narrated from Umar ibn Abi Shu'bah who said:
"I saw Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) eating while reclining.
Then Imam (as) mentioned the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and said:
thaqalaynMatn: 'He never ate while reclining until he passed away.' "

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4249 - It is narrated from Hammad ibn Uthman, from Umar ibn Abi Shu'bah, from Abi Shu'bah:
"He saw Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), eating while sitting cross-legged."
arabicText: 4249 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ أَبِي شُعْبَةَ عَنْ أَبِي شُعْبَةَ : أَنَّهُ رَأَى أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَأْكُلُ مُتَرَبِّعاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4249 - It is narrated from Hammad ibn Uthman, from Umar ibn Abi Shu'bah, from Abi Shu'bah:
thaqalaynMatn: "He saw Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), eating while sitting cross-legged."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4250 - It is narrated by Isma'il ibn Abi Ziyad, from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"When the table (for food) is set, four angels surround it.
If the servant says 'In the name of Allah (swt),' the angels say to Satan, 'Be gone, O wicked one, for you have no authority over them.'
But if they finish eating and say 'Praise be to Allah (swt),' the angels say, 'They are a people whom Allah (swt) has blessed, and they have expressed gratitude to their Lord (azj).'
However, if they do not say 'In the name of Allah (swt),' the angels say to Satan, 'Come closer, O wicked one, and eat with them.'
And if they do not praise Allah (swt) when they finish, the angels say, 'They are a people whom Allah (swt) has blessed, but they forgot their Lord (azj).'"
arabicText: 4250 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ أَبِي زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ : "إِذَا وُضِعَتِ اَلْمَائِدَةُ حَفَّهَا أَرْبَعَةُ أَمْلاَكٍ فَإِذَا قَالَ اَلْعَبْدُ بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ لِلشَّيْطَانِ اِخْزَ يَا فَاسِقُ فَلاَ سُلْطَانَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ فَإِذَا فَرَغُوا فَقَالُوا اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ هُمْ قَوْمٌ أَنْعَمَ اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ فَأَدَّوْا شُكْرَ رَبِّهِمْ فَإِذَا لَمْ يَقُولُوا بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ لِلشَّيْطَانِ اُدْنُ يَا فَاسِقُ فَكُلْ مَعَهُمْ فَإِذَا رُفِعَتْ فَلَمْ يَحْمَدُوا اَللَّهَ قَالَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ هُمْ قَوْمٌ أَنْعَمَ اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ فَنَسُوا رَبَّهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4250 - It is narrated by Isma'il ibn Abi Ziyad, from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) that the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When the table (for food) is set, four angels surround it.
If the servant says 'In the name of Allah (swt),' the angels say to Satan, 'Be gone, O wicked one, for you have no authority over them.'
But if they finish eating and say 'Praise be to Allah (swt),' the angels say, 'They are a people whom Allah (swt) has blessed, and they have expressed gratitude to their Lord (azj).'
However, if they do not say 'In the name of Allah (swt),' the angels say to Satan, 'Come closer, O wicked one, and eat with them.'
And if they do not praise Allah (swt) when they finish, the angels say, 'They are a people whom Allah (swt) has blessed, but they forgot their Lord (azj).'"

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4251 - The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"The owner of the provision will drink first among the people and performs ablution last among them."
arabicText: 4251 - وَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "صَاحِبُ اَلرَّحْلِ يَشْرَبُ أَوَّلَ اَلْقَوْمِ وَ يَتَوَضَّأُ آخِرَهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4251 - The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The owner of the provision will drink first among the people and performs ablution last among them."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4252 - Sama'ah bin Mehran narrated:
I was eating with Abu Abdullah (as), and Imam (as) said:
"O Sama'ah, eat with gratitude and praise, not with eating and silence."
arabicText: 4252 - وَ رَوَى سَمَاعَةُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ قَالَ : كُنْتُ آكُلُ مَعَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ "يَا سَمَاعَةُ أَكْلاً وَ حَمْداً لاَ أَكْلاً وَ صَمْتاً".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4252 - Sama'ah bin Mehran narrated:
I was eating with Abu Abdullah (as), and Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O Sama'ah, eat with gratitude and praise, not with eating and silence."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4253 - Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, said:
"I guarantee that whoever mentions the name of Allah (swt) upon his food will not suffer any harm from it."
Then Ibn al-Kawwa' said:
"O Commander of the Faithful, I ate food last night, mentioned the name of Allah (swt) upon it, and yet it caused me discomfort."
Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, replied:
"You ate different types of food, but you mentioned the name of Allah (swt) on some and did not mention it on others, O foolish one!"
It is also narrated: "Whoever forgets to mention the name of Allah (swt) on each type of food should say: 'In the name of Allah (swt), on its beginning and its end.'"
arabicText:
4253 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "ضَمِنْتُ لِمَنْ سَمَّى عَلَى طَعَامِهِ أَنْ لاَ يَشْتَكِيَ مِنْهُ" فَقَالَ اِبْنُ اَلْكَوَّاءِ يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ لَقَدْ أَكَلْتُ اَلْبَارِحَةَ طَعَاماً فَسَمَّيْتُ عَلَيْهِ ثُمَّ آذَانِي فَقَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَكَلْتَ أَلْوَاناً فَسَمَّيْتَ عَلَى بَعْضِهَا وَ لَمْ تُسَمِّ عَلَى بَعْضٍ يَا لُكَعُ".
وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ مَنْ نَسِيَ أَنْ يُسَمِّيَ عَلَى كُلِّ لَوْنٍ فَلْيَقُلْ بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ عَلَى أَوَّلِهِ وَ آخِرِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4253 - Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I guarantee that whoever mentions the name of Allah (swt) upon his food will not suffer any harm from it."
Then Ibn al-Kawwa' said:
"O Commander of the Faithful, I ate food last night, mentioned the name of Allah (swt) upon it, and yet it caused me discomfort."
Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, replied:
"You ate different types of food, but you mentioned the name of Allah (swt) on some and did not mention it on others, O foolish one!"
It is also narrated: "Whoever forgets to mention the name of Allah (swt) on each type of food should say: 'In the name of Allah (swt), on its beginning and its end.'"

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4254 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"I have never suffered from indigestion, and that is because I never began eating any food without saying: 'In the name of Allah (swt),' and I never finished eating without saying: 'All praise is due to Allah (swt).'"
arabicText: 4254 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَا اِتَّخَمْتُ قَطُّ وَ ذَلِكَ أَنِّي لَمْ أَبْدَأْ بِطَعَامٍ إِلاَّ قُلْتُ: بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ وَ لَمْ أَفْرُغْ مِنْ طَعَامٍ إِلاَّ قُلْتُ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4254 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I have never suffered from indigestion, and that is because I never began eating any food without saying: 'In the name of Allah (swt),' and I never finished eating without saying: 'All praise is due to Allah (swt).'"

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4255 - Imam (as) said: "Indeed, when the stomach is full, it becomes rebellious."
arabicText: 4255 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَلْبَطْنَ إِذَا شَبِعَ طَغَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4255 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, when the stomach is full, it becomes rebellious."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4256 - Amr ibn Qays al-Masir narrated:
I entered upon Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), in Medina, and there was a dining table before him, and Imam (as) was eating.
I said to Imam (as): "What is the proper etiquette for this table?"
Imam (as) replied: "When you place it, mention the name of Allah (swt), and when you remove it, praise Allah (swt). Clean up what is around the table, for this is its etiquette."
He said: Then I turned, and there was a jug placed there. So I said to Imam (as), "What is the proper etiquette for the jug?"
Imam (as) replied: "Drink from the side of its lip, and mention the name of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic. When you lift it from your mouth, praise Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic. Avoid drinking from the spot near the handle, for that is the seat of Satan. This is its etiquette."
arabicText: 4256 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ قَيْسٍ اَلْمَاصِرِ قَالَ : دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِالْمَدِينَةِ وَ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ خِوَانٌ وَ هُوَ يَأْكُلُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ مَا حَدُّ هَذَا اَلْخِوَانِ فَقَالَ "إِذَا وَضَعْتَهُ فَسَمِّ اَللَّهَ وَ إِذَا رَفَعْتَهُ فَاحْمَدِ اَللَّهَ وَ قُمَّ مَا حَوْلَ اَلْخِوَانِ فَإِنَّ هَذَا حَدُّهُ" قَالَ فَالْتَفَتُّ فَإِذَا كُوزٌ مَوْضُوعٌ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ مَا حَدُّ اَلْكُوزِ فَقَالَ "اِشْرَبْ مِمَّا يَلِي شَفَتَيْهِ وَ سَمِّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَإِذَا رَفَعْتَهُ عَنْ فِيكَ فَاحْمَدِ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ إِيَّاكَ وَ مَوْضِعَ اَلْعُرْوَةِ أَنْ تَشْرَبَ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّهَا مَقْعَدُ اَلشَّيْطَانِ فَهَذَا حَدُّهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4256 - Amr ibn Qays al-Masir narrated:
thaqalaynMatn:
I entered upon Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), in Medina, and there was a dining table before him, and Imam (as) was eating.
I said to Imam (as): "What is the proper etiquette for this table?"
Imam (as) replied: "When you place it, mention the name of Allah (swt), and when you remove it, praise Allah (swt). Clean up what is around the table, for this is its etiquette."
He said: Then I turned, and there was a jug placed there. So I said to Imam (as), "What is the proper etiquette for the jug?"
Imam (as) replied: "Drink from the side of its lip, and mention the name of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic. When you lift it from your mouth, praise Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic. Avoid drinking from the spot near the handle, for that is the seat of Satan. This is its etiquette."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4257 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Walid al-Kirmani:
I ate in the presence of Abu Ja'far al-Thani Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Jawad (as).
When I finished and the dining mat was lifted, a servant went to collect the crumbs of food that had fallen.
Imam (as) said to him: "Whatever is in the open area, leave it even if it is the leg of a sheep, and whatever is inside the house, collect it and pick it up."
arabicText: 4257 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ اَلْوَلِيدِ اَلْكِرْمَانِيِّ قَالَ : أَكَلْتُ بَيْنَ يَدَيْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلثَّانِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ حَتَّى إِذَا فَرَغْتُ وَ رُفِعَ اَلْخِوَانُ ذَهَبَ اَلْغُلاَمُ يَرْفَعُ مَا وَقَعَ مِنْ فُتَاتِ اَلطَّعَامِ فَقَالَ لَهُ "مَا كَانَ فِي اَلصَّحْرَاءِ فَدَعْهُ وَ لَوْ فَخِذَ شَاةٍ وَ مَا كَانَ فِي اَلْبَيْتِ فَتَتَبَّعْهُ وَ اُلْقُطْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4257 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Walid al-Kirmani:
I ate in the presence of Abu Ja'far al-Thani Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Jawad (as).
thaqalaynMatn:
When I finished and the dining mat was lifted, a servant went to collect the crumbs of food that had fallen.
Imam (as) said to him: "Whatever is in the open area, leave it even if it is the leg of a sheep, and whatever is inside the house, collect it and pick it up."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4258 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"Indeed, the Banu Umayyah begin their meals with vinegar and end them with salt. Whereas we begin our meals with salt and end them with vinegar."
arabicText: 4258 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ بَنِي أُمَيَّةَ يَبْدَءُونَ بِالْخَلِّ فِي أَوَّلِ اَلطَّعَامِ وَ يَخْتِمُونَ بِالْمِلْحِ وَ إِنَّا نَبْدَأُ بِالْمِلْحِ فِي أَوَّلِ اَلطَّعَامِ وَ نَخْتِمُ بِالْخَلِّ".

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4259 - Commander of the Faithful (as) said: "Begin with salt at the start of the meal, for if people knew what is in salt, they would prefer it over the tried remedy."
arabicText: 4259 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اِبْدَءُوا بِالْمِلْحِ فِي أَوَّلِ اَلطَّعَامِ فَلَوْ عَلِمَ اَلنَّاسُ مَا فِي اَلْمِلْحِ لاَخْتَارُوهُ عَلَى اَلتِّرْيَاقِ اَلْمُجَرَّبِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4259 - Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Begin with salt at the start of the meal, for if people knew what is in salt, they would prefer it over the tried remedy."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4260 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Wahb ibn Abd Rabbih who said: I saw Abu Abdillah (as) using a toothpick, so I looked at him.
Imam (as) said: "Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) used a toothpick, and it purifies the mouth."
arabicText: 4260 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ وَهْبِ بْنِ عَبْدِ رَبِّهِ قَالَ : رَأَيْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَتَخَلَّلُ فَنَظَرْتُ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ "إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ كَانَ يَتَخَلَّلُ وَ هُوَ يُطَيِّبُ اَلْفَمَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4260 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Wahb ibn Abd Rabbih who said: I saw Abu Abdillah (as) using a toothpick, so I looked at him.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) used a toothpick, and it purifies the mouth."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4261 - And in another narration: "Indeed, it is from the rights of the guest that a toothpick is prepared for him."
arabicText: 4261 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : "إِنَّ مِنْ حَقِّ اَلضَّيْفِ أَنْ يُعَدَّ لَهُ اَلْخِلاَلُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4261 - And in another narration:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, it is from the rights of the guest that a toothpick is prepared for him."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4262 - Imam (as) said: "Whatever you roll around with your tongue and remove, swallow it, and whatever you remove with a toothpick, discard it."
arabicText: 4262 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَا أَدَرْتَ عَلَيْهِ لِسَانَكَ فَأَخْرَجْتَهُ فَابْلَعْهُ وَ مَا أَخْرَجْتَهُ بِالْخِلاَلِ فَارْمِ بِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4262 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whatever you roll around with your tongue and remove, swallow it, and whatever you remove with a toothpick, discard it."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4263 - Safwan al-Jammal narrated from Abi Ghurrah al-Khurasani who said that Abu Abdillah (as) said: "Performing ablution before and after eating removes poverty."
arabicText: 4263 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ اَلْجَمَّالُ عَنْ أَبِي غُرَّةَ اَلْخُرَاسَانِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْوُضُوءُ قَبْلَ اَلطَّعَامِ وَ بَعْدَهُ يَذْهَبَانِ بِالْفَقْرِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4263 - Safwan al-Jammal narrated from Abi Ghurrah al-Khurasani who said that Abu Abdillah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Performing ablution before and after eating removes poverty."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4264 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Whoever desires that the blessings of his house increase, let him perform ablution when food is brought."
arabicText: 4264 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَنْ سَرَّهُ أَنْ يَكْثُرَ خَيْرُ بَيْتِهِ فَلْيَتَوَضَّأْ عِنْدَ حُضُورِ طَعَامِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4264 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever desires that the blessings of his house increase, let him perform ablution when food is brought."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4265 - Imam (as) said: "Whoever washes his hands before and after eating will live in ease and will be protected from afflictions in his body."
arabicText: 4265 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ غَسَلَ يَدَهُ قَبْلَ اَلطَّعَامِ وَ بَعْدَهُ عَاشَ فِي سَعَةٍ وَ عُوفِيَ مِنْ بَلْوَى فِي جَسَدِهِ".

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4266 - It is narrated from Abu Hamzah al-Thumali, from Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as), that whenever he ate, Imam (as) would say:
"All praise is due to Allah (swt), Who fed us, gave us drink, sufficed us, supported us, sheltered us, blessed us, and bestowed His favor upon us. All praise is due to Allah (swt), Who feeds and is not fed."
arabicText: 4266 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ اَلثُّمَالِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ كَانَ إِذَا طَعِمَ قَالَ -: " اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ اَلَّذِي أَطْعَمَنَا وَ سَقَانَا وَ كَفَانَا وَ أَيَّدَنَا وَ آوَانَا وَ أَنْعَمَ عَلَيْنَا وَ أَفْضَلَ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ اَلَّذِي "يُطْعِمُ وَ لاٰ يُطْعَمُ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4266 - It is narrated from Abu Hamzah al-Thumali, from Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as), that whenever he ate, Imam (as) would say:
thaqalaynMatn: "All praise is due to Allah (swt), Who fed us, gave us drink, sufficed us, supported us, sheltered us, blessed us, and bestowed His favor upon us. All praise is due to Allah (swt), Who feeds and is not fed."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4267 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "What an excellent condiment vinegar is! A house that has vinegar will never be destitute."
arabicText: 4267 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "نِعْمَ اَلْإِدَامُ اَلْخَلُّ مَا أَقْفَرَ بَيْتٌ فِيهِ خَلٌّ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4267 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "What an excellent condiment vinegar is! A house that has vinegar will never be destitute."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4268 - Shu'ayb narrated from Abu Basir who said: Abu Abdillah (as) was asked about garlic, onions, and leeks.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in eating them raw or cooked in pots, and there is no harm in using garlic as a remedy. However, if one does so, let him not go to the mosque."
arabicText: 4268 - وَ رَوَى شُعَيْبٌ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلثُّومِ وَ اَلْبَصَلِ وَ اَلْكُرَّاثِ فَقَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَكْلِهِ نِيّاً وَ فِي اَلْقُدُورِ وَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يُتَدَاوَى بِالثُّومِ وَ لَكِنْ إِذَا كَانَ ذَلِكَ فَلاَ يَخْرُجْ إِلَى اَلْمَسْجِدِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4268 - Shu'ayb narrated from Abu Basir who said: Abu Abdillah (as) was asked about garlic, onions, and leeks.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in eating them raw or cooked in pots, and there is no harm in using garlic as a remedy. However, if one does so, let him not go to the mosque."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4269 - Umar ibn Udhaynah narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said: I asked him about garlic.
Imam (as) said:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) only forbade it because of its smell.
Prophet (sw) said: 'Whoever eats this foul plant should not come near our mosque.' However, as for one who eats it and does not go to the mosque, there is no harm."
arabicText: 4269 - وَ رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلثُّومِ فَقَالَ "إِنَّمَا نَهَى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَنْهُ لِرِيحِهِ وَ قَالَ "مَنْ أَكَلَ هَذِهِ اَلْبَقْلَةَ اَلْخَبِيثَةَ فَلاَ يَقْرَبْ مَسْجِدَنَا فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَكَلَهُ وَ لَمْ يَأْتِ اَلْمَسْجِدَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4269 - Umar ibn Udhaynah narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said: I asked him about garlic.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) only forbade it because of its smell.
Prophet (sw) said: 'Whoever eats this foul plant should not come near our mosque.' However, as for one who eats it and does not go to the mosque, there is no harm."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4270 - Ibrahim al-Karkhi narrated from Abu Abdillah (as), from his fathers (peace be upon them), who said: Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as) said:
"There are twelve qualities related to the dining table that every Muslim must know, four of them are obligatory, four are recommended practices (Sunnah), and four are etiquettes:
As for the obligatory ones, they are: recognition (of Allah (swt)), contentment, mentioning the name of Allah (swt) (Bismillah), and gratitude.
As for the recommended practices, they are: performing ablution before eating, sitting on the left side, eating with three fingers, and licking the fingers.
As for the etiquettes, they are: eating from what is directly in front of you, taking small bites, chewing well, and avoiding looking at people's faces."
arabicText:
4270 - وَ رَوَى إِبْرَاهِيمُ اَلْكَرْخِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
"فِي اَلْمَائِدَةِ اِثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ خَصْلَةً يَجِبُ عَلَى كُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ أَنْ يَعْرِفَهَا أَرْبَعٌ مِنْهَا فَرْضٌ وَ أَرْبَعٌ سُنَّةٌ وَ أَرْبَعٌ تَأْدِيبٌ فَأَمَّا اَلْفَرْضُ فَالْمَعْرِفَةُ وَ اَلرِّضَا وَ اَلتَّسْمِيَةُ وَ اَلشُّكْرُ وَ أَمَّا اَلسُّنَّةُ فَالْوُضُوءُ قَبْلَ اَلطَّعَامِ وَ اَلْجُلُوسُ عَلَى اَلْجَانِبِ اَلْأَيْسَرِ وَ اَلْأَكْلُ بِثَلاَثِ أَصَابِعَ وَ لَعْقُ اَلْأَصَابِعِ وَ أَمَّا اَلتَّأْدِيبُ فَالْأَكْلُ مِمَّا يَلِيكَ وَ تَصْغِيرُ اَللُّقْمَةِ وَ تَجْوِيدُ اَلْمَضْغِ وَ قِلَّةُ اَلنَّظَرِ فِي وُجُوهِ اَلنَّاسِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4270 - Ibrahim al-Karkhi narrated from Abu Abdillah (as), from his fathers (peace be upon them), who said: Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There are twelve qualities related to the dining table that every Muslim must know, four of them are obligatory, four are recommended practices (Sunnah), and four are etiquettes:
As for the obligatory ones, they are: recognition (of Allah (swt)), contentment, mentioning the name of Allah (swt) (Bismillah), and gratitude.
As for the recommended practices, they are: performing ablution before eating, sitting on the left side, eating with three fingers, and licking the fingers.
As for the etiquettes, they are: eating from what is directly in front of you, taking small bites, chewing well, and avoiding looking at people's faces."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4271 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"It is appropriate for an elderly person not to sleep unless his stomach is full of food, for it makes his sleep more restful and his breath more pleasant."
arabicText: 4271 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "يَنْبَغِي لِلشَّيْخِ اَلْكَبِيرِ أَلاَّ يَنَامَ إِلاَّ وَ جَوْفُهُ مُمْتَلِئٌ مِنَ اَلطَّعَامِ فَإِنَّهُ أَهْدَأُ لِنَوْمِهِ وَ أَطْيَبُ لِنَكْهَتِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4271 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is appropriate for an elderly person not to sleep unless his stomach is full of food, for it makes his sleep more restful and his breath more pleasant."

chapter: Chapter on Eating and Drinking From Gold and Silver Utensils and Other Etiquettes of Eating
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4272 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"I am amazed at the one who abstains from food out of fear of illness, how does he not abstain from sins out of fear of the Fire?"
arabicText: 4272 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يَحْتَمِي مِنَ اَلطَّعَامِ مَخَافَةَ اَلدَّاءِ كَيْفَ لاَ يَحْتَمِي مِنَ اَلذُّنُوبِ مَخَافَةَ اَلنَّارِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4272 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I am amazed at the one who abstains from food out of fear of illness, how does he not abstain from sins out of fear of the Fire?"

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4273 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"There is no breastfeeding after weaning, no continuous fasting without breaking, no orphanhood after reaching puberty, no silence for a day until night, no returning to a Bedouin life after migration, no migration after the conquest (of Mecca), no divorce before marriage, no emancipation before ownership, no oath for a child in the presence of their parent, nor for a slave with their master, nor for a woman with her husband, no vow in disobedience, and no oath in severing family ties."
arabicText:
4273 - رَوَى مَنْصُورُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ :
"لاَ رَضَاعَ بَعْدَ فِطَامٍ وَ لاَ وِصَالَ فِي صِيَامٍ وَ لاَ يُتْمَ بَعْدَ اِحْتِلاَمٍ وَ لاَ صَمْتَ يَوْماً إِلَى اَللَّيْلِ وَ لاَ تَعَرُّبَ بَعْدَ اَلْهِجْرَةِ وَ لاَ هِجْرَةَ بَعْدَ اَلْفَتْحِ وَ لاَ طَلاَقَ قَبْلَ نِكَاحٍ وَ لاَ عِتْقَ قَبْلَ مِلْكٍ وَ لاَ يَمِينَ لِوَلَدٍ مَعَ وَالِدِهِ وَ لاَ لِمَمْلُوكٍ مَعَ مَوْلاَهُ وَ لاَ لِلْمَرْأَةِ مَعَ زَوْجِهَا وَ لاَ نَذْرَ فِي مَعْصِيَةٍ وَ لاَ يَمِينَ فِي قَطِيعَةٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4273 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no breastfeeding after weaning, no continuous fasting without breaking, no orphanhood after reaching puberty, no silence for a day until night, no returning to a Bedouin life after migration, no migration after the conquest (of Mecca), no divorce before marriage, no emancipation before ownership, no oath for a child in the presence of their parent, nor for a slave with their master, nor for a woman with her husband, no vow in disobedience, and no oath in severing family ties."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4274 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from one of the Imams (as), that he was asked about a woman who vowed to donate all her wealth as an offering and to set all her slaves free if she ever spoke to her sister again.
Imam (as) said: "She may speak to her, and this (vow) is of no consequence. Indeed, this and similar actions are among the steps of Satan."
arabicText: 4274 - وَ رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ جَعَلَتْ مَالَهَا هَدْياً وَ كُلَّ مَمْلُوكٍ لَهَا حُرّاً إِنْ كَلَّمَتْ أُخْتَهَا أَبَداً قَالَ "تُكَلِّمُهَا وَ لَيْسَ هَذَا بِشَيْءٍ إِنَّمَا هَذَا وَ شِبْهُهُ مِنْ "خُطُوٰاتِ اَلشَّيْطٰانِ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4274 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from one of the Imams (as), that he was asked about a woman who vowed to donate all her wealth as an offering and to set all her slaves free if she ever spoke to her sister again.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "She may speak to her, and this (vow) is of no consequence. Indeed, this and similar actions are among the steps of Satan."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4275 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever swears an oath and then sees something better than it, let him do that which is better, and he will have an additional good deed."
arabicText: 4275 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ حَلَفَ عَلَى يَمِينٍ فَرَأَى مَا هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنْهَا فَلْيَأْتِ اَلَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنْهَا وَ لَهُ زِيَادَةُ حَسَنَةٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4275 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever swears an oath and then sees something better than it, let him do that which is better, and he will have an additional good deed."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4276 - Hammad ibn Uthman narrated from Muhammad ibn Abi al-Sabbah who said:
I said to Abu al-Hasan (as): "My mother gave me her share in the house as charity. I told her that the judges do not approve of this unless it is written as a sale.
She said: 'Do whatever you see fit and whatever you think is permissible for you.'
So I documented it.
Later, some of the heirs wanted me to swear that I had paid her the price, although I had not given her anything. What do you suggest?"
Imam (as) said, "Swear to them."
arabicText: 4276 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي اَلصَّبَّاحِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ أُمِّي تَصَدَّقَتْ عَلَيَّ بِنَصِيبٍ لَهَا فِي اَلدَّارِ فَقُلْتُ لَهَا إِنَّ اَلْقُضَاةَ لاَ يُجِيزُونَ هَذَا وَ لَكِنِ اُكْتُبِيهِ شِرًى فَقَالَتْ اِصْنَعْ مِنْ ذَلِكَ مَا بَدَا لَكَ وَ كُلَّ مَا تَرَى أَنْ يَسُوغَ لَكَ فَتَوَثَّقْتُ فَأَرَادَ بَعْضُ اَلْوَرَثَةِ أَنْ يَسْتَحْلِفَنِي أَنِّي قَدْ نَقَدْتُهَا اَلثَّمَنَ وَ لَمْ أَنْقُدْهَا شَيْئاً فَمَا تَرَى قَالَ "فَاحْلِفْ لَهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4276 - Hammad ibn Uthman narrated from Muhammad ibn Abi al-Sabbah who said:
I said to Abu al-Hasan (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"My mother gave me her share in the house as charity. I told her that the judges do not approve of this unless it is written as a sale.
She said: 'Do whatever you see fit and whatever you think is permissible for you.'
So I documented it.
Later, some of the heirs wanted me to swear that I had paid her the price, although I had not given her anything. What do you suggest?"
Imam (as) said, "Swear to them."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4277 - Abu Abdillah (as) was asked about a man who swore that if he spoke to his father or mother, he would enter into the state of ihram for Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "It is of no consequence."
arabicText: 4277 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ حَلَفَ إِنْ كَلَّمَ أَبَاهُ أَوْ أُمَّهُ فَهُوَ يُحْرِمُ بِحَجَّةٍ قَالَ "لَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4277 - Abu Abdillah (as) was asked about a man who swore that if he spoke to his father or mother, he would enter into the state of ihram for Hajj.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is of no consequence."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4278 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who, in a state of anger, said:
"Upon me is to walk to the Sacred House of Allah (swt)."
Imam (as) said: "If he did not say, 'It is a vow to Allah (swt) upon me,' then it is of no consequence."
arabicText: 4278 - وَ سُئِلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ غَضِبَ فَقَالَ عَلَيَّ اَلْمَشْيُ إِلَى بَيْتِ اَللَّهِ اَلْحَرَامِ قَالَ "إِذَا لَمْ يَقُلْ لِلَّهِ عَلَيَّ فَلَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4278 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who, in a state of anger, said:
"Upon me is to walk to the Sacred House of Allah (swt)."
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he did not say, 'It is a vow to Allah (swt) upon me,' then it is of no consequence."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4279 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious: "Allah (swt) does not take you to task for what is unintentional in your oaths" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:225).
Imam (as) said: "It refers to sayings like 'No, by Allah (swt)' and 'Yes, by Allah (swt).'"
arabicText: 4279 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: ۝ لاٰ يُؤٰاخِذُكُمُ اَللّٰهُ بِاللَّغْوِ فِي أَيْمٰانِكُمْ ۝ قَالَ "هُوَ لاَ وَ اَللَّهِ وَ بَلَى وَ اَللَّهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4279 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious: "Allah (swt) does not take you to task for what is unintentional in your oaths" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:225).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "It refers to sayings like 'No, by Allah (swt)' and 'Yes, by Allah (swt).'"

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4280 - Muhammad ibn Muslim said: I asked one of the Imams (as) about a man whose wife said to him, "I ask you, for the sake of Allah (swt), to divorce me."
Imam (as) said: "He should either discipline her with a beating or forgive her."
arabicText: 4280 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَحَدَهُمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَتْ لَهُ اِمْرَأَتُهُ أَسْأَلُكَ بِوَجْهِ اَللَّهِ إِلاَّ مَا طَلَّقْتَنِي قَالَ "يُوجِعُهَا ضَرْباً أَوْ يَعْفُو عَنْهَا ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4280 - Muhammad ibn Muslim said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked one of the Imams (as) about a man whose wife said to him, "I ask you, for the sake of Allah (swt), to divorce me."
Imam (as) said: "He should either discipline her with a beating or forgive her."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4281 - Uthman ibn Isa narrated from Abu Ayyub, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
"Do not swear by Allah (swt), whether truthfully or falsely, for Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, has forbidden that, as He (swt), the Almighty, says: 'And do not make Allah (swt) an excuse in your oaths' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:224)."
arabicText: 4281 - وَ رَوَى عُثْمَانُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ تَحْلِفُوا بِاللَّهِ صَادِقِينَ وَ لاَ كَاذِبِينَ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ قَدْ نَهَى عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ۝ وَ لاٰ تَجْعَلُوا اَللّٰهَ عُرْضَةً لِأَيْمٰانِكُمْ ۝.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4281 - Uthman ibn Isa narrated from Abu Ayyub, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not swear by Allah (swt), whether truthfully or falsely, for Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, has forbidden that, as He (swt), the Almighty, says: 'And do not make Allah (swt) an excuse in your oaths' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:224)."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4282 - Abu Ayyub said that Abu Abdillah (as) said: "Whoever swears by Allah (swt), let him speak the truth; and whoever does not speak the truth has nothing to do with Allah (swt) in any way. And whoever is sworn to by Allah (swt), let him be content; and whoever is not content has nothing to do with Allah  (swt) in any way."
arabicText: 4282 - وَ- قَالَ أَبُو أَيُّوبَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَنْ حَلَفَ بِاللَّهِ فَلْيَصْدُقْ وَ مَنْ لَمْ يَصْدُقْ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ اللَّهِ فِي شَيْ‌ءٍ وَ مَنْ حُلِفَ لَهُ بِاللَّهِ فَلْيَرْضَ وَ مَنْ لَمْ يَرْضَ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ اللَّهِ فِي شَيْ‌ءٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4282 - Abu Ayyub said that Abu Abdillah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever swears by Allah (swt), let him speak the truth; and whoever does not speak the truth has nothing to do with Allah (swt) in any way. And whoever is sworn to by Allah (swt), let him be content; and whoever is not content has nothing to do with Allah  (swt) in any way."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4283 - Bakr ibn Muhammad al-Azdi narrated from Abu Basir, from Imam (as), that he said:
"If a man swears that he will not rub his nose against a wall, Allah (swt), the Exalted, will test him until he rubs his nose against the wall. And if a man swears that he will not strike his head against the wall, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, will assign a devil to him until he strikes his head against the wall."
arabicText: 4283 - وَ رَوَى بَكْرُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْأَزْدِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "لَوْ حَلَفَ اَلرَّجُلُ أَنْ لاَ يَحُكَّ أَنْفَهُ بِالْحَائِطِ لاَبْتَلاَهُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى حَتَّى يَحُكَّ أَنْفَهُ بِالْحَائِطِ وَ لَوْ حَلَفَ اَلرَّجُلُ أَنْ لاَ يَنْطَحَ بِرَأْسِهِ اَلْحَائِطَ لَوَكَّلَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِهِ شَيْطَاناً حَتَّى يَنْطَحَ بِرَأْسِهِ اَلْحَائِطَ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4283 - Bakr ibn Muhammad al-Azdi narrated from Abu Basir, from Imam (as), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man swears that he will not rub his nose against a wall, Allah (swt), the Exalted, will test him until he rubs his nose against the wall. And if a man swears that he will not strike his head against the wall, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, will assign a devil to him until he strikes his head against the wall."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4284 - Hammad ibn Isa narrated from Abdullah ibn Maymun, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
"A servant may make an exception (by saying 'If Allah (swt) wills') within forty days if he forgets. The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) was visited by some Jews who asked Him (sw) about certain matters.
He (sw) said to them: 'Come tomorrow, and I will inform you,' but He (sw) did not say 'If Allah (swt) wills.'
So, Archangel Jibril (as) was delayed from coming to Him (sw) for forty days. Then Jibril (as) came and said:
'And do not say about anything: Surely I will do that tomorrow, except (by adding) If Allah (swt) wills. And remember your Lord (azj) when you forget.' (Surah Al-Kahf 18:23-24)"
arabicText: 4284 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لِلْعَبْدِ أَنْ يَسْتَثْنِيَ مَا بَيْنَهُ وَ بَيْنَ أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً إِذَا نَسِيَ إِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أَتَاهُ نَاسٌ مِنَ اَلْيَهُودِ فَسَأَلُوهُ عَنْ أَشْيَاءَ فَقَالَ لَهُمْ "تَعَالَوْا غَداً أُحَدِّثْكُمْ" وَ لَمْ يَسْتَثْنِ فَاحْتَبَسَ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْهُ أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً ثُمَّ أَتَاهُ فَقَالَ ۝ وَ لاٰ تَقُولَنَّ لِشَيْءٍ إِنِّي فٰاعِلٌ ذٰلِكَ غَداً إِلاّٰ أَنْ يَشٰاءَ اَللّٰهُ وَ اُذْكُرْ رَبَّكَ إِذٰا نَسِيتَ ۝ "
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4284 - Hammad ibn Isa narrated from Abdullah ibn Maymun, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"A servant may make an exception (by saying 'If Allah (swt) wills') within forty days if he forgets. The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) was visited by some Jews who asked Him (sw) about certain matters.
He (sw) said to them: 'Come tomorrow, and I will inform you,' but He (sw) did not say 'If Allah (swt) wills.'
So, Archangel Jibril (as) was delayed from coming to Him (sw) for forty days. Then Jibril (as) came and said:
'And do not say about anything: Surely I will do that tomorrow, except (by adding) If Allah (swt) wills. And remember your Lord (azj) when you forget.' (Surah Al-Kahf 18:23-24)"

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4285 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, who said: I asked him about someone who said: "By Allah (swt)," and then did not fulfill it.
Abu Abdillah (as) said: "Its expiation is feeding ten needy people with a measure (mudd) each of flour or wheat, or freeing a slave. If he cannot find any of these, then he must fast for three consecutive days."
arabicText: 4285 - وَ رَوَى اَلْقَاسِمُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْجَوْهَرِيُّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَمَّنْ قَالَ وَ اَللَّهِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَفِ بِهِ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "كَفَّارَتُهُ إِطْعَامُ عَشَرَةِ مَسَاكِينَ مُدّاً مُدّاً دَقِيقٍ أَوْ حِنْطَةٍ أَوْ تَحْرِيرُ رَقَبَةٍ أَوْ صِيَامُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ مُتَوَالِيَةٍ إِذَا لَمْ يَجِدْ شَيْئاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4285 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, who said: I asked him about someone who said: "By Allah (swt)," and then did not fulfill it.
thaqalaynMatn: Abu Abdillah (as) said: "Its expiation is feeding ten needy people with a measure (mudd) each of flour or wheat, or freeing a slave. If he cannot find any of these, then he must fast for three consecutive days."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4286 - Ibn Bukayr narrated from Zurarah, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as): "We pass by tax collectors, and they ask us to swear an oath so that they let us go, and they are not satisfied with anything else."
Imam (as) said: "Then swear to them, for it is more lawful than dates and butter."
arabicText: 4286 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ نَمُرُّ بِالْمَالِ عَلَى اَلْعُشَّارِ فَيَطْلُبُونَ مِنَّا أَنْ نَحْلِفَ لَهُمْ وَ يُخَلُّونَ سَبِيلَنَا وَ لاَ يَرْضَوْنَ مِنَّا إِلاَّ بِذَلِكَ قَالَ "فَاحْلِفْ لَهُمْ فَهُوَ أَحَلُّ مِنَ اَلتَّمْرِ وَ اَلزُّبْدِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4286 - Ibn Bukayr narrated from Zurarah, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as): "We pass by tax collectors, and they ask us to swear an oath so that they let us go, and they are not satisfied with anything else."
Imam (as) said: "Then swear to them, for it is more lawful than dates and butter."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4287 - Abu Abdillah (as) said: "Taqiyyah (dissimulation) is in every situation of necessity, and the one facing it knows best when it arises."
arabicText: 4287 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلتَّقِيَّةُ فِي كُلِّ ضَرُورَةٍ وَ صَاحِبُهَا أَعْلَمُ بِهَا حِينَ تَنْزِلُ بِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4287 - Abu Abdillah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Taqiyyah (dissimulation) is in every situation of necessity, and the one facing it knows best when it arises."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4288 - Hammad narrated from al-Halabi, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
"I believe that one should only swear by Allah (swt).
As for a man's saying, 'No, by your enemy,' this is from the sayings of Jahiliyyah (the pre-Islamic era of ignorance). If people were to swear by this or similar expressions, swearing by Allah (swt) would be abandoned.
As for a man's saying, 'Ya Hanah, Ya Hanah' (O so-and-so), it is merely calling a name, and I see no harm in it.
And as for saying, 'By the life of Allah (swt)' (La 'amr Allah (swt)) and 'By the oath of Allah (swt)' (Aym Allah (swt)), these are indeed swearing by Allah (swt)."
arabicText:
4288 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ :
"أَرَى أَنْ لاَ يُحْلَفَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ وَ أَمَّا قَوْلُ اَلرَّجُلِ لاَ بَلِ شَانِئِكَ فَإِنَّهُ مِنْ قَوْلِ اَلْجَاهِلِيَّةِ وَ لَوْ حَلَفَ اَلنَّاسُ بِهَذَا أَوْ شِبْهِهِ تُرِكَ أَنْ يُحْلَفَ بِاللَّهِ وَ أَمَّا قَوْلُ اَلرَّجُلِ يَا هَنَاهْ يَا هَنَاهْ فَإِنَّمَا ذَلِكَ طَلَبُ اَلاِسْمِ وَ لاَ أَرَى بِهِ بَأْساً وَ أَمَّا لَعَمْرُ اَللَّهِ وَ اَيْمُ اَللَّهِ فَإِنَّمَا هُوَ بِاللَّهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4288 - Hammad narrated from al-Halabi, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I believe that one should only swear by Allah (swt).
As for a man's saying, 'No, by your enemy,' this is from the sayings of Jahiliyyah (the pre-Islamic era of ignorance). If people were to swear by this or similar expressions, swearing by Allah (swt) would be abandoned.
As for a man's saying, 'Ya Hanah, Ya Hanah' (O so-and-so), it is merely calling a name, and I see no harm in it.
And as for saying, 'By the life of Allah (swt)' (La 'amr Allah (swt)) and 'By the oath of Allah (swt)' (Aym Allah (swt)), these are indeed swearing by Allah (swt)."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4289 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who swore an oath out of taqiyyah (dissimulation).
Imam (as) said: "If you fear for your life or property, then swear an oath to protect yourself with it. However, if you see that your oath will not protect you in any way, then do not swear to them."
arabicText: 4289 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ حَلَفَ تَقِيَّةً قَالَ "إِنْ خَشِيتَ عَلَى دَمِكَ وَ مَالِكَ فَاحْلِفْ تَرُدُّهُ عَنْكَ بِيَمِينِكَ فَإِنْ رَأَيْتَ أَنَّ يَمِينَكَ لاَ تَرُدُّ عَنْكَ شَيْئاً فَلاَ تَحْلِفْ لَهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4289 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who swore an oath out of taqiyyah (dissimulation).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If you fear for your life or property, then swear an oath to protect yourself with it. However, if you see that your oath will not protect you in any way, then do not swear to them."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4290 - Al-Halabi said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who makes a vow upon himself without specifying it.
Imam (as) said: "If you specify it, then it is as you specified. But if you do not specify anything, then it is of no consequence. However, if you said: 'It is upon me for the sake of Allah (swt),' then its expiation is the expiation of an oath."
arabicText: 4290 - وَ قَالَ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ : وَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَجْعَلُ عَلَيْهِ نَذْراً وَ لاَ يُسَمِّيهِ قَالَ "إِنْ سَمَّيْتَهُ فَهُوَ مَا سَمَّيْتَ وَ إِنْ لَمْ تُسَمِّ شَيْئاً فَلَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ فَإِنْ قُلْتَ لِلَّهِ عَلَيَّ فَكَفَّارَةُ يَمِينٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4290 - Al-Halabi said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who makes a vow upon himself without specifying it.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If you specify it, then it is as you specified. But if you do not specify anything, then it is of no consequence. However, if you said: 'It is upon me for the sake of Allah (swt),' then its expiation is the expiation of an oath."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4291 - Imam (as) said: "Any oath that is not intended for the sake of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, is of no consequence, whether it pertains to divorce or emancipation."
arabicText: 4291 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "كُلُّ يَمِينٍ لاَ يُرَادُ بِهَا وَجْهُ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَلَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ، فِي طَلاَقٍ أَوْ عِتْقٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4291 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Any oath that is not intended for the sake of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, is of no consequence, whether it pertains to divorce or emancipation."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4292 - Imam (as) said regarding the expiation of an oath: "It is a mudd and a handful."
arabicText: 4292 - وَ قَالَ : "فِي كَفَّارَةِ اَلْيَمِينِ مُدٌّ وَ حَفْنَةٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4292 - Imam (as) said regarding the expiation of an oath:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is a mudd and a handful."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4293 - And regarding a man who swears an oath to the tax collector in order to protect his wealth.
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 4293 - وَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَحْلِفُ لِصَاحِبِ اَلْعُشُورِ يُحْرِزُ بِذَلِكَ مَالَهُ قَالَ "نَعَمْ".

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4294 - I asked him about a woman who vowed to offer her wealth as an offering to the House of Allah (swt) if she lent some of her belongings to so-and-so. Then, some of her family members lent those belongings without her permission.
Imam (as) said: "She is not required to offer the offering. The true offering is what is made as a dedication to Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, as an offering to the Ka'bah. That is what must be fulfilled when it is made for Allah (swt). But matters like this are of no consequence, and an offering that does not mention the name of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, is not valid."
arabicText: 4294 - وَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ جَعَلَتْ مَالَهَا هَدْياً لِبَيْتِ اَللَّهِ إِنْ أَعَارَتْ مَتَاعاً لَهَا فُلاَنَةَ وَ فُلاَنَةَ فَأَعَارَ بَعْضُ أَهْلِهَا بِغَيْرِ أَمْرِهَا قَالَ "لَيْسَ عَلَيْهَا هَدْيٌ إِنَّمَا اَلْهَدْيُ مَا جُعِلَ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ هَدْياً لِلْكَعْبَةِ فَذَلِكَ اَلَّذِي يُوفَى بِهِ إِذَا جُعِلَ لِلَّهِ وَ مَا كَانَ مِنْ أَشْبَاهِ هَذَا فَلَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ وَ لاَ هَدْيَ لاَ يُذْكَرُ فِيهِ اِسْمُ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ".

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4295 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who says, "I am obligated to offer a thousand camels" while he is in the state of ihram for a thousand Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "These are the steps of Satan."
And regarding a man who, while in ihram for Hajj, says, "I will offer this food as a gift,"
Imam (as) said: "It is of no consequence. Food is not offered as a gift."
Or if he says about a camel after it has been slaughtered, "This is an offering to the House of Allah (swt),"
Imam (as) said: "Offerings are made while the animals are alive, and they are not offered after they have become meat."
arabicText: 4295 - وَ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَقُولُ عَلَيَّ أَلْفُ بَدَنَةٍ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ بِأَلْفِ حَجَّةٍ قَالَ "تِلْكَ خُطُوَاتُ اَلشَّيْطَانِ" وَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَقُولُ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ بِحَجَّةٍ أَوْ يَقُولُ أَنَا أُهْدِي هَذَا اَلطَّعَامَ قَالَ "لَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ إِنَّ اَلطَّعَامَ لاَ يُهْدَى أَوْ يَقُولُ لِجَزُورٍ بَعْدَ مَا نُحِرَتْ هُوَ هَدْيٌ لِبَيْتِ اَللَّهِ إِنَّمَا تُهْدَى اَلْبُدْنُ وَ هِيَ أَحْيَاءٌ وَ لَيْسَ تُهْدَى حِينَ صَارَتْ لَحْماً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4295 - Imam (as) was asked about a man who says,
thaqalaynMatn:
"I am obligated to offer a thousand camels" while he is in the state of ihram for a thousand Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "These are the steps of Satan."
And regarding a man who, while in ihram for Hajj, says, "I will offer this food as a gift,"
Imam (as) said: "It is of no consequence. Food is not offered as a gift."
Or if he says about a camel after it has been slaughtered, "This is an offering to the House of Allah (swt),"
Imam (as) said: "Offerings are made while the animals are alive, and they are not offered after they have become meat."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4296 - It is narrated in another tradition about a man who said: "No, by my father."
Imam (as) said: "He should seek forgiveness from Allah (swt)."
arabicText: 4296 - وَ رُوِيَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ : فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لاَ وَ أَبِي قَالَ "يَسْتَغْفِرُ اَللَّهَ".

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4297 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"An oath is of two types. One type is when a man swears upon something that he is not obligated to do, yet he swears that he will do it.
The other type is when he swears upon something that he is obligated to do; in this case, if he does not fulfill it, he must offer expiation.
The second type has three categories. One of them is an oath for which a man will be rewarded if he swears falsely, another for which there is neither expiation nor reward, and the third for which there is no expiation but the punishment is entering the Fire.
As for the oath for which a man will be rewarded if he swears falsely and for which no expiation is required, it is when a person swears to protect the life of a Muslim or his property from an oppressor or a thief or anyone who intends harm.
As for the oath for which there is neither expiation nor reward, it is when a person swears upon something but later finds an option that is better than his oath, so he leaves the oath and chooses what is better.
And as for the oath whose punishment is entering the Fire, it is when a man swears falsely to take the wealth or rights of another Muslim unjustly. This is a 'Ghamus' oath, which necessitates the Fire, and there is no expiation for it in this world."
arabicText: 4297 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْيَمِينُ عَلَى وَجْهَيْنِ أَحَدُهُمَا أَنْ يَحْلِفَ اَلرَّجُلُ عَلَى شَيْءٍ لاَ يَلْزَمُهُ أَنْ يَفْعَلَ فَيَحْلِفُ أَنَّهُ يَفْعَلُ ذَلِكَ اَلشَّيْءَ أَوْ يَحْلِفَ عَلَى مَا يَلْزَمُهُ أَنْ يَفْعَلَ فَعَلَيْهِ اَلْكَفَّارَةُ إِذَا لَمْ يَفْعَلْهُ وَ اَلْأُخْرَى عَلَى ثَلاَثَةِ أَوْجُهٍ فَمِنْهَا مَا يُؤْجَرُ اَلرَّجُلُ عَلَيْهِ إِذَا حَلَفَ كَاذِباً وَ مِنْهَا مَا لاَ كَفَّارَةَ عَلَيْهِ وَ لاَ أَجْرَ لَهُ وَ مِنْهَا مَا لاَ كَفَّارَةَ عَلَيْهِ فِيهَا وَ اَلْعُقُوبَةُ فِيهَا دُخُولُ اَلنَّارِ فَأَمَّا اَلَّتِي يُؤْجَرُ عَلَيْهَا اَلرَّجُلُ إِذَا حَلَفَ كَاذِباً وَ لاَ تَلْزَمُهُ اَلْكَفَّارَةُ فَهُوَ أَنْ يَحْلِفَ اَلرَّجُلُ فِي خَلاَصِ اِمْرِئٍ مُسْلِمٍ أَوْ خَلاَصِ مَالِهِ مِنْ مُتَعَدٍّ يَتَعَدَّى عَلَيْهِ مِنْ لِصٍّ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ وَ أَمَّا اَلَّتِي لاَ كَفَّارَةَ عَلَيْهِ فِيهَا وَ لاَ أَجْرَ لَهُ فَهُوَ أَنْ يَحْلِفَ اَلرَّجُلُ عَلَى شَيْءٍ ثُمَّ يَجِدُ مَا هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنَ اَلْيَمِينِ فَيَتْرُكُ اَلْيَمِينَ وَ يَرْجِعُ إِلَى اَلَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ وَ أَمَّا اَلَّتِي عُقُوبَتُهَا دُخُولُ اَلنَّارِ فَهُوَ أَنْ يَحْلِفَ اَلرَّجُلُ عَلَى مَالِ اِمْرِئٍ مُسْلِمٍ أَوْ عَلَى حَقِّهِ ظُلْماً فَهَذِهِ يَمِينٌ غَمُوسٌ تُوجِبُ اَلنَّارَ وَ لاَ كَفَّارَةَ عَلَيْهِ فِي اَلدُّنْيَا ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4297 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"An oath is of two types. One type is when a man swears upon something that he is not obligated to do, yet he swears that he will do it.
The other type is when he swears upon something that he is obligated to do; in this case, if he does not fulfill it, he must offer expiation.
The second type has three categories. One of them is an oath for which a man will be rewarded if he swears falsely, another for which there is neither expiation nor reward, and the third for which there is no expiation but the punishment is entering the Fire.
As for the oath for which a man will be rewarded if he swears falsely and for which no expiation is required, it is when a person swears to protect the life of a Muslim or his property from an oppressor or a thief or anyone who intends harm.
As for the oath for which there is neither expiation nor reward, it is when a person swears upon something but later finds an option that is better than his oath, so he leaves the oath and chooses what is better.
And as for the oath whose punishment is entering the Fire, it is when a man swears falsely to take the wealth or rights of another Muslim unjustly. This is a 'Ghamus' oath, which necessitates the Fire, and there is no expiation for it in this world."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4298 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said that a false oath leaves homes deserted of their inhabitants.
arabicText: 4298 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْيَمِينُ اَلْكَاذِبَةُ تَدَعُ اَلدِّيَارَ بَلاَقِعَ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4298 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said that
thaqalaynMatn: a false oath leaves homes deserted of their inhabitants.

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4299 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"Whoever reveres Allah (swt) and refrains from swearing a false oath by Him (swt), Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, will grant him something better than what he has lost."
arabicText: 4299 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَنْ أَجَلَّ اَللَّهَ أَنْ يَحْلِفَ بِهِ كَاذِباً أَعْطَاهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ خَيْراً مِمَّا ذَهَبَ مِنْهُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4299 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever reveres Allah (swt) and refrains from swearing a false oath by Him (swt), Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, will grant him something better than what he has lost."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4300 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"No servant leaves something for the sake of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, and then finds himself in loss because of it."
arabicText: 4300 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ اَلْبَاقِرُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَا تَرَكَ عَبْدٌ شَيْئاً لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَفَقَدَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4300 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "No servant leaves something for the sake of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, and then finds himself in loss because of it."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4301 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"Whoever takes an oath in private should make an exception in private, and whoever takes an oath publicly should make an exception publicly."
arabicText: 4301 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَنْ حَلَفَ سِرّاً فَلْيَسْتَثْنِ سِرّاً وَ مَنْ حَلَفَ عَلاَنِيَةً فَلْيَسْتَثْنِ عَلاَنِيَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4301 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever takes an oath in private should make an exception in private, and whoever takes an oath publicly should make an exception publicly."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4302 - Isma'il ibn Sa'd asked Abu al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about a man who swears an oath, but his intention in the oath differs from the apparent wording.
Imam (as) said: "The oath is based on the intention."
arabicText: 4302 - وَ سَأَلَ إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَحْلِفُ بِالْيَمِينِ وَ ضَمِيرُهُ عَلَى غَيْرِ مَا حَلَفَ قَالَ "اَلْيَمِينُ عَلَى اَلضَّمِيرِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4302 - Isma'il ibn Sa'd asked Abu al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about a man who swears an oath, but his intention in the oath differs from the apparent wording.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The oath is based on the intention."

chapter: Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4303 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who takes an oath and then forgets what he said.
Imam (as) replied: "It is based on what he intended."
