englishText: Hadith.4368 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "A Muslim man does not gain a better benefit after Islam than a Muslim wife who pleases him when he looks at her, obeys him when he commands her, and safeguards herself and his wealth in his absence."
arabicText: 4368 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَا اِسْتَفَادَ اِمْرُؤٌ مُسْلِمٌ فَائِدَةً بَعْدَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ أَفْضَلَ مِنْ زَوْجَةٍ مُسْلِمَةٍ تَسُرُّهُ إِذَا نَظَرَ إِلَيْهَا وَ تُطِيعُهُ إِذَا أَمَرَهَا وَ تَحْفَظُهُ إِذَا غَابَ عَنْهَا فِي نَفْسِهَا وَ مَالِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4368 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A Muslim man does not gain a better benefit after Islam than a Muslim wife who pleases him when he looks at her, obeys him when he commands her, and safeguards herself and his wealth in his absence."

chapter: Chapter on the Recommended and Praiseworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4369 - A man came to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) and said: "I have a wife who, when I enter the house, welcomes me, and when I leave, bids me farewell. If she sees me worried, she says, 'What is troubling you? If you are concerned about your sustenance, know that someone else has taken responsibility for it. And if you are concerned about your afterlife, then may Allah (swt) increase your concern.'"
The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Indeed, Allah (swt) has workers, and she is one of His (swt) workers. She will have half the reward of a martyr."
arabicText: 4369 - : وَ جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَقَالَ إِنَّ لِي زَوْجَةً إِذَا دَخَلْتُ تَلَقَّتْنِي وَ إِذَا خَرَجْتُ شَيَّعَتْنِي وَ إِذَا رَأَتْنِي مَهْمُوماً قَالَتْ مَا يُهِمُّكَ إِنْ كُنْتَ تَهْتَمُّ لِرِزْقِكَ فَقَدْ تَكَفَّلَ لَكَ بِهِ غَيْرُكَ وَ إِنْ كُنْتَ تَهْتَمُّ بِأَمْرِ آخِرَتِكَ فَزَادَكَ اَللَّهُ هَمّاً فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عُمَّالاً وَ هَذِهِ مِنْ عُمَّالِهِ لَهَا نِصْفُ أَجْرِ اَلشَّهِيدِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4369 - A man came to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I have a wife who, when I enter the house, welcomes me, and when I leave, bids me farewell. If she sees me worried, she says, 'What is troubling you? If you are concerned about your sustenance, know that someone else has taken responsibility for it. And if you are concerned about your afterlife, then may Allah (swt) increase your concern.'"
The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Indeed, Allah (swt) has workers, and she is one of His (swt) workers. She will have half the reward of a martyr."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4370 - It is narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
"The most overpowering enemy of a believer is a bad wife."
arabicText: 4370 - رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "أَغْلَبُ اَلْأَعْدَاءِ لِلْمُؤْمِنِ زَوْجَةُ اَلسَّوْءِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4370 - It is narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdillah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The most overpowering enemy of a believer is a bad wife."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4371 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"I have not seen those who are weak in faith and deficient in intellect more capable of overwhelming a man of reason than you (women)."
arabicText: 4371 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَا رَأَيْتُ ضَعِيفَاتِ اَلدِّينِ نَاقِصَاتِ اَلْعُقُولِ أَسْلَبَ لِذِي لُبٍّ مِنْكُنَّ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4371 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I have not seen those who are weak in faith and deficient in intellect more capable of overwhelming a man of reason than you (women)."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4372 - Imam (as) said:
"Indeed, women are a source of dependence and vulnerability. So, conceal their vulnerability within the homes and cover their dependence with silence."
arabicText: 4372 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّمَا اَلنِّسَاءُ عِيٌّ وَ عَوْرَةٌ فَاسْتُرُوا اَلْعَوْرَةَ بِالْبُيُوتِ وَ اُسْتُرُوا اَلْعِيَّ بِالسُّكُوتِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4372 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, women are a source of dependence and vulnerability. So, conceal their vulnerability within the homes and cover their dependence with silence."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4373 - Imam (as) said: "If it were not for women, Allah (swt) would have been truly worshiped as He (swt) deserves to be worshiped."
arabicText: 4373 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "لَوْ لاَ اَلنِّسَاءُ لَعُبِدَ اَللَّهُ حَقّاً حَقّاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4373 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If it were not for women, Allah (swt) would have been truly worshiped as He (swt) deserves to be worshiped."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4374 - Al-Asbagh ibn Nubatah narrated from Commander of the Faithful (as) that he said:
"I heard him say: In the last days and near the Hour, when it will be the worst of times, there will appear women who are uncovered, naked, and flaunting themselves.
They will outwardly belong to the religion but will be immersed in trials, inclined toward desires, hastening toward pleasures, and making permissible what is forbidden. They will dwell in Hell forever."
arabicText: 4374 - وَ رَوَى اَلْأَصْبَغُ بْنُ نُبَاتَةَ عَنْ أَمِيرِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ: "يَظْهَرُ فِي آخِرِ اَلزَّمَانِ وَ اِقْتِرَابِ اَلسَّاعَةِ وَ هُوَ شَرُّ اَلْأَزْمِنَةِ نِسْوَةٌ كَاشِفَاتٌ عَارِيَاتٌ مُتَبَرِّجَاتٌ مِنَ اَلدِّينِ دَاخِلاَتٌ فِي اَلْفِتَنِ مَائِلاَتٌ إِلَى اَلشَّهَوَاتِ مُسْرِعَاتٌ إِلَى اَللَّذَّاتِ مُسْتَحِلاَّتٌ لِلْمُحَرَّمَاتِ فِي جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدَاتٌ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4374 - Al-Asbagh ibn Nubatah narrated from Commander of the Faithful (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I heard him say: In the last days and near the Hour, when it will be the worst of times, there will appear women who are uncovered, naked, and flaunting themselves.
They will outwardly belong to the religion but will be immersed in trials, inclined toward desires, hastening toward pleasures, and making permissible what is forbidden. They will dwell in Hell forever."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4375 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) passed by a group of women, stopped, and said:
"O assembly of women! I have not seen those who are deficient in intellect and religion more capable of taking away the reasoning of men of understanding than you. Indeed, I have observed that you will form the majority of the inhabitants of Hell on the Day of Judgment. So, seek closeness to Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, as much as you can."
One of the women asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is the deficiency in our religion and intellect?"
He (sw) replied: "As for the deficiency in your religion, it is due to the menstruation that afflicts you, during which one of you may remain for a period, as Allah (swt) wills, without praying or fasting. And as for the deficiency in your intellect, it is because the testimony of a woman is equivalent to half the testimony of a man."
arabicText:
4375 - : وَ مَرَّ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَلَى نِسْوَةٍ فَوَقَفَ عَلَيْهِنَّ ثُمَّ قَالَ
"يَا مَعَاشِرَ اَلنِّسَاءِ مَا رَأَيْتُ نَوَاقِصَ عُقُولٍ وَ دِينٍ أَذْهَبَ بِعُقُولِ ذَوِي اَلْأَلْبَابِ مِنْكُنَّ إِنِّي قَدْ رَأَيْتُ أَنَّكُنَّ أَكْثَرُ أَهْلِ اَلنَّارِ ، يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ فَتَقَرَّبْنَ إِلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مَا اِسْتَطَعْتُنَّ"
فَقَالَتِ اِمْرَأَةٌ مِنْهُنَّ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ مَا نُقْصَانُ دِينِنَا وَ عُقُولِنَا فَقَالَ "أَمَّا نُقْصَانُ دِينِكُنَّ فَالْحَيْضُ اَلَّذِي يُصِيبُكُنَّ فَتَمْكُثُ إِحْدَاكُنَّ مَا شَاءَ اَللَّهُ لاَ تُصَلِّي وَ لاَ تَصُومُ وَ أَمَّا نُقْصَانُ عُقُولِكُنَّ فَشَهَادَتُكُنَّ إِنَّمَا شَهَادَةُ اَلْمَرْأَةِ نِصْفُ شَهَادَةِ اَلرَّجُلِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4375 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) passed by a group of women, stopped, and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O assembly of women! I have not seen those who are deficient in intellect and religion more capable of taking away the reasoning of men of understanding than you. Indeed, I have observed that you will form the majority of the inhabitants of Hell on the Day of Judgment. So, seek closeness to Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, as much as you can."
One of the women asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is the deficiency in our religion and intellect?"
He (sw) replied: "As for the deficiency in your religion, it is due to the menstruation that afflicts you, during which one of you may remain for a period, as Allah (swt) wills, without praying or fasting. And as for the deficiency in your intellect, it is because the testimony of a woman is equivalent to half the testimony of a man."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4376 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Shall I not inform you about the worst of your women?"
They said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah (swt), tell us."
He said: "The worst of your women is the one who is humble and submissive with her family but domineering and arrogant with her husband. She is barren, spiteful, and does not refrain from committing indecency. She flaunts herself when her husband is absent but is reserved and guarded when he is present. She does not listen to his words nor obey his commands. When he is alone with her, she behaves stubbornly like a difficult mount that resists being ridden. She neither accepts his apology nor forgives his faults."
arabicText: 4376 - : وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "أَ لاَ أُخْبِرُكُمْ بِشَرِّ نِسَائِكُمْ" قَالُوا بَلَى يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ فَأَخْبِرْنَا قَالَ "مِنْ شَرِّ نِسَائِكُمُ اَلذَّلِيلَةُ فِي أَهْلِهَا اَلْعَزِيزَةُ مَعَ بَعْلِهَا اَلْعَقِيمُ اَلْحَقُودُ اَلَّتِي لاَ تَتَوَرَّعُ عَنْ قَبِيحٍ اَلْمُتَبَرِّجَةُ إِذَا غَابَ عَنْهَا زَوْجُهَا اَلْحَصَانُ مَعَهُ إِذَا حَضَرَ اَلَّتِي لاَ تَسْمَعُ قَوْلَهُ وَ لاَ تُطِيعُ أَمْرَهُ فَإِذَا خَلاَ بِهَا تَمَنَّعَتْ تَمَنُّعَ اَلصَّعْبَةِ عِنْدَ رُكُوبِهَا وَ لاَ تَقْبَلُ لَهُ عُذْراً وَ لاَ تَغْفِرُ لَهُ ذَنْباً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4376 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Shall I not inform you about the worst of your women?"
They said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah (swt), tell us."
He said: "The worst of your women is the one who is humble and submissive with her family but domineering and arrogant with her husband. She is barren, spiteful, and does not refrain from committing indecency. She flaunts herself when her husband is absent but is reserved and guarded when he is present. She does not listen to his words nor obey his commands. When he is alone with her, she behaves stubbornly like a difficult mount that resists being ridden. She neither accepts his apology nor forgives his faults."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4377 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) stood up to deliver a sermon and said: "O people, beware of the green growth in a dung heap."
It was asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is the green growth in a dung heap?"
He (sw) replied: "A beautiful woman raised in a bad environment."
arabicText: 4377 - : وَ قَامَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ خَطِيباً فَقَالَ "أَيُّهَا اَلنَّاسُ إِيَّاكُمْ وَ خَضْرَاءَ اَلدِّمَنِ " قِيلَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ وَ مَا خَضْرَاءُ اَلدِّمَنِ قَالَ "اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْحَسْنَاءُ فِي مَنْبِتِ اَلسَّوْءِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4377 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) stood up to deliver a sermon and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O people, beware of the green growth in a dung heap."
It was asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is the green growth in a dung heap?"
He (sw) replied: "A beautiful woman raised in a bad environment."

chapter: Chapter on the Blameworthy Traits and Characteristics of Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4378 - Imam (as) said: "Know that a dark-skinned woman who bears many children is more beloved to me than a beautiful woman who is barren."
arabicText: 4378 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "اِعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اَلْمَرْأَةَ اَلسَّوْدَاءَ إِذَا كَانَتْ وَلُوداً أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنَ اَلْحَسْنَاءِ اَلْعَاقِرِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4378 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Know that a dark-skinned woman who bears many children is more beloved to me than a beautiful woman who is barren."

chapter: Chapter on the Admonition Regarding Women
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4379 - Sama'ah narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said: "Fear Allah (swt) regarding the two weak ones."
arabicText: 4379 - رَوَى سَمَاعَةُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اِتَّقُوا اَللَّهَ فِي اَلضَّعِيفَيْنِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4379 - Sama'ah narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Fear Allah (swt) regarding the two weak ones."

chapter: Chapter on Marrying a Woman for Her Wealth, Beauty, or Religion
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4380 - Hisham ibn al-Hakam narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said: "If a man marries a woman for her wealth or her beauty, he will not be granted that. But if he marries her for her religion, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, will grant him her beauty and her wealth."
arabicText: 4380 - رَوَى هِشَامُ بْنُ اَلْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِذَا تَزَوَّجَ اَلرَّجُلُ اَلْمَرْأَةَ لِمَالِهَا أَوْ جَمَالِهَا لَمْ يُرْزَقْ ذَلِكَ فَإِنْ تَزَوَّجَهَا لِدِينِهَا رَزَقَهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ جَمَالَهَا وَ مَالَهَا ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4380 - Hisham ibn al-Hakam narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man marries a woman for her wealth or her beauty, he will not be granted that. But if he marries her for her religion, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, will grant him her beauty and her wealth."

chapter: Chapter on Compatibility in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4381 - Muhammad ibn al-Walid narrated from al-Husayn ibn Bashshar, who said:
I wrote to Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) concerning a man who proposed marriage to someone.
Imam (as) replied: "If someone proposes to you, and you are satisfied with his religion and trustworthiness, then marry him, whoever he may be. If you do not do so, there will be 'fitnah (discord) on the earth and great corruption.'"
arabicText: 4381 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْوَلِيدِ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ بَشَّارٍ قَالَ: كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي رَجُلٍ خَطَبَ إِلَيَّ فَكَتَبَ "مَنْ خَطَبَ إِلَيْكُمْ فَرَضِيتُمْ دِينَهُ وَ أَمَانَتَهُ كَائِناً مَنْ كَانَ فَزَوِّجُوهُ وَ إِلاَّ تَفْعَلُوا "تَكُنْ فِتْنَةٌ فِي اَلْأَرْضِ وَ فَسٰادٌ كَبِيرٌ" ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4381 - Muhammad ibn al-Walid narrated from al-Husayn ibn Bashshar, who said:
I wrote to Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) concerning a man who proposed marriage to someone.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "If someone proposes to you, and you are satisfied with his religion and trustworthiness, then marry him, whoever he may be. If you do not do so, there will be 'fitnah (discord) on the earth and great corruption.'"

chapter: Chapter on Compatibility in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4382 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"I am only a human being like you; I marry amongst you and I arrange marriages for you.
Except for Sayyida Fatimah {s.a}, for her marriage was decreed from the heavens."
arabicText: 4382 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : " "إِنَّمٰا أَنَا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُكُمْ" أَتَزَوَّجُ فِيكُمْ وَ أُزَوِّجُكُمْ إِلاَّ فَاطِمَةَ فَإِنَّ تَزْوِيجَهَا نَزَلَ مِنَ اَلسَّمَاءِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4382 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I am only a human being like you; I marry amongst you and I arrange marriages for you.
Except for Sayyida Fatimah {s.a}, for her marriage was decreed from the heavens."

chapter: Chapter on Compatibility in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4383 - Imam (as) said: "Had Allah (swt), the Exalted, not created Sayyida Fatimah {s.a} for Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), there would not have been any equal for her on the face of the earth, from Adam to those after him."
arabicText: 4383 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "لَوْ لاَ أَنَّ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى خَلَقَ فَاطِمَةَ لِعَلِيٍّ مَا كَانَ لَهَا عَلَى وَجْهِ اَلْأَرْضِ كُفْوٌ آدَمُ فَمَنْ دُونَهُ".

chapter: Chapter on Compatibility in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4384 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) looked at the children of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) and Ja'far (as), peace be upon them, and said:
"Our daughters are for our sons, and our sons are for our daughters."
arabicText: 4384 - : وَ نَظَرَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِلَى أَوْلاَدِ عَلِيٍّ وَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ "بَنَاتُنَا لِبَنِينَا وَ بَنُونَا لِبَنَاتِنَا ".

chapter: Chapter on Compatibility in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4385 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "
Believers are equals to one another."
arabicText: 4385 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : " اَلْمُؤْمِنُونَ بَعْضُهُمْ أَكْفَاءُ بَعْضٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4385 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "
thaqalaynMatn: Believers are equals to one another."

chapter: Chapter on Compatibility in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4386 - Imam (as) said: "A suitable match is one who is chaste and possesses financial means."
arabicText: 4386 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "اَلْكُفْؤُ أَنْ يَكُونَ عَفِيفاً وَ عِنْدَهُ يَسَارٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4386 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A suitable match is one who is chaste and possesses financial means."

chapter: Chapter on the Recommended Supplications and Prayers for One Who Intends to Marry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4387 - Muthanna ibn al-Walid al-Hannat narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
Abu Abdillah (as) said to me: "When one of you intends to get married, what should he do?"
I replied: "I do not know, may I be your ransom."
Imam (as) said: "When he makes up his mind for that, let him perform two units of prayer, praise Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, and say:
'O Allah (swt), I intend marriage, so decree for me from among the women the one who is most chaste in her private parts, best in preserving herself for me, my wealth, and the most abundant in sustenance, and the greatest in blessings. Grant me from her a good offspring whom You (swt) make for me a righteous successor during my life and after my death.'"
arabicText: 4387 - رَوَى مُثَنَّى بْنُ اَلْوَلِيدِ اَلْحَنَّاطُ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ قَالَ لِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا تَزَوَّجَ أَحَدُكُمْ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ" قُلْتُ مَا أَدْرِي جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ قَالَ "إِذَا هَمَّ بِذَلِكَ فَلْيُصَلِّ رَكْعَتَيْنِ وَ يَحْمَدُ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ يَقُولُ: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أُرِيدُ اَلتَّزْوِيجَ فَقَدِّرْ لِي مِنَ اَلنِّسَاءِ أَعَفَّهُنَّ فَرْجاً وَ أَحْفَظَهُنَّ لِي فِي نَفْسِهَا وَ مَالِي وَ أَوْسَعَهُنَّ رِزْقاً وَ أَعْظَمَهُنَّ بَرَكَةً وَ قَيِّضْ لِي مِنْهَا وَلَداً طَيِّباً تَجْعَلُهُ لِي خَلَفاً صَالِحاً فِي حَيَاتِي وَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِي".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4387 - Muthanna ibn al-Walid al-Hannat narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
Abu Abdillah (as) said to me: "When one of you intends to get married, what should he do?"
I replied: "I do not know, may I be your ransom."
Imam (as) said: "When he makes up his mind for that, let him perform two units of prayer, praise Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, and say:
'O Allah (swt), I intend marriage, so decree for me from among the women the one who is most chaste in her private parts, best in preserving herself for me, my wealth, and the most abundant in sustenance, and the greatest in blessings. Grant me from her a good offspring whom You (swt) make for me a righteous successor during my life and after my death.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Time When Marriage is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4388 - Muhammad ibn Humran narrated from his father, who reported from Abu Abdillah (as) that he said: "Whoever marries when the moon is in a harmful or unfavorable position will not see good outcomes."
arabicText: 4388 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ حُمْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "مَنْ تَزَوَّجَ وَ اَلْقَمَرُ فِي اَلْعَقْرَبِ لَمْ يَرَ اَلْحُسْنَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4388 - Muhammad ibn Humran narrated from his father, who reported from Abu Abdillah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever marries when the moon is in a harmful or unfavorable position will not see good outcomes."

chapter: Chapter on the Time When Marriage is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4389 - It is narrated that "It is disliked to marry during the waning phase of the moon."
arabicText: 4389 - وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّهُ يُكْرَهُ اَلتَّزْوِيجُ فِي مُحَاقِ اَلشَّهْرِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4389 - It is narrated that
thaqalaynMatn: "It is disliked to marry during the waning phase of the moon."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4391 - Muhammad ibn Isma'il ibn Bazi' asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about a young girl who was married off by her father, and then the father died while she was still a child.
When she grew older, before her husband consummated the marriage, does the marriage remain valid, or is the matter in her hands?
Imam (as) replied: "The marriage performed by her father is valid for her."
arabicText:
4391 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
عَنِ اَلصَّبِيَّةِ يُزَوِّجُهَا أَبُوهَا ثُمَّ يَمُوتُ وَ هِيَ صَغِيرَةٌ ثُمَّ تَكْبَرُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَدْخُلَ بِهَا زَوْجُهَا أَ يَجُوزُ عَلَيْهَا اَلتَّزْوِيجُ أَمِ اَلْأَمْرُ إِلَيْهَا فَقَالَ "يَجُوزُ عَلَيْهَا تَزْوِيجُ أَبِيهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4391 - Muhammad ibn Isma'il ibn Bazi' asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about a young girl who was married off by her father, and then the father died while she was still a child.
When she grew older, before her husband consummated the marriage, does the marriage remain valid, or is the matter in her hands?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The marriage performed by her father is valid for her."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4392 - Ibn Bukayr narrated from Ubayd ibn Zurarah who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a young girl whose father wishes to marry her to one man, while her grandfather wishes to marry her to another man.
Imam (as) said: "The grandfather has more right in this matter if the father has not already married her off before him."
arabicText:
4392 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ:
قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلْجَارِيَةُ يُرِيدُ أَبُوهَا أَنْ يُزَوِّجَهَا مِنْ رَجُلٍ وَ يُرِيدُ جَدُّهَا أَنْ يُزَوِّجَهَا مِنْ رَجُلٍ آخَرَ فَقَالَ "اَلْجَدُّ أَوْلَى بِذَلِكَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنِ اَلْأَبُ زَوَّجَهَا مِنْ قَبْلِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4392 - Ibn Bukayr narrated from Ubayd ibn Zurarah who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a young girl whose father wishes to marry her to one man, while her grandfather wishes to marry her to another man.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The grandfather has more right in this matter if the father has not already married her off before him."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4393 - Hisham ibn Salim and Muhammad ibn Hakim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: "If the father and the grandfather both arrange the marriage, the marriage arranged by the first one will take precedence. However, if both arranged the marriage simultaneously, then the grandfather has greater authority."
arabicText: 4393 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ وَ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِذَا زَوَّجَ اَلْأَبُ وَ اَلْجَدُّ كَانَ اَلتَّزْوِيجُ لِلْأَوَّلِ فَإِنْ كَانَا زَوَّجَا فِي حَالٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَالْجَدُّ أَوْلَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4393 - Hisham ibn Salim and Muhammad ibn Hakim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the father and the grandfather both arrange the marriage, the marriage arranged by the first one will take precedence. However, if both arranged the marriage simultaneously, then the grandfather has greater authority."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4394 - Hanan ibn Sadir narrated from Muslim ibn Bashir, who reported from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
He said: I asked him about a man who married a woman without witnesses.
Imam (as) replied: "As far as what is between him and Allah (swt), the Exalted, there is nothing against him. However, if a tyrannical ruler were to apprehend him, he would punish him."
arabicText: 4394 - وَ رَوَى حَنَانُ بْنُ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ مُسْلِمِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ تَزَوَّجَ اِمْرَأَةً وَ لَمْ يُشْهِدْ فَقَالَ "أَمَّا فِيمَا بَيْنَهُ وَ بَيْنَ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ وَ لَكِنْ إِنْ أَخَذَهُ سُلْطَانٌ جَائِرٌ عَاقَبَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4394 - Hanan ibn Sadir narrated from Muslim ibn Bashir, who reported from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
He said: I asked him about a man who married a woman without witnesses.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "As far as what is between him and Allah (swt), the Exalted, there is nothing against him. However, if a tyrannical ruler were to apprehend him, he would punish him."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4395 - It is narrated from Abdul Hamid ibn Awad, who reported from Abdul Khaliq, that he said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a previously married woman (thayyib) who arranges her own marriage proposal.
He replied: "She has full authority over herself. She may entrust her affairs to whomever she wishes, provided he is a suitable match, as long as she has been married to a husband prior to this."
arabicText: 4395 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْحَمِيدِ بْنِ عَوَّاضٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْخَالِقِ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ اَلثَّيِّبِ تَخْطُبُ إِلَى نَفْسِهَا قَالَ "هِيَ أَمْلَكُ بِنَفْسِهَا تُوَلِّي أَمْرَهَا مَنْ شَاءَتْ إِذَا كَانَ كُفْواً بَعْدَ أَنْ تَكُونَ قَدْ نَكَحَتْ زَوْجاً قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4395 - It is narrated from Abdul Hamid ibn Awad, who reported from Abdul Khaliq, that he said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a previously married woman (thayyib) who arranges her own marriage proposal.
He replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "She has full authority over herself. She may entrust her affairs to whomever she wishes, provided he is a suitable match, as long as she has been married to a husband prior to this."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4396 - It is narrated by Dawood ibn Sirhan from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said regarding a man who wishes to arrange the marriage of his sister:
"He should consult her. If she remains silent, it is her consent, but if she refuses, he should not marry her off. If she says, 'Marry me to so-and-so,' then he should marry her to someone she approves of.
As for an orphan girl under the care of a man, he should not marry her off except to someone she is pleased with."
arabicText: 4396 - وَ رَوَى دَاوُدُ بْنُ سِرْحَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: فِي رَجُلٍ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُزَوِّجَ أُخْتَهُ قَالَ "يُؤَامِرُهَا فَإِنْ سَكَتَتْ فَهُوَ إِقْرَارُهَا وَ إِنْ أَبَتْ لَمْ يُزَوِّجْهَا فَإِنْ قَالَتْ زَوِّجْنِي فُلاَناً فَلْيُزَوِّجْهَا مِمَّنْ تَرْضَى وَ اَلْيَتِيمَةُ فِي حَجْرِ اَلرَّجُلِ لاَ يُزَوِّجُهَا إِلاَّ مِمَّنْ تَرْضَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4396 - It is narrated by Dawood ibn Sirhan from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said regarding a man who wishes to arrange the marriage of his sister:
thaqalaynMatn:
"He should consult her. If she remains silent, it is her consent, but if she refuses, he should not marry her off. If she says, 'Marry me to so-and-so,' then he should marry her to someone she approves of.
As for an orphan girl under the care of a man, he should not marry her off except to someone she is pleased with."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4397 - It is narrated by Al-Fudhayl ibn Yasar, Muhammad ibn Muslim, Zurara, and Burayd ibn Muawiyah from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"A woman who has control over herself, is neither foolish nor under guardianship, her marriage without a guardian is permissible."
arabicText: 4397 - وَ رَوَى اَلْفُضَيْلُ بْنُ يَسَارٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ وَ زُرَارَةُ وَ بُرَيْدُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلَّتِي قَدْ مَلَكَتْ نَفْسَهَا غَيْرَ اَلسَّفِيهَةِ وَ لاَ اَلْمُوَلَّى عَلَيْهَا تَزْوِيجُهَا بِغَيْرِ وَلِيٍّ جَائِزٌ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4397 - It is narrated by Al-Fudhayl ibn Yasar, Muhammad ibn Muslim, Zurara, and Burayd ibn Muawiyah from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman who has control over herself, is neither foolish nor under guardianship, her marriage without a guardian is permissible."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4398 - When Abu Talib (as), may Allah (swt) have mercy upon him, arranged the marriage of the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) to Khadijah bint Khuwaylid {s.a}, may Allah (swt) have mercy upon her, after proposing to her through her father, or as some say, through her uncle.
Abu Talib (as), stood by the doorposts, addressing the gathering of Quraysh who were present.
Abu Talib (as) began by praising Allah (swt), saying:
"All praise is due to Allah (swt), who made us from the progeny of Ibrahim and the descendants of Isma'il, who established for us a sacred house that is frequented (by pilgrims) and a secure sanctuary to which the fruits of all things are brought.
He (swt) has made us the rulers over the people in our land.
My nephew, Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abdul-Muttalib (sw), cannot be compared to any man of Quraysh except that He (sw) surpasses them in virtue, nor can He (sw) be equated with anyone except that He (sw) holds greater honor than them.
Though He (sw) may possess little wealth, wealth is merely a fleeting provision and a transient shade.
He (sw) has an interest in Khadijah {s.a}, and she {s.a} has an interest in Him (as).
The dowry, whether its immediate or deferred portion, will be paid from my wealth.
He (sw) holds a great position, a lofty status, and an eloquent and persuasive tongue."
Following this address, Khadijah {s.a} was married to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), and He (sw) consummated the marriage the following day.
The first child she {s.a} bore for Him (sw) was Abdullah ibn Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him and his family).
arabicText:
4398 - : وَ خَطَبَ أَبُو طَالِبٍ رَحِمَهُ اَللَّهُ لَمَّا تَزَوَّجَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ، خَدِيجَةَ بِنْتَ خُوَيْلِدٍ رَحِمَهَا اَللَّهُ بَعْدَ أَنْ خَطَبَهَا إِلَى أَبِيهَا وَ مِنَ اَلنَّاسِ مَنْ يَقُولُ إِلَى عَمِّهَا فَأَخَذَ بِعِضَادَتَيِ اَلْبَابِ وَ مَنْ شَاهَدَهُ مِنْ قُرَيْشٍ حُضُورٌ فَقَالَ
اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ اَلَّذِي جَعَلَنَا مِنْ زَرْعِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَ ذُرِّيَّةِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَ جَعَلَ لَنَا بَيْتاً مَحْجُوجاً وَ "حَرَماً آمِناً يُجْبىٰ إِلَيْهِ ثَمَرٰاتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ" وَ جَعَلَنَا اَلْحُكَّامَ عَلَى اَلنَّاسِ فِي بَلَدِنَا اَلَّذِي نَحْنُ فِيهِ ثُمَّ إِنَّ اِبْنَ أَخِي مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلْمُطَّلِبِ لاَ يُوزَنُ بِرَجُلٍ مِنْ قُرَيْشٍ إِلاَّ رَجَحَ وَ لاَ يُقَاسُ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْهُمْ إِلاَّ عَظُمَ عَنْهُ وَ إِنْ كَانَ فِي اَلْمَالِ قَلَّ فَإِنَّ اَلْمَالَ رِزْقٌ حَائِلٌ وَ ظِلٌّ زَائِلٌ وَ لَهُ فِي خَدِيجَةَ رَغْبَةٌ وَ لَهَا فِيهِ رَغْبَةٌ وَ اَلصَّدَاقُ مَا سَأَلْتُمْ عَاجِلُهُ وَ آجِلُهُ مِنْ مَالِي وَ لَهُ خَطَرٌ عَظِيمٌ وَ شَأْنٌ رَفِيعٌ وَ لِسَانٌ
شَافِعٌ جَسِيمٌ فَزَوَّجَهُ وَ دَخَلَ بِهَا مِنَ اَلْغَدِ فَأَوَّلُ مَا حَمَلَتْ وَلَدَتْ عَبْدَ اَللَّهِ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ.

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4399 - When Imam Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Ali al-Ridha (as) married the daughter of al-Ma'mun, Imam (as) delivered the following sermon for himself:
"All praise is due to Allah (swt), the Completer of blessings through His (swt) mercy, and the Guide to gratitude through His (swt) favor.
May Allah (swt) send blessings upon Muhammad (sw), the best of His (swt) creation, in whom He (swt) gathered all virtues that He (swt) distributed among the previous messengers, and He (swt) entrusted his inheritance to those whom He (swt) chose for his succession. May Allah (swt) grant him peace and blessings in abundance.
Here stands (your political ruler) Commander of Faithful, who has married me to his daughter in accordance with what Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, has ordained for Muslim women over believing men, either to retain them honorably or to release them kindly.
I have offered her as a dowry what the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) offered to his wives, which is twelve uqiyyah and a nashsh (approximately 500 dirhams). And I have added to it, from my own wealth, one hundred thousand (dirhams).
O' (political ruler) Commander of the Faithful, you have married her to me, have you not?"
He (al-Ma'mun) replied: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "I accept, and I am satisfied."
arabicText:
4399 - : وَ لَمَّا تَزَوَّجَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اِبْنَةَ اَلْمَأْمُونِ خَطَبَ لِنَفْسِهِ فَقَالَ
" اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ مُتِمِّ اَلنِّعَمِ بِرَحْمَتِهِ وَ اَلْهَادِي إِلَى شُكْرِهِ بِمَنِّهِ وَ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ خَيْرِ خَلْقِهِ اَلَّذِي جَمَعَ فِيهِ مِنَ اَلْفَضْلِ مَا فَرَّقَهُ فِي اَلرُّسُلِ قَبْلَهُ وَ جَعَلَ تُرَاثَهُ إِلَى مَنْ خَصَّهُ بِخِلاَفَتِهِ وَ سَلَّمَ تَسْلِيماً وَ هَذَا أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ زَوَّجَنِي اِبْنَتَهُ عَلَى مَا فَرَضَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لِلْمُسْلِمَاتِ عَلَى اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ مِنْ إِمْسَاكٍ بِمَعْرُوفٍ أَوْ تَسْرِيحٍ بِإِحْسَانٍ وَ بَذَلْتُ لَهَا مِنَ اَلصَّدَاقِ مَا بَذَلَهُ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لِأَزْوَاجِهِ وَ هُوَ اِثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ أُوقِيَّةً وَ نَشٌّ وَ عَلَيَّ تَمَامُ اَلْخَمْسِمِائَةِ وَ قَدْ نَحَلْتُهَا مِنْ مَالِي مِائَةَ أَلْفٍ زَوَّجْتَنِي يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ"
قَالَ بَلَى قَالَ "قَبِلْتُ وَ رَضِيتُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4399 - When Imam Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Ali al-Ridha (as) married the daughter of al-Ma'mun, Imam (as) delivered the following sermon for himself:
thaqalaynMatn:
"All praise is due to Allah (swt), the Completer of blessings through His (swt) mercy, and the Guide to gratitude through His (swt) favor.
May Allah (swt) send blessings upon Muhammad (sw), the best of His (swt) creation, in whom He (swt) gathered all virtues that He (swt) distributed among the previous messengers, and He (swt) entrusted his inheritance to those whom He (swt) chose for his succession. May Allah (swt) grant him peace and blessings in abundance.
Here stands (your political ruler) Commander of Faithful, who has married me to his daughter in accordance with what Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, has ordained for Muslim women over believing men, either to retain them honorably or to release them kindly.
I have offered her as a dowry what the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) offered to his wives, which is twelve uqiyyah and a nashsh (approximately 500 dirhams). And I have added to it, from my own wealth, one hundred thousand (dirhams).
O' (political ruler) Commander of the Faithful, you have married her to me, have you not?"
He (al-Ma'mun) replied: "Yes."
Imam (as) said: "I accept, and I am satisfied."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4400 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever marries a woman and does not intend to pay her dowry is, in the sight of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, considered a fornicator."
arabicText: 4400 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ تَزَوَّجَ اِمْرَأَةً وَ لَمْ يَنْوِ أَنْ يُوَفِّيَهَا صَدَاقَهَا فَهُوَ عِنْدَ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ زَانٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4400 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever marries a woman and does not intend to pay her dowry is, in the sight of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, considered a fornicator."

chapter: Chapter on the Guardian, Witnesses, Proposal, and Dowry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4401 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Indeed, the most deserving of conditions to be fulfilled are those by which you make lawful access to private parts."
arabicText: 4401 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ أَحَقَّ اَلشُّرُوطِ أَنْ يُوفَى بِهَا مَا اِسْتَحْلَلْتُمْ بِهِ اَلْفُرُوجَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4401 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, the most deserving of conditions to be fulfilled are those by which you make lawful access to private parts."

chapter: Chapter on Scattering Gifts and the Wedding Ceremony
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4402 - It is narrated from Jabir ibn Abdullah Al-Ansari that he said:
When the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, married Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a} to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), peace be upon them, some people from Quraysh came to Him (sw) and said: "You have married Ali (as) with a trivial dowry."
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, replied to them:
"It was not I, who married Ali (as), but Allah (swt), Mighty and Majestic, married Him (as) to Her {s.a}.
On the night I was taken on the Night Journey to the Sidrat al-Muntaha (Lote Tree at the Utmost Boundary), Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, revealed to the Lote Tree, 'Scatter your ornaments.' It then scattered pearls and jewels upon the maidens of Paradise, who exchanged them as gifts and took pride in them, saying, 'This is from the scattering for Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a}, the daughter of Muhammad (sw), peace be upon him and his family.'"
When the night of the wedding arrived, the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, brought his grey mule and covered it with a cloak. He (sw) said to Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a}, peace be upon her, "Mount it."
He (sw) then commanded Salman, may Allah (swt) have mercy on him, to lead it, while the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, walked behind it.
While they were on the way, the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, heard a sound and saw Archangel Jibril (Gabriel) (as), descending with seventy thousand angels, and Mika'il (Michael), peace be upon him, with seventy thousand angels.
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, said: "What has brought you down to earth?"
They said: "We have come to escort Sayyida Fatimah {s.a}, peace be upon her, to her husband."
Archangel Jibril (as) proclaimed "Allahu Akbar" (Allah (swt) is the Greatest), and Mika'il, peace be upon him, followed with the same proclamation, as did the angels.
Then Muhammad (sw), peace be upon him and his family, also proclaimed "Allahu Akbar." From that night, the custom of proclaiming "Allahu Akbar" during weddings was established.
arabicText:
4402 - رُوِيَ عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ اَلْأَنْصَارِيِّ قَالَ: لَمَّا زَوَّجَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَاطِمَةَ مِنْ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَتَاهُ نَاسٌ مِنْ قُرَيْشٍ فَقَالُوا إِنَّكَ زَوَّجْتَ عَلِيّاً بِمَهْرٍ خَسِيسٍ فَقَالَ لَهُمْ "مَا أَنَا زَوَّجْتُ عَلِيّاً وَ لَكِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ زَوَّجَهُ لَيْلَةً أَسْرَى بِي عِنْدَ سِدْرَةِ اَلْمُنْتَهَى " أَوْحَى اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَى اَلسِّدْرَةِ "أَنِ اُنْثُرِي" فَنَثَرَتِ اَلدُّرَّ وَ اَلْجَوْهَرَ عَلَى اَلْحُورِ اَلْعِينِ فَهُنَّ يَتَهَادَيْنَهُ وَ يَتَفَاخَرْنَ بِهِ وَ يَقُلْنَ هَذَا مِنْ نُثَارِ فَاطِمَةَ بِنْتِ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَلَمَّا كَانَتْ لَيْلَةُ اَلزِّفَافِ أَتَى اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِبَغْلَتِهِ اَلشَّهْبَاءِ وَ ثَنَى عَلَيْهَا قَطِيفَةً وَ قَالَ لِفَاطِمَةَ عَلَيْهَا اَلسَّلاَمُ "اِرْكَبِي"
وَ أَمَرَ سَلْمَانَ رَحِمَهُ اَللَّهُ أَنْ يَقُودَهَا وَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ يَسُوقُهَا فَبَيْنَا هُوَ فِي بَعْضِ اَلطَّرِيقِ إِذْ سَمِعَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَجْبَةً فَإِذَا هُوَ بِجَبْرَئِيلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي سَبْعِينَ أَلْفاً وَ مِيكَائِيلَ فِي سَبْعِينَ أَلْفاً فَقَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "مَا أَهْبَطَكُمْ إِلَى اَلْأَرْضِ" قَالُوا جِئْنَا نَزُفُّ فَاطِمَةَ عَلَيْهَا اَلسَّلاَمُ إِلَى زَوْجِهَا وَ كَبَّرَ جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ كَبَّرَ مِيكَائِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ كَبَّرَتِ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةُ وَ كَبَّرَ مُحَمَّدٌ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَوُضِعَ اَلتَّكْبِيرُ عَلَى اَلْعَرَائِسِ مِنْ تِلْكَ اَللَّيْلَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4402 - It is narrated from Jabir ibn Abdullah Al-Ansari that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
When the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, married Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a} to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), peace be upon them, some people from Quraysh came to Him (sw) and said: "You have married Ali (as) with a trivial dowry."
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, replied to them:
"It was not I, who married Ali (as), but Allah (swt), Mighty and Majestic, married Him (as) to Her {s.a}.
On the night I was taken on the Night Journey to the Sidrat al-Muntaha (Lote Tree at the Utmost Boundary), Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, revealed to the Lote Tree, 'Scatter your ornaments.' It then scattered pearls and jewels upon the maidens of Paradise, who exchanged them as gifts and took pride in them, saying, 'This is from the scattering for Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a}, the daughter of Muhammad (sw), peace be upon him and his family.'"
When the night of the wedding arrived, the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, brought his grey mule and covered it with a cloak. He (sw) said to Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a}, peace be upon her, "Mount it."
He (sw) then commanded Salman, may Allah (swt) have mercy on him, to lead it, while the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, walked behind it.
While they were on the way, the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, heard a sound and saw Archangel Jibril (Gabriel) (as), descending with seventy thousand angels, and Mika'il (Michael), peace be upon him, with seventy thousand angels.
The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, said: "What has brought you down to earth?"
They said: "We have come to escort Sayyida Fatimah {s.a}, peace be upon her, to her husband."
Archangel Jibril (as) proclaimed "Allahu Akbar" (Allah (swt) is the Greatest), and Mika'il, peace be upon him, followed with the same proclamation, as did the angels.
Then Muhammad (sw), peace be upon him and his family, also proclaimed "Allahu Akbar." From that night, the custom of proclaiming "Allahu Akbar" during weddings was established.

chapter: Chapter on Scattering Gifts and the Wedding Ceremony
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4403 - It is narrated by Al-Sakooni from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Escort your brides at night and serve food in the morning."
arabicText: 4403 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "زُفُّوا عَرَائِسَكُمْ لَيْلاً وَ أَطْعِمُوا ضُحًى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4403 - It is narrated by Al-Sakooni from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Escort your brides at night and serve food in the morning."

chapter: Chapter on the Wedding Feast (walimah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4404 - It is narrated by Musa ibn Bakr from Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as), peace be upon him, that the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"There is no feast except on five occasions; at a wedding, at childbirth (nifas), at circumcision, when a man buys a house, and upon returning from Hajj."
The wedding refers to marriage, childbirth refers to the postnatal period, circumcision refers to the act of circumcision, buying a house refers to acquiring a new home, and returning from Hajj refers to returning from pilgrimage to Mecca.
arabicText: 4404 - رَوَى مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْأَوَّلِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ: "لاَ وَلِيمَةَ إِلاَّ فِي خَمْسٍ فِي عُرْسٍ أَوْ خُرْسٍ أَوْ عِذَارٍ أَوْ وِكَارٍ أَوْ رِكَازٍ فَالْعُرْسُ اَلتَّزْوِيجُ وَ اَلْخُرْسُ اَلنِّفَاسُ بِالْوَلَدِ وَ اَلْعِذَارُ اَلْخِتَانُ وَ اَلْوِكَارُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَشْتَرِي اَلدَّارَ وَ اَلرِّكَازُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَقْدَمُ مِنْ مَكَّةَ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4404 - It is narrated by Musa ibn Bakr from Imam Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as), peace be upon him, that the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no feast except on five occasions; at a wedding, at childbirth (nifas), at circumcision, when a man buys a house, and upon returning from Hajj."
The wedding refers to marriage, childbirth refers to the postnatal period, circumcision refers to the act of circumcision, buying a house refers to acquiring a new home, and returning from Hajj refers to returning from pilgrimage to Mecca.

chapter: Chapter on What a Man Should Do When His Wife is Brought to Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4405 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said to some of his companions:
"When your wife is brought to you, take hold of her forelock, face her toward the Qibla, and say: 'O Allah (swt), I have taken her with Your (swt) trust, and by Your (swt) words, I have made her lawful for myself. If You (swt) decree for me from her a child, then make him blessed, righteous, and sound, and do not allow Satan to have any share or portion in him.'"
arabicText: 4405 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِبَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ : "إِذَا أُدْخِلَتْ عَلَيْكَ أَهْلُكَ فَخُذْ بِنَاصِيَتِهَا وَ اِسْتَقْبِلْ بِهَا اَلْقِبْلَةَ وَ قُلْ: اَللَّهُمَّ بِأَمَانَتِكَ أَخَذْتُهَا وَ بِكَلِمَاتِكَ اِسْتَحْلَلْتُ فَرْجَهَا فَإِنْ قَضَيْتَ لِي مِنْهَا وَلَداً فَاجْعَلْهُ مُبَارَكاً سَوِيّاً وَ لاَ تَجْعَلْ لِلشَّيْطَانِ فِيهِ شِرْكاً وَ لاَ نَصِيباً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4405 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said to some of his companions:
thaqalaynMatn: "When your wife is brought to you, take hold of her forelock, face her toward the Qibla, and say: 'O Allah (swt), I have taken her with Your (swt) trust, and by Your (swt) words, I have made her lawful for myself. If You (swt) decree for me from her a child, then make him blessed, righteous, and sound, and do not allow Satan to have any share or portion in him.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4406 - Sulaiman bin Ja'far al-Ja'fari narrated from Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), that he said: "Whoever approaches his wife during the waning phase of the moon, let him be prepared for the miscarriage of the child."
arabicText: 4406 - رَوَى سُلَيْمَانُ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ اَلْجَعْفَرِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ: "مَنْ أَتَى أَهْلَهُ فِي مُحَاقِ اَلشَّهْرِ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ لِسِقْطِ اَلْوَلَدِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4406 - Sulaiman bin Ja'far al-Ja'fari narrated from Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever approaches his wife during the waning phase of the moon, let him be prepared for the miscarriage of the child."

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4407 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz, from Amr bin Uthman, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
I asked Imam (as): "Is it disliked to have intercourse at certain times?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, it is disliked during a night when the moon is eclipsed, during the day when the sun is eclipsed, between sunset and the disappearance of twilight, from the rising of dawn until the rising of the sun, during black, red, and yellow winds, and during earthquakes."
Imam (as) continued: "The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, spent a night with one of his wives, and the moon was eclipsed that night. He (sw) refrained from intimacy.
His (sw) wife said to him: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), may my father and mother be sacrificed for you, is all of this due to dislike?"
He (sw) replied: "Woe to you! This celestial event has occurred, and I disliked to take pleasure and engage in something (worldly) at such a time. Indeed, Allah, the Exalted, has reproached a people, saying: 'And if they see a piece of the sky falling, they would say, "A heap of clouds!"'  (Surah At-Tur 52:44)
By Allah (swt), no one engages in intimacy during these times that I (sw) have described, having heard this explanation, and is granted a child from that intimacy, except that they will see what they dislike."
arabicText:
4407 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ اَلْخَزَّازِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ أَ يُكْرَهُ اَلْجِمَاعُ فِي سَاعَةٍ مِنَ اَلسَّاعَاتِ قَالَ "نَعَمْ يُكْرَهُ فِي لَيْلَةٍ يَنْخَسِفُ فِيهَا اَلْقَمَرُ وَ اَلْيَوْمِ اَلَّذِي تَنْكَسِفُ فِيهِ اَلشَّمْسُ وَ فِيمَا بَيْنَ غُرُوبِ اَلشَّمْسِ إِلَى أَنْ يَغِيبَ اَلشَّفَقُ وَ مِنْ طُلُوعِ اَلْفَجْرِ إِلَى طُلُوعِ اَلشَّمْسِ وَ فِي اَلرِّيحِ اَلسَّوْدَاءِ وَ اَلْحَمْرَاءِ وَ اَلصَّفْرَاءِ وَ اَلزَّلْزَلَةِ وَ لَقَدْ بَاتَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَيْلَةً عِنْدَ بَعْضِ نِسَائِهِ فَانْخَسَفَ اَلْقَمَرُ فِي تِلْكَ اَللَّيْلَةِ فَلَمْ يَكُنْ مِنْهُ شَيْءٌ فَقَالَتْ لَهُ زَوْجَتُهُ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ بِأَبِي أَنْتَ وَ أُمِّي أَ كُلُّ هَذَا لِبُغْضٍ فَقَالَ "وَيْحَكِ حَدَثَ هَذَا اَلْحَادِثُ فِي اَلسَّمَاءِ فَكَرِهْتُ أَنْ أَتَلَذَّذَ وَ أَدْخُلَ فِي شَيْءٍ وَ لَقَدْ عَيَّرَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى قَوْماً فَقَالَ: ۝ وَ إِنْ يَرَوْا كِسْفاً مِنَ اَلسَّمٰاءِ سٰاقِطاً يَقُولُوا سَحٰابٌ مَرْكُومٌ ۝ "
وَ اَيْمُ اَللَّهِ لاَ يُجَامِعُ أَحَدٌ فِي هَذِهِ اَلسَّاعَاتِ اَلَّتِي وَصَفْتُ فَيُرْزَقَ مِنْ جِمَاعِهِ وَلَداً وَ قَدْ سَمِعَ هَذَا اَلْحَدِيثَ فَيَرَى مَا يُحِبُّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4407 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz, from Amr bin Uthman, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as): "Is it disliked to have intercourse at certain times?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, it is disliked during a night when the moon is eclipsed, during the day when the sun is eclipsed, between sunset and the disappearance of twilight, from the rising of dawn until the rising of the sun, during black, red, and yellow winds, and during earthquakes."
Imam (as) continued: "The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, spent a night with one of his wives, and the moon was eclipsed that night. He (sw) refrained from intimacy.
His (sw) wife said to him: 'O Messenger of Allah (swt), may my father and mother be sacrificed for you, is all of this due to dislike?"
He (sw) replied: "Woe to you! This celestial event has occurred, and I disliked to take pleasure and engage in something (worldly) at such a time. Indeed, Allah, the Exalted, has reproached a people, saying: 'And if they see a piece of the sky falling, they would say, "A heap of clouds!"'  (Surah At-Tur 52:44)
By Allah (swt), no one engages in intimacy during these times that I (sw) have described, having heard this explanation, and is granted a child from that intimacy, except that they will see what they dislike."

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4408 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"Do not have intercourse at the beginning of the month, in its middle, or at its end. For whoever does so should prepare himself for the possibility of miscarriage.
And if the child is born, it is likely to suffer from mental instability.
Do you not see that most cases of insanity occur at the beginning, middle, and end of the month?"
arabicText: 4408 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تُجَامِعْ فِي أَوَّلِ اَلشَّهْرِ وَ لاَ فِي وَسَطِهِ وَ لاَ فِي آخِرِهِ فَإِنَّهُ مَنْ فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ لِسِقْطِ اَلْوَلَدِ فَإِنْ تَمَّ أَوْشَكَ أَنْ يَكُونَ مَجْنُوناً أَ لاَ تَرَى أَنَّ اَلْمَجْنُونَ أَكْثَرُ مَا يُصْرَعُ فِي أَوَّلِ اَلشَّهْرِ وَ وَسَطِهِ وَ آخِرِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4408 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Do not have intercourse at the beginning of the month, in its middle, or at its end. For whoever does so should prepare himself for the possibility of miscarriage.
And if the child is born, it is likely to suffer from mental instability.
Do you not see that most cases of insanity occur at the beginning, middle, and end of the month?"

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4409 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said: "It is disliked to engage in janabah (ritual impurity due to sexual intercourse) when the sun is turning yellow and when it rises while it is yellow."
arabicText: 4409 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "يُكْرَهُ اَلْجَنَابَةُ حِينَ تَصْفَرُّ اَلشَّمْسُ وَ حِينَ تَطْلُعُ وَ هِيَ صَفْرَاءُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4409 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is disliked to engage in janabah (ritual impurity due to sexual intercourse) when the sun is turning yellow and when it rises while it is yellow."

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4410 - Muhammad ibn al-Faydh asked Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), saying: "May I engage in intercourse while being completely naked?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, and do not face the Qibla nor turn your back to it."
arabicText: 4410 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْفَيْضِ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فَقَالَ أُجَامِعُ وَ أَنَا عُرْيَانٌ قَالَ "لاَ وَ لاَ تَسْتَقْبِلُ اَلْقِبْلَةَ وَ لاَ تَسْتَدْبِرُهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4410 - Muhammad ibn al-Faydh asked Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), saying: "May I engage in intercourse while being completely naked?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "No, and do not face the Qibla nor turn your back to it."

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4411 - Imam (as) said: "Do not engage in intercourse on a ship."
arabicText: 4411 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "لاَ تُجَامِعْ فِي اَلسَّفِينَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4411 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not engage in intercourse on a ship."

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4412 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: "It is disliked for a man to approach his wife after having experienced a nocturnal emission (wet dream) until he has performed ghusl (ritual purification) from that emission. If he does so and the child is born with a mental disorder, he should blame none but himself."
arabicText: 4412 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "يُكْرَهُ أَنْ يَغْشَى اَلرَّجُلُ اَلْمَرْأَةَ وَ قَدِ اِحْتَلَمَ حَتَّى يَغْتَسِلَ مِنِ اِحْتِلاَمِهِ اَلَّذِي رَأَى فَإِنْ فَعَلَ فَخَرَجَ اَلْوَلَدُ مَجْنُوناً فَلاَ يَلُومَنَّ إِلاَّ نَفْسَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4412 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is disliked for a man to approach his wife after having experienced a nocturnal emission (wet dream) until he has performed ghusl (ritual purification) from that emission. If he does so and the child is born with a mental disorder, he should blame none but himself."

chapter: Chapter on the Times When Intercourse is Disliked
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4413 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: "Whoever has intercourse with his wife while she is menstruating, and a child is born afflicted with leprosy or vitiligo, let him blame none but himself."
arabicText: 4413 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَنْ جَامَعَ اِمْرَأَتَهُ وَ هِيَ حَائِضٌ فَخَرَجَ اَلْوَلَدُ مَجْذُوماً أَوْ أَبْرَصَ فَلاَ يَلُومَنَّ إِلاَّ نَفْسَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4413 - The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever has intercourse with his wife while she is menstruating, and a child is born afflicted with leprosy or vitiligo, let him blame none but himself."

chapter: Chapter on Saying the Name of Allah {swt} Before Intercourse
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4414 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said: "If one of you approaches his wife, let him remember Allah (swt), for whoever does not remember Allah (swt) during intercourse, and a child is born from it, that child will have a share of Satan's partnership.
This can be recognized by the child's love or hatred for us."
arabicText: 4414 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا أَتَى أَحَدُكُمْ أَهْلَهُ فَلْيَذْكُرِ اَللَّهَ فَإِنَّ مَنْ لَمْ يَذْكُرِ اَللَّهَ عِنْدَ اَلْجِمَاعِ وَ كَانَ مِنْهُ وَلَدٌ كَانَ ذَلِكَ شِرْكَ شَيْطَانٍ وَ يُعْرَفُ ذَلِكَ بِحُبِّنَا وَ بُغْضِنَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4414 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If one of you approaches his wife, let him remember Allah (swt), for whoever does not remember Allah (swt) during intercourse, and a child is born from it, that child will have a share of Satan's partnership.
This can be recognized by the child's love or hatred for us."

chapter: Chapter on the Permissible Duration for Abstaining From Intercourse for One Who Has a Young Free Wife
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4415 - Safwan ibn Yahya asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), about a man who has a young wife and refrains from approaching her for months or even a year, not intending to harm her but due to some hardship or difficulty they are facing. Is he considered sinful for this?
The Imam (as) replied: "If he refrains from her for four months, he is sinful after that unless it is with her consent."
arabicText: 4415 - سَأَلَ صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ تَكُونُ عِنْدَهُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلشَّابَّةُ فَيُمْسِكُ عَنْهَا اَلْأَشْهُرَ وَ اَلسَّنَةَ لاَ يَقْرَبُهَا لَيْسَ يُرِيدُ اَلْإِضْرَارَ بِهَا يَكُونُ لَهُمْ مُصِيبَةٌ يَكُونُ فِي ذَلِكَ آثِماً قَالَ "إِذَا تَرَكَهَا أَرْبَعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ كَانَ آثِماً بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ بِإِذْنِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4415 - Safwan ibn Yahya asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), about a man who has a young wife and refrains from approaching her for months or even a year, not intending to harm her but due to some hardship or difficulty they are facing. Is he considered sinful for this?
The Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he refrains from her for four months, he is sinful after that unless it is with her consent."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4416 - It is narrated from Abu al-Maghra from Al-Halabi who said that Abu Abdullah (as), said: "A woman who openly commits adultery should not be married, nor should a man who openly commits adultery be given in marriage, unless repentance is known from both of them."
arabicText: 4416 - رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْمَغْرَاءِ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تُتَزَوَّجُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْمُسْتَعْلِنَةُ بِالزِّنَا وَ لاَ يُزَوَّجُ اَلرَّجُلُ اَلْمُسْتَعْلِنُ بِالزِّنَا إِلاَّ أَنْ تُعْرَفَ مِنْهُمَا اَلتَّوْبَةُ".

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4417 - It is narrated by Dawood bin Sirhan from Zurarah, who said that Abu Abdullah (as), was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic:
"The adulterer does not marry except an adulteress or a polytheist, and the adulteress does not marry except an adulterer or a polytheist." (Surah An-Nur 24:3)
Imam (as) said: "They are women known for adultery and men known for adultery, who have been publicly infamous for committing adultery and are recognized for it.
Today, people in such a situation, whether the prescribed punishment for adultery has been carried out on them or they are publicly known for adultery, should not be married until their repentance is established."
arabicText:
4417 - رَوَى دَاوُدُ بْنُ سِرْحَانَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ:
۝ اَلزّٰانِي لاٰ يَنْكِحُ إِلاّٰ زٰانِيَةً أَوْ مُشْرِكَةً وَ اَلزّٰانِيَةُ لاٰ يَنْكِحُهٰا إِلاّٰ زٰانٍ أَوْ مُشْرِكٌ ۝
قَالَ "هُنَّ نِسَاءٌ مَشْهُورَاتٌ بِالزِّنَا وَ رِجَالٌ مَشْهُورُونَ بِالزِّنَا شُهِرُوا بِالزِّنَا وَ عُرِفُوا بِهِ وَ اَلنَّاسُ اَلْيَوْمَ بِتِلْكَ اَلْمَنْزِلَةِ مَنْ أُقِيمَ عَلَيْهِ حَدُّ اَلزِّنَا أَوْ شُهِرَ بِالزِّنَا لَمْ يَنْبَغِ لِأَحَدٍ أَنْ يُنَاكِحَهُ حَتَّى يَعْرِفَ مِنْهُ تَوْبَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4417 - It is narrated by Dawood bin Sirhan from Zurarah, who said that Abu Abdullah (as), was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The adulterer does not marry except an adulteress or a polytheist, and the adulteress does not marry except an adulterer or a polytheist." (Surah An-Nur 24:3)
Imam (as) said: "They are women known for adultery and men known for adultery, who have been publicly infamous for committing adultery and are recognized for it.
Today, people in such a situation, whether the prescribed punishment for adultery has been carried out on them or they are publicly known for adultery, should not be married until their repentance is established."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4418 - Imam (as) said: "Beware of marrying women who have been divorced three times in a single sitting, for they are still considered to have spouses."
arabicText: 4418 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "إِيَّاكُمْ وَ تَزْوِيجَ اَلْمُطَلَّقَاتِ ثَلاَثاً فِي مَجْلِسٍ وَاحِدٍ فَإِنَّهُنَّ ذَوَاتُ أَزْوَاجٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4418 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Beware of marrying women who have been divorced three times in a single sitting, for they are still considered to have spouses."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4419 - Hafs ibn Al-Bakhtari narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who wishes to marry a woman who has been divorced three times.
Imam (as) said: "He should leave her until she experiences a menstrual period and becomes pure. Then he should go to her husband along with two men and ask him, 'Have you divorced so-and-so?'
If he says yes, he should leave her for three months and then propose marriage to her himself."
arabicText: 4419 - وَ رَوَى حَفْصُ بْنُ اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ يُرِيدُ تَزْوِيجَ اِمْرَأَةٍ قَدْ طُلِّقَتْ ثَلاَثاً كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ فِيهَا قَالَ "يَدَعُهَا حَتَّى تَحِيضَ وَ تَطْهُرَ ثُمَّ يَأْتِي زَوْجَهَا وَ مَعَهُ رَجُلاَنِ فَيَقُولُ لَهُ قَدْ طَلَّقْتَ فُلاَنَةَ فَإِذَا قَالَ نَعَمْ تَرَكَهَا ثَلاَثَةَ أَشْهُرٍ ثُمَّ خَطَبَهَا إِلَى نَفْسِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4419 - Hafs ibn Al-Bakhtari narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who wishes to marry a woman who has been divorced three times.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He should leave her until she experiences a menstrual period and becomes pure. Then he should go to her husband along with two men and ask him, 'Have you divorced so-and-so?'
If he says yes, he should leave her for three months and then propose marriage to her himself."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4420 - And in another narration, Imam (as) said: "Indeed, your triple divorce does not become permissible for others, but their divorce becomes permissible for you because you do not consider the triple divorce as binding, whereas they deem it obligatory."
arabicText: 4420 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "إِنَّ طَلاَقَكُمُ اَلثَّلاَثَ لاَ يَحِلُّ لِغَيْرِكُمْ وَ طَلاَقَهُمْ يَحِلُّ لَكُمْ لِأَنَّكُمْ لاَ تَرَوْنَ اَلثَّلاَثَ شَيْئاً وَ هُمْ يُوجِبُونَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4420 - And in another narration, Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, your triple divorce does not become permissible for others, but their divorce becomes permissible for you because you do not consider the triple divorce as binding, whereas they deem it obligatory."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4421 - And Imam (as) said: "Whoever follows the religion of a people is bound by their rulings."
arabicText: 4421 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "مَنْ كَانَ يَدِينُ بِدِينِ قَوْمٍ لَزِمَتْهُ أَحْكَامُهُمْ".

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4422 - And Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Muawiyah ibn Wahb and others of our companions, from Abu Abdullah (as).
He said: I asked Imam (as) about a believing man marrying a Jewish or Christian woman.
Imam (as) replied: "If he has access to a Muslim woman, what need does he have for a Jewish or Christian woman?"
I said: "He may have affection for her."
Imam (as) said: "If he does so, then he must prevent her from drinking wine and eating pork, and know that there is a deficiency in his religion for marrying her."
arabicText: 4422 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ وَ غَيْرِهِ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِ يَتَزَوَّجُ اَلْيَهُودِيَّةَ وَ اَلنَّصْرَانِيَّةَ فَقَالَ "إِذَا أَصَابَ اَلْمُسْلِمَةَ فَمَا يَصْنَعُ بِالْيَهُودِيَّةِ وَ اَلنَّصْرَانِيَّةِ " قُلْتُ يَكُونُ لَهُ فِيهَا اَلْهَوَى قَالَ "فَإِنْ فَعَلَ فَلْيَمْنَعْهَا مِنْ شُرْبِ اَلْخَمْرِ وَ أَكْلِ لَحْمِ اَلْخِنْزِيرِ وَ اِعْلَمْ أَنَّ عَلَيْهِ فِي دِينِهِ فِي تَزْوِيجِهِ إِيَّاهَا غَضَاضَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4422 - And Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Muawiyah ibn Wahb and others of our companions, from Abu Abdullah (as).
thaqalaynMatn:
He said: I asked Imam (as) about a believing man marrying a Jewish or Christian woman.
Imam (as) replied: "If he has access to a Muslim woman, what need does he have for a Jewish or Christian woman?"
I said: "He may have affection for her."
Imam (as) said: "If he does so, then he must prevent her from drinking wine and eating pork, and know that there is a deficiency in his religion for marrying her."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4423 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Ala ibn Razin, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
He said: I asked Imam (as) about a Muslim man marrying a Magian (Zoroastrian) woman.
Imam (as) replied: "No, but if he has a Magian bondwoman, then there is no harm in having relations with her while practicing withdrawal, and he should not seek to have a child with her."
arabicText: 4423 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ اَلْعَلاَءِ بْنِ رَزِينٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُسْلِمِ يَتَزَوَّجُ اَلْمَجُوسِيَّةَ فَقَالَ "لاَ وَ لَكِنْ إِنْ كَانَتْ لَهُ أَمَةٌ مَجُوسِيَّةٌ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَطَأَهَا وَ يَعْزِلَ عَنْهَا وَ لاَ يَطْلُبَ وَلَدَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4423 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Ala ibn Razin, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
thaqalaynMatn:
He said: I asked Imam (as) about a Muslim man marrying a Magian (Zoroastrian) woman.
Imam (as) replied: "No, but if he has a Magian bondwoman, then there is no harm in having relations with her while practicing withdrawal, and he should not seek to have a child with her."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4424 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Sulayman al-Hammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "It is not appropriate for a Muslim man among you to marry a Nasibi woman, nor to give his daughter in marriage to a Nasibi man, nor to leave her with him."
arabicText: 4424 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ اَلْحَمَّارِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ يَنْبَغِي لِلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُسْلِمِ مِنْكُمْ أَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ اَلنَّاصِبِيَّةَ وَ لاَ يُزَوِّجَ اِبْنَتَهُ نَاصِباً وَ لاَ يَطْرَحَهَا عِنْدَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4424 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Sulayman al-Hammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not appropriate for a Muslim man among you to marry a Nasibi woman, nor to give his daughter in marriage to a Nasibi man, nor to leave her with him."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4425 - The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
"Two groups from my nation have no share in Islam: those who harbor enmity against my household and declare war against them, and those who are extreme in religion and deviate from it."
arabicText: 4425 - وَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "صِنْفَانِ مِنْ أُمَّتِي لاَ نَصِيبَ لَهُمَا فِي اَلْإِسْلاَمِ اَلنَّاصِبُ لِأَهْلِ بَيْتِي حَرْباً وَ غَالٍ فِي اَلدِّينِ مَارِقٌ مِنْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4425 - The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Two groups from my nation have no share in Islam: those who harbor enmity against my household and declare war against them, and those who are extreme in religion and deviate from it."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4426 - Safwan narrated from Zurara, who reported from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said: "Marry among those who are doubtful (in faith), but do not give them your daughters in marriage, for the woman adopts the manners of her husband and he compels her to follow his religion."
arabicText: 4426 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "تَزَوَّجُوا فِي اَلشُّكَّاكِ وَ لاَ تُزَوِّجُوهُمْ لِأَنَّ اَلْمَرْأَةَ تَأْخُذُ مِنْ أَدَبِ زَوْجِهَا وَ يَقْهَرُهَا عَلَى دِينِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4426 - Safwan narrated from Zurara, who reported from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Marry among those who are doubtful (in faith), but do not give them your daughters in marriage, for the woman adopts the manners of her husband and he compels her to follow his religion."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4427 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Yunus ibn Yaqub, who reported from Humran ibn Ayan: Some of his family members were seeking to marry, but they could not find a woman they deemed suitable. This matter was mentioned to Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Where are you regarding the simple and innocent women, those who know nothing?"
I said: "But people say that humanity is divided into two types: believer and disbeliever."
Imam (as) replied: "Then where are those about whom Allah (swt) said: 'They mixed a righteous deed with another that was evil.' (Surah At-Tawbah, 9:102) and where are those who are 'deferred until Allah's (swt) command,' (Surah At-Tawbah, 9:106), awaiting for Allah's (swt) pardon?"
arabicText: 4427 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ حُمْرَانَ بْنِ أَعْيَنَ : وَ كَانَ بَعْضُ أَهْلِهِ يُرِيدُ اَلتَّزْوِيجَ فَلَمْ يَجِدِ اِمْرَأَةً يَرْضَاهَا فَذُكِرَ ذَلِكَ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ "أَيْنَ أَنْتَ مِنَ اَلْبَلْهَاءِ وَ اَللَّوَاتِي لاَ يَعْرِفْنَ شَيْئاً" قُلْتُ إِنَّمَا يَقُولُ إِنَّ اَلنَّاسَ عَلَى وَجْهَيْنِ كَافِرٍ وَ مُؤْمِنٍ فَقَالَ "فَأَيْنَ اَلَّذِينَ ۝ خَلَطُوا عَمَلاً صٰالِحاً وَ آخَرَ سَيِّئاً ۝ وَ أَيْنَ اَلْ‍  ۝ مُرْجَوْنَ لِأَمْرِ اَللّٰهِ ۝ أَيْ عَفْوِ اَللَّهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4427 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Yunus ibn Yaqub, who reported from Humran ibn Ayan:
thaqalaynMatn:
Some of his family members were seeking to marry, but they could not find a woman they deemed suitable. This matter was mentioned to Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Where are you regarding the simple and innocent women, those who know nothing?"
I said: "But people say that humanity is divided into two types: believer and disbeliever."
Imam (as) replied: "Then where are those about whom Allah (swt) said: 'They mixed a righteous deed with another that was evil.' (Surah At-Tawbah, 9:102) and where are those who are 'deferred until Allah's (swt) command,' (Surah At-Tawbah, 9:106), awaiting for Allah's (swt) pardon?"

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4428 - Yaqub ibn Yazid narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Bashshar Al-Wasiti, who said:
I wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) saying:
"I have a relative who has proposed to my daughter, but he has bad character."
Imam (as) replied: "Do not marry her to him if he has bad character."
arabicText: 4428 - وَ رَوَى يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ بَشَّارٍ اَلْوَاسِطِيِّ قَالَ: كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّ لِي قَرَابَةً قَدْ خَطَبَ إِلَيَّ اِبْنَتِي وَ فِي خُلُقِهِ سُوءٌ فَقَالَ "لاَ تُزَوِّجْهُ إِنْ كَانَ سَيِّئَ اَلْخُلُقِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4428 - Yaqub ibn Yazid narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Bashshar Al-Wasiti, who said:
I wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) saying:
"I have a relative who has proposed to my daughter, but he has bad character."
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not marry her to him if he has bad character."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4429 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Jamil ibn Salih, from Zurara, who said:
I heard Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) say: "I do not like for a Muslim man to marry a woman who would be a co-wife to his mother, with someone other than his father."
arabicText: 4429 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: "مَا أُحِبُّ لِلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُسْلِمِ أَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ اِمْرَأَةً إِذَا كَانَتْ ضَرَّةً لِأُمِّهِ مَعَ غَيْرِ أَبِيهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4429 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Jamil ibn Salih, from Zurara, who said:
I heard Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn: "I do not like for a Muslim man to marry a woman who would be a co-wife to his mother, with someone other than his father."

chapter: Chapter on What Allah {swt}, the Almighty, Has Made Permissible and Prohibited in Marriage
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4430 - Muhammad ibn Ismail ibn Bazi reported that he asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), about a woman who had been afflicted with drinking wine and became intoxicated, then married herself to a man while in her intoxicated state.
When she sobered up, she denied it but then assumed that the marriage might be binding, so she remained with the man out of caution based on that marriage.
He asked whether this was lawful for her or if the marriage was invalid due to the intoxication, and whether the man had any claim over her.
Imam (as) said: "If she remained with him after she sobered up, then that is her consent."
He then asked: "Does such a marriage become valid for her?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes."
