thaqalaynMatn: The Imam (as) replied: "He cannot take it back."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4591 - Muhammad bin Yahya al-Khathami narrated from Muhammad bin Muslim:
I asked Imam (as) about a bondwoman - can a man engage in Mutah (temporary marriage) with her?
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, except if she is a young girl who can be deceived."
I said: "May Allah (swt) rectify your condition, what is the age limit at which she cannot be deceived?"
Imam (as) said: "Ten years old."
arabicText: 4591 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى اَلْخَثْعَمِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْجَارِيَةِ يَتَمَتَّعُ مِنْهَا اَلرَّجُلُ قَالَ "نَعَمْ إِلاَّ أَنْ تَكُونَ صَبِيَّةً تُخْدَعُ" قُلْتُ أَصْلَحَكَ اَللَّهُ وَ كَمِ اَلْحَدُّ اَلَّذِي إِذَا بَلَغَتْهُ لَمْ تُخْدَعْ قَالَ "اِبْنَةُ عَشْرِ سِنِينَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4591 - Muhammad bin Yahya al-Khathami narrated from Muhammad bin Muslim:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a bondwoman - can a man engage in Mutah (temporary marriage) with her?
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, except if she is a young girl who can be deceived."
I said: "May Allah (swt) rectify your condition, what is the age limit at which she cannot be deceived?"
Imam (as) said: "Ten years old."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4592 - Hafs bin al-Bakhtari narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) regarding a man who marries a virgin in Mutah (temporary marriage).
The Imam (as) said: "It is disliked (makruh) due to the reproach it may bring upon her family."
arabicText: 4592 - وَ رَوَى حَفْصُ بْنُ اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَتَزَوَّجُ اَلْبِكْرَ مُتْعَةً قَالَ "يُكْرَهُ لِلْعَيْبِ عَلَى أَهْلِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4592 - Hafs bin al-Bakhtari narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) regarding a man who marries a virgin in Mutah (temporary marriage).
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam (as) said: "It is disliked (makruh) due to the reproach it may bring upon her family."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4593 - Aban narrated from Abu Maryam, from Abu Abdillah (as):
"The virgin who has a father cannot marry in Mutah (temporary marriage) except with her father's permission."
arabicText: 4593 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ أَبِي مَرْيَمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلْعَذْرَاءُ اَلَّتِي لَهَا أَبٌ لاَ تَتَزَوَّجُ مُتْعَةً إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِ أَبِيهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4593 - Aban narrated from Abu Maryam, from Abu Abdillah (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "The virgin who has a father cannot marry in Mutah (temporary marriage) except with her father's permission."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4594 - Hammad narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
Abu Abdillah (as) was asked about Mutah (temporary marriage) - whether it is counted as part of the four [wives].
Imam (as) said: "No, and not even among seventy."
arabicText: 4594 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْمُتْعَةِ أَ هِيَ مِنَ اَلْأَرْبَعِ قَالَ "لاَ وَ لاَ مِنَ اَلسَّبْعِينَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4594 - Hammad narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
Abu Abdillah (as) was asked about Mutah (temporary marriage) - whether it is counted as part of the four [wives].
Imam (as) said: "No, and not even among seventy."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4595 - Al-Fudhayl ibn Yasaar asked him about Mutah (temporary marriage).
Imam (as) said: "It is like some of your bondwomen."
arabicText: 4595 - وَ سَأَلَهُ اَلْفُضَيْلُ بْنُ يَسَارٍ : عَنِ اَلْمُتْعَةِ فَقَالَ "هِيَ كَبَعْضِ إِمَائِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4595 - Al-Fudhayl ibn Yasaar asked him about Mutah (temporary marriage).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is like some of your bondwomen."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4596 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Umar ibn Hanzalah who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "Can I marry a woman for a month with a specified dowry, but she only fulfills part of the month and does not fulfill the rest?"
Imam (as) said: "You withhold from her dowry an amount proportional to the time she withheld herself from you, except for the days of her menstruation, as those days belong to her."
arabicText:
4596 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ حَنْظَلَةَ قَالَ:
قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَتَزَوَّجُ اَلْمَرْأَةَ شَهْراً بِشَيْءٍ مُسَمًّى فَتَأْتِي بَعْضَ اَلشَّهْرِ وَ لاَ تَفِي بِبَعْضِ اَلشَّهْرِ قَالَ "تَحْبِسُ عَنْهَا مِنْ صَدَاقِهَا بِقَدْرِ مَا اِحْتَبَسَتْ عَنْكَ إِلاَّ أَيَّامَ حَيْضِهَا فَإِنَّهَا لَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4596 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Umar ibn Hanzalah who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "Can I marry a woman for a month with a specified dowry, but she only fulfills part of the month and does not fulfill the rest?"
Imam (as) said: "You withhold from her dowry an amount proportional to the time she withheld herself from you, except for the days of her menstruation, as those days belong to her."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4597 - Muhammad ibn al-Nu'man al-Ahwal asked:
"What is the minimum requirement for a man to marry a woman in Mut'ah?"
Imam (as) replied: "A handful of wheat. He should say to her: 'Marry me to yourself in Mut'ah according to the Book of Allah (swt) and the Sunnah of His Prophet, a marriage that is not fornication, with the condition that I will not inherit from you, nor will you inherit from me, and I will not seek a child from you, for a specified period. If we both wish, we can extend the period and increase the dowry mutually.'"
arabicText:
4597 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلنُّعْمَانِ اَلْأَحْوَلُ :
فَقَالَ أَدْنَى مَا يَتَزَوَّجُ بِهِ اَلرَّجُلُ مُتْعَةً قَالَ "كَفٌّ مِنْ بُرٍّ يَقُولُ لَهَا زَوِّجِينِي نَفْسَكِ مُتْعَةً عَلَى كِتَابِ اَللَّهِ وَ سُنَّةِ نَبِيِّهِ نِكَاحاً غَيْرَ سِفَاحٍ عَلَى أَنْ لاَ أَرِثَكِ وَ لاَ تَرِثِينِي وَ لاَ أَطْلُبَ وَلَدَكِ إِلَى أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى فَإِنْ بَدَا لِي زِدْتُكِ وَ زِدْتِنِي".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4597 - Muhammad ibn al-Nu'man al-Ahwal asked:
"What is the minimum requirement for a man to marry a woman in Mut'ah?"
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "A handful of wheat. He should say to her: 'Marry me to yourself in Mut'ah according to the Book of Allah (swt) and the Sunnah of His Prophet, a marriage that is not fornication, with the condition that I will not inherit from you, nor will you inherit from me, and I will not seek a child from you, for a specified period. If we both wish, we can extend the period and increase the dowry mutually.'"

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4598 - Jamil ibn Salih reported: One of our companions said to Abu Abdillah (as):
"I feel uneasy about Mut'ah, and I have sworn that I will never engage in Mut'ah again."
Abu Abdillah (as) replied: "If you do not obey Allah (swt), then you have disobeyed Him."
arabicText: 4598 - وَ رَوَى جَمِيلُ بْنُ صَالِحٍ قَالَ إِنَّ بَعْضَ أَصْحَابِنَا قَالَ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : إِنَّهُ يَدْخُلُنِي مِنَ اَلْمُتْعَةِ شَيْءٌ فَقَدْ حَلَفْتُ أَنْ لاَ أَتَزَوَّجَ مُتْعَةً أَبَداً فَقَالَ لَهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "إِنَّكَ إِذَا لَمْ تُطِعِ اَللَّهَ فَقَدْ عَصَيْتَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4598 - Jamil ibn Salih reported: One of our companions said to Abu Abdillah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I feel uneasy about Mut'ah, and I have sworn that I will never engage in Mut'ah again."
Abu Abdillah (as) replied: "If you do not obey Allah (swt), then you have disobeyed Him."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4599 - Yunus ibn Abdul Rahman reported:
I asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about a man who married a woman in Mut'ah (temporary marriage). Later, her family came to know about it, and they married her off to another man in a public marriage, although she was a truthful woman.
Imam (as) said: "She must not allow her new husband to approach her until her waiting period ('iddah) and contract have ended."
I said: "What if her contract specifies a term of one year, and her new husband cannot wait that long?"
Imam (as) said: "Then her husband should fear Allah (swt) and waive the remaining time for her. Indeed, she has been put to trial, and this world is a place of peace, and believers live in taqiyyah (dissimulation)."
I asked: "What if he waives the remaining days for her, and her waiting period ends? What should she do?"
Imam (as) said: "When she meets her new husband, she should say: 'O man, my family forced me and married me off without consulting me. But now, I am pleased. So, let us begin today with a new, proper marriage between us.'"
I also asked Al-Ridha (as): "What about a woman who marries in Mut'ah, and after her contract ends, she marries another man before completing her waiting period?"
Imam (as) said: "What concern is it to you? The sin of that act is upon her."
arabicText: 4599 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ تَزَوَّجَ اِمْرَأَةً مُتْعَةً فَعَلِمَ بِهَا أَهْلُهَا فَزَوَّجُوهَا مِنْ رَجُلٍ فِي اَلْعَلاَنِيَةِ وَ هِيَ اِمْرَأَةُ صِدْقٍ قَالَ "لاَ تُمَكِّنُ زَوْجَهَا مِنْ نَفْسِهَا حَتَّى تَنْقَضِيَ عِدَّتُهَا وَ شَرْطُهَا" قُلْتُ إِنْ كَانَ شَرْطُهَا سَنَةً وَ لاَ يَصْبِرُ لَهَا زَوْجُهَا قَالَ "فَلْيَتَّقِ اَللَّهَ زَوْجُهَا وَ لْيَتَصَدَّقْ عَلَيْهَا بِمَا بَقِيَ لَهُ فَإِنَّهَا قَدِ اُبْتُلِيَتْ وَ اَلدَّارُ دَارُ هُدْنَةٍ وَ اَلْمُؤْمِنُونَ فِي تَقِيَّةٍ" قُلْتُ فَإِنْ تَصَدَّقَ عَلَيْهَا بِأَيَّامِهَا وَ اِنْقَضَتْ عِدَّتُهَا كَيْفَ تَصْنَعُ قَالَ "تَقُولُ لِزَوْجِهَا إِذَا دَخَلَتْ بِهِ يَا هَذَا وَثَبَ عَلَيَّ أَهْلِي فَزَوَّجُونِي بِغَيْرِ أَمْرِي وَ لَمْ يَسْتَأْمِرُونِي وَ إِنِّي اَلْآنَ قَدْ رَضِيتُ فَاسْتَأْنِفْ أَنْتَ اَلْيَوْمَ وَ تَزَوَّجْنِي تَزْوِيجاً صَحِيحاً فِيمَا بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَكَ" قَالَ وَ قُلْتُ لِلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ تَتَزَوَّجُ مُتْعَةً فَيَنْقَضِي شَرْطُهَا فَتَتَزَوَّجُ رَجُلاً آخَرَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَنْقَضِيَ عِدَّتُهَا قَالَ "وَ مَا عَلَيْكَ إِنَّمَا إِثْمُ ذَلِكَ عَلَيْهَا".

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4600 - Salih ibn Uqbah reported from his father, who reported from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
I asked him, "Is there a reward for Mut'ah?"
He (as) replied: "If he seeks by it the pleasure of Allah (swt) Almighty and to oppose those who deny it, then Allah (swt) writes a good deed for him for every word he speaks to her. When he extends his hand toward her, Allah (swt) writes a good deed for him. When he approaches her, Allah (swt) forgives a sin for him. And when he performs ghusl (ritual purification), Allah (swt) forgives him a number of sins equal to the drops of water that pass over his hair."
I asked: "Equal to the number of hairs?"
He (as) replied: "Yes, equal to the number of hairs."
arabicText: 4600 - وَ رَوَى صَالِحُ بْنُ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ لِلْمُتَمَتِّعِ ثَوَابٌ قَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ يُرِيدُ بِذَلِكَ وَجْهَ اَللَّهِ تَعَالَى وَ خِلاَفاً عَلَى مَنْ أَنْكَرَهَا لَمْ يُكَلِّمْهَا كَلِمَةً إِلاَّ كَتَبَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى لَهُ بِهَا حَسَنَةً وَ لَمْ يَمُدَّ يَدَهُ إِلَيْهَا إِلاَّ كَتَبَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ حَسَنَةً فَإِذَا دَنَا مِنْهَا غَفَرَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى لَهُ بِذَلِكَ ذَنْباً فَإِذَا اِغْتَسَلَ غَفَرَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ بِقَدْرِ مَا مَرَّ مِنَ اَلْمَاءِ عَلَى شَعْرِهِ" قُلْتُ بِعَدَدِ اَلشَّعْرِ قَالَ "نَعَمْ بِعَدَدِ اَلشَّعْرِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4600 - Salih ibn Uqbah reported from his father, who reported from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him, "Is there a reward for Mut'ah?"
He (as) replied: "If he seeks by it the pleasure of Allah (swt) Almighty and to oppose those who deny it, then Allah (swt) writes a good deed for him for every word he speaks to her. When he extends his hand toward her, Allah (swt) writes a good deed for him. When he approaches her, Allah (swt) forgives a sin for him. And when he performs ghusl (ritual purification), Allah (swt) forgives him a number of sins equal to the drops of water that pass over his hair."
I asked: "Equal to the number of hairs?"
He (as) replied: "Yes, equal to the number of hairs."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4601 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
"When the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) was taken up to the heavens (Mi'raj), Jibril (as) came to him and said: 'O Muhammad (as)! Verily, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, says: I have forgiven those among your followers who engage in Mut'ah with women.'"
arabicText: 4601 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَلنَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَمَّا أُسْرِيَ بِهِ إِلَى اَلسَّمَاءِ قَالَ لَحِقَنِي جَبْرَئِيلُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ يَا مُحَمَّدُ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى يَقُولُ "إِنِّي قَدْ غَفَرْتُ لِلْمُتَمَتِّعِينَ مِنْ أُمَّتِكَ مِنَ اَلنِّسَاءِ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4601 - Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) was taken up to the heavens (Mi'raj), Jibril (as) came to him and said: 'O Muhammad (as)! Verily, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, says: I have forgiven those among your followers who engage in Mut'ah with women.'"

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4602 - Bakr ibn Muhammad narrated from Abu Abdillah (as): I asked him about Mut'ah (temporary marriage).
Imam (as) said: "Indeed, I dislike for a Muslim man to leave this world while there remains an unfulfilled practice from the practices of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) that he did not act upon."
arabicText: 4602 - وَ رَوَى بَكْرُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمُتْعَةِ فَقَالَ "إِنِّي لَأَكْرَهُ لِلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُسْلِمِ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ مِنَ اَلدُّنْيَا وَ قَدْ بَقِيَتْ عَلَيْهِ خَلَّةٌ مِنْ خِلاَلِ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَمْ يَقْضِهَا ".

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4603 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah:
I read in a man's letter to Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who married a woman in Mut'ah (temporary marriage) for a specified period. When the term between them ended, he asked whether it was permissible for him to marry her sister.
Imam (as) replied: "It is not permissible for him until her waiting period ('iddah) has ended."
arabicText: 4603 - وَ رَوَى اَلْقَاسِمُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْجَوْهَرِيُّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ: قَرَأْتُ فِي كِتَابِ رَجُلٍ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ تَزَوَّجَ بِامْرَأَةٍ مُتْعَةً إِلَى أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى فَإِذَا اِنْقَضَى اَلْأَجَلُ بَيْنَهُمَا هَلْ يَحِلُّ لَهُ أَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ بِأُخْتِهَا فَقَالَ "لاَ يَحِلُّ لَهُ حَتَّى تَنْقَضِيَ عِدَّتُهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4603 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah:
I read in a man's letter to Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who married a woman in Mut'ah (temporary marriage) for a specified period. When the term between them ended, he asked whether it was permissible for him to marry her sister.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not permissible for him until her waiting period ('iddah) has ended."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4604 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr asked al-Ridha (as) about a man who marries a woman in Mut'ah (temporary marriage).
Is it permissible for him to marry her daughter permanently?
Imam (as) replied: "No."
arabicText: 4604 - وَ سَأَلَ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَتَزَوَّجُ اَلْمَرْأَةَ مُتْعَةً أَ يَحِلُّ لَهُ أَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ اِبْنَتَهَا بَتَاتاً قَالَ "لاَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4604 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr asked al-Ridha (as) about a man who marries a woman in Mut'ah (temporary marriage).
Is it permissible for him to marry her daughter permanently?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "No."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4605 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Zurara, who said:
I heard Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) saying:
"The waiting period ('Iddah) for Mut'ah (temporary marriage) is forty-five days."
Imam (as) then demonstrated by holding up his hand and showing forty-five days.
"When the specified term ends, the separation occurs without the need for divorce."
arabicText: 4605 - وَ رَوَى مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: "عِدَّةُ اَلْمُتْعَةِ خَمْسَةٌ وَ أَرْبَعُونَ يَوْماً" كَأَنِّي أَنْظُرُ إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَعْقِدُ بِيَدِهِ خَمْسَةً وَ أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً "فَإِذَا جَاءَ اَلْأَجَلُ كَانَتْ فُرْقَةً بِغَيْرِ طَلاَقٍ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4605 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Zurara, who said:
I heard Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) saying:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The waiting period ('Iddah) for Mut'ah (temporary marriage) is forty-five days."
Imam (as) then demonstrated by holding up his hand and showing forty-five days.
"When the specified term ends, the separation occurs without the need for divorce."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4606 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who entered into a Mut'ah (temporary marriage) and then her husband passed away.
Imam (as) said: "She must observe an 'Iddah (waiting period) of four months and ten days."
Then Imam (as) continued: "If her term ends while he is still alive, her waiting period is one and a half menstrual cycles, similar to what is required for a female slave."
I asked: "Does she need to observe mourning (Hadd)?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, but if she stayed with him for a day, two days, or even just an hour during the day, the waiting period becomes obligatory, but mourning (Hadd) is not required."
arabicText: 4606 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ اَلْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ يَتَزَوَّجُهَا اَلرَّجُلُ مُتْعَةً ثُمَّ يُتَوَفَّى عَنْهَا هَلْ عَلَيْهَا اَلْعِدَّةُ قَالَ "تَعْتَدُّ أَرْبَعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ وَ عَشْراً فَإِذَا اِنْقَضَتْ أَيَّامُهَا وَ هُوَ حَيٌّ فَحَيْضَةٌ وَ نِصْفٌ مِثْلَ مَا يَجِبُ عَلَى اَلْأَمَةِ" قَالَ قُلْتُ فَتُحِدُّ قَالَ "نَعَمْ وَ إِذَا مَكَثَتْ عِنْدَهُ يَوْماً أَوْ يَوْمَيْنِ أَوْ سَاعَةً مِنَ اَلنَّهَارِ فَقَدْ وَجَبَتِ اَلْعِدَّةُ وَ لاَ تُحِدُّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4606 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who entered into a Mut'ah (temporary marriage) and then her husband passed away.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "She must observe an 'Iddah (waiting period) of four months and ten days."
Then Imam (as) continued: "If her term ends while he is still alive, her waiting period is one and a half menstrual cycles, similar to what is required for a female slave."
I asked: "Does she need to observe mourning (Hadd)?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, but if she stayed with him for a day, two days, or even just an hour during the day, the waiting period becomes obligatory, but mourning (Hadd) is not required."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4607 - Umar ibn Udhaynah narrated from Zurara, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about the waiting period ('Iddah) for a woman in a Mut'ah (temporary marriage) if her husband passes away.
Imam (as) replied: "It is four months and ten days."
Then Imam (as) continued:
"O Zurara, for every type of marriage-whether the woman is free or a slave, and regardless of whether the marriage was permanent (Nikah), temporary (Mut'ah), or through ownership (Milk Yamin)-if the husband dies, the waiting period ('Iddah) is four months and ten days."
"However, the waiting period ('Iddah) for a divorced woman is three months, and for a divorced female slave, it is half the waiting period of a free woman. Similarly, the waiting period ('Iddah) for a woman in Mut'ah is the same as that for a female slave."
arabicText: 4607 - وَ رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَا عِدَّةُ اَلْمُتْعَةِ إِذَا مَاتَ عَنْهَا اَلَّذِي تَمَتَّعَ بِهَا قَالَ "أَرْبَعَةُ أَشْهُرٍ وَ عَشْراً" قَالَ ثُمَّ قَالَ "يَا زُرَارَةُ كُلُّ نِكَاحٍ إِذَا مَاتَ عَنْهَا اَلزَّوْجُ فَعَلَى اَلْمَرْأَةِ حُرَّةً كَانَتْ أَوْ أَمَةً أَوْ عَلَى أَيِّ وَجْهٍ كَانَ اَلنِّكَاحُ مِنْهُ مُتْعَةً أَوْ تَزْوِيجاً أَوْ مِلْكَ يَمِينٍ فَالْعِدَّةُ أَرْبَعَةُ أَشْهُرٍ وَ عَشْراً وَ عِدَّةُ اَلْمُطَلَّقَةِ ثَلاَثَةُ أَشْهُرٍ وَ اَلْأَمَةُ اَلْمُطَلَّقَةُ عَلَيْهَا نِصْفُ مَا عَلَى اَلْحُرَّةِ وَ كَذَلِكَ اَلْمُتْعَةُ عَلَيْهَا مِثْلُ مَا عَلَى اَلْأَمَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4607 - Umar ibn Udhaynah narrated from Zurara, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about the waiting period ('Iddah) for a woman in a Mut'ah (temporary marriage) if her husband passes away.
Imam (as) replied: "It is four months and ten days."
Then Imam (as) continued:
"O Zurara, for every type of marriage-whether the woman is free or a slave, and regardless of whether the marriage was permanent (Nikah), temporary (Mut'ah), or through ownership (Milk Yamin)-if the husband dies, the waiting period ('Iddah) is four months and ten days."
"However, the waiting period ('Iddah) for a divorced woman is three months, and for a divorced female slave, it is half the waiting period of a free woman. Similarly, the waiting period ('Iddah) for a woman in Mut'ah is the same as that for a female slave."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4608 - It was said to Abu Abdullah (as): "Why has Allah (swt) prescribed four witnesses for proving adultery (Zina) and only two witnesses for proving murder?"
Imam (as) replied: "Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has made Mut'ah (temporary marriage) lawful for you, and He (swt) knew that it would be denied and rejected by people. Therefore, He (swt) required four witnesses as a precaution for you.
Had it not been for this requirement, people would have accused you unjustly. And it is rare for four people to come together and testify about the same matter."
arabicText: 4608 - : وَ قِيلَ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لِمَ جَعَلَ فِي اَلزِّنَا أَرْبَعَةً مِنَ اَلشُّهُودِ وَ فِي اَلْقَتْلِ شَاهِدَيْنِ قَالَ "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى أَحَلَّ لَكُمُ اَلْمُتْعَةَ وَ عَلِمَ أَنَّهَا سَتُنْكَرُ عَلَيْكُمْ فَجَعَلَ اَلْأَرْبَعَةَ اَلشُّهُودِ اِحْتِيَاطاً لَكُمْ وَ لَوْ لاَ ذَلِكَ لَأُتِيَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَ قَلَّ مَا يَجْتَمِعُ أَرْبَعَةٌ عَلَى شَهَادَةٍ بِأَمْرٍ وَاحِدٍ".

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4609 - It is narrated from Bakkar bin Kardam, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "A man meets a woman and says to her, 'Marry me to yourself for a month,' but he does not specify which month. Then he meets her again after several years-does he still have his month?"
Imam (as) replied: "He has his month if he had specified it. However, if he did not specify it, then he has no claim over her."
arabicText: 4609 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ بَكَّارِ بْنِ كَرْدَمٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَلْقَى اَلْمَرْأَةَ فَيَقُولُ لَهَا زَوِّجِينِي نَفْسَكِ شَهْراً وَ لاَ يُسَمِّي اَلشَّهْرَ بِعَيْنِهِ فَيَلْقَاهَا بَعْدَ سِنِينَ فَقَالَ "لَهُ شَهْرُهُ إِنْ كَانَ سَمَّاهُ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ سَمَّاهُ فَلاَ سَبِيلَ لَهُ عَلَيْهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4609 - It is narrated from Bakkar bin Kardam, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "A man meets a woman and says to her, 'Marry me to yourself for a month,' but he does not specify which month. Then he meets her again after several years-does he still have his month?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "He has his month if he had specified it. However, if he did not specify it, then he has no claim over her."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4610 - It is narrated from Zur'ah, from Sama'ah, who said:
I asked him about a man who took a bondwoman for temporary marriage but forgot and had intercourse with her. Does he deserve the punishment of a fornicator?
Imam (as) replied: "No, but he should perform the temporary marriage contract with her again and seek forgiveness from Allah (swt) for what he has done."
arabicText: 4610 - وَ رَوَى زُرْعَةُ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَدْخَلَ جَارِيَةً يَتَمَتَّعُ بِهَا ثُمَّ أُنْسِيَ حَتَّى وَاقَعَهَا هَلْ يَجِبُ عَلَيْهِ حَدُّ اَلزَّانِي قَالَ "لاَ وَ لَكِنْ يَتَمَتَّعُ بِهَا بَعْدَ اَلنِّكَاحِ وَ يَسْتَغْفِرُ اَللَّهَ مِمَّا أَتَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4610 - It is narrated from Zur'ah, from Sama'ah, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about a man who took a bondwoman for temporary marriage but forgot and had intercourse with her. Does he deserve the punishment of a fornicator?
Imam (as) replied: "No, but he should perform the temporary marriage contract with her again and seek forgiveness from Allah (swt) for what he has done."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4611 - It is narrated from Ali ibn Asbat, from Muhammad ibn Udhafir, from someone he mentioned, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about engaging in temporary marriage with virgins.
Imam (as) replied: "Was it not made permissible except for them? So let them observe modesty and chastity."
arabicText: 4611 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُذَافِرٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلتَّمَتُّعِ بِالْأَبْكَارِ قَالَ "هَلْ جُعِلَ ذَلِكَ إِلاَّ لَهُنَّ فَلْيَسْتَتِرْنَ مِنْهُ وَ لْيَسْتَعْفِفْنَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4611 - It is narrated from Ali ibn Asbat, from Muhammad ibn Udhafir, from someone he mentioned, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about engaging in temporary marriage with virgins.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Was it not made permissible except for them? So let them observe modesty and chastity."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4612 - It is narrated from Ishaq in Ammar, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): A man married a young bondwoman with the condition that he would not deflower her. Then afterward, she gave him permission.
Imam (as) replied: "If she gave him permission, then there is no harm in it."
arabicText: 4612 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ تَزَوَّجَ بِجَارِيَةٍ عَاتِقٍ عَلَى أَنْ لاَ يَقْتَضَّهَا ثُمَّ أَذِنَتْ لَهُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ قَالَ "إِذَا أَذِنَتْ لَهُ فَلاَ بَأْسَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4612 - It is narrated from Ishaq in Ammar, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): A man married a young bondwoman with the condition that he would not deflower her. Then afterward, she gave him permission.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If she gave him permission, then there is no harm in it."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4613 - It is narrated: "A believer does not attain completeness until he practices Mut'ah."
arabicText: 4613 - وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ اَلْمُؤْمِنَ لاَ يَكْمُلُ حَتَّى يَتَمَتَّعَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4613 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "A believer does not attain completeness until he practices Mut'ah."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4614 - It is narrated from Jabir ibn Abdullah Al-Ansari that:
The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, addressed the people and said: "O people, indeed Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has made permissible for you intimate relations in three forms: an inherited relationship, which is permanent (Nikah); a non-inherited relationship, which is Mut'ah; and what your right hands possess (slavery)."
arabicText: 4614 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ اَلْأَنْصَارِيِّ : أَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ خَطَبَ اَلنَّاسَ فَقَالَ "أَيُّهَا اَلنَّاسُ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى أَحَلَّ لَكُمُ اَلْفُرُوجَ عَلَى ثَلاَثَةِ مَعَانٍ فَرْجِ مَوْرُوثٍ وَ هُوَ اَلْبَتَاتُ وَ فَرْجِ غَيْرِ مَوْرُوثٍ وَ هُوَ اَلْمُتْعَةُ وَ مِلْكِ أَيْمَانِكُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4614 - It is narrated from Jabir ibn Abdullah Al-Ansari that:
The Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, addressed the people and said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O people, indeed Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has made permissible for you intimate relations in three forms: an inherited relationship, which is permanent (Nikah); a non-inherited relationship, which is Mut'ah; and what your right hands possess (slavery)."

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4615 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
"Indeed, I dislike for a man to die while there remains a Sunnah of the practices of the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, that he did not act upon."
I said to him: "Did the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, perform Mut'ah?"
He replied: "Yes," and then recited this verse:
"'And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement'... to His saying: 'widowed and virgins'" (Surah Al-Tahrim 66:3-5).
arabicText: 4615 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنِّي لَأَكْرَهُ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَمُوتَ وَ قَدْ بَقِيَتْ عَلَيْهِ خَلَّةٌ مِنْ خِلاَلِ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَمْ يَأْتِهَا" فَقُلْتُ لَهُ فَهَلْ تَمَتَّعَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ "نَعَمْ" وَ قَرَأَ هَذِهِ اَلْآيَةَ " ۝ وَ إِذْ أَسَرَّ اَلنَّبِيُّ إِلىٰ بَعْضِ أَزْوٰاجِهِ حَدِيثاً ۝ إِلَى قَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى ۝ ثَيِّبٰاتٍ وَ أَبْكٰاراً ۝ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4615 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Indeed, I dislike for a man to die while there remains a Sunnah of the practices of the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, that he did not act upon."
I said to him: "Did the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family, perform Mut'ah?"
He replied: "Yes," and then recited this verse:
"'And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement'... to His saying: 'widowed and virgins'" (Surah Al-Tahrim 66:3-5).

chapter: Chapter on Temporary Marriage (mutʿah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4616 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said: "Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, has forbidden all intoxicating drinks for our Shia and has compensated them with mut'ah (temporary marriage)."
arabicText: 4616 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى حَرَّمَ عَلَى شِيعَتِنَا اَلْمُسْكِرَ مِنْ كُلِّ شَرَابٍ وَ عَوَّضَهُمْ مِنْ ذَلِكَ اَلْمُتْعَةَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4616 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdillah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Allah (swt), Blessed and Exalted, has forbidden all intoxicating drinks for our Shia and has compensated them with mut'ah (temporary marriage)."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4617 - Isma'il ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers (peace be upon them) that the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"It is not permissible for a woman who is menstruating to adopt a qussah (a specific type of cloth) or a jummah (a certain hairstyle or wig)."
arabicText: 4617 - رَوَى إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "لاَ يَحِلُّ لاِمْرَأَةٍ حَاضَتْ أَنْ تَتَّخِذَ قُصَّةً وَ لاَ جُمَّةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4617 - Isma'il ibn Muslim narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers (peace be upon them) that the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not permissible for a woman who is menstruating to adopt a qussah (a specific type of cloth) or a jummah (a certain hairstyle or wig)."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4618 - Imam (as) said: "May Allah have mercy on the Musarwalat (those who wear trousers or are modestly covered)."
arabicText: 4618 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "رَحِمَ اَللَّهُ اَلْمُسَرْوَلاَتِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4618 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "May Allah have mercy on the Musarwalat (those who wear trousers or are modestly covered)."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4619 - Imam (as) said: "When a woman leaves her seat, no one should sit in her place until it has cooled down."
arabicText: 4619 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "إِذَا جَلَسَتِ اَلْمَرْأَةُ مَجْلِساً فَقَامَتْ عَنْهُ فَلاَ يَجْلِسُ فِي مَجْلِسِهَا أَحَدٌ حَتَّى يَبْرُدَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4619 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a woman leaves her seat, no one should sit in her place until it has cooled down."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4620 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, created desire in ten parts, nine parts in men and one part in women."
arabicText: 4620 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ خَلَقَ اَلشَّهْوَةَ عَشَرَةَ أَجْزَاءٍ تِسْعَةً فِي اَلرِّجَالِ وَ وَاحِدَةً فِي اَلنِّسَاءِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4620 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, created desire in ten parts, nine parts in men and one part in women."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4621 - Jabir narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that he said: "Regarding women, do not consult them in confidential matters, and do not obey them in matters concerning relatives.
When a woman grows old, the better half of her qualities departs, and the worse half remains, her beauty fades, her tongue becomes sharper, and her womb becomes barren.
However, when a man grows old, the worse half of his qualities departs, and the better half remains, his intellect becomes more steadfast, his judgment more firm, and his ignorance decreases."
arabicText:
4621 - وَ رَوَى جَابِرٌ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ:
"فِي اَلنِّسَاءِ لاَ تُشَاوِرُوهُنَّ فِي اَلنَّجْوَى وَ لاَ تُطِيعُوهُنَّ فِي ذِي قَرَابَةٍ إِنَّ اَلْمَرْأَةَ إِذَا كَبِرَتْ ذَهَبَ خَيْرُ شَطْرَيْهَا وَ بَقِيَ شَرُّهُمَا ذَهَبَ جَمَالُهَا وَ اِحْتَدَّ لِسَانُهَا وَ عَقِمَ رَحِمُهَا وَ إِنَّ اَلرَّجُلَ إِذَا كَبِرَ ذَهَبَ شَرُّ شَطْرَيْهِ وَ بَقِيَ خَيْرُهُمَا ثَبَتَ عَقْلُهُ وَ اِسْتَحْكَمَ رَأْيُهُ وَ قَلَّ جَهْلُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4621 - Jabir narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Regarding women, do not consult them in confidential matters, and do not obey them in matters concerning relatives.
When a woman grows old, the better half of her qualities departs, and the worse half remains, her beauty fades, her tongue becomes sharper, and her womb becomes barren.
However, when a man grows old, the worse half of his qualities departs, and the better half remains, his intellect becomes more steadfast, his judgment more firm, and his ignorance decreases."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4622 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Any man who is ruled by a woman is cursed."
arabicText: 4622 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "كُلُّ اِمْرِئٍ تُدَبِّرُهُ اِمْرَأَةٌ فَهُوَ مَلْعُونٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4622 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Any man who is ruled by a woman is cursed."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4623 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "There is blessing in opposing them."
arabicText: 4623 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "فِي خِلاَفِهِنَّ اَلْبَرَكَةُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4623 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is blessing in opposing them."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4624 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), whenever He (sw) intended to go to war, would consult his wives and then act contrary to their advice.
arabicText: 4624 - : وَ كَانَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِذَا أَرَادَ اَلْحَرْبَ دَعَا نِسَاءَهُ فَاسْتَشَارَهُنَّ ثُمَّ خَالَفَهُنَّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4624 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family),
thaqalaynMatn: whenever He (sw) intended to go to war, would consult his wives and then act contrary to their advice.

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4625 - He (as) forbade riding a saddle with a gap.
arabicText: 4625 - : وَ نَهَى عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنْ يُرْكَبَ اَلسَّرْجُ بِفَرْجٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4625 - He (as)
thaqalaynMatn: forbade riding a saddle with a gap.

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4626 - Commander of the Faithful (as) said: "Do not place women on saddles, for it may provoke them toward immorality."
arabicText: 4626 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تَحْمِلُوا اَلْفُرُوجَ عَلَى اَلسُّرُوجِ فَتُهَيِّجُوهُنَّ لِلْفُجُورِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4626 - Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not place women on saddles, for it may provoke them toward immorality."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4627 - Al-Fudayl narrated from Abu Abdullah (as). I said to Imam (as):
"There is something people say, that most of the inhabitants of Hell on the Day of Judgment will be women."
Imam (as) replied: "How can that be, when a man may marry a thousand women of this world in the Hereafter, all within a single palace made of one pearl?"
arabicText:
4627 - وَ رَوَى اَلْفُضَيْلُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ قَالَ:
قُلْتُ لَهُ شَيْءٌ يَقُولُهُ اَلنَّاسُ إِنَّ أَكْثَرَ أَهْلِ اَلنَّارِ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ اَلنِّسَاءُ قَالَ "وَ أَنَّى ذَلِكَ وَ قَدْ يَتَزَوَّجُ اَلرَّجُلُ فِي اَلْآخِرَةِ أَلْفاً مِنْ نِسَاءِ اَلدُّنْيَا فِي قَصْرٍ مِنْ دُرَّةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4627 - Al-Fudayl narrated from Abu Abdullah (as). I said to Imam (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is something people say, that most of the inhabitants of Hell on the Day of Judgment will be women."
Imam (as) replied: "How can that be, when a man may marry a thousand women of this world in the Hereafter, all within a single palace made of one pearl?"

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4628 - Ammar Al-Sabati narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"The majority of the inhabitants of Paradise will be the weak women. Allah (swt), the Almighty, knew their weakness and thus had mercy on them."
arabicText: 4628 - وَ رَوَى عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "أَكْثَرُ أَهْلِ اَلْجَنَّةِ مِنَ اَلْمُسْتَضْعَفِينَ اَلنِّسَاءُ، عَلِمَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ضَعْفَهُنَّ فَرَحِمَهُنَّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4628 - Ammar Al-Sabati narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The majority of the inhabitants of Paradise will be the weak women. Allah (swt), the Almighty, knew their weakness and thus had mercy on them."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4629 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "The private parts of the women of my nation are forbidden to the men of my nation."
arabicText: 4629 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَحَاشُّ نِسَاءِ أُمَّتِي عَلَى رِجَالِ أُمَّتِي حَرَامٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4629 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The private parts of the women of my nation are forbidden to the men of my nation."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4630 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Modesty consists of ten parts-nine of them are in women and one is in men. When a woman undergoes circumcision, one part of her modesty diminishes. When she marries, another part diminishes. When her virginity is taken, another part diminishes. When she gives birth, another part diminishes, leaving her with five parts of modesty. If she commits adultery, all her modesty is lost, but if she remains chaste, the five parts of modesty remain with her."
arabicText: 4630 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْحَيَاءُ عَشَرَةُ أَجْزَاءٍ تِسْعَةٌ فِي اَلنِّسَاءِ وَ وَاحِدَةٌ فِي اَلرِّجَالِ فَإِذَا خُفِضَتْ ذَهَبَ جُزْءٌ مِنْ حَيَائِهَا وَ إِذَا تَزَوَّجَتْ ذَهَبَ جُزْءٌ فَإِذَا اُفْتُرِعَتْ ذَهَبَ جُزْءٌ وَ إِذَا وَلَدَتْ ذَهَبَ جُزْءٌ وَ بَقِيَ لَهَا خَمْسَةُ أَجْزَاءٍ فَإِذَا فَجَرَتْ ذَهَبَ حَيَاؤُهَا كُلُّهُ وَ إِنْ عَفَّتْ بَقِيَ لَهَا خَمْسَةُ أَجْزَاءٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4630 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Modesty consists of ten parts-nine of them are in women and one is in men. When a woman undergoes circumcision, one part of her modesty diminishes. When she marries, another part diminishes. When her virginity is taken, another part diminishes. When she gives birth, another part diminishes, leaving her with five parts of modesty. If she commits adultery, all her modesty is lost, but if she remains chaste, the five parts of modesty remain with her."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4631 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "The virtuous and beautiful women of the people of this world are more beautiful than the houris of Paradise, and there is no harm if a man looks at his wife while she is unclothed."
arabicText: 4631 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْخَيْرَاتُ اَلْحِسَانُ مِنْ نِسَاءِ أَهْلِ اَلدُّنْيَا وَ هُنَّ أَجْمَلُ مِنَ اَلْحُورِ اَلْعِينِ وَ لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَنْظُرَ اَلرَّجُلُ إِلَى اِمْرَأَتِهِ وَ هِيَ عُرْيَانَةٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4631 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The virtuous and beautiful women of the people of this world are more beautiful than the houris of Paradise, and there is no harm if a man looks at his wife while she is unclothed."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4632 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated that he said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as): "Can a servant look at the hair of his mistress?"
The Imam replied: "Yes, and at her legs as well."
arabicText: 4632 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَ يَنْظُرُ اَلْمَمْلُوكُ إِلَى شَعْرِ مَوْلاَتِهِ قَالَ "نَعَمْ وَ إِلَى سَاقِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4632 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated that he said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"Can a servant look at the hair of his mistress?"
The Imam replied: "Yes, and at her legs as well."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4633 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn Ishaq ibn Ammar that he said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (as): "Can a eunuch belonging to a man enter upon his women and hand them water for ablution, thereby seeing their hair?"
The Imam (as) replied: "No."
arabicText:
4633 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ:
قُلْتُ لِأَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَكُونُ لِلرَّجُلِ اَلْخَصِيُّ يَدْخُلُ عَلَى نِسَائِهِ يُنَاوِلُهُنَّ اَلْوَضُوءَ فَيَرَى شُعُورَهُنَّ قَالَ "لاَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4633 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn Ishaq ibn Ammar that he said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (as): "Can a eunuch belonging to a man enter upon his women and hand them water for ablution, thereby seeing their hair?"
thaqalaynMatn: The Imam (as) replied: "No."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4634 - In a narration from Rabi' ibn Abdullah:
When the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) took the pledge of allegiance from the women, he brought a vessel, filled it with water, and dipped his hand into it. Then he withdrew his hand and instructed the women to dip their hands into the vessel and immerse them.
He (as) would greet women, and they would return the greeting. Commander of the Faithful (as) would also greet women but disliked greeting young women.
Imam (as) said: "I fear that their voice might please me, and thereby I would fall into sin greater than the reward I seek."
arabicText: 4634 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ رِبْعِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ : أَنَّهُ لَمَّا بَايَعَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَلنِّسَاءَ وَ أَخَذَ عَلَيْهِنَّ دَعَا بِإِنَاءٍ فَمَلَأَهُ ثُمَّ غَمَسَ يَدَهُ فِي اَلْإِنَاءِ ثُمَّ أَخْرَجَهَا فَأَمَرَهُنَّ أَنْ يُدْخِلْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ فَيَغْمِسْنَ فِيهِ وَ كَانَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُسَلِّمُ عَلَى اَلنِّسَاءِ وَ يَرْدُدْنَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمَ وَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُسَلِّمُ عَلَى اَلنِّسَاءِ وَ كَانَ يَكْرَهُ أَنْ يُسَلِّمَ عَلَى اَلشَّابَّةِ مِنْهُنَّ وَ قَالَ "أَتَخَوَّفُ أَنْ يُعْجِبَنِي صَوْتُهَا فَيَدْخُلَ مِنَ اَلْإِثْمِ عَلَيَّ أَكْثَرُ مِمَّا أَطْلُبُ مِنَ اَلْأَجْرِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4634 - In a narration from Rabi' ibn Abdullah:
thaqalaynMatn:
When the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) took the pledge of allegiance from the women, he brought a vessel, filled it with water, and dipped his hand into it. Then he withdrew his hand and instructed the women to dip their hands into the vessel and immerse them.
He (as) would greet women, and they would return the greeting. Commander of the Faithful (as) would also greet women but disliked greeting young women.
Imam (as) said: "I fear that their voice might please me, and thereby I would fall into sin greater than the reward I seek."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4635 - Abu Basir asked Abu Abdullah (as): "Can a man shake hands with a woman who is not his mahram?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, except from behind a cloth."
arabicText: 4635 - وَ سَأَلَ أَبُو بَصِيرٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : هَلْ يُصَافِحُ اَلرَّجُلُ اَلْمَرْأَةَ لَيْسَتْ لَهُ بِذِي مَحْرَمٍ قَالَ "لاَ إِلاَّ مِنْ وَرَاءِ اَلثَّوْبِ".

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4636 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abbad ibn Suhayb who said:
I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say:
"There is no harm in looking at the hair of the women of Tihama, the Bedouins, the people of the desert from among the People of the Book (Ahl al-Dhimma), and non-Arab pagans (al-'uluj), because if they are forbidden, they do not comply."
Imam (as) also said: "As for a madwoman who is overpowered by her condition, there is no harm in looking at her hair and body, as long as it is not done deliberately."
arabicText:
4636 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبَّادِ بْنِ صُهَيْبٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ:
"لاَ بَأْسَ بِالنَّظَرِ إِلَى شُعُورِ نِسَاءِ أَهْلِ تِهَامَةَ وَ اَلْأَعْرَابِ وَ أَهْلِ اَلْبَوَادِي مِنْ أَهْلِ اَلذِّمَّةِ وَ اَلْعُلُوجِ لِأَنَّهُنَّ إِذَا نُهِينَ لاَ يَنْتَهِينَ " قَالَ "وَ اَلْمَجْنُونَةُ اَلْمَغْلُوبَةُ لاَ بَأْسَ بِالنَّظَرِ إِلَى شَعْرِهَا وَ جَسَدِهَا مَا لَمْ يَتَعَمَّدْ ذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4636 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abbad ibn Suhayb who said:
I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no harm in looking at the hair of the women of Tihama, the Bedouins, the people of the desert from among the People of the Book (Ahl al-Dhimma), and non-Arab pagans (al-'uluj), because if they are forbidden, they do not comply."
Imam (as) also said: "As for a madwoman who is overpowered by her condition, there is no harm in looking at her hair and body, as long as it is not done deliberately."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4637 - Ammar Al-Sabati asked Abu Abdullah (as) about how women should greet when they enter upon a group of people.
Imam (as) replied:
"A woman should say, 'Peace be upon you (ʿAlaykum al-Salam),' and a man should say, 'Peace be upon you all (Al-Salam ʿAlaykum).'"
arabicText: 4637 - وَ سَأَلَ عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلنِّسَاءِ كَيْفَ يُسَلِّمْنَ إِذَا دَخَلْنَ عَلَى اَلْقَوْمِ قَالَ "اَلْمَرْأَةُ تَقُولُ عَلَيْكُمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ اَلرَّجُلُ يَقُولُ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4637 - Ammar Al-Sabati asked Abu Abdullah (as) about how women should greet when they enter upon a group of people.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman should say, 'Peace be upon you (ʿAlaykum al-Salam),' and a man should say, 'Peace be upon you all (Al-Salam ʿAlaykum).'"

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4638 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who marries a woman while she has a husband.
Imam (as) said: "If the matter is not brought to the attention of the Imam, he must give five sa' (measures) of flour in charity. This is after he separates from her."
arabicText: 4638 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ يَتَزَوَّجُ اِمْرَأَةً وَ لَهَا زَوْجٌ فَقَالَ "إِذَا لَمْ يُرْفَعْ خَبَرُهُ إِلَى اَلْإِمَامِ فَعَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَتَصَدَّقَ بِخَمْسَةِ أَصْوَاعٍ دَقِيقاً هَذَا بَعْدَ أَنْ يُفَارِقَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4638 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who marries a woman while she has a husband.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the matter is not brought to the attention of the Imam, he must give five sa' (measures) of flour in charity. This is after he separates from her."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4639 - In the narration of Jameel ibn Darraj regarding a woman who marries during her waiting period (iddah).
Imam (as) said: "They must be separated, and she must observe one waiting period from either of them. If she gives birth to a child after six months or more, the child belongs to the latter husband. However, if she gives birth to a child in less than six months, the child belongs to the former husband."
arabicText: 4639 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ : فِي اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَتَزَوَّجُ فِي عِدَّتِهَا قَالَ "يُفَرَّقُ بَيْنَهُمَا وَ تَعْتَدُّ عِدَّةً وَاحِدَةً مِنْهُمَا فَإِنْ جَاءَتْ بِوَلَدٍ لِسِتَّةِ أَشْهُرٍ أَوْ أَكْثَرَ فَهُوَ لِلْأَخِيرِ وَ إِنْ جَاءَتْ بِوَلَدٍ فِي أَقَلَّ مِنْ سِتَّةِ أَشْهُرٍ فَهُوَ لِلْأَوَّلِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4639 - In the narration of Jameel ibn Darraj regarding a woman who marries during her waiting period (iddah).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "They must be separated, and she must observe one waiting period from either of them. If she gives birth to a child after six months or more, the child belongs to the latter husband. However, if she gives birth to a child in less than six months, the child belongs to the former husband."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4640 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Abu Basir who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about a man who married a woman, and she told him, "I am pregnant," or "I am your sister through breastfeeding," or "I am still in my waiting period (iddah)."
Imam (as) said: "If he has already been intimate with her and consummated the marriage, he should not believe her. But if he has not been intimate with her and has not consummated the marriage, then he should take precaution and inquire if he was not aware of her situation beforehand."
arabicText: 4640 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ تَزَوَّجَ اِمْرَأَةً فَقَالَتْ لَهُ أَنَا حُبْلَى أَوْ أَنَا أُخْتُكَ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعَةِ أَوْ عَلَى غَيْرِ عِدَّةٍ فَقَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ دَخَلَ بِهَا وَ وَاقَعَهَا فَلاَ يُصَدِّقُهَا وَ إِنْ كَانَ لَمْ يَدْخُلْ بِهَا وَ لَمْ يُوَاقِعْهَا فَلْيَحْتَطْ وَ لْيَسْأَلْ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ عَرَفَهَا قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4640 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Abu Basir who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) about a man who married a woman, and she told him, "I am pregnant," or "I am your sister through breastfeeding," or "I am still in my waiting period (iddah)."
Imam (as) said: "If he has already been intimate with her and consummated the marriage, he should not believe her. But if he has not been intimate with her and has not consummated the marriage, then he should take precaution and inquire if he was not aware of her situation beforehand."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4641 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who said to his mother, "Any woman I marry is as forbidden to me as you are."
Imam (as) replied: "This means nothing."
arabicText: 4641 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِأُمِّهِ كُلُّ اِمْرَأَةٍ أَتَزَوَّجُهَا فَهِيَ عَلَيَّ مِثْلُكِ حَرَامٌ قَالَ "لَيْسَ هَذَا بِشَيْءٍ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4641 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who said to his mother,
thaqalaynMatn:
"Any woman I marry is as forbidden to me as you are."
Imam (as) replied: "This means nothing."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4642 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Jameelah from Aban ibn Taghlib who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who married a woman, and after being brought to him, she gave birth to a girl in only four months.
He denied that the child was his, while she claimed that she had conceived from him.
Imam (as) said: "Her claim is not accepted. If they take the matter to the ruler, they must both engage in mutual cursing (lian), and they will be separated, and she will never be permissible for him again."
arabicText: 4642 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ تَغْلِبَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ تَزَوَّجَ اِمْرَأَةً فَلَمْ تَلْبَثْ بَعْدَ مَا أُهْدِيَتْ إِلَيْهِ إِلاَّ أَرْبَعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ حَتَّى وَلَدَتْ جَارِيَةً فَأَنْكَرَ وَلَدَهَا وَ زَعَمَتْ هِيَ أَنَّهَا حَبِلَتْ مِنْهُ فَقَالَ "لاَ يُقْبَلُ مِنْهَا ذَلِكَ وَ إِنْ تَرَافَعَا إِلَى اَلسُّلْطَانِ تَلاَعَنَا وَ فُرِّقَ بَيْنَهُمَا وَ لَمْ تَحِلَّ لَهُ أَبَداً".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4642 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Jameelah from Aban ibn Taghlib who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who married a woman, and after being brought to him, she gave birth to a girl in only four months.
He denied that the child was his, while she claimed that she had conceived from him.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Her claim is not accepted. If they take the matter to the ruler, they must both engage in mutual cursing (lian), and they will be separated, and she will never be permissible for him again."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4643 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Muhammad ibn Hakim who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who married off his female slave to another man and then told her, "When your husband dies, you will be free."
The husband then died.
Imam (as) said: "When the husband dies, she becomes free and must observe the waiting period (iddah) of a free woman whose husband has passed away. However, she does not inherit from him because she only became free after the husband's death."
arabicText: 4643 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ زَوَّجَ أَمَتَهُ مِنْ رَجُلٍ آخَرَ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهَا إِذَا مَاتَ اَلزَّوْجُ فَهِيَ حُرَّةٌ فَمَاتَ اَلزَّوْجُ فَقَالَ "إِذَا مَاتَ اَلزَّوْجُ فَهِيَ حُرَّةٌ تَعْتَدُّ عِدَّةَ اَلْحُرَّةِ اَلْمُتَوَفَّى عَنْهَا زَوْجُهَا وَ لاَ مِيرَاثَ لَهَا مِنْهُ لِأَنَّهَا إِنَّمَا صَارَتْ حُرَّةً بَعْدَ مَوْتِ اَلزَّوْجِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4643 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Muhammad ibn Hakim who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who married off his female slave to another man and then told her,
thaqalaynMatn:
"When your husband dies, you will be free."
The husband then died.
Imam (as) said: "When the husband dies, she becomes free and must observe the waiting period (iddah) of a free woman whose husband has passed away. However, she does not inherit from him because she only became free after the husband's death."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4644 - It was narrated from Abu Basir who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "A man was found with a woman in a house, and she admitted that she was his wife, and he admitted that he was her husband."
Imam (as) said: "There may be a man whom, if he were brought to me, I would approve of that for him, and there may be a man whom, if he were brought to me, I would have him beaten."
arabicText: 4644 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ أُخِذَ مَعَ اِمْرَأَةٍ فِي بَيْتٍ فَأَقَرَّتْ أَنَّهَا اِمْرَأَتُهُ وَ أَقَرَّ أَنَّهُ زَوْجُهَا فَقَالَ "رُبَّ رَجُلٍ لَوْ أُتِيتُ بِهِ لَأَجَزْتُ لَهُ ذَلِكَ وَ رُبَّ رَجُلٍ لَوْ أُتِيتُ بِهِ لَضَرَبْتُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4644 - It was narrated from Abu Basir who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "A man was found with a woman in a house, and she admitted that she was his wife, and he admitted that he was her husband."
Imam (as) said: "There may be a man whom, if he were brought to me, I would approve of that for him, and there may be a man whom, if he were brought to me, I would have him beaten."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4645 - Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj narrated: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who marries his male slave to his female slave. Should she continue to serve him as she used to, seeing him uncovered or him seeing her in that state?
Imam (as) disliked that and said: "My father (as) prevented me from marrying one of my male servants to my female servant for this very reason."
arabicText: 4645 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ اَلْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ يُزَوِّجُ مَمْلُوكَتَهُ عَبْدَهُ أَ تَقُومُ عَلَيْهِ كَمَا كَانَتْ تَقُومُ عَلَيْهِ تَرَاهُ مُنْكَشِفاً أَوْ يَرَاهَا عَلَى تِلْكَ اَلْحَالِ فَكَرِهَ ذَلِكَ وَ قَالَ "قَدْ مَنَعَنِي أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنْ أُزَوِّجَ بَعْضَ غِلْمَانِي أَمَتِي لِذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4645 - Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj narrated: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who marries his male slave to his female slave. Should she continue to serve him as she used to, seeing him uncovered or him seeing her in that state?
Imam (as) disliked that and said:
thaqalaynMatn: "My father (as) prevented me from marrying one of my male servants to my female servant for this very reason."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4646 - Al-Alaa ibn Razin asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the the general masses (Jumhur al-Nas).
Imam (as) said: "They are today considered people of truce. Their lost property is to be returned to them, their trusts are to be fulfilled, their blood is to be protected, and marriage with them and inheritance from them is permissible in this state."
arabicText: 4646 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْعَلاَءُ بْنُ رَزِينٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ جُمْهُورِ اَلنَّاسِ فَقَالَ "هُمُ اَلْيَوْمَ أَهْلُ هُدْنَةٍ تُرَدُّ ضَالَّتُهُمْ وَ تُؤَدَّى أَمَانَتُهُمْ وَ تُحْقَنُ دِمَاؤُهُمْ وَ تَجُوزُ مُنَاكَحَتُهُمْ وَ مُوَارَثَتُهُمْ فِي هَذَا اَلْحَالِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4646 - Al-Alaa ibn Razin asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the the general masses (Jumhur al-Nas).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "They are today considered people of truce. Their lost property is to be returned to them, their trusts are to be fulfilled, their blood is to be protected, and marriage with them and inheritance from them is permissible in this state."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4647 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Part of a man's happiness is that his daughter does not experience menstruation in his house."
arabicText: 4647 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مِنْ سَعَادَةِ اَلرَّجُلِ أَنْ لاَ تَحِيضَ اِبْنَتُهُ فِي بَيْتِهِ".

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4648 - Ibn Abi Umair narrated from Yahya ibn Imran from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: "Bravery is found among the people of Khurasan, physical vigor among the people of Barbar, and generosity and envy among the Arabs. Therefore, choose carefully where you place your seed."
arabicText: 4648 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ عِمْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلشَّجَاعَةُ فِي أَهْلِ خُرَاسَانَ وَ اَلْبَاهُ فِي أَهْلِ بَرْبَرَ وَ اَلسَّخَاءُ وَ اَلْحَسَدُ فِي اَلْعَرَبِ فَتَخَيَّرُوا لِنُطَفِكُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4648 - Ibn Abi Umair narrated from Yahya ibn Imran from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Bravery is found among the people of Khurasan, physical vigor among the people of Barbar, and generosity and envy among the Arabs. Therefore, choose carefully where you place your seed."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4649 - In the narration of Isma'il ibn Abi Ziyad from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "No man has ever had an abundance of hair without his desire becoming less."
arabicText: 4649 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ أَبِي زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَا كَثُرَ شَعْرُ رَجُلٍ قَطُّ إِلاَّ قَلَّتْ شَهْوَتُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4649 - In the narration of Isma'il ibn Abi Ziyad from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "No man has ever had an abundance of hair without his desire becoming less."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4650 - Ibrahim ibn Hashim narrated from Abdul Aziz ibn al-Muhtadi who said:
I asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as): "May I be sacrificed for you! My brother passed away, and I married his wife. Then my uncle came and claimed that he had secretly married her.
I asked her about this, and she strongly denied it, saying, 'There was never anything between me and him at all.'"
Imam (as) replied: "Her acknowledgment is binding upon you, and her denial is binding upon him."
arabicText: 4650 - وَ رَوَى إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْعَزِيزِ بْنِ اَلْمُهْتَدِي قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنَّ أَخِي مَاتَ وَ تَزَوَّجْتُ اِمْرَأَتَهُ فَجَاءَ عَمِّي وَ اِدَّعَى أَنَّهُ كَانَ تَزَوَّجَهَا سِرّاً فَسَأَلْتُهَا عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَأَنْكَرَتْ أَشَدَّ اَلْإِنْكَارِ وَ قَالَتْ مَا كَانَ بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَهُ شَيْءٌ قَطُّ فَقَالَ "يَلْزَمُكَ إِقْرَارُهَا وَ يَلْزَمُهُ إِنْكَارُهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4650 - Ibrahim ibn Hashim narrated from Abdul Aziz ibn al-Muhtadi who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as): "May I be sacrificed for you! My brother passed away, and I married his wife. Then my uncle came and claimed that he had secretly married her.
I asked her about this, and she strongly denied it, saying, 'There was never anything between me and him at all.'"
Imam (as) replied: "Her acknowledgment is binding upon you, and her denial is binding upon him."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4651 - Salih ibn Uqbah narrated from Sulayman ibn Salih from Abu Abdullah (as) who was asked about a man who engages in intercourse with his wife's bondwoman and then asks his wife to pardon him, but she refuses. He then says: "If you do not pardon me, I will divorce you," and he avoids her bed until she pardons him.
Imam (as) said: "This man is an oppressor. Where is his kindness?"
arabicText: 4651 - وَ رَوَى صَالِحُ بْنُ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ يَنْكِحُ جَارِيَةَ اِمْرَأَتِهِ ثُمَّ يَسْأَلُهَا أَنْ تَجْعَلَهُ فِي حِلٍّ فَتَأْبَى فَيَقُولُ إِذاً لَأُطَلِّقَنَّكِ وَ يَجْتَنِبُ فِرَاشَهَا فَتَجْعَلُهُ فِي حِلٍّ قَالَ "هَذَا غَاصِبٌ فَأَيْنَ هُوَ عَنِ اَللُّطْفِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4651 - Salih ibn Uqbah narrated from Sulayman ibn Salih from Abu Abdullah (as) who was asked about a man who engages in intercourse with his wife's bondwoman and then asks his wife to pardon him, but she refuses. He then says:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If you do not pardon me, I will divorce you," and he avoids her bed until she pardons him.
Imam (as) said: "This man is an oppressor. Where is his kindness?"

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4652 - Abu al-Abbas and Ubayd narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a woman who had a slave husband, then inherited him and freed him. They asked if they would remain in their marriage.
Imam (as) said: "No, but they must renew their marriage contract."
arabicText: 4652 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو اَلْعَبَّاسِ وَ عُبَيْدٌ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اِمْرَأَةٍ كَانَ لَهَا زَوْجٌ مَمْلُوكٌ فَوَرِثَتْهُ وَ أَعْتَقَتْهُ هَلْ يَكُونَانِ عَلَى نِكَاحِهِمَا قَالَ "لاَ وَ لَكِنْ يُجَدِّدَانِ نِكَاحاً آخَرَ".

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4653 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "It is recommended for a man to approach his wife on the first night of the month of Ramadan because of the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic: 'It has been made lawful for you to be intimate with your wives during the nights of fasting' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:187), and al-rafath means sexual intercourse."
arabicText: 4653 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "يُسْتَحَبُّ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ أَهْلَهُ أَوَّلَ لَيْلَةٍ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ لِقَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: ۝ أُحِلَّ لَكُمْ لَيْلَةَ اَلصِّيٰامِ اَلرَّفَثُ إِلىٰ نِسٰائِكُمْ ۝ وَ اَلرَّفَثُ اَلْمُجَامَعَةُ".

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4654 - Hariz narrated from Muhammad ibn Ishaq who said:
Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said: "Do you know why the dowries of women became four thousand dirhams?"
I said: "No."
Imam (as) said: "Indeed, Umm Habibah, the daughter of Abu Sufyan, was in Abyssinia when the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) proposed to her. The Negus (the king of Abyssinia) gave four thousand dirhams on his behalf as her dowry. Since then, people have followed this practice. However, the original dowry was twelve uqiyyah and a nash."
arabicText: 4654 - وَ رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَ تَدْرِي مِنْ أَيْنَ صَارَ مُهُورُ اَلنِّسَاءِ أَرْبَعَةَ آلاَفِ دِرْهَمٍ" قُلْتُ لاَ قَالَ "إِنَّ أُمَّ حَبِيبَةَ بِنْتَ أَبِي سُفْيَانَ كَانَتْ فِي اَلْحَبَشَةِ فَخَطَبَهَا اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَسَاقَ عَنْهُ اَلنَّجَاشِيُّ أَرْبَعَةَ آلاَفِ دِرْهَمٍ فَمِنْ ثَمَّ هَؤُلاَءِ يَأْخُذُونَ بِهِ فَأَمَّا اَلْأَصْلُ فَاثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ أُوقِيَّةً وَ نَشٌّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4654 - Hariz narrated from Muhammad ibn Ishaq who said:
Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Do you know why the dowries of women became four thousand dirhams?"
I said: "No."
Imam (as) said: "Indeed, Umm Habibah, the daughter of Abu Sufyan, was in Abyssinia when the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) proposed to her. The Negus (the king of Abyssinia) gave four thousand dirhams on his behalf as her dowry. Since then, people have followed this practice. However, the original dowry was twelve uqiyyah and a nash."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4655 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, it is reported that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) passed by an animal and a stud mating in the middle of the road, and Imam (as) turned his face away.
It was said to him: "Why did you do that, O Commander of the Faithful (as)?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is not appropriate for you to do what they do (i.e., allow such things publicly). It is among the unacceptable acts unless you conceal it where no man or woman can see it."
arabicText: 4655 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ : أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَرَّ عَلَى بَهِيمَةٍ وَ فَحْلٍ يَسْفَدُهَا عَلَى ظَهْرِ اَلطَّرِيقِ فَأَعْرَضَ عَنْهُ بِوَجْهِهِ فَقِيلَ لَهُ لِمَ فَعَلْتَ ذَلِكَ يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ فَقَالَ "إِنَّهُ لاَ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ تَصْنَعُوا مَا يَصْنَعُونَ وَ هُوَ مِنَ اَلْمُنْكَرِ إِلاَّ أَنْ تُوَارُوهُ حَيْثُ لاَ يَرَاهُ رَجُلٌ وَ لاَ اِمْرَأَةٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4655 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, it is reported that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) passed by an animal and a stud mating in the middle of the road, and Imam (as) turned his face away.
thaqalaynMatn:
It was said to him: "Why did you do that, O Commander of the Faithful (as)?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is not appropriate for you to do what they do (i.e., allow such things publicly). It is among the unacceptable acts unless you conceal it where no man or woman can see it."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4656 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Whoever looks at a woman and then raises his gaze to the sky or lowers his eyes, his sight will not return to him until Allah (swt) marries him to a heavenly maiden (Hoor al-Ayn)."
arabicText: 4656 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَنْ نَظَرَ إِلَى اِمْرَأَةٍ فَرَفَعَ بَصَرَهُ إِلَى اَلسَّمَاءِ أَوْ غَمَّضَ بَصَرَهُ لَمْ يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْهِ بَصَرُهُ حَتَّى يُزَوِّجَهُ اَللَّهُ مِنَ اَلْحُورِ اَلْعِينِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4656 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever looks at a woman and then raises his gaze to the sky or lowers his eyes, his sight will not return to him until Allah (swt) marries him to a heavenly maiden (Hoor al-Ayn)."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4657 - And in another narration: "His gaze will not return to him until Allah (swt) grants him faith, the sweetness of which he will experience."
arabicText: 4657 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ: "لَمْ يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْهِ طَرْفُهُ حَتَّى يُعْقِبَهُ اَللَّهُ إِيمَاناً يَجِدُ طَعْمَهُ".

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4658 - Imam (as) said: "The first glance is for you, the second is against you and not for you, and the third in it is destruction."
arabicText: 4658 - قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "أَوَّلُ اَلنَّظْرَةِ لَكَ وَ اَلثَّانِيَةُ عَلَيْكَ وَ لاَ لَكَ وَ اَلثَّالِثَةُ فِيهَا اَلْهَلاَكُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4658 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The first glance is for you, the second is against you and not for you, and the third in it is destruction."

chapter: Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4659 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni from Ja'far ibn Muhammad from his father (as), he said: "There is no harm for a man to look at the hair of his mother, his sister, or his daughter."
arabicText: 4659 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَنْظُرَ اَلرَّجُلُ إِلَى شَعْرِ أُمِّهِ أَوْ أُخْتِهِ أَوِ اِبْنَتِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4659 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni from Ja'far ibn Muhammad from his father (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm for a man to look at the hair of his mother, his sister, or his daughter."

chapter: Chapter on Supplication for Seeking Offspring
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4660 - Ali ibn Al-Husayn (peace be upon them) said to one of his companions:
"When seeking a child, say:
'My Lord (azj), do not leave me alone [without offspring], and You (swt) are the best of inheritors' and add;
'Grant me from Yourself (swt) a successor who will inherit from me during my life and seek forgiveness for me after my death. Make him well-formed in creation and do not allow Satan to have any share in him. O Allah (swt), I seek Your (swt) forgiveness and repent to You (swt). Indeed, You (swt) are the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful.'
Repeat this seventy times. For whoever frequently says this supplication, Allah (swt) the Exalted will grant him whatever he wishes of wealth, children, and the goodness of this world and the Hereafter.
For Allah (swt) says: 'Seek forgiveness from your Lord (azj); indeed, He (swt) is ever Forgiving. He (swt) will send rain to you in abundance and supply you with wealth and children and make for you gardens and make for you rivers' (Surah Nuh 71:10-12)."
arabicText: 4660 - قَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ لِبَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ : "قُلْ فِي طَلَبِ اَلْوَلَدِ "رَبِّ لاٰ تَذَرْنِي فَرْداً وَ أَنْتَ خَيْرُ اَلْوٰارِثِينَ" وَ اِجْعَلْ "لِي مِنْ لَدُنْكَ وَلِيًّا يَرِثُنِي" فِي حَيَاتِي وَ يَسْتَغْفِرُ لِي بَعْدَ مَوْتِي وَ اِجْعَلْهُ لِي خَلْقاً سَوِيّاً وَ لاَ تَجْعَلْ لِلشَّيْطَانِ فِيهِ نَصِيباً اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَ أَتُوبُ إِلَيْكَ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ اَلْغَفُورُ اَلرَّحِيمُ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةً فَإِنَّهُ مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ هَذَا اَلْقَوْلِ رَزَقَهُ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى مَا تَمَنَّى مِنْ مَالٍ وَ وَلَدٍ وَ مِنْ خَيْرِ اَلدُّنْيَا وَ اَلْآخِرَةِ فَإِنَّهُ يَقُولُ ۝ اِسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كٰانَ غَفّٰاراً يُرْسِلِ اَلسَّمٰاءَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِدْرٰاراً وَ يُمْدِدْكُمْ بِأَمْوٰالٍ وَ بَنِينَ وَ يَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ جَنّٰاتٍ وَ يَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ أَنْهٰاراً ۝ "

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4661 - It was narrated from Sama'ah ibn Mihran that Abu Abdullah (as) said: "Breastfeeding is for twenty-one months, and anything less than that is an injustice to the child."
arabicText: 4661 - رُوِيَ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلرَّضَاعُ وَاحِدٌ وَ عِشْرُونَ شَهْراً فَمَا نَقَصَ فَهُوَ جَوْرٌ عَلَى اَلصَّبِيِّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4661 - It was narrated from Sama'ah ibn Mihran that Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Breastfeeding is for twenty-one months, and anything less than that is an injustice to the child."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4662 - Sa'd ibn Sa'd asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about whether a child can be breastfed for more than two years.
Imam (as) replied: "Two years."
I asked: "If it exceeds two years, is there any obligation upon the parents because of that?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
arabicText: 4662 - وَ سَأَلَ سَعْدُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلصَّبِيِّ هَلْ يُرْضَعُ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَنَتَيْنِ فَقَالَ "عَامَيْنِ" قُلْتُ فَإِنْ زَادَ عَلَى سَنَتَيْنِ هَلْ عَلَى أَبَوَيْهِ مِنْ ذَلِكَ شَيْءٌ قَالَ "لاَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4662 - Sa'd ibn Sa'd asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about whether a child can be breastfed for more than two years.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Two years."
I asked: "If it exceeds two years, is there any obligation upon the parents because of that?"
Imam (as) said: "No."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4663 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"There is no milk with greater blessing for a child to be nursed with than the milk of his mother."
arabicText: 4663 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مَا مِنْ لَبَنٍ يُرْضَعُ بِهِ اَلصَّبِيُّ أَعْظَمَ بَرَكَةً عَلَيْهِ مِنْ لَبَنِ أُمِّهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4663 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no milk with greater blessing for a child to be nursed with than the milk of his mother."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4664 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) looked at Umm Ishaq bint Sulayman while she was breastfeeding one of her two sons, either Muhammad or Ishaq, and Imam (as) said:
