"O Umm Ishaq, do not nurse him from only one breast; rather, nurse him from both. One will serve as food and the other as drink."
arabicText: 4664 - : وَ نَظَرَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِلَى أُمِّ إِسْحَاقَ بِنْتِ سُلَيْمَانَ وَ هِيَ تُرْضِعُ أَحَدَ اِبْنَيْهَا مُحَمَّداً أَوْ إِسْحَاقَ فَقَالَ "يَا أُمَّ إِسْحَاقَ لاَ تُرْضِعِيهِ مِنْ ثَدْيٍ وَاحِدٍ وَ أَرْضِعِيهِ مِنْ كِلَيْهِمَا يَكُونُ أَحَدُهُمَا طَعَاماً وَ اَلْآخَرُ شَرَاباً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4664 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) looked at Umm Ishaq bint Sulayman while she was breastfeeding one of her two sons, either Muhammad or Ishaq, and Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O Umm Ishaq, do not nurse him from only one breast; rather, nurse him from both. One will serve as food and the other as drink."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4665 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Burayd al-Ijli who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as): "What is the meaning of the saying of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) -
'What is unlawful through lineage is also unlawful through breastfeeding'? Explain it to me."
Imam (as) replied: "Every woman who nurses, with the milk of her husband, the child of another woman, whether the child is male or female, that is the breastfeeding (ridha') referred to by the Messenger of Allah (swt) (may Allah bless him and his family).
But any woman who nurses, with the milk of two different husbands (one after the other), the child of another woman, whether male or female, this is breastfeeding that does not fall under the ruling of the statement of the Messenger of Allah (swt) 'What is prohibited through breastfeeding is the same as what is prohibited through lineage.'"
arabicText: 4665 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ اَلْعِجْلِيِّ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَ رَأَيْتَ قَوْلَ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعِ مَا يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلنَّسَبِ" فَسِّرْهُ لِي فَقَالَ "كُلُّ اِمْرَأَةٍ أَرْضَعَتْ مِنْ لَبَنِ فَحْلِهَا وَلَدَ اِمْرَأَةٍ أُخْرَى مِنْ جَارِيَةٍ أَوْ غُلاَمٍ فَذَلِكَ اَلرَّضَاعُ اَلَّذِي قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ كُلُّ اِمْرَأَةٍ أَرْضَعَتْ مِنْ لَبَنِ فَحْلَيْنِ كَانَا لَهَا وَاحِداً بَعْدَ آخَرَ مِنْ جَارِيَةٍ أَوْ غُلاَمٍ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ رَضَاعٌ لَيْسَ بِالرَّضَاعِ اَلَّذِي قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعِ مَا يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلنَّسَبِ"".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4665 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Burayd al-Ijli who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as): "What is the meaning of the saying of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) -
'What is unlawful through lineage is also unlawful through breastfeeding'? Explain it to me."
Imam (as) replied: "Every woman who nurses, with the milk of her husband, the child of another woman, whether the child is male or female, that is the breastfeeding (ridha') referred to by the Messenger of Allah (swt) (may Allah bless him and his family).
But any woman who nurses, with the milk of two different husbands (one after the other), the child of another woman, whether male or female, this is breastfeeding that does not fall under the ruling of the statement of the Messenger of Allah (swt) 'What is prohibited through breastfeeding is the same as what is prohibited through lineage.'"

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4666 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
"There is no breastfeeding after weaning."
arabicText: 4666 - وَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "لاَ رَضَاعَ بَعْدَ فِطَامٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4666 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no breastfeeding after weaning."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4667 - Dawud ibn Al-Husayn narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"Breastfeeding within two years, before the child is weaned, establishes prohibition."
arabicText: 4667 - وَ رَوَى دَاوُدُ بْنُ اَلْحُصَيْنِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلرَّضَاعُ بَعْدَ حَوْلَيْنِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُفْطَمَ يُحَرِّمُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4667 - Dawud ibn Al-Husayn narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Breastfeeding within two years, before the child is weaned, establishes prohibition."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4668 - It was narrated from Ayyub ibn Nuh who said: Ali ibn Shu'ayb wrote to Abu al-Hasan (as) asking: "A woman breastfed one of my children. Is it permissible for me to marry one of her children?"
Imam (as) wrote in response, "That is not permissible because her children have become like your own children."
arabicText: 4668 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ نُوحٍ قَالَ كَتَبَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ شُعَيْبٍ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : اِمْرَأَةٌ أَرْضَعَتْ بَعْضَ وُلْدِي هَلْ يَجُوزُ لِي أَنْ أَتَزَوَّجَ بَعْضَ وُلْدِهَا فَكَتَبَ "لاَ يَجُوزُ ذَلِكَ لِأَنَّ وُلْدَهَا قَدْ صَارَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ وُلْدِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4668 - It was narrated from Ayyub ibn Nuh who said: Ali ibn Shu'ayb wrote to Abu al-Hasan (as) asking: "A woman breastfed one of my children. Is it permissible for me to marry one of her children?"
Imam (as) wrote in response,
thaqalaynMatn: "That is not permissible because her children have become like your own children."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4669 - Abdullah ibn Ja'far al-Himyari wrote to Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) asking about a woman who breastfed a man's child.
He asked: "Is it permissible for that man to marry the daughter of this wet nurse or not?"
Imam (as) responded, "It is not permissible for him."
arabicText: 4669 - وَ كَتَبَ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ اَلْحِمْيَرِيُّ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ اَلْعَسْكَرِيِّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اِمْرَأَةٍ أَرْضَعَتْ وَلَدَ اَلرَّجُلِ أَ يَحِلُّ لِذَلِكَ اَلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ اِبْنَةَ هَذِهِ اَلْمُرْضِعَةِ أَمْ لاَ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "لاَ يَحِلُّ ذَلِكَ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4669 - Abdullah ibn Ja'far al-Himyari wrote to Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) asking about a woman who breastfed a man's child.
He asked: "Is it permissible for that man to marry the daughter of this wet nurse or not?"
Imam (as) responded,
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not permissible for him."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4670 - Al-Alaa narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "If a man marries a young girl (jariyah) who is still nursing, and his wife then breastfeeds her, the marriage becomes invalid."
arabicText: 4670 - وَ رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لَوْ أَنَّ رَجُلاً تَزَوَّجَ جَارِيَةً رَضِيعَةً فَأَرْضَعَتْهَا اِمْرَأَتُهُ فَسَدَ اَلنِّكَاحُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4670 - Al-Alaa narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man marries a young girl (jariyah) who is still nursing, and his wife then breastfeeds her, the marriage becomes invalid."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4671 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Malik ibn Atiyyah from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who marries a woman, and she gives birth to his child.
Then she breastfeeds a bondwoman with her milk.
Imam (as) was asked: "Is it permissible for his child from another woman to marry that bondwoman whom she breastfed?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, she is like a sister through breastfeeding because the milk comes from the same father."
arabicText: 4671 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ عَطِيَّةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَتَزَوَّجُ اَلْمَرْأَةَ فَتَلِدُ مِنْهُ ثُمَّ تُرْضِعُ مِنْ لَبَنِهَا جَارِيَةً أَ يَصْلُحُ لِوَلَدِهِ مِنْ غَيْرِهَا أَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ تِلْكَ اَلْجَارِيَةَ اَلَّتِي أَرْضَعَتْهَا قَالَ "لاَ هِيَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ اَلْأُخْتِ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعَةِ لِأَنَّ اَللَّبَنَ لِفَحْلٍ وَاحِدٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4671 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Malik ibn Atiyyah from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who marries a woman, and she gives birth to his child.
thaqalaynMatn:
Then she breastfeeds a bondwoman with her milk.
Imam (as) was asked: "Is it permissible for his child from another woman to marry that bondwoman whom she breastfed?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, she is like a sister through breastfeeding because the milk comes from the same father."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4672 - Hariz narrated from Al-Fudayl ibn Yasar from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: "Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when it is continuous and intentional."
I asked: "What is meant by continuous and intentional?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is when a mother raises the child, a wet nurse is hired, or a bondwoman is purchased for breastfeeding."
arabicText: 4672 - وَ رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعِ إِلاَّ مَا كَانَ مَجْبُوراً " قَالَ قُلْتُ وَ مَا اَلْمَجْبُورُ قَالَ "أُمٌّ تُرَبِّي أَوْ ظِئْرٌ تُسْتَأْجَرُ أَوْ أَمَةٌ تُشْتَرَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4672 - Hariz narrated from Al-Fudayl ibn Yasar from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when it is continuous and intentional."
I asked: "What is meant by continuous and intentional?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is when a mother raises the child, a wet nurse is hired, or a bondwoman is purchased for breastfeeding."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4673 - Al-Alaa ibn Razin narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when a child nurses from one breast for a full year."
arabicText: 4673 - وَ رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ بْنُ رَزِينٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعِ إِلاَّ مَا اِرْتَضَعَ مِنْ ثَدْيٍ وَاحِدٍ سَنَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4673 - Al-Alaa ibn Razin narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when a child nurses from one breast for a full year."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4674 - Ubayd ibn Zurarah narrated from Zurarah from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: I asked him about breastfeeding, and Imam (as) said:
"Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when a child nurses from one breast for two complete years."
arabicText: 4674 - وَ رَوَى عُبَيْدُ بْنُ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلرَّضَاعِ فَقَالَ "لاَ يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعِ إِلاَّ مَا اِرْتَضَعَ مِنْ ثَدْيٍ وَاحِدٍ حَوْلَيْنِ كَامِلَيْنِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4674 - Ubayd ibn Zurarah narrated from Zurarah from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: I asked him about breastfeeding, and Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when a child nurses from one breast for two complete years."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4675 - Abdullah ibn Zurarah narrated from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: "Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when it is for two complete years."
arabicText: 4675 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ زُرَارَةَ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعِ إِلاَّ مَا كَانَ حَوْلَيْنِ كَامِلَيْنِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4675 - Abdullah ibn Zurarah narrated from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Breastfeeding does not create a prohibition except when it is for two complete years."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4676 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, it is reported that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to say, "Prevent your women from breastfeeding here and there (to various children), for they may forget."
arabicText: 4676 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ قَالَ كَانَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: "اِنْهَوْا نِسَاءَكُمْ أَنْ يُرْضِعْنَ يَمِيناً وَ شِمَالاً فَإِنَّهُنَّ يَنْسَيْنَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4676 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, it is reported that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) used to say,
thaqalaynMatn: "Prevent your women from breastfeeding here and there (to various children), for they may forget."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4677 - Fudayl narrated from Zurarah from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "Choose healthy wet nurses, for milk can transmit illness."
arabicText: 4677 - وَ رَوَى فُضَيْلٌ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "عَلَيْكُمْ بِالْوُضَّاءِ مِنَ اَلظُّئُورَةِ فَإِنَّ اَللَّبَنَ يُعْدِي".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4677 - Fudayl narrated from Zurarah from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Choose healthy wet nurses, for milk can transmit illness."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4678 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a woman who committed adultery - whether she is suitable to be taken as a wet nurse.
He (as) replied: "She is not suitable, nor is the milk of her daughter who was born from adultery."
arabicText: 4678 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ زَنَتْ هَلْ تَصْلُحُ أَنْ تُسْتَرْضَعَ قَالَ "لاَ تَصْلُحُ وَ لاَ لَبَنُ اِبْنَتِهَا اَلَّتِي وُلِدَتْ مِنَ اَلزِّنَا".

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4679 - Muhammad ibn Qays narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Do not choose a foolish woman as a wet nurse, for milk can transmit traits. A child is influenced by the milk, meaning by the wet nurse, in foolishness and ignorance."
arabicText: 4679 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ قَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "لاَ تَسْتَرْضِعُوا اَلْحَمْقَاءَ فَإِنَّ اَللَّبَنَ يُعْدِي وَ إِنَّ اَلْغُلاَمَ يَنْزِعُ إِلَى اَللَّبَنِ يَعْنِي إِلَى اَلظِّئْرِ فِي اَلرُّعُونَةِ وَ اَلْحُمْقِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4679 - Muhammad ibn Qays narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not choose a foolish woman as a wet nurse, for milk can transmit traits. A child is influenced by the milk, meaning by the wet nurse, in foolishness and ignorance."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4680 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Al-Halabi who said: I asked him about a man who gives his child to a Jewish, Christian, or Magian (Zoroastrian) wet nurse to breastfeed him either in her house or in his house.
Imam (as) said: "A Jewish or Christian woman may breastfeed your child, but you must prevent her from drinking alcohol and consuming what is unlawful, such as pork. Do not let them take your child to their homes. A woman who is an adulteress must not breastfeed your child, for it is not permissible for you. A Magian woman must not breastfeed your child unless you are compelled to it."
arabicText:
4680 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ:
سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ دَفَعَ وَلَدَهُ إِلَى ظِئْرٍ يَهُودِيَّةٍ أَوْ نَصْرَانِيَّةٍ أَوْ مَجُوسِيَّةٍ تُرْضِعُهُ فِي بَيْتِهَا أَوْ تُرْضِعُهُ فِي بَيْتِهِ قَالَ "تُرْضِعُهُ لَكَ اَلْيَهُودِيَّةُ وَ اَلنَّصْرَانِيَّةُ وَ تَمْنَعُهَا مِنْ شُرْبِ اَلْخَمْرِ وَ مَا لاَ يَحِلُّ مِثْلَ لَحْمِ اَلْخِنْزِيرِ وَ لاَ يَذْهَبْنَ بِوَلَدِكَ إِلَى بُيُوتِهِنَّ وَ اَلزَّانِيَةُ لاَ تُرْضِعُ وَلَدَكَ فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَحِلُّ لَكَ وَ اَلْمَجُوسِيَّةُ لاَ تُرْضِعُ لَكَ وَلَدَكَ إِلاَّ أَنْ تُضْطَرَّ إِلَيْهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4680 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Al-Halabi who said: I asked him about a man who gives his child to a Jewish, Christian, or Magian (Zoroastrian) wet nurse to breastfeed him either in her house or in his house.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "A Jewish or Christian woman may breastfeed your child, but you must prevent her from drinking alcohol and consuming what is unlawful, such as pork. Do not let them take your child to their homes. A woman who is an adulteress must not breastfeed your child, for it is not permissible for you. A Magian woman must not breastfeed your child unless you are compelled to it."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4681 - Hariz narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"The milk of a Jewish, Christian, or Magian woman is more beloved to me than the milk of a child born from adultery. However, he saw no harm in the milk of a child born from adultery if the master of the bondwoman, with whom the immoral act was committed, pardons it."
arabicText: 4681 - وَ رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لَبَنُ اَلْيَهُودِيَّةِ وَ اَلنَّصْرَانِيَّةِ وَ اَلْمَجُوسِيَّةِ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنْ لَبَنِ وَلَدِ اَلزِّنَا وَ كَانَ لاَ يَرَى بَأْساً بِلَبَنِ وَلَدِ اَلزِّنَا إِذَا جَعَلَ مَوْلَى اَلْجَارِيَةِ اَلَّذِي فَجَرَ بِالْجَارِيَةِ فِي حِلٍّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4681 - Hariz narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The milk of a Jewish, Christian, or Magian woman is more beloved to me than the milk of a child born from adultery. However, he saw no harm in the milk of a child born from adultery if the master of the bondwoman, with whom the immoral act was committed, pardons it."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4682 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Yunus ibn Yaqub from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: I asked Imam (as) about a woman whose milk flowed without childbirth, and she breastfed a girl and a boy with that milk.
Does this milk create the same prohibitions as regular breastfeeding?
Imam (as) replied: "No."
arabicText: 4682 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ دَرَّ لَبَنُهَا مِنْ غَيْرِ وِلاَدَةٍ فَأَرْضَعَتْ جَارِيَةً وَ غُلاَماً بِذَلِكَ اَللَّبَنِ هَلْ يَحْرُمُ بِذَلِكَ اَللَّبَنِ مَا يَحْرُمُ مِنَ اَلرَّضَاعِ قَالَ "لاَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4682 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Yunus ibn Yaqub from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a woman whose milk flowed without childbirth, and she breastfed a girl and a boy with that milk.
Does this milk create the same prohibitions as regular breastfeeding?
Imam (as) replied: "No."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4683 - Abu Abdullah (as) said: "The sucking of milk by a child is equivalent to breastfeeding."
arabicText: 4683 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "وَجُورُ اَلصَّبِيِّ اَللَّبَنَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ اَلرَّضَاعِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4683 - Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The sucking of milk by a child is equivalent to breastfeeding."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4684 - Imam Abu Abdullah (as) said: "A free woman cannot be forced to breastfeed a child, but a but a bondwoman (umm al-walad) can be compelled to do so."
arabicText: 4684 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "لاَ تُجْبَرُ اَلْحُرَّةُ عَلَى إِرْضَاعِ اَلْوَلَدِ وَ تُجْبَرُ أُمُّ اَلْوَلَدِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4684 - Imam Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A free woman cannot be forced to breastfeed a child, but a but a bondwoman (umm al-walad) can be compelled to do so."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4685 - The Commander of the Faithful (as), ruled regarding a man who passed away and left behind a child who needed to be breastfed:
"The payment for the child's breastfeeding should be taken from what the child inherits from his father and mother."
arabicText: 4685 - وَ قَضَى أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي رَجُلٍ تُوُفِّيَ وَ تَرَكَ صَبِيّاً وَ اُسْتُرْضِعَ لَهُ "أَنَّ أَجْرَ رَضَاعِ اَلصَّبِيِّ مِمَّا يَرِثُ مِنْ أَبِيهِ وَ أُمِّهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4685 - The Commander of the Faithful (as), ruled regarding a man who passed away and left behind a child who needed to be breastfed:
thaqalaynMatn: "The payment for the child's breastfeeding should be taken from what the child inherits from his father and mother."

chapter: Chapter on Breastfeeding
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4686 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported that a man came to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) and said: "My bondwoman has breastfed my child, and I want to sell her."
Imam (as) replied: "Take her by the hand and say, 'Who will buy from me the mother of my child?'"
arabicText: 4686 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَتَاهُ رَجُلٌ فَقَالَ إِنَّ أَمَتِي أَرْضَعَتْ وَلَدِي وَ قَدْ أَرَدْتُ بَيْعَهَا قَالَ "خُذْ بِيَدِهَا وَ قُلْ مَنْ يَشْتَرِي مِنِّي أُمَّ وَلَدِي".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4686 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported that a man came to Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"My bondwoman has breastfed my child, and I want to sell her."
Imam (as) replied: "Take her by the hand and say, 'Who will buy from me the mother of my child?'"

chapter: Chapter on Congratulating for the Birth of a Child
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4687 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
A man congratulated another man on the birth of a son by saying, "May this young warrior bring you joy!"
Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as)said to him: "How do you know whether he will be a warrior or one who walks on foot?"
The man replied: "May I be sacrificed for you! What should I say then?"
Imam (as) said: "Say: May you thank the Giver, may the gift be blessed for you, may he reach maturity, and may you be granted his righteousness."
arabicText: 4687 - قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "رَجُلٌ هَنَّأَ رَجُلاً أَصَابَ اِبْناً فَقَالَ يَهْنِيكَ اَلْفَارِسُ فَقَالَ لَهُ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "مَا عِلْمُكَ أَنْ يَكُونَ فَارِساً أَوْ رَاجِلاً" فَقَالَ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ فَمَا أَقُولُ قَالَ "تَقُولُ شَكَرْتَ اَلْوَاهِبَ وَ بُورِكَ لَكَ فِي اَلْمَوْهُوبِ، وَ بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَ رُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4687 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man congratulated another man on the birth of a son by saying, "May this young warrior bring you joy!"
Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as)said to him: "How do you know whether he will be a warrior or one who walks on foot?"
The man replied: "May I be sacrificed for you! What should I say then?"
Imam (as) said: "Say: May you thank the Giver, may the gift be blessed for you, may he reach maturity, and may you be granted his righteousness."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4688 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
"A righteous child is a flower from the flowers of Paradise."
arabicText: 4688 - فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "اَلْوَلَدُ اَلصَّالِحُ رَيْحَانَةٌ مِنْ رَيَاحِينِ اَلْجَنَّةِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4688 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A righteous child is a flower from the flowers of Paradise."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4689 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Allah's (swt) inheritance from His (swt) believing servant is a righteous child who seeks forgiveness for him."
arabicText: 4689 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "مِيرَاثُ اَللَّهِ مِنْ عَبْدِهِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِ اَلْوَلَدُ اَلصَّالِحُ يَسْتَغْفِرُ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4689 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Allah's (swt) inheritance from His (swt) believing servant is a righteous child who seeks forgiveness for him."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4690 - Abu al-Hasan (as) said:
"Indeed, when Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, intends good for a servant, He (swt) does not cause him to die until He (swt) shows him (the believer) his successor."
arabicText: 4690 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى إِذَا أَرَادَ بِعَبْدٍ خَيْراً لَمْ يُمِتْهُ حَتَّى يُرِيَهُ اَلْخَلَفَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4690 - Abu al-Hasan (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, when Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, intends good for a servant, He (swt) does not cause him to die until He (swt) shows him (the believer) his successor."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4691 - It is narrated:
"Whoever dies without leaving behind a successor, it is as if he was never among the people. And whoever dies and leaves behind a successor, it is as if he never died."
arabicText: 4691 - وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ مَنْ مَاتَ بِلاَ خَلَفٍ فَكَأَنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ فِي اَلنَّاسِ وَ مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَهُ خَلَفٌ فَكَأَنْ لَمْ يَمُتْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4691 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever dies without leaving behind a successor, it is as if he was never among the people. And whoever dies and leaves behind a successor, it is as if he never died."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4692 - Aban ibn Taghlib narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: "Daughters are good deeds, and sons are blessings. Good deeds are rewarded, and blessings are questioned about."
arabicText: 4692 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانُ بْنُ تَغْلِبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلْبَنَاتُ حَسَنَاتٌ وَ اَلْبَنُونَ نِعْمَةٌ فَالْحَسَنَاتُ يُثَابُ عَلَيْهَا وَ اَلنِّعْمَةُ يُسْأَلُ عَنْهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4692 - Aban ibn Taghlib narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Daughters are good deeds, and sons are blessings. Good deeds are rewarded, and blessings are questioned about."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4693 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) was given the glad tidings of a daughter. He (sw) looked at the faces of his companions and saw displeasure in them.
He (sw) said: "What is the matter with you? She is a sweet flower (rayḥanah) that I smell, and her sustenance is upon Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
And Prophet (as) was a father of daughters.
arabicText: 4693 - : وَ بُشِّرَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِابْنَةٍ فَنَظَرَ فِي وُجُوهِ أَصْحَابِهِ فَرَأَى اَلْكَرَاهَةَ فِيهِمْ فَقَالَ "مَا لَكُمْ رَيْحَانَةٌ أَشَمُّهَا وَ رِزْقُهَا عَلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ" وَ كَانَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَبَا بَنَاتٍ.

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4694 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "When a child falls ill, it serves as an expiation for the sins of the parents."
arabicText: 4694 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "فِي اَلْمَرَضِ يُصِيبُ اَلصَّبِيَّ إِنَّهُ كَفَّارَةٌ لِوَالِدَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4694 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a child falls ill, it serves as an expiation for the sins of the parents."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4695 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Indeed, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, has mercy on a man because of the intensity of his love for his child."
arabicText: 4695 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَيَرْحَمُ اَلرَّجُلَ لِشِدَّةِ حُبِّهِ لِوَلَدِهِ".

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4696 - Umar ibn Yazid said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as): "I have daughters."
The Imam (as) replied: "Perhaps you wish for their death? Know that if you wish for their death and they die, you will not be rewarded on the Day of Judgment, and you will meet your Lord (azj) while being disobedient to Him (swt)."
arabicText: 4696 - وَ - قَالَ لَهُ عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ : إِنَّ لِي بَنَاتٍ فَقَالَ "لَعَلَّكَ تَتَمَنَّى مَوْتَهُنَّ أَمَا إِنَّكَ إِنْ تَمَنَّيْتَ مَوْتَهُنَّ وَ مِتْنَ لَمْ تُؤْجَرْ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ وَ لَقِيتَ رَبَّكَ حِينَ تَلْقَاهُ وَ أَنْتَ عَاصٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4696 - Umar ibn Yazid said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I have daughters."
The Imam (as) replied: "Perhaps you wish for their death? Know that if you wish for their death and they die, you will not be rewarded on the Day of Judgment, and you will meet your Lord (azj) while being disobedient to Him (swt)."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4697 - Hamzah ibn Humran narrated through his chain of transmission that a man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) while another man was sitting with Him (sw).
The man informed the Prophet (sw) about the birth of his child, and the color of the man's face changed.
The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) asked him: "What is the matter with you?"
The man replied: "It's nothing."
The Prophet (sw) said: "Speak."
The man said: "I left while my wife was in labor, and I was informed that she gave birth to a daughter."
The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said to him: "The earth will carry her, the sky will shade her, and Allah (swt) will provide for her. She is a sweet flower that you will smell."
Then the Prophet (sw) turned to his companions and said: "Whoever has one daughter will be burdened with care.
Whoever has two daughters, then seek help from Allah (swt) for him.
Whoever has three daughters, the obligation of jihad and every hardship is lifted from him.
And whoever has four daughters, O servants of Allah (swt), help him! O servants of Allah (swt), support him! O servants of Allah (swt), have mercy on him!"
arabicText: 4697 - وَ رَوَى حَمْزَةُ بْنُ حُمْرَانَ بِإِسْنَادِهِ: أَنَّهُ أَتَى رَجُلٌ إِلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ عِنْدَهُ رَجُلٌ فَأَخْبَرَهُ بِمَوْلُودٍ لَهُ فَتَغَيَّرَ لَوْنُ اَلرَّجُلِ فَقَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "مَا لَكَ" قَالَ خَيْرٌ قَالَ "قُلْ" قَالَ خَرَجْتُ وَ اَلْمَرْأَةُ تَمْخَضُ فَأُخْبِرْتُ أَنَّهَا وَلَدَتْ جَارِيَةً فَقَالَ لَهُ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "اَلْأَرْضُ تُقِلُّهَا وَ اَلسَّمَاءُ تُظِلُّهَا وَ اَللَّهُ يَرْزُقُهَا وَ هِيَ رَيْحَانَةٌ تَشَمُّهَا" ثُمَّ أَقْبَلَ عَلَى أَصْحَابِهِ فَقَالَ "مَنْ كَانَ لَهُ اِبْنَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَهُوَ مَقْرُوحٌ وَ مَنْ كَانَ لَهُ اِبْنَتَانِ فَيَا غَوْثَاهْ بِاللَّهِ وَ مَنْ كَانَ لَهُ ثَلاَثُ بَنَاتٍ وُضِعَ عَنْهُ اَلْجِهَادُ وَ كُلُّ مَكْرُوهٍ وَ مَنْ كَانَ لَهُ أَرْبَعُ بَنَاتٍ فَيَا عِبَادَ اَللَّهِ أَعِينُوهُ يَا عِبَادَ اَللَّهِ أَقْرِضُوهُ يَا عِبَادَ اَللَّهِ اِرْحَمُوهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4697 - Hamzah ibn Humran narrated through his chain of transmission that
thaqalaynMatn:
a man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) while another man was sitting with Him (sw).
The man informed the Prophet (sw) about the birth of his child, and the color of the man's face changed.
The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) asked him: "What is the matter with you?"
The man replied: "It's nothing."
The Prophet (sw) said: "Speak."
The man said: "I left while my wife was in labor, and I was informed that she gave birth to a daughter."
The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said to him: "The earth will carry her, the sky will shade her, and Allah (swt) will provide for her. She is a sweet flower that you will smell."
Then the Prophet (sw) turned to his companions and said: "Whoever has one daughter will be burdened with care.
Whoever has two daughters, then seek help from Allah (swt) for him.
Whoever has three daughters, the obligation of jihad and every hardship is lifted from him.
And whoever has four daughters, O servants of Allah (swt), help him! O servants of Allah (swt), support him! O servants of Allah (swt), have mercy on him!"

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4698 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
"Whoever takes care of three daughters or three sisters, Paradise becomes obligatory for him." It was asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what about two?"
He (sw) replied: "And two (meaning same reward)."
It was asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), and one?"
He (sw) said: "And one (meaning same reward)."
arabicText: 4698 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "مَنْ عَالَ ثَلاَثَ بَنَاتٍ أَوْ ثَلاَثَ أَخَوَاتٍ وَجَبَتْ لَهُ اَلْجَنَّةُ " قِيلَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ وَ اِثْنَتَيْنِ قَالَ "وَ اِثْنَتَيْنِ" قِيلَ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ "وَ وَاحِدَةً" قَالَ "وَ وَاحِدَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4698 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever takes care of three daughters or three sisters, Paradise becomes obligatory for him." It was asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), what about two?"
He (sw) replied: "And two (meaning same reward)."
It was asked: "O Messenger of Allah (swt), and one?"
He (sw) said: "And one (meaning same reward)."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4699 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever takes care of two daughters, two sisters, two paternal aunts, or two maternal aunts, they will shield him from the Fire."
arabicText:
4699 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
"مَنْ عَالَ اِبْنَتَيْنِ أَوْ أُخْتَيْنِ أَوْ عَمَّتَيْنِ أَوْ خَالَتَيْنِ حَجَبَتَاهُ مِنَ اَلنَّارِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4699 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever takes care of two daughters, two sisters, two paternal aunts, or two maternal aunts, they will shield him from the Fire."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4700 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"When a man is blessed with a daughter, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, sends an angel to her who passes his wing over her head and chest and says, 'A fragile being created from weakness; whoever provides for her will be assisted.'"
arabicText:
4700 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
"إِذَا أَصَابَ اَلرَّجُلُ اِبْنَةً بَعَثَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَيْهَا مَلَكاً فَأَمَرَّ جَنَاحَهُ عَلَى رَأْسِهَا وَ صَدْرِهَا وَ قَالَ ضَعِيفَةٌ خُلِقَتْ مِنْ ضَعْفٍ اَلْمُنْفِقُ عَلَيْهَا مُعَانٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4700 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a man is blessed with a daughter, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, sends an angel to her who passes his wing over her head and chest and says, 'A fragile being created from weakness; whoever provides for her will be assisted.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4701 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Know that one of you will find his miscarried child waiting anxiously at the gate of Paradise. When they (the child) sees him, they will grasp his hand and not let go until he brings him into Paradise. Indeed, if one of your children dies, you will be rewarded for it, and if the child remains after you, he will seek forgiveness for you after your death."
arabicText:
4701 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ :
"اِعْلَمُوا أَنَّ أَحَدَكُمْ يَلْقَى سِقْطَهُ مُحْبَنْطِئاً عَلَى بَابِ اَلْجَنَّةِ حَتَّى إِذَا رَآهُ أَخَذَ بِيَدِهِ حَتَّى يُدْخِلَهُ اَلْجَنَّةَ وَ إِنَّ وَلَدَ أَحَدِكُمْ إِذَا مَاتَ أُجِرَ فِيهِ وَ إِنْ بَقِيَ بَعْدَهُ اِسْتَغْفَرَ لَهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4701 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Know that one of you will find his miscarried child waiting anxiously at the gate of Paradise. When they (the child) sees him, they will grasp his hand and not let go until he brings him into Paradise. Indeed, if one of your children dies, you will be rewarded for it, and if the child remains after you, he will seek forgiveness for you after your death."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4702 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Love the children and have mercy on them. When you promise them something, fulfill it for them, for they only perceive that you are the ones who provide for them."
arabicText: 4702 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "أَحِبُّوا اَلصِّبْيَانَ وَ اِرْحَمُوهُمْ وَ إِذَا وَعَدْتُمُوهُمْ فَفُوا لَهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ لاَ يَرَوْنَ إِلاَّ أَنَّكُمْ تَرْزُقُونَهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4702 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Love the children and have mercy on them. When you promise them something, fulfill it for them, for they only perceive that you are the ones who provide for them."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4703 - Rifa'ah ibn Musa narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as) who said:
I asked him about a man who has sons from different mothers, can he favor one of them over the others?
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, there is no harm in that. My father (as) used to favor me over Abdullah."
arabicText: 4703 - وَ رَوَى رِفَاعَةُ بْنُ مُوسَى عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَكُونُ لَهُ بَنُونَ وَ أُمُّهُمْ لَيْسَتْ بِوَاحِدَةٍ أَ يُفَضِّلُ أَحَدَهُمْ عَلَى اَلْآخَرِ قَالَ "نَعَمْ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ وَ قَدْ كَانَ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُفَضِّلُنِي عَلَى عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4703 - Rifa'ah ibn Musa narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as) who said:
I asked him about a man who has sons from different mothers, can he favor one of them over the others?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, there is no harm in that. My father (as) used to favor me over Abdullah."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4704 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, it is reported that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) saw a man who had two sons.
The man kissed one of them and left the other.
The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said to him, "Why did you not treat them equally?"
arabicText: 4704 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ قَالَ: نَظَرَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِلَى رَجُلٍ لَهُ اِبْنَانِ فَقَبَّلَ أَحَدَهُمَا وَ تَرَكَ اَلْآخَرَ فَقَالَ لَهُ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ "فَهَلاَّ وَاسَيْتَ بَيْنَهُمَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4704 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, it is reported that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) saw a man who had two sons.
thaqalaynMatn:
The man kissed one of them and left the other.
The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said to him, "Why did you not treat them equally?"

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4705 - Imam (as) said: "Parents are held accountable for disobedience toward their children just as children are held accountable for disobedience toward their parents."
arabicText: 4705 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "يَلْزَمُ اَلْوَالِدَيْنِ مِنْ عُقُوقِ اَلْوَلَدِ مَا يَلْزَمُ اَلْوَلَدَ لَهُمَا مِنَ اَلْعُقُوقِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4705 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Parents are held accountable for disobedience toward their children just as children are held accountable for disobedience toward their parents."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4706 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"A man's kindness to his child is a form of his kindness to his own parents."
arabicText: 4706 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "بِرُّ اَلرَّجُلِ بِوَلَدِهِ بِرُّهُ بِوَالِدَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4706 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A man's kindness to his child is a form of his kindness to his own parents."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4707 - In another narration, the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Whoever has a child should act childishly with him."
arabicText: 4707 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ قَالَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "مَنْ كَانَ عِنْدَهُ صَبِيٌّ فَلْيَتَصَابَ لَهُ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4707 - In another narration, the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever has a child should act childishly with him."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4708 - Imam (as) said:
"Among the blessings of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, upon a man is that his child resembles him."
arabicText: 4708 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ: "مِنْ نِعَمِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَلَى اَلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يُشْبِهَهُ وَلَدُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4708 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Among the blessings of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, upon a man is that his child resembles him."

chapter: Chapter on the Virtue of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4709 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"When Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, wills to create a being,
He (swt) gathers every form between him and Adam (as), then creates him in the image of one of them. Therefore, no one should say about his child, 'This one does not resemble me or any of my ancestors.'"
arabicText: 4709 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى إِذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ خَلْقاً جَمَعَ كُلَّ صُورَةٍ بَيْنَهُ وَ بَيْنَ آدَمَ ثُمَّ خَلَقَهُ عَلَى صُورَةِ إِحْدَاهُنَّ فَلاَ يَقُولَنَّ أَحَدٌ لِوَلَدِهِ هَذَا لاَ يُشْبِهُنِي وَ لاَ يُشْبِهُ شَيْئاً مِنْ آبَائِي".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4709 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, wills to create a being,
He (swt) gathers every form between him and Adam (as), then creates him in the image of one of them. Therefore, no one should say about his child, 'This one does not resemble me or any of my ancestors.'"

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4710 - Umar ibn Yazid narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: "Every person is held in pledge on the Day of Judgment by their Aqiqah, and the Aqiqah is more obligatory than the sacrificial offering (Udhiyyah)."
arabicText: 4710 - رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ: "كُلُّ اِمْرِئٍ مُرْتَهَنٌ، يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ بِعَقِيقَتِهِ وَ اَلْعَقِيقَةُ أَوْجَبُ مِنَ اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4710 - Umar ibn Yazid narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Every person is held in pledge on the Day of Judgment by their Aqiqah, and the Aqiqah is more obligatory than the sacrificial offering (Udhiyyah)."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4711 - In the narration of Abu Khadijah from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said:
"Every person is held in pledge by their natural disposition (fitrah), and every newborn is held in pledge by their Aqiqah."
arabicText: 3711 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ أَبِي خَدِيجَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "كُلُّ إِنْسَانٍ مُرْتَهَنٌ بِالْفِطْرَةِ وَ كُلُّ مَوْلُودٍ مُرْتَهَنٌ بِالْعَقِيقَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4711 - In the narration of Abu Khadijah from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Every person is held in pledge by their natural disposition (fitrah), and every newborn is held in pledge by their Aqiqah."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4712 - It was narrated from Umar ibn Yazid who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "By Allah (swt), I do not know whether my father performed the aqiqah (sacrifice for a newborn) for me or not."
Imam (as) instructed me, so I performed the aqiqah for myself while I was an old man.
arabicText: 4712 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ اَللَّهِ مَا أَدْرِي أَ كَانَ أَبِي عَقَّ عَنِّي أَمْ لاَ فَأَمَرَنِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَعَقَقْتُ عَنْ نَفْسِي وَ أَنَا شَيْخٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4712 - It was narrated from Umar ibn Yazid who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "By Allah (swt), I do not know whether my father performed the aqiqah (sacrifice for a newborn) for me or not."
Imam (as) instructed me, so I performed the aqiqah for myself while I was an old man.

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4713 - In the narration of Ali ibn Al-Hakam from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah from the Righteous Servant (Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as)), that he said:
"Aqiqah is obligatory when a man is blessed with a child. If he wishes to name the child on the same day, he may do so."
arabicText: 4713 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحَكَمِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنِ اَلْعَبْدِ اَلصَّالِحِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلْعَقِيقَةُ وَاجِبَةٌ إِذَا وُلِدَ لِلرَّجُلِ وَلَدٌ فَإِنْ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يُسَمِّيَهُ مِنْ يَوْمِهِ فَعَلَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4713 - In the narration of Ali ibn Al-Hakam from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah from the Righteous Servant (Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as)), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Aqiqah is obligatory when a man is blessed with a child. If he wishes to name the child on the same day, he may do so."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4714 - Ammar Al-Sabati narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"Aqiqah is obligatory for those who are wealthy. As for the poor, when they become financially capable, they should perform it. If they are unable to do so, then nothing is required of them.
If Aqiqah was not done for a person until a sacrifice (Udhiyyah) was offered on their behalf, the sacrifice suffices for them. Every newborn is held in pledge by their Aqiqah."
Imam (as) also said regarding Aqiqah: "A ram should be slaughtered on their behalf. If a ram is not available, anything permissible for sacrifice in Udhiyyah will suffice. If that is not possible, then a lamb, the largest among the lambs of the year, should be offered."
arabicText: 4714 - وَ رَوَى عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلْعَقِيقَةُ لاَزِمَةٌ لِمَنْ كَانَ غَنِيّاً وَ مَنْ كَانَ فَقِيراً إِذَا أَيْسَرَ فَعَلَ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ عَلَى ذَلِكَ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَعُقَّ عَنْهُ حَتَّى ضَحَّى عَنْهُ فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَتْهُ اَلْأُضْحِيَّةُ وَ كُلُّ مَوْلُودٍ مُرْتَهَنٌ بِعَقِيقَتِهِ" وَ قَالَ فِي اَلْعَقِيقَةِ "يُذْبَحُ عَنْهُ كَبْشٌ فَإِنْ لَمْ يُوجَدْ كَبْشٌ أَجْزَأَهُ مَا يُجْزِي فِي اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ وَ إِلاَّ فَحَمَلٌ أَعْظَمُ مَا يَكُونُ مِنْ حُمْلاَنِ اَلسَّنَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4714 - Ammar Al-Sabati narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Aqiqah is obligatory for those who are wealthy. As for the poor, when they become financially capable, they should perform it. If they are unable to do so, then nothing is required of them.
If Aqiqah was not done for a person until a sacrifice (Udhiyyah) was offered on their behalf, the sacrifice suffices for them. Every newborn is held in pledge by their Aqiqah."
Imam (as) also said regarding Aqiqah: "A ram should be slaughtered on their behalf. If a ram is not available, anything permissible for sacrifice in Udhiyyah will suffice. If that is not possible, then a lamb, the largest among the lambs of the year, should be offered."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4715 - In the narration of Muhammad ibn Marid from Abu Abdullah (as), he said: I asked him about the Aqiqah.
Imam (as) replied: "It can be a sheep, a cow, or a camel. Then the child should be named, and his head should be shaved on the seventh day. Charity should be given in gold or silver equal to the weight of the shaved hair. If the newborn is a boy, a male animal should be sacrificed on his behalf, and if it is a girl, a female animal should be sacrificed for her."
arabicText: 4715 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَارِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْعَقِيقَةِ فَقَالَ "شَاةٌ أَوْ بَقَرَةٌ أَوْ بَدَنَةٌ ثُمَّ يُسَمِّي وَ يَحْلِقُ رَأْسَ اَلْمَوْلُودِ يَوْمَ اَلسَّابِعِ وَ يَتَصَدَّقُ بِوَزْنِ شَعْرِهِ ذَهَباً أَوْ فِضَّةً فَإِنْ كَانَ ذَكَراً عَقَّ عَنْهُ ذَكَراً وَ إِنْ كَانَ أُنْثَى عَقَّ عَنْهَا أُنْثَى".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4715 - In the narration of Muhammad ibn Marid from Abu Abdullah (as), he said: I asked him about the Aqiqah.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "It can be a sheep, a cow, or a camel. Then the child should be named, and his head should be shaved on the seventh day. Charity should be given in gold or silver equal to the weight of the shaved hair. If the newborn is a boy, a male animal should be sacrificed on his behalf, and if it is a girl, a female animal should be sacrificed for her."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4716 - Abu Talib (as), may Allah (swt) have mercy on him, performed the Aqiqah for the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) on the seventh day after his birth.
He invited the family of Abu Talib, and when they asked: "What is this?"
Abu Talib (as) replied: "This is the Aqiqah of Ahmad (sw)."
They asked: "Why did you name him Ahmad (sw)?"
Abu Talib (as) said: "I named him Ahmad (sw) because of the praise (maḥmadah) He (sw) receives from the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth."
arabicText: 4716 - وَ عَقَّ أَبُو طَالِبٍ رَحِمَهُ اَللَّهُ عَنْ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ يَوْمَ اَلسَّابِعِ فَدَعَا آلَ أَبِي طَالِبٍ فَقَالُوا مَا هَذِهِ فَقَالَ "عَقِيقَةُ أَحْمَدَ " قَالُوا لِأَيِّ شَيْءٍ سَمَّيْتَهُ أَحْمَدَ قَالَ "سَمَّيْتُهُ أَحْمَدَ لِمَحْمَدَةِ أَهْلِ اَلسَّمَاءِ وَ اَلْأَرْضِ لَهُ".

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4717 - In the narration of Ammar Al-Sabati from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said:
"If the midwife (qabilah) is a Jewess who does not eat the meat of an animal slaughtered by Muslims, she should be given one-fourth of the value of the ram, and it is purchased from her with that."
arabicText: 4717 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَمَّارٍ اَلسَّابَاطِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِنْ كَانَتِ اَلْقَابِلَةُ يَهُودِيَّةً لاَ تَأْكُلُ مِنْ ذَبِيحَةِ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ أُعْطِيَتْ رُبُعَ قِيمَةِ اَلْكَبْشِ يُشْتَرَى ذَلِكَ مِنْهَا ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4717 - In the narration of Ammar Al-Sabati from Abu Abdullah (as), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the midwife (qabilah) is a Jewess who does not eat the meat of an animal slaughtered by Muslims, she should be given one-fourth of the value of the ram, and it is purchased from her with that."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4718 - In another narration from Ammar, it is reported: "A quarter of the Aqiqah should be given to the midwife. If there is no midwife, then the child's mother may give it to whomever she wishes. She should also feed ten Muslims from it, and if she feeds more, it is even better."
arabicText: 4718 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَمَّارٍ أَيْضاً: "أَنَّهُ يُعْطِي اَلْقَابِلَةَ رُبُعَهَا فَإِنْ لَمْ تَكُنْ قَابِلَةٌ فَلِأُمِّهِ تُعْطِيهَا مَنْ شَاءَتْ وَ تُطْعِمُ مِنْهَا عَشَرَةً مِنَ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ فَإِنْ زَادَ فَهُوَ أَفْضَلُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4718 - In another narration from Ammar, it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn: "A quarter of the Aqiqah should be given to the midwife. If there is no midwife, then the child's mother may give it to whomever she wishes. She should also feed ten Muslims from it, and if she feeds more, it is even better."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4719 - It is narrated: "The best way to cook the Aqiqah meat is with water and salt."
arabicText: 4719 - وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ أَفْضَلَ مَا يُطْبَخُ بِهِ مَاءٌ وَ مِلْحٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4719 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "The best way to cook the Aqiqah meat is with water and salt."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4720 - Ammar Al-Sabati reported that Imam (as) was asked about the Aqiqah about when it is slaughtered, should its bones be broken?
He (as) replied: "Yes, its bones should be broken, and its meat should be cut up. After the slaughter, you may do with it as you wish."
arabicText: 4720 - قَالَ عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ : وَ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلْعَقِيقَةِ إِذَا ذُبِحَتْ هَلْ يُكْسَرُ عَظْمُهَا قَالَ "نَعَمْ يُكْسَرُ عَظْمُهَا وَ يُقَطَّعُ لَحْمُهَا وَ تَصْنَعُ بِهَا بَعْدَ اَلذَّبْحِ مَا شِئْتَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4720 - Ammar Al-Sabati reported that Imam (as) was asked about the Aqiqah about when it is slaughtered, should its bones be broken?
thaqalaynMatn: He (as) replied: "Yes, its bones should be broken, and its meat should be cut up. After the slaughter, you may do with it as you wish."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4721 - Idris ibn Abdullah Al-Qummi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a newborn who is born and dies on the seventh day. Should the Aqiqah be performed for him?
Imam (as) replied: "If he dies before noon, the Aqiqah is not performed for him. But if he dies after noon, the Aqiqah should be performed for him."
arabicText:
4721 - وَ سَأَلَ إِدْرِيسُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ اَلْقُمِّيُّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
عَنْ مَوْلُودٍ يُولَدُ فَيَمُوتُ يَوْمَ اَلسَّابِعِ هَلْ يُعَقُّ عَنْهُ قَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ مَاتَ قَبْلَ اَلظُّهْرِ لَمْ يُعَقَّ عَنْهُ وَ إِنْ كَانَ مَاتَ بَعْدَ اَلظُّهْرِ عُقَّ عَنْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4721 - Idris ibn Abdullah Al-Qummi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a newborn who is born and dies on the seventh day. Should the Aqiqah be performed for him?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he dies before noon, the Aqiqah is not performed for him. But if he dies after noon, the Aqiqah should be performed for him."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4722 - Ammar Al-Sabati narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: "When you intend to slaughter the Aqiqah, say:
'O my people, I am free from what you associate with Allah (swt). Indeed, I have turned my face toward the One (swt) who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not among the polytheists. Indeed, my prayer, my sacrifice, my life, and my death are for Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of the worlds. He (swt) has no partner, and with this I have been commanded, and I am among the Muslims. O Allah (swt), this is from You (swt) and for You (swt). In the name of Allah (swt) and Allah (swt) is the Greatest. O Allah (swt), accept this from (mention the child's name), son of (mention the father's name).'
Then you proceed with the slaughter."
arabicText: 4722 - وَ رَوَى عَمَّارٌ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِذَا أَرَدْتَ أَنْ تَذْبَحَ اَلْعَقِيقَةَ قُلْتَ "يٰا قَوْمِ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِمّٰا تُشْرِكُونَ إِنِّي وَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي فَطَرَ اَلسَّمٰاوٰاتِ وَ اَلْأَرْضَ حَنِيفاً" مُسْلِماً "وَ مٰا أَنَا مِنَ اَلْمُشْرِكِينَ " "إِنَّ صَلاٰتِي وَ نُسُكِي وَ مَحْيٰايَ وَ مَمٰاتِي لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ اَلْعٰالَمِينَ لاٰ شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَ بِذٰلِكَ أُمِرْتُ" وَ أَنَا مِنَ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ اَللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ وَ لَكَ بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ وَ اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اَللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنْ فُلاَنِ بْنِ فُلاَنٍ وَ تُسَمِّي اَلْمَوْلُودَ بِاسْمِهِ ثُمَّ تَذْبَحُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4722 - Ammar Al-Sabati narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When you intend to slaughter the Aqiqah, say:
'O my people, I am free from what you associate with Allah (swt). Indeed, I have turned my face toward the One (swt) who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not among the polytheists. Indeed, my prayer, my sacrifice, my life, and my death are for Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of the worlds. He (swt) has no partner, and with this I have been commanded, and I am among the Muslims. O Allah (swt), this is from You (swt) and for You (swt). In the name of Allah (swt) and Allah (swt) is the Greatest. O Allah (swt), accept this from (mention the child's name), son of (mention the father's name).'
Then you proceed with the slaughter."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4723 - In another narration from Abu Abdullah (as), he said: "At the time of performing the Aqiqah, say:
'O Allah (swt), this is from You (swt) and for You (swt). It is what You (swt) have granted, and You (swt) are the Giver. O Allah (swt), accept it from us in accordance with the tradition of Your Prophet (sw). I seek refuge in Allah (swt) from the accursed Satan.'
Then mention the child's name, slaughter the animal, and say:
'For You (swt), I have shed this blood, with no partner for You (swt). All praise is due to Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of the worlds. O Allah (swt), drive away from us the accursed Satan.'
As for circumcision, it is a Sunnah (recommended practice) for men and an honorable practice (makramah) for women."
arabicText:
4723 - وَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ:
"يُقَالُ عِنْدَ اَلْعَقِيقَةِ اَللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ وَ لَكَ مَا وَهَبْتَ وَ أَنْتَ أَعْطَيْتَ اَللَّهُمَّ فَتَقَبَّلْهُ مِنَّا عَلَى سُنَّةِ نَبِيِّكَ وَ تَسْتَعِيذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ اَلشَّيْطَانِ اَلرَّجِيمِ وَ تُسَمِّي وَ تَذْبَحُ وَ تَقُولُ لَكَ سَفَكْتُ اَلدِّمَاءَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ "وَ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ اَلْعٰالَمِينَ" اَللَّهُمَّ اِخْسَأْ عَنَّا اَلشَّيْطَانَ اَلرَّجِيمَ ".
وَ أَمَّا الْخِتَانُ فَإِنَّهُ سُنَّةٌ فِي الرِّجَالِ وَ مَكْرُمَةٌ فِي النِّسَاءِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4723 - In another narration from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"At the time of performing the Aqiqah, say:
'O Allah (swt), this is from You (swt) and for You (swt). It is what You (swt) have granted, and You (swt) are the Giver. O Allah (swt), accept it from us in accordance with the tradition of Your Prophet (sw). I seek refuge in Allah (swt) from the accursed Satan.'
Then mention the child's name, slaughter the animal, and say:
'For You (swt), I have shed this blood, with no partner for You (swt). All praise is due to Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of the worlds. O Allah (swt), drive away from us the accursed Satan.'
As for circumcision, it is a Sunnah (recommended practice) for men and an honorable practice (makramah) for women."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4724 - Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim narrated from Ja'far ibn Muhammad from his father (as) who said that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as)said:
"There is no harm if a woman is not circumcised, but as for a man, it is necessary for him."
arabicText: 4724 - وَ رَوَى غِيَاثُ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ لاَ تَخْتَتِنَ اَلْمَرْأَةُ فَأَمَّا اَلرَّجُلُ فَلاَ بُدَّ مِنْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4724 - Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim narrated from Ja'far ibn Muhammad from his father (as) who said that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as)said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a woman is not circumcised, but as for a man, it is necessary for him."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4725 - Abdullah ibn Ja'far al-Himyari wrote to Imam Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan ibn Ali (as), saying:
"It has been narrated from the Righteous Ones (peace be upon them) that they said: 'Circumcise your children on the seventh day so they may be purified, for the earth complains to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, about the urine of the uncircumcised.'
May Allah make me your ransom, but the barbers in our region are not skilled in this, and they do not circumcise on the seventh day. However, we have a barber who is a Jew. Is it permissible for the Jews to circumcise Muslim children or not?"
Imam (as) replied: "On the seventh day - do not oppose the Sunnah, God willing."
arabicText: 4725 - وَ - كَتَبَ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ اَلْحِمْيَرِيُّ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلصَّالِحِينَ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَنِ اِخْتِنُوا أَوْلاَدَكُمْ يَوْمَ اَلسَّابِعِ يَطَّهَّرُوا فَإِنَّ اَلْأَرْضَ تَضِجُّ إِلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ بَوْلِ اَلْأَغْلَفِ" وَ لَيْسَ جَعَلَنِيَ اَللَّهُ فِدَاكَ لِحَجَّامِي بَلَدِنَا حِذْقٌ بِذَلِكَ وَ لاَ يَخْتِنُونَهُ يَوْمَ اَلسَّابِعِ وَ عِنْدَنَا حَجَّامٌ مِنَ اَلْيَهُودِ فَهَلْ يَجُوزُ لِلْيَهُودِ أَنْ يَخْتِنُوا أَوْلاَدَ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ أَمْ لاَ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "يَوْمَ اَلسَّابِعِ فَلاَ تُخَالِفُوا اَلسُّنَنَ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4725 - Abdullah ibn Ja'far al-Himyari wrote to Imam Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan ibn Ali (as), saying:
thaqalaynMatn:
"It has been narrated from the Righteous Ones (peace be upon them) that they said: 'Circumcise your children on the seventh day so they may be purified, for the earth complains to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, about the urine of the uncircumcised.'
May Allah make me your ransom, but the barbers in our region are not skilled in this, and they do not circumcise on the seventh day. However, we have a barber who is a Jew. Is it permissible for the Jews to circumcise Muslim children or not?"
Imam (as) replied: "On the seventh day - do not oppose the Sunnah, God willing."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4726 - It was narrated from Murazim ibn Hakim Al-Azdi that Abu Abdullah (as) said regarding the circumcision of a child:
"One should say:
O Allah (swt), this is Your (swt) Sunnah and the Sunnah of Your Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), and it is our following of You (swt) and Your Prophet (sw) by Your (swt) will, Your (swt) desire, and Your (swt) decree for a matter You (swt) have willed, a decision You (swt) have made obligatory, and a command You (swt) have executed.
You (swt) have made him taste the heat of iron in his circumcision and cupping for a matter You (swt) know better than I do. O Allah (swt), purify him from sins, increase his lifespan, protect his body from afflictions and his flesh from pain, increase him in wealth, and remove poverty from him. Indeed, You (swt) know while we do not."
Abu Abdullah (as) also said: "Whoever does not say this at the time of his child's circumcision should say it before the child reaches puberty. If he says it, the child will be protected from the heat of iron, whether from killing or anything else."
arabicText: 4726 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُرَازِمِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ اَلْأَزْدِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلصَّبِيِّ إِذَا خُتِنَ قَالَ "يَقُولُ: اَللَّهُمَّ هَذِهِ سُنَّتُكَ وَ سُنَّةُ نَبِيِّكَ صَلَوَاتُكَ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ اِتِّبَاعٌ مِنَّا لَكَ وَ لِنَبِيِّكَ بِمَشِيَّتِكَ وَ بِإِرَادَتِكَ وَ قَضَائِكَ لِأَمْرٍ أَنْتَ أَرَدْتَهُ وَ قَضَاءٍ حَتَمْتَهُ وَ أَمْرٍ أَنْفَذْتَهُ فَأَذَقْتَهُ حَرَّ اَلْحَدِيدِ فِي خِتَانِهِ وَ حِجَامَتِهِ لِأَمْرٍ أَنْتَ أَعْرَفُ بِهِ مِنِّي اَللَّهُمَّ فَطَهِّرْهُ مِنَ اَلذُّنُوبِ وَ زِدْ فِي عُمُرِهِ وَ اِدْفَعِ اَلْآفَاتِ عَنْ بَدَنِهِ وَ اَلْأَوْجَاعَ عَنْ جِسْمِهِ وَ زِدْهُ مِنَ اَلْغِنَى وَ اِدْفَعْ عَنْهُ اَلْفَقْرَ فَإِنَّكَ تَعْلَمُ وَ لاَ نَعْلَمُ " وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَيُّ رَجُلٍ لَمْ يَقُلْهَا عِنْدَ خِتَانِ وَلَدِهِ فَلْيَقُلْهَا عَلَيْهِ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَحْتَلِمَ فَإِنْ قَالَهَا كُفِيَ حَرَّ اَلْحَدِيدِ مِنْ قَتْلٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4726 - It was narrated from Murazim ibn Hakim Al-Azdi that Abu Abdullah (as) said regarding the circumcision of a child:
thaqalaynMatn:
"One should say:
O Allah (swt), this is Your (swt) Sunnah and the Sunnah of Your Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), and it is our following of You (swt) and Your Prophet (sw) by Your (swt) will, Your (swt) desire, and Your (swt) decree for a matter You (swt) have willed, a decision You (swt) have made obligatory, and a command You (swt) have executed.
You (swt) have made him taste the heat of iron in his circumcision and cupping for a matter You (swt) know better than I do. O Allah (swt), purify him from sins, increase his lifespan, protect his body from afflictions and his flesh from pain, increase him in wealth, and remove poverty from him. Indeed, You (swt) know while we do not."
Abu Abdullah (as) also said: "Whoever does not say this at the time of his child's circumcision should say it before the child reaches puberty. If he says it, the child will be protected from the heat of iron, whether from killing or anything else."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4727 - It was narrated from Harun ibn Muslim who said:
I wrote to the 'Sahib al-Dar' (Master of the House Imam Muhammad ibn Hassan Al-Mahdi (as)) saying: "A child was born to me, and I shaved his head, weighed his hair in dirhams, and gave its equivalent in charity."
Imam (as) replied: "It is not permissible to weigh it except with gold or silver, and this is the established Sunnah."
arabicText:
4727 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ:
كَتَبْتُ إِلَى صَاحِبِ اَلدَّارِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وُلِدَ لِي مَوْلُودٌ وَ حَلَقْتُ رَأْسَهُ وَ وَزَنْتُ شَعْرَهُ بِالدَّرَاهِمِ وَ تَصَدَّقْتُ بِهِ قَالَ "لاَ يَجُوزُ وَزْنُهُ إِلاَّ بِالذَّهَبِ أَوِ اَلْفِضَّةِ وَ كَذَا جَرَتِ اَلسُّنَّةُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4727 - It was narrated from Harun ibn Muslim who said:
I wrote to the 'Sahib al-Dar' (Master of the House Imam Muhammad ibn Hassan Al-Mahdi (as)) saying:
thaqalaynMatn:
"A child was born to me, and I shaved his head, weighed his hair in dirhams, and gave its equivalent in charity."
Imam (as) replied: "It is not permissible to weigh it except with gold or silver, and this is the established Sunnah."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4728 - Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about the reason for shaving the head of a newborn. Imam (as) replied: "It is to purify the child from the hair of the womb."
arabicText: 4728 - : وَ سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَا اَلْعِلَّةُ فِي حَلْقِ رَأْسِ اَلْمَوْلُودِ قَالَ "تَطْهِيرُهُ مِنْ شَعْرِ اَلرَّحِمِ ".

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4729 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a newborn whose head was not shaved on the seventh day.
Imam (as) replied: "If seven days have passed, then shaving the head is no longer required."
arabicText: 4729 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ مَوْلُودٍ لَمْ يُحْلَقْ رَأْسُهُ يَوْمَ اَلسَّابِعِ فَقَالَ "إِذَا مَضَى سَبْعَةُ أَيَّامٍ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ حَلْقٌ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4729 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a newborn whose head was not shaved on the seventh day.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If seven days have passed, then shaving the head is no longer required."

chapter: Chapter on Aqiqah, Tahnik, Naming, Kunyah, Shaving the newborn's Head, Piercing the Ears, and Circumcision
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.4730 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "O Fatimah, pierce the ears of Al-Hasan and Al-Husayn in opposition to the Jews."
arabicText: 4730 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "يَا فَاطِمَةُ اُثْقُبِي أُذُنَيِ اَلْحَسَنِ وَ اَلْحُسَيْنِ خِلاَفاً لِلْيَهُودِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4730 - In the narration of Al-Sakooni, the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "O Fatimah, pierce the ears of Al-Hasan and Al-Husayn in opposition to the Jews."

chapter: Chapter on the State of believers' Children Who Pass Away
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4731 - Abu Zakariya narrated from Abu Basir who said that Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"When a child from the children of the believers dies, a caller announces in the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, 'Indeed, so-and-so, the son of so-and-so, has passed away.'
If his parents, one of them, or a family member from the believers had already passed away, the child is entrusted to them to nurture him.
If none of them had passed away, the child is entrusted to Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a} to nurture and care for them until their parents, one of them, or a family member arrives, and then she hands the child over to them."
arabicText: 4731 - رَوَى أَبُو زَكَرِيَّا عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا مَاتَ طِفْلٌ مِنْ أَطْفَالِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ نَادَى مُنَادٍ فِي مَلَكُوتِ اَلسَّمَاوَاتِ وَ اَلْأَرْضِ أَلاَ إِنَّ فُلاَنَ بْنَ فُلاَنٍ قَدْ مَاتَ فَإِنْ كَانَ مَاتَ وَالِدَاهُ أَوْ أَحَدُهُمَا أَوْ بَعْضُ أَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ مِنَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ دُفِعَ إِلَيْهِ يَغْذُوهُ وَ إِلاَّ دُفِعَ إِلَى فَاطِمَةَ عَلَيْهَا اَلسَّلاَمُ تَغْذُوهُ حَتَّى يَقْدَمَ أَبَوَاهُ أَوْ أَحَدُهُمَا أَوْ بَعْضُ أَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ فَتَدْفَعُهُ إِلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.4731 - Abu Zakariya narrated from Abu Basir who said that Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When a child from the children of the believers dies, a caller announces in the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, 'Indeed, so-and-so, the son of so-and-so, has passed away.'
If his parents, one of them, or a family member from the believers had already passed away, the child is entrusted to them to nurture him.
If none of them had passed away, the child is entrusted to Sayyidah Fatimah {s.a} to nurture and care for them until their parents, one of them, or a family member arrives, and then she hands the child over to them."

chapter: Chapter on the State of believers' Children Who Pass Away
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4732 - In the narration of Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Al-Halabi, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has entrusted Ibrahim (as) and Sarah {s.a} with the care of the children of the believers. They nourish them from a tree in Paradise that has teats like those of cows, inside a palace made of pearl.
On the Day of Judgment, these children will be dressed, perfumed, and presented to their parents. They will be kings in Paradise along with their parents. This is in accordance with the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic:
'And those who believe and whose descendants follow them in faith - We will join them with their descendants'" (Surah At-Tur 52:21).
arabicText:
4732 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى كَفَّلَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَ سَارَةَ أَطْفَالَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَغْذُوَانِهِمْ بِشَجَرَةٍ فِي اَلْجَنَّةِ لَهَا أَخْلاَفٌ كَأَخْلاَفِ اَلْبَقَرِ فِي قَصْرٍ مِنْ دُرَّةٍ فَإِذَا كَانَ يَوْمُ اَلْقِيَامَةِ أُلْبِسُوا وَ طُيِّبُوا وَ أُهْدُوا إِلَى آبَائِهِمْ فَهُمْ مُلُوكٌ فِي اَلْجَنَّةِ مَعَ آبَائِهِمْ وَ هُوَ قَوْلُ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ:
۝ اَلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَ اِتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُمْ بِإِيمٰانٍ أَلْحَقْنٰا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ ۝

chapter: Chapter on the State of believers' Children Who Pass Away
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4733 - In the narration of Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami, Abu Abdullah (as) said regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic: "And those who believe and whose descendants follow them in faith - We will join them with their descendants" (Surah At-Tur 52:21),
Imam (as) said: "The children fell short of the deeds of their fathers, so Allah (swt) joined the children with their fathers to bring comfort to their eyes."
arabicText:
4733 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ أَبِي بَكْرٍ اَلْحَضْرَمِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ:
۝ وَ اَلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَ اِتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُمْ بِإِيمٰانٍ أَلْحَقْنٰا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ ۝
قَالَ "قَصَرَتِ اَلْأَبْنَاءُ عَنْ أَعْمَالِ اَلْآبَاءِ فَأَلْحَقَ اَللَّهُ اَلْأَبْنَاءَ بِالْآبَاءِ لِتَقَرَّ بِذَلِكَ أَعْيُنُهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4733 - In the narration of Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami, Abu Abdullah (as) said regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic: "And those who believe and whose descendants follow them in faith - We will join them with their descendants" (Surah At-Tur 52:21),
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The children fell short of the deeds of their fathers, so Allah (swt) joined the children with their fathers to bring comfort to their eyes."

chapter: Chapter on the State of believers' Children Who Pass Away
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4734 - Jameel ibn Darraj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the children of the prophets (peace be upon them).
Imam (as) replied: "They are not like the children of ordinary people."
arabicText: 4734 - وَ سَأَلَ جَمِيلُ بْنُ دَرَّاجٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ أَطْفَالِ اَلْأَنْبِيَاءِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ "لَيْسُوا كَأَطْفَالِ اَلنَّاسِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4734 - Jameel ibn Darraj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the children of the prophets (peace be upon them).
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "They are not like the children of ordinary people."

chapter: Chapter on the State of believers' Children Who Pass Away
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4735 - Jameel ibn Darraj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about Ibrahim, the son of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), whether he would have been a truthful prophet (ṣiddiq nabi) if he had lived.
Imam (as) replied: "If he had lived, he would have followed the path of his father (peace and blessings be upon him)."
arabicText: 4735 - : وَ سَأَلَهُ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لَوْ بَقِيَ كَانَ صِدِّيقاً نَبِيّاً قَالَ "لَوْ بَقِيَ كَانَ عَلَى مِنْهَاجِ أَبِيهِ صَلَوَاتُ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4735 - Jameel ibn Darraj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about Ibrahim, the son of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), whether he would have been a truthful prophet (ṣiddiq nabi) if he had lived.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he had lived, he would have followed the path of his father (peace and blessings be upon him)."

chapter: Chapter on the State of believers' Children Who Pass Away
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.4736 - In the narration of ʿAmir ibn ʿAbdullah, he said:
I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say: "There was a palm branch (ʿadhq) over the grave of Ibrahim, the son of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), that shaded it from the sun wherever it moved. When the branch dried up, the trace of the grave disappeared, and its exact location became unknown."
arabicText: 4736 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَامِرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: "كَانَ عَلَى قَبْرِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَذْقٌ يُظِلُّهُ مِنَ اَلشَّمْسِ حَيْثُمَا دَارَتْ فَلَمَّا يَبِسَ اَلْعَذْقُ ذَهَبَ أَثَرُ اَلْقَبْرِ فَلَمْ يُعْلَمْ مَكَانُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.4736 - In the narration of ʿAmir ibn ʿAbdullah, he said:
